SubSection 1.1 — Role System Design

1) Core Concept: “Linked Service Profiles” under One Account

One account per person (single login, single identity).

Each account can attach one or more “Service Profiles” (SP) — one per role:

Model SP

Photographer SP

Videographer SP

Content Creator SP

Each Service Profile is a self-contained, bookable offering with its own:

Rolespecific fields (e.g., measurements vs. gear list)

Portfolio (images/videos assigned to that role)

Rates/packages & availability

Reviews & rating (per role)

Search index entry and URL

The Account has shared, global elements:

Display name, avatar, city/region, verification badges, background check badge

Follower/following counts (global)

Unified inbox (roleaware threads)

Unified feed (posts can be tagged to one/more roles)

Favorites boards (can hold userlevel or rolelevel items)

Why: Treating each role as a distinct, bookable “Service Profile” makes search and booking crystal clear while keeping life simple for multirole users via one login and shared assets.

2) URLs & Navigation

User overview: /u/{handle}
Shows account header + tabs for each Service Profile (e.g., Model | Photographer | Creator), global posts, and “About”.

Service Profile canonical pages:

Model: /u/{handle}/model

Photographer: /u/{handle}/photographer

Videographer: /u/{handle}/videographer

Creator: /u/{handle}/creator

Search results always link to the rolespecific page (not the account overview) to keep context tight.
Example: From “Model” search, clicking Jane goes to /u/jane/model. From there, users can switch roles via tabs (“Also offers: Photographer”).

3) Profile UI (What viewers see)

Header (shared)

Name, city, avatar, verification badges, backgroundcheck badge, overall followers, quick actions (Message, Share, Report).

Role chips: Model | Photographer | Videographer | Creator (active role highlighted).

Tabs (roleaware, contextual default):

Work (role portfolio) — grid/lightbox, role tags on media; NSFW gating if applicable.

About (role fields) — e.g., for Model: height, measurements, hair/eyes, categories; for Photographer: specialties, gear, software; for Creator: platform links, verified follower counts, engagement rate.

Rates & Packages — hourly/day rates, packaged offers (e.g., “2hr studio shoot w/ 10 edits”).

Availability — calendar, travel notes, response time.

Reviews — rolespecific (default to the role you’re viewing) with toggle to view All Roles.

Posts — profile feed; filter chips to display posts from this role by default.

Primary CTA (contextual):

On role pages: “Book {Role}” and “Message about {Role}”

On overview: disabled until a role is selected (or show a small role selector popover).

4) RoleSpecific Data (Minimum Fields)

Model SP

Height, weight, measurements, dress/shoe size

Hair color, eye color, skin tone/ethnicity (selfascribed)

Categories (fashion, fitness, swim, glam, etc.)

Willingness: TFP/paid only; NSFW allowed? (if policy permits)

Base rates, travel radius/fees

Photographer SP

Specialties (portraits, fashion, boudoir, commercial, events)

Gear (camera bodies, lenses, lighting), studio access

Editing software/turnaround time

License/usage terms defaults (for contracts)

Base rates/packages

Videographer SP

Specialties (reels, music videos, events, product)

Equipment (cameras, gimbals, drones), editing tools

Deliverables (duration, formats), turnaround

Base rates/packages

Content Creator SP

Platforms (IG, TikTok, YT, OF, etc.) with verified follower counts & computed engagement rate (if integrations enabled)

Niche(s), audience geo %, age/gender splits (if available)

Promo formats offered (grid post, story, reel, live)

Base rates/packages

Notes: All SPs inherit shared basics (bio, location), but require rolespecific fields to be indexed for search.

5) Search & Discovery (CategoryFirst)

Search begins by selecting a category (role): Models | Photographers | Videographers | Creators.

Home search bar has a leading role selector (defaults to last used).

Each role has its own advanced filters (different fields, operators, and ranges).

Indexing: Each Service Profile is a separate search document.

A multirole user appears once per relevant role (e.g., “Jane — Model” and “Jane — Photographer” are distinct cards).

Result Cards (rolescoped):

Avatar, name, city, role label, role rating (e.g., ★4.9 • 32), starting rate, key highlights per role (Models: height/measurements; Creators: followers/engagement; Photographers: specialties), verification badges.

Quick actions: Book, Message, Save to Board.

Subtext: “Also offers: Photographer” (clickable) — but doesn’t pollute the current role results.

Saved searches & alerts are rolescoped (e.g., “Models in Houston, 5'8+ fitness, $$/hour”).

6) Booking (RoleAnchored)

A booking is always tied to a Service Profile (the role being hired).

Request flow: Date/time, location, brief, deliverables, rate/packages; optional contract terms (usage rights, model release template).

Calendar integration: One unified availability for the account; bookings from any role block out time globally to prevent conflicts.

Rescheduling/cancellation apply to the rolebound booking, but time blocking stays global.

7) Reviews & Ratings (Clear & Fair)

Only bookers can review. One review per completed booking.

Rolespecific ratings:

Each Service Profile has its own star rating and review list.

On the account header (and in search cards), show perrole ratings if they exist (e.g., “Model ★4.9 (32) | Photographer ★4.6 (12)”).

Overall rating (optional/secondary): A weighted composite (by # of reviews per role). Display lightly on the overview, never used in rolespecific ranking.

Review visibility: Default to the role you’re viewing with a toggle to see All Roles (clearly labeled).

Why: Keeps feedback relevant to the service hired while still showing crossrole reputation if desired.

8) Messaging (Unified Inbox, RoleAware)

One inbox for the user, with smart organization:

Thread type: General Inquiry vs. Booking Thread #ID

Role context tag: e.g., Model, Photographer

Counterparty and project title/date

Status chips: New, Awaiting Reply, Payment Pending, Completed

Read receipts (✓ sent, ✓✓ read) with timestamps.

Filters & folders: By role, by status (Unread, Awaiting response), by city/date.

Thread merge policy:

Each booking always gets its own thread.

Prebooking inquiries by role are separate threads per role (prevent confusion).

The inbox shows conversation bundles by counterpart (expand to see rolespecific threads).

Attachments: Mood boards, references, call sheets.

Safety: Inline tips for firsttime connections; easy report/block.

Incentives (ties to verification; see §12): base monthly newconversation credits + bonus credits for verified tiers. Bookings and reply threads do not consume credits.

9) Portfolio & Tagging (Per Role, Easy to Maintain)

Media Library (account level): upload once, then assign media to one or more roles (checks).

Role Portfolios: Each SP has Albums (e.g., “Editorial”, “Fitness”). Media show role tags and collaborator tags.

Tagging collaborators: Add other users to media with role credit (e.g., “@Sam — Model”).

Approval queue for the tagged user; on approve, the media appears in their Collaboration section (rolespecific).

NSFW controls (if allowed): mark media NSFW; hidden by default unless viewer opts in.

Maintenance speed: Assigning media to roles is a multiselect action. Bulk actions to clone albums across roles.

10) Follows & Favorites (Boards)

Follow (global, simple):

Follow the user account (not per role) to keep counts meaningful.

Feed preferences let a follower choose which roletagged posts they want to see (All / Model / Photographer / …).

Favorites (“Boards”):

Save either the role card (“Jane — Model”) or the user (“Jane — All Roles”).

Boards can mix items but default to roleconsistent when saved from a role search.

Create projectspecific boards (e.g., “Q2 Lookbook Models”) with notes, tags, and share/collab options (optional future).

Quick actions on cards: Compare, Bulk message, Request availability (future).

11) Posts & Feeds (RoleTagged, Unified View)

Users can post updates (text, image, video). Each post must be tagged with one or more roles.

Profile Posts tab defaults to the role being viewed; toggle to “All roles”.

Global follower feed shows posts from accounts you follow; filter by role tags.

Post types (examples): Portfolio release, BTS, Availability, Lookingtocollab (but avoid “job board” styling), Deliverables showcase.

12) Verification Badges & DM Credits (Incentives)

Badge tiers:

Email verified

Phone/SMS verified (+5 newconversation message credits/month)

ID verified (+10 credits, search boost)

Background checked (“Trusted Pro”) (+∞ credits for new conversations, top search tier)

Display: badges in header & on search cards.

Search boost rules: Verified profiles rank above unverified (within relevance range). Backgroundchecked get an extra boost.

Rationale: Tangible perks make verification desirable beyond trust (more DMs, higher visibility), aligning with your incentive idea.

13) Admin & Safety Controls (RoleAware)

Role completeness gates: a Service Profile must meet a minimal completeness score (mandatory fields + 6+ portfolio items) to appear in search.

Moderation by role: media, posts, and reviews are flagged in context of a role.

Dispute/Report always tied to a booking (and thus to a role), keeping records clean.

14) Analytics (User & Internal)

For users (per role and overall):

Views, saves to boards, messages started, booking requests, conversion rate, avg. response time.

Content performance: portfolio item views, post engagement.

For ops (internal):

Liquidity by city/role, search→inquiry→booking funnel, verification adoption, dispute rates by role.

15) Edge Cases & UX Rules

Multirole appearing in one search: Show only the matching role card; breadcrumb says “Also offers: X” (link to other SP page).

Switching roles on profile: Keep sticky tabs visible; switching tabs changes CTA & fields seamlessly.

Adding a new role later: Onboarding wizard for that role (fields + minimal portfolio) before activation.

Calendar conflicts: Booking on any role blocks the account calendar. Attempting overlapping requests prompts a conflict resolution UI.

Reviews spillover: Do not mix ratings across roles in search ranking. Display crossrole ratings in the header for transparency only.

16) MVP vs. PhaseUp (for scope control)

MVP must haves:

Linked Service Profiles; rolefirst search; rolespecific fields & portfolios; roleanchored bookings; rolespecific reviews; unified inbox with role tags; basic follows; basic favorites boards; verification + incentives (email/phone/ID); availability blocking; NSFW gating switch (policy-dependent).

Phase 2+ enhancements:

Packages catalogs, advanced board collaboration, post analytics, social metrics verification integrations, audience demographics for creators, compare view for boards, saved search alerts, deep calendar sync, and DND windows.

17) Acceptance Criteria (we can check these off)

From a Model search, multirole users appear only as Model cards with rolespecific fields.

On reaching a profile from search, the Model tab is active; switching tabs shows other roles without leaving the page.

Booking, messaging, and reviews are tied to the active role.

The inbox groups threads with role context and shows read receipts.

Users can post once and tag the role(s); feeds and profile posts filter accordingly.

Favorites boards accept both role cards and full users; boards are organizable and shareable.

Verification badges grant DM credits and search boost; credits are visible in a simple meter.

Calendar is global; bookings on any role block time across all roles.

Design Rationale (short)

Rolescoped everything (search, rates, reviews, portfolio) = zero confusion for buyers.

One account, linked Service Profiles = low maintenance for multirole users (shared assets, one inbox).

Incentivized verification = safer community + tangible growth perks.

Categoryfirst search = faster decisionmaking + cleaner filters.

Boards & posts = stickiness, collaboration, and social proof without turning into a job board.

Addendum to §1.1 — Roles & IA

FanSubscription Creator (OnlyFans/Fansly/etc.) — Role Definition

New role (toplevel): FanSubscription Creator (icon + label). Appears alongside Model / Photographer / Videographer / Creator in nav and onboarding.

Age gate & safe mode: The global “18+ results” toggle defaults OFF for guests/new users. Turning it ON (with age confirmation) reveals FanSubscription Creators and any profiles with Nudity Tier > Lingerie.

Portfolio policy: Onplatform nonexplicit content only (artistic nudity allowed per policy). Explicit sexual content/acts are prohibited. Links to paid fan platforms are allowed in a dedicated “Links” block.

Deliverables scope: We support SFW collaborations and promo deliverables (IG/TT/YT/X). We do not facilitate explicit content production or sale.

Acceptance criteria

“FanSubscription Creator” is its own role in the role picker, navbar, and category landing pages.

Global 18+ toggle (default OFF) gates visibility; explanatory tooltip clarifies policy.

Profile “Links” block exists; portfolio upload filters block explicit content.

Addendum — §1.1 Roles & Entity Model (Studios as Space Listings) — FINAL

Goal: Introduce Studios as space listings (not roles) that complement talent bookings without diluting the core multirole account model. Keep terminology crisp so search, profiles, reviews, and booking policies remain coherent.

A) Entities & Terminology (strictly §1.1 scope)

Account — one login that can own multiple assets.

Service Profile (Role) — a person-based offering the account can operate under:
Model • Photographer • Videographer • Creator • FanSubscription Creator (unchanged).

Space Listing (Listing Type) — a place-based offering the account can own: Studio.

When verified via the light process in §3.4, it displays the Verified Studio badge.

Key distinction: Studios are listings, not roles. Service Profiles represent people; Studio represents a rentable space.

B) Relationships (what can link to what)

An Account may own 0..N Service Profiles and 0..N Studio listings.

Linking (optional): A Service Profile may link one of the Account’s Studio listings (e.g., a photographer links their cyclorama).

Result: the Service Profile shows a “Owns/Has Studio” chip; the linked Studio’s detail page shows “Hosted by {Profile}”.

Independence: Studios can exist without any Service Profile (e.g., host who only rents space).

C) Classification & Surfaces

Public categories (highlevel):

People (roles): Model / Photographer / Videographer / Creator / FanSubscription Creator

Places (listings): Studio

Search role selector (later detailed in §4.1/§1.2) includes Studio alongside People roles.

Profiles vs Listings:

Service Profile page = person’s offering + booking widget.

Studio Listing page = space details + hourly booking widget.
(UX/page map specifics belong to §4.0/§4.1; this addendum only defines the entities.)

D) Reviews, Reputation & Policies (alignment only)

Reviews & scores are typescoped:

Service Profiles accrue rolespecific reviews.

Studios accrue spacespecific reviews.

Reputation Score is computed separately for Service Profiles vs Studios (consumed by ranking later).

Policies: Talent bookings follow talent matrices; Studio bookings follow studio matrices (per §3.9/Studio addendum). (This addendum only records that they are distinct.)

E) Verification & Gating (entitylevel)

Service Profiles: ID → Instant Book; Background → Trusted Pro (unchanged).

Studios: Studio Lite verification (address/doc check) → Verified Studio badge; Instant Book may require verification (policy in §3.4).

Safe Mode: applies to people profiles with 18+ settings; Studios are not gated by Safe Mode.

F) Data Model (nontechnical description)

ServiceProfile: role_type, role_fields (varies by role), verification_status (ID, BG), reputation metrics.

StudioListing: listing_type=studio, studio_fields (address neighborhood, capacity, amenities), verification_status (unverified | lite_verified), reputation metrics.

Link: optional association from ServiceProfile → StudioListing for “owns/has studio” chip.

Booking: distinct booking objects for Service vs Studio; can be Linked at checkout (see §1.3/§4.0 later).

G) Acceptance Criteria (to mark §1.1 addendum FINAL)

Studios defined as Space Listings, distinct from Service Profiles (roles).

Account may own multiple Service Profiles and Studio listings.

Linking from a Service Profile to an owned Studio is supported (for crosssurfacing chips only; no coupling of reviews).

Review/Rep separation: Service reviews remain rolescoped; Studio reviews are spacescoped.

Verification: Studio uses Studio Lite → Verified Studio badge; Service verification unchanged.

Policy separation acknowledged: talent vs studio matrices handled in their own sections.

H) Why this works

Clarity: People (roles) vs Places (studios) eliminates ambiguity in search, reviews, and policies.

Scalability: One account can grow horizontally (new roles) and vertically (add studio listings) without schema contortions.

Low coupling: Linking is optional and displayonly, preserving clean ownership and independent

SubSection 1.2 — RoleSpecific Data & Advanced Search

1) Design Goal

Make search pinpoint and commercially relevant (not gear-nerdy), so a buyer can quickly find the exact look, reach, budget fit, availability, and reliability they need—then book in a few clicks.

2) Global Search UX (CategoryFirst)

Step 1 (Required): User selects a Role to search: Models / Photographers / Videographers / Creators.

Step 2: Search bar accepts keywords; Advanced Filters change per role.

Result Card = Service Profile (rolescoped): name, city, role label, role rating, starting rate, 2–3 rolespecific highlights, verification badges, followers/engagement (if connected), and Instant Book badge (if enabled).

Clickthrough: Goes to the role page (e.g., /u/jane/model) with sticky tabs to view Jane’s other roles.

3) Global Filters (apply to every role)

Location & distance radius

Available on (date/time picker) → “Only show profiles available on this date”

Budget / starting rate (range)

Rating (min stars) & # of reviews (min)

Verification (ID / Backgroundchecked / Socialverified)

Response time (e.g., “usually replies within 2h”)

Completion / cancellation rate (reliability)

Instant Book toggle (see §7)

Languages; Travel willing (local only / regional / national)

Last active (e.g., last 7 days)

These are the “what buyers care about” filters—availability, price, quality, trust, reliability, and speed.

4) RoleSpecific Filters (what truly matters)

4.1 Models

Look & presence (high impact):

Height, measurements (bust/chest, waist, hips; cup optional), dress/clothing, shoe

Body type, tattoos, piercings, hair (color/length), eye color, skin tone, facial hair (if applicable)

Age (18+ only platform), ethnicity (selfdescribed)

Categories/levels (fashion, beauty, fitness, swim, lingerie, artistic nude if allowed—see §9)

Commercial/operational:

Rate (hour/day), travel radius & travel fee, chaperone friendly, release preference (e.g., standard model release)

Reliability signals: noshow rate, ontime rate, average reply time

Social signals (if connected): platform(s), followers range, engagement rate, audience top geos, growth rate 30d (see §5)

Competitors already filter basics like hair/height/measurements; we add reliability, availability, and audience quality—which they lack.

4.2 Photographers

Focus on result buyers see, not gear:

Specialties (portrait, fashion/editorial, beauty, commercial, product, events)

Style descriptors (natural light, moody, highkey, cinematic, colortrue, retouchedlook)

Deliverables (e.g., “# edited images”, RAW available?, lookbook, campaign, ecomm sets)

Turnaround (e.g., 48h, 1 week)

Studio access (yes/no), preferred shoot types (instudio, outdoor), chaperone welcome

Rate (hour/day/packages)

Reliability (completion rate, ontime rate), rating

Social signals (if connected): followers, engagement, recent growth

We remove gear/software filters; nonphotographer buyers don’t care. We foreground style, deliverables, turnaround, studio access, price, reliability.

4.3 Videographers

Content types (shortform reels, promo, music video, event, interview, product)

Deliverables (duration formats, aspect—vertical/horizontal), # of revisions, sound capture (yes/no), captions (yes/no)

Turnaround, rate, travel

Style (snappy/reels, cinematic, docu, productclean)

Reliability, rating

Social signals (followers, avg views—if connected)

4.4 Content Creators / Influencers

Platforms (IG/TikTok/YouTube/…); posting frequency

Followers range, engagement rate, avg video views, story views (if available)

Audience demographics (top countries/cities, age/gender splits) & brand safety tag

Niches (beauty, fitness, cosplay, gaming, fashion, etc.)

Deliverables & rates (grid post, story set, reel/short, live, bundle), lead time

Growth rate 30/90d, prior brand collabs

Reliability (ontime posting rate), rating

Verified social metrics & audience demographics are available via firstparty APIs when the creator connects their accounts (details §5). TikTok Creator Marketplace & IG Graph API support verified metrics for optedin professional accounts; YouTube API provides channel stats.

5) Social Metrics: Live, Verified & Searchable

What’s possible (2025):

Instagram (Graph API): For Creator/Business accounts that connect, we can fetch followers_count, media stats, and some insights; Business Discovery lets you query other professional accounts’ public metrics within policy. (Regular personal accounts are limited.)

YouTube Data/Analytics APIs: Provide subscriber counts, view counts, watch time & more for connected channels.

TikTok: Via Login/Display API we can show connected profile/video info; richer audience/engagement demographics are available through Creator Marketplace / Business integrations for optedin creators/partners.

OnlyFans: No official public API; thirdparty wrappers rely on reverseengineering and are not official or guaranteed. So we should not promise live OF metrics; we can let creators link OF and selfdisclose stats, optionally verified manually.

Product approach:

“Connect Socials” module for any role. If connected, we show a Verified Social badge + live counts on profile & enable search filters (followers/engagement/growth/audience geos) for those users.

Privacy & consent: Only metrics the user consents to share are displayed and indexed.

Fallback when not connected: userentered stats (clearly marked Unverified; not searchable by metrics).

Data freshness: sync nightly; fast ondemand refresh button with ratelimits.

6) Packages & Extras (Fiverrstyle) — Required on every Service Profile

Each role supports:

Packages (Basic / Standard / Premium) with deliverables, turnaround, revision count, and price.

Extras (addons): examples by role

Models: “Wardrobe change packs”, “Travel to location (miles)”, “Social shoutout addon”, “Rush booking”

Photographers: “Extra edited images”, “Rush delivery”, “RAWs”, “Studio included”, “MUA coordination”

Videographers: “Extra revisions”, “Captions/subtitles”, “Vertical cutdowns”, “Thumbnail package”

Creators: “Extra story frames”, “Link in bio (X days)”, “Pin post (X days)”, “Crosspost to TikTok”

Usage/licensing tiers (Commercial / Paid Ads / Exclusive / Buyout) with clear pricing.

Instant Book allowed when provider sets autorules (e.g., package X, availability, radius).

This removes TFP ambiguity and makes booking pure ecommerce: see options → add extras → pay → schedule.

7) Fixing the “Manual Networking” Problem (for low and highfollower users)

A. Instant Book + Smart Availability

Talent can optin to Instant Book by defining guardrails (packages, calendar windows, location radius). Search filter “Instant Book” shows readytobook now talent.

Smart availability filter: pick date/time → show only available Service Profiles.

B. Smart Invites (private, not a job board)

A buyer can select up to N profiles and send a single, personalized booking invite that reaches each privately (no public listing).

Autoaccept rules (for busy/highfollower talent): “autoaccept if: package ≥ $X, travel ≤ Y, brand safe, date in my windows.”

C. Concierge (Pro)

For VIPs and brands: a paid Concierge that assembles shortlists, handles invites, negotiates packages/extras, and schedules. Revenue: subscription or perengagement fee.

D. Collab Mode (for highhigh, noncash)

Zerocash collaboration contracts with deliverables (shoot + crossposting obligations). Both sides sign; platform tracks performance (proofofpost, content delivered).

We monetize via Pro plan features, not commission, and still accrue reviews + reliability metrics.

E. AudienceFit Match

For creators/models: filter/score by audience geos and engagement (e.g., “US female 18–24 heavy”) so buyers pay for reach that matters.

Existing platforms make you post castings or DM endlessly; Swipecast leans into job posts with live chat. We avoid public job boards and keep 1to1 booking, plus powerful smart invites and autoaccept to remove the manual grind.

8) Boards (Favorites) for Real Projects

Save role cards into project boards, add notes (budget, fit, priority).

Bulk actions: Invite all, Request availability, Compare (rates, social reach, reliability).

Share board as private link to collaborators (internal/agency use).

9) NSFW & OnlyFans Policy — Decision Framework & Recommendation

Reality: payment processors (Stripe/PayPal) restrict adult content; explicit sexual content risks account shutdowns.

Options

Mainstreamfirst (Recommended)

Allow SFW + artistic nudity (nonexplicit) with NSFW gating and age/ID verification; disallow explicit sexual content onplatform.

Allow OnlyFans creators as users; portfolios must follow our content rules. They can link to OF externally; we don’t ingest OF metrics (no official API).

Use mainstream processors (easier scaling & brandsafe).

Adultfriendly lane (complex)

Permit explicit content in a segregated, agegated area; requires adultfriendly payment processors and heavy compliance (age checks, recordkeeping). High ops/compliance cost; potential ad restrictions.

Recommendation: Option 1 for launch. Capture the boudoir/glamour business and OF creators (as creators) without explicit content on the site. Revisit a dedicated adult lane only after strong traction and compliance capability.

10) SingleCompose Feed (No Double Posting), Smart Delivery

User posts once, tags one or more roles (Model/Photog/etc.).

Delivery:

Followers choose role preferences when following a user; the feed shows posts matching their interests first.

Dedupe: if a post is multitagged, we only show it once to the follower.

Profile Posts tab defaults to the role you’re viewing; toggle “All roles”.

Templates: Availability update, Portfolio drop, BTS, Looking to collab (private invite CTA, not public job).

Optional: crosspost to connected socials (later).

This keeps posting simple for multirole users while giving followers clean, relevant feeds.

11) Extra Verifications (low cost, high trust)

Baseline (free): email + phone/SMS; 2FA optional.

ID & Age (paid): document + selfie liveness via IDV provider (e.g., Persona/Onfido). Typical SMB pricing starts around $250/mo platform minimums or percheck fees; we can pass costs to users wanting the badge.

Background Check (paid, optional “Trusted Pro”): US checks via vendor (e.g., Checkr packages ~$30–$90/report). We pass through + small margin; renewal annually.

SocialVerified (free): connect IG/TikTok/YT for verified metrics badge (see §5).

PaymentVerified (free): valid card/bank on file.

StudioVerified (optional): onetime address + utility/biz doc for studio listings.

ReferenceVerified (free): after N completed bookings with >4★ average, earn “Great Partner” ribbon (automated).

Incentives: Each badge improves search boost and DM credits (as we set in §1.1), so verification increases bookings and offsets its cost.

12) Pricing Impact of Verifications

We do not absorb expensive checks at scale; instead:

Passthrough direct costs (IDV/background) with small margin.

Bundle into Pro subscription (includes 1 ID check + search boost + analytics Pro).

Net effect: verifications pay for themselves via higher ranking, more DMs, Instant Book eligibility, and higher conversion. (We’ll track uplift in Analytics, §13.)

13) ProviderSide Analytics (RightSized)

Core (free)

Views → Messages → Bookings funnel (per role)

Search queries & top filters that surfaced you (e.g., “5′8″+ fitness models in Houston”)

Avg position in search for your key filters (est.)

Package performance (acceptance, upsell to extras)

Reliability metrics (response time, cancellation rate)

Social snippet if connected: followers, engagement trend (30d)

Pro (paid)

Audience analytics (for creators): geo/age/gender summaries from APIs

Benchmarking: your rates/turnaround vs. local peers (by role & rating)

Price optimizer suggestions (raise/drop by X% based on conversion)

Boarding intelligence: who saved you to boards; abandoned invite recovery prompts

ROI calculators (e.g., cost per 1k engaged audience for creators/models)

We’ll use public platform benchmarks to contextualize engagement expectations (e.g., TikTok engagement averages).

14) Acceptance Criteria (for this section)

Rolefirst search with rolespecific filters deployed.

SocialVerified users show live metrics and can be filtered by followers/engagement/audience (platform permitting).

Packages + Extras required for checkout across roles.

Instant Book, Smart Invites, and Autoaccept rules working (nonpublic, not a job board).

NSFW policy implemented per recommendation (artistic nudity only; explicit disallowed; NSFW gating + 18+ checks).

Singlecompose, multitag feed with follower role preferences and dedupe.

Verification badges confer search boost + DM credits; paid checks passthrough costs.

Core Analytics panel live; Pro Analytics gated behind subscription.

15) Competitive Notes (Why this wins)

ModelMayhem/PurplePort: filters exist for appearance but lack availability, reliability, and true audience metrics; UX is dated and often forum/casting dependent. We modernize with ecommerce booking, reputation signals, and socialverified discovery.

Swipecast: strong on job posts & payments, but our smart invites + instant book + verified social metrics deliver faster 1to1 bookings and eliminate the “manual casting call” drag.

Quick Answers to Your Specific Points

“Live display of social metrics & searchable?” Yes, for connected Instagram Creator/Business, YouTube, and TikTok (within respective APIs/permissions). OF has no official public API—so no live OF search.

“Don’t show gear/software for photographers.” Done—our filters focus on style, deliverables, turnaround, rate, reliability, studio access.

“No TFP in search; make it like Airbnb/Fiverr.” Agreed—Packages + Extras with instant book/escrow = frictionless paid bookings. We support Collab Mode separately for highhigh noncash pairings (keeps brand clean & still builds reputation).

“NSFW & OnlyFans?” Launch mainstreamfirst (allow artistic nudity with gating, no explicit content). Allow OF creators on the platform but don’t ingest OF metrics. This keeps payments simple (Stripe/PayPalcompatible) and brandsafe.

“One post or multiple per role?” One post with role tags; followers see only what they opted into; profile posts default to the active role tab.

“More verifications?” Added SocialVerified, PaymentVerified, StudioVerified, ReferenceVerified—lowcost, hightrust. Paid checks (ID, Background) are passthrough with perks to offset cost.

“Analytics size?” Start with Core (funnel, search terms, package performance), then upsell Pro (benchmarks, audience analytics, price optimizer).

A) Global search flow (unchanged)

Step 1 (required): pick a role to search (Models / Photographers / Videographers / Creators).

Step 2: rolespecific filters appear; result card is a Service Profile (SP) with role label, rating, starting price, highlights, verification, social metrics (if verified), and Instant Book badge (if enabled).

B) Rolespecific filters (final list)

Global filters (all roles): Location+radius, Available on (date/time), Budget (range), Rating & # reviews, Verification (ID / Background / SocialVerified), Response time, Completion rate, Instant Book, Languages, Travel willing, Last active.

Models — “find the look + reliability + reach”

Look: height; measurements (bust/chest, waist, hips; cup optin); dress/clothing; shoe; body type; tattoos; piercings; hair (color/length); eye color; skin tone; facial hair (if applicable); age (18+ only); ethnicity (selfdescribed).

Work & logistics: categories (fashion, beauty, fitness, swim, artistic nude); base rate (hour/day); travel radius/fee; chaperonefriendly; release preference.

Reliability: reply time, ontime rate, noshow rate.

Social (if connected): platform(s), followers range, engagement rate, 30day growth, audience geos.

Photographers — “style, output, speed, price”

Style/specialty: portrait, fashion/editorial, beauty, commercial, product, events; style descriptors (natural light, cinematic, highkey, moody, colortrue).

Deliverables: edited image count, RAW provided?, lookbook/ecomm sets; turnaround; studio access (yes/no); preferred shoot type (studio/outdoor).

Rates: hour/day, packages.

Reliability: completion, ontime, rating.

Social (if connected): followers, engagement, recent growth.

Videographers — “format, deliverables, speed, price”

Types: reels/shorts, promo, music video, event, interview, product.

Deliverables: runtime(s), aspect (vertical/horizontal), revisions, sound capture, captions.

Turnaround, rate, travel.

Style: snappy/reels, cinematic, docu, productclean.

Reliability & social (as above).

Creators/Influencers — “reach that matches goals”

Platforms: IG/TikTok/YouTube (multiselect).

Followers, engagement rate, avg views, story views (if available).

Audience: top countries/cities; age/gender split (if available).

Niches: beauty, fitness, cosplay, gaming, fashion, etc.

Deliverables & rates: grid post, stories pack, reel/short, live, bundles; lead time.

Growth (30/90d); prior brand collabs; reliability (ontime posting rate), rating.

Note: these social filters are enabled when a user has granted the platform access via Instagram Graph / YouTube / TikTok APIs; otherwise results can include Unverified stats only if the buyer toggles them on.

C) Packages & extras (final)

Booking baseline (required): Every SP must have either

≥1 package (Basic/Standard/Premium with deliverables, turnaround, revisions), or

A clear hourly/day rate (min duration + what’s included).

Extras (optional but encouraged):

Models: wardrobe changes; travel miles; social shoutout; rush booking.

Photographers: extra edits; rush delivery; RAWs; studio included; MUA coordination.

Videographers: extra revisions; captions; vertical cutdowns; thumbnails.

Creators: extra stories; linkinbio days; pinnedpost days; crosspost to TikTok.

Usage/licensing tiers for all roles (Commercial / Ads / Exclusive / Buyout) with transparent pricing.

D) Instant Book / Smart Invites / Autoaccept (final)

Instant Book (optin):

Talent defines rules: which packages, price minimum, travel radius, date windows, advancenotice buffer.

If the buyer’s request matches, they can book instantly (escrow charged; calendar autoblocked; chat opens for details).

Talent can cap daily/weekly instant bookings to avoid overload.

Smart Invites (private, not a job board):

A buyer selects up to N profiles and sends a single invite (shared brief, proposed date/time/package, budget).

Each recipient receives a private request; the buyer can award 1 slot (first to accept or manual choose) or multiple slots for team shoots.

Prevents broadcast spam; keeps everything 1to1.

Autoaccept (for highdemand users):

Talent can set autoaccept rules (e.g., “autoaccept Standard or Premium packages ≥ $X, weekday 10am–2pm, within 10 miles”).

Perfect for highfollower users who don’t want backandforth.

Payment is captured on accept; cancellation rules apply.

These three together eliminate the “manual chase” for both lowfollower buyers (instant transactions) and highfollowertohighfollower pairings (autoaccept + Smart Invites).

E) Social metrics (productized)

Connect Socials (any role):

Instagram (Creator/Business): followers_count, recent media stats, and Insights where permissioned.

YouTube: subscriberCount, views, watch time via Data/Analytics APIs.

TikTok: Display/authorized user info (follower counts where scopes permit).

OnlyFans: link only (no live metrics—no official public API).

Verification levels:

Verified Social (connected): metrics shown, appear in Verifiedonly filters.

Unverified (selfreported): labeled clearly; excluded when buyers toggle “Verified only.”

How we compute “engagement rate”:

IG: avg(likes+comments) on last 12 feed posts ÷ followers.

TikTok: avg views/likes on last 20 public videos ÷ followers (show both ER and avg views).

YouTube: avg views per video last 20 ÷ subscribers (plus shorts vs nonshorts disclosure).
(Exact formulas displayed in “ⓘ” tooltips on the filter panel.)

Freshness & load:

Nightly sync; manual refresh up to 3×/day per platform (ratelimited).

We store daily snapshots to calculate 30/90day growth and show a trend sparkline.

Privacy: users choose which platforms to show and which metrics to index in search.

F) NSFW & OnlyFans (launch rules)

Allowed: SFW and artistic nudity (nonexplicit), behind an NSFW toggle; 18+ verified users only.

Disallowed: explicit sexual content, pornographic acts, escorting/services.

OF creators welcome: can link OF; onsite portfolio must follow our rules; no live OF metrics.

Why: Stripe/PayPal restrictions on adult content; this path preserves mainstream payments and brandsafe growth.

G) Feed (singlecompose, multitag)

Creators post once and tag one or more roles.

Follower preferences: when following, users choose which role tags they want to see; feed shows relevant posts once (deduped).

On profile, Posts defaults to the active role tab; toggle “All roles.”

H) Acceptance criteria (updated)

Rolefirst search with final role filters above.

Verifiedonly social filters work for IG/YouTube/TikTok when connected; Unverified stats clearly labeled and excluded by default.

Every SP has ≥1 package or a base rate; extras optional.

Instant Book, Smart Invites, and Autoaccept function as specified.

NSFW policy enforced (artistic nudity gated; explicit disallowed); OF linking allowed.

Singlecompose, multitag feed with follower role preferences and dedupe.

Implementation notes (brief)

Search index: Each Service Profile is its own document; social metrics fields are written only for Verified Social accounts (with a usertoggle to include/exclude unverified numbers in search results).

Metrics storage: Perplatform table of daily snapshots → compute 30/90day growth and ER.

UI copy: On filters, add “ⓘ Verified by platform connection”; on unverified, “ⓘ Selfreported (not platform verified)”.

Addendum to §1.2 (Search)

RoleSpecific Data & Advanced Search

Recommendation: Insert these as new subsections after your existing role filters (e.g., §1.2.7 → §1.2.11). Keep all trust/verification definitions in §1.5; only keep here what directly affects search UI, filters, results, and ranking.

§1.2.7 PerPlatform Social Search (IG, YT, TT, X; Phase2: LinkedIn, Facebook Pages, Snapchat)

New filter group: “Social Platforms.” Users toggle any mix of platforms, then set perplatform filters:

Instagram — Followers (min–max), Engagement Rate (min %), 30/90day growth (min %).
Live when the user connects an IG Business/Creator account; Business Discovery may show limited public metrics for other pro accounts, within policy.

YouTube — Subscribers (min–max), Avg views/video (min), 30/90day growth.
Live when channel is connected.

TikTok — Followers (min–max), Avg views/video (min), Engagement Rate (min %), 30/90day growth.
Live when account is connected (scopes required).

X (Twitter) — Followers (min–max), Engagement (avg likes+reposts+replies), growth.
Subject to API access level/quotas.

Phase2 (optin): LinkedIn Pages/Members, Facebook Pages, Snapchat Public Profiles — Followers/subscribers if connected and API access granted.
Until then: linkonly + selfreported stats (clearly marked Unverified).

Filter logic:

Match ANY (default) or Match ALL selected platforms.

Verifiedonly toggle (only include metrics pulled via official connections/APIs).

Optional Include selfreported toggle to expand results.

Result cards: perplatform chips, e.g., IG 182k • 2.8% ER, TT 530k • 120k avg views, with a “ⓘ Verified by platform” tooltip.

§1.2.8 Engagement Metrics — Definitions & BeginnerFriendly UX

Computed consistently (shown in tooltips):

IG ER = avg (likes + comments) on last 12 feed posts ÷ followers.

TikTok ER = avg (likes + comments + shares) on last 20 public videos ÷ followers; also show avg views.

YouTube = avg views on last 20 uploads (Shorts vs longform shown separately) ÷ subscribers.

X = avg (likes + reposts + replies) on last 20 posts ÷ followers.

Controls:

Simple mode: “Engagement level” slider (Low ↔︎ High) with presets (e.g., Top 20%, Top 10% in city/role).

Advanced mode: numeric inputs (ER ≥ %, Avg views ≥ N).

Inline explainer: “Followers ≠ engagement” (1sentence card with example).

Freshness: nightly sync + manual refresh up to 3×/day per platform (ratelimited).

§1.2.9 Supported Platforms — Day1 vs Phase2

Day1: Instagram (Business/Creator), YouTube, TikTok, X/Twitter (connected accounts).

Phase2: LinkedIn Pages/Members (partner access), Facebook Pages, Snapchat Public Profiles (partner access).

Always linkonly fallback: users can selfreport (labeled Unverified) and request manual verify for large accounts.

§1.2.10 Search Integration with Trust Signals & Boosting (hooks)

(Definitions and policies live in §1.5; this subsection defines how search uses them.)

Studio access (from §1.5): add Search filter: Studio access = Verified.

References (from §1.5): add Search filter: Has verified references (≥ N).

Reputation Score (from §1.5):

Filter: Min Rep Score; Sort: Top Reputation.

Ranking: Rep Score is a tiebreaker after relevance, availability, distance, price.

Paid Boosting (pricing & rules detailed later in Monetization):

Search can render Promoted placements (Search Boost, Profile Highlight) only if the result still matches all active filters.

Enforce ad density caps (e.g., ≤2 promoted in top 20; ≤1 above the fold).

Eligibility checks (Rep ≥ 70, ID Verified, no recent strikes) come from §1.5 signals.

§1.2.11 Acceptance Criteria (Search addendum)

Search supports perplatform filters (IG, YT, TT, X), Verifiedonly toggle, and ANY/ALL logic; Phase2 placeholders for LinkedIn/Facebook/Snapchat.

Result cards show perplatform chips with verified tooltips; profile pages show chips + trend sparklines.

Engagement filters offer Simple (Top 10/20%) and Advanced (ER %, Avg views) modes; tooltips explain each metric plainly.

Filters for trust signals (Studio Verified, Verified references, Min Rep Score) are available and integrated into ranking as specified.

Promoted slots render with clear labeling, density caps, and only within matching searches.

Addendum to §1.2 — Search (Models/Creators) — Comfort & Boundary Filters + FanSubscription Creators (FINAL)

Policy anchor: We’re mainstreamfirst. Artistic nudity (nonexplicit) is allowed; explicit sexual content/acts are not. All nudityrelated options are 18+ and IDgated (see §3.4). Processors remain mainstreamsafe.

A) Comfort & Boundary Filters (visible on Model/Creator profiles & in search)

Nudity tier (multiselect, 18+ only):

No Nudity

Lingerie/Swimwear

Implied Nudity (no explicit exposure)

Topless (nonsexualized context; policycompliant)

Artistic Nude (nonexplicit; no sexual acts)

Content boundaries (toggle chips): sheer/seethrough, bodypaint, boudoir, glamour, fetish (not allowed) clearly flagged as disallowed.

Comfort notes: freetext “Do/Don’t” section (e.g., “comfortable with implied shower scenes; no oil/latex”).

Chaperone policy: “Chaperone welcome” toggle; “Femaleonly teams preferred” toggle.

Search panel gets these as filters; results show chips like “Artistic Nude • Chaperone OK”.

B) FanSubscription Creators (e.g., OnlyFans/Fansly) — role & search support

Role mapping: treat as a Creator subtype: “FanSubscription Creator”.

Portfolio rules: no explicit sexual content on our platform; link outs allowed in a dedicated “Links” section.

Metrics: since there’s no reliable public API, show selfreported subscriber counts with “Unverified” label; allow manual verification on request (e.g., screenshot billing dashboard → staff verifies → “Verified by Platform” chip).

Search filters: “FanSubscription Creator: Yes”, Subscriber count (selfreported), Open to Collabs toggle.

Collab deliverables: add preset deliverables like IG Collab Post, Story Mention, TT Duet/Stitch, with posting windows (e.g., within 72h) and link verification (see §3.5 addendum below).

C) Age & Policy Gates

IDverified 18+ required to select any nudity tier above Lingerie/Swimwear.

Booking form includes Nudity & Boundaries step; both parties confirm tiers and chaperone policy.

Autoflagging: briefs requesting explicit sexual acts are blocked with policy guidance.

D) Acceptance Criteria

Search filters for Nudity Tier, Chaperone OK, Comfort notes present; chips displayed on cards/profile.

Creator subtype “FanSubscription Creator” live; linkout section; selfreported metrics with “Unverified” label + optional manual verify.

Booking brief includes Nudity & Boundaries acknowledgments; ID gate enforced.

Addendum to §1.2 — Search & Discovery

Filters & Chips for FanSubscription Creators

New filter group: Creator Type

FanSubscription Creator (toggle) — shows only creators who selfidentify in this role.

Metrics (roleaware)

Subscriber count (selfreported) — ranges: 0–1k, 1–5k, 5–20k, 20–100k, 100k+ (shown with Unverified label unless manually verified).

Promo readiness — “Open to collabs,” “Open to SFW shoots,” preferred platforms (IG/TT/YT/X).

Social metrics — perplatform followers/ER/growth (from OAuth connections), as already defined in §1.2 addendum.

Comfort & safety chips (present for this role too)

Nudity Tier (No Nudity, Lingerie/Swim, Implied, Topless, Artistic Nude), Chaperone OK, Femaleonly teams preferred.

Results UI

Cards display role chip: “FanSubscription Creator”, plus social chips (IG 182k • 3% ER) and, if supplied, Subs 5–20k (Unverified).

Acceptance criteria

New role filter & result chips live; 18+ toggle must be ON to surface these results.

Subscriber count is labeled Unverified by default; manual verification adds a Verified by Platform chip.

Addendum — §1.2 Search & Discovery (Studios) — FINAL

Goal: Add Studios as a searchable space listing type with creativespecific filters, clear result cards, savedsearch support, and ranking rules that keep talentfirst flows intact. This does not elevate Studios to a coequal pillar—just a complementary search mode and attach step.

A) Role Selector & Entry Points

Role selector (top of Search) adds Studio alongside Model / Photographer / Videographer / Creator / FanSubscription Creator.

Safe Mode: does not hide Studios (no 18+ gating for spaces).

Attach in flow: When a buyer searches talent with a date/time, a “Suggest Studios nearby” pill appears; clicking opens the Studio search prefiltered by city/date/time.

B) Filters (Studio role only)

Core

City & radius (mi/km)

Date & time window (single slot or range)

Duration (hours) with Min hours enforcement

Price / hr (min–max)

Capacity (people)

Size (sq ft / m²) (optional)

Creative amenities (toggle chips)

Natural light (orientation optional: N/E/S/W)

Cyclorama wall (chip) + dimension field (optional)

Blackout capable

Ceiling height ≥ N ft

Soundtreated / quiet

Parking / loadin (street, lot, garage; freight elevator)

Makeup station / dressing room

Seamless paper available (colors count)

Grip/lighting available (Yes/No; rental addon)

Climate control (A/C)

Kitchenette / bathroom / shower

Set builds / backgrounds allowed

Rules & policies

Instant Book only (toggle)

Verified Studio only (toggle)

Overtime policy shown (readonly pill in results)

Sort

Best match (default), Price, Distance, Availability first, Rating

C) Results UX

Card content

Cover image; Title; Neighborhood; Price / hr; Min hours

Verified Studio badge (if Liteverified)

Amenity chips (e.g., Natural light • Cyc wall • Blackout • 14’ ceilings)

Instant Book chip (if enabled)

Capacity; Rating (★, count)

Map view

Optional toggle; markers show price/hr; hover sync with list.

Empty states

If no matches: show nearby neighborhoods, relaxfilters tips, and “Broaden date window” quick actions.

D) Saved Searches & Alerts

Users can Save Search in Studio mode (all filters preserved).

Daily batched alerts for new/updated studios matching the saved query.

Combo templates: “Talent + Studio in [City] this weekend” creates two saved searches (talent & studio) tied to the same date window.

E) Ranking Logic (Studio role)

Order = Relevance to filters → Availability match (slot fit, min hours) → Distance → Price fit (to buyer’s range) → Reputation (space reviews) → Verified Studio tiebreak → Instant Book tiebreak.

No paytowin: Paid promotions (if enabled later per §3.3) sit in clearly labeled, densitycapped positions and never bypass filter matching.

Freshness: recent calendar updates get a small boost (avoids stale listings).

F) AttachinFlow (from Talent Search)

When a buyer has a talent query with a date/time:

A “Attach a Studio” pill appears above results.

Clicking opens the Studio search preseeded with city/date/time/duration; top three results appear in an inline drawer with amenity chips.

Selecting a studio adds it to the checkout summary as a Linked Booking Group (see §1.3 addendum).

G) Analytics & Events

search.role=studio, filter.apply.amenity, studio.instant_book.filter_on

saved_search.create.studio, alert.open.studio

attach_studio.opened, attach_studio.suggested_click, attach_studio.selected

H) Acceptance Criteria (mark §1.2 addendum FINAL)

Studio appears in role selector; Safe Mode does not gate Studio visibility.

Studiospecific filters implemented (core, creative amenities, rules).

Result cards show Verified badge, Instant Book chip, amenity chips, capacity, rating.

Saved search & daily alerts work in Studio mode; combo template creates paired searches.

Attach a Studio pill appears in talent searches with date/time; opens prefiltered Studio drawer; selection persists to checkout.

Ranking follows relevance → availability → distance → price fit → rep → verified → IB; no paytowin.

I) Why this works

Creators’ needs first: Filters reflect real shoot needs (light, cyc, blackout, loadin).

Low friction attach: Suggesting studios in context boosts award rates without bloating nav.

Clean ranking: Availability & fit come before badges, keeping search results trustworthy.

SubSection 1.3 — Booking, Payments & Disputes

Purpose: Make booking as fast and trustable as Airbnb/Fiverr: clear options, instant or nearinstant confirmation, escrowed payment, transparent cancellation rules, and a fair dispute process — all optimized for repeatable revenue and low support overhead.

A) Key Concepts & Objects

Service Profile (SP): The bookable unit for a role (Model / Photographer / Videographer / Creator). All bookings are tied to a specific SP.

Package: A preconfigured offer (deliverables, duration, turnaround, revisions, price). Each SP must have ≥1 package or a base hourly/day rate.

Extras (optional): Addons the buyer can select at checkout (rush, extra edits, travel miles, etc.). Not required to publish.

Usage License: A selectable tier (Commercial / Ads / Exclusive / Buyout) with clear terms & price adders.

Instant Book: Book without messaging if the request matches the SP’s autorules.

Smart Invite: Private multirecipient invite (no public job board) that lets the buyer send one request to N profiles and award 1 or more slots.

Autoaccept Rules (optin): Talent-defined conditions that autoaccept requests (e.g., package ≥ $X, weekday window, <=10 miles).

B) Booking Modes (How a booking starts)

Instant Book (optin by talent)

Visible “Instant Book” badge in search.

Buyer selects date/time, package, extras, license, location, pays → booking confirmed immediately if within rules.

Calendar blocked; chat thread opens automatically.

RequesttoBook

Buyer configures the same elements; sends a request.

Talent can Accept / Decline / Counter (send Custom Offer with different package/price/time).

On Accept, payment is captured and booking confirmed.

SLA nudges: autoexpire unanswered requests (e.g., 48h) to keep the funnel clean.

Smart Invite (private)

Buyer selects up to N profiles → writes one brief (date/time, package/budget).

Each recipient receives a private invite; buyer can award one or multiple hires.

Reduces backandforth while avoiding a public job board.

C) Checkout & Payment Flow (Buyer experience)

Select Offer: Choose package or base rate duration; pick extras and license tier.

Pick Date/Time: Required; availability filter helps show open slots.

Location: Address or “studio provided by talent” if applicable; travel fee dynamically calculated if the SP adds permile pricing.

Contract Pack (autoattached):

Booking Agreement (scope, deliverables, schedule, payment terms, cancellation, safety rules).

Usage License (for photographer/videographer deliverables; simple, prepriced tiers).

Model Release (autoattached if booking a model).

Content Promotion Terms (for Creators: posting timeline, tag/credit rules).

Parties esign at checkout; all docs stored with the booking.

Summary & Fees: Subtotal, platform fees (see §E), taxes (if any), and escrow notice.

Pay & Confirm: Card or bank method; funds moved to escrow; confirmation screen and email. Calendar blocks for both parties; chat opens.

Tip: Show a small “What you get” panel (deliverables, revisions, turnaround, license) and a separate “What’s not included” to reduce postshoot disputes.

D) Escrow, Release, and Payouts (Money movement)

Escrow on Accept/Book: Buyer is charged; funds held in custodial escrow.

Completion signal:

Timebased jobs (e.g., hiring a model): Provider taps “Completed” after session; client has 24–48h to confirm or raise a dispute.

Deliverablebased jobs (e.g., photo/video/creator posts): Provider marks individual milestones (Shoot done → Proofs delivered → Finals delivered) or single “Delivered” if simple. Client has review window per milestone.

Autorelease: If no dispute is opened by the end of the window, payout is autoreleased.

Payout timing:

Standard: Release 48h after completion confirmation (or window expiry).

New provider risk policy: First X payouts delayed up to 7 days or reserve % held to reduce chargeback/fraud risk; relax as reputation builds.

Payout methods: Bank transfer (ACH) primary; backup options (PayPal, etc.).

Tips: After completion (or milestone), buyer can add a tip (0% platform fee on tips to encourage generosity).

E) Fee & Pricing Strategy (Revenue model)

Goal: be simpler and fairer than legacy directories, with enough margin to fund verification, support, and growth.

Recommended baseline (US launch):

Provider fee (commission): 12% of booking subtotal.

Buyer service fee: 5% (min $2).

Processing costs: Covered within these fees (we keep the math simple for users).

Elastic incentives (drive behaviors we want):

Instant Book discount: Provider fee – 1% on Instant Book transactions (promotes “buy now”).

Verified boosts: Backgroundchecked providers get –0.5% fee and ranking boost (ties to Trust incentives).

Highvalue tiering: For any single booking subtotal > $1,000, provider fee on the portion above that drops to 10%.

Alternatives to test (A/B later):

15% provider, 0% buyer (simpler, common in marketplaces).

8% provider, 7% buyer (shifts load to buyer; sometimes better acceptance with pros).

We’ll start with the baseline, track conversion and sentiment, and optimize. Promotions (e.g., zero buyer fee for first booking) can accelerate adoption.

F) Changes, Overtime & OnSet Additions

Overtime: In booking thread, either party can propose overtime in 30/60min increments at a preset rate; both tap to confirm; card is incrementally charged; calendar extended.

Extras after checkout: Provider can offer postcheckout extras (e.g., “+10 edits”) as onetap upsells; buyer approves & pays.

Travel/expenses: Preapproved extras (travel miles, parking, studio rental). For adhoc expenses: upload receipt → buyer approves (or dispute) → charge processed.

G) Rescheduling & Cancellations (Policies)

Providers choose one of three policy templates per SP (or per package). Buyers see the policy before paying.

Noshows & late arrivals (defaults):

Noshow (buyer): 0% refund; provider may still be reviewed.

Noshow (provider): 100% refund + strike; buyer may review; provider flagged for support review.

Grace: 15minute grace window; beyond that, time may be deducted or counted as noshow per policy.

Safety & force majeure exceptions:

Harassment, unsafe location, severe illness, natural events → Support can override to full/partial refund; strikes applied accordingly. A “safety cancel” reason shields public review text (but logs internally).

Reschedule flow:

Either party proposes a new time; if accepted, booking updates.

If not accepted within policy windows, original cancellation terms apply.

H) Disputes (Fair, timeboxed, evidencedriven)

When: Buyer or provider can open a dispute before payout (or within X hours after if autoreleased; we’ll keep this window short).

What we collect (inthread):

Timeline: checkin/out times, chat logs, shared files, signed contracts, location pin (if enabled).

Evidence uploads: screenshots, deliverables, RAW proof (when relevant).

Resolution paths:

Noshow / not as described / deliverables missing:

Timebased jobs: prorated or full refund depending on attendance.

Deliverablebased: partial refund based on % of agreed deliverables; or full refund if nothing delivered.

Partial performance: Mediation suggests partial settlement (we generate a proposed split both can accept).

Bad faith / repeated issues: Strikes, suspension, or removal (internal policy).

Outcome handling:

If settlement agreed → escrow splits accordingly.

If not → platform decides per policy & evidence; decision is final (per ToS).

Chargebacks: We retain evidence packets to contest with processor; repeat chargebackers flagged.

I) Contracts & Releases (Builtin)

Autoattach the right forms based on roles & selected license:

Booking Agreement (scope, payment, cancellation, IP).

Model Release (for shoots with a model).

Usage License (creator → buyer; tiered).

Promotion Terms (for creators: posting dates, tags).

Esign at checkout (both parties).

Perbooking vault: Timestamped PDFs accessible to both; immutable log.

Templates: We provide clear, plainlanguage templates; providers can upload a Custom Addendum (subject to platform review).

J) AntiCircumvention & Safety

Onplatform payments are required. Messaging attempts to share external payment details trigger gentle warnings and, if repeated, temporary messaging limits.

Why it’s better here: payment protection (escrow), cancellation coverage, dispute support, verified reviews, DM credit incentives.

Emergency tools: Inthread “Safety flag” → prioritizes to Support; optional checkin toggle that marks arrival/departure time & general area (not visible publicly).

K) Taxes & Compliance (US launch)

We facilitate payments between buyer and provider and will follow applicable tax reporting obligations as a marketplace facilitator (exact thresholds can change; we’ll align with the processor’s reporting workflow).

Sales tax: Most creative services are servicebased; taxability varies by jurisdiction. The platform will support tax toggles per state/city and adjust at checkout when applicable.

Yearend docs: Providers get a yeartodate earnings report and any required tax forms via the payout provider dashboard.

We avoid giving tax advice; we provide the records and surface processorlevel reporting where applicable.

L) Notifications & Calendar

Email/push for: requests, invites, accept/decline, payment received, reminder (24h/2h before), reschedule, dispute events, payout sent.

Calendar: 2way sync (readonly in MVP; writeback in Phase 2). ICS file in confirmation email.

M) Provider & Buyer Dashboards

Provider (per role + overall):

Next bookings; outstanding requests; required actions (confirm, deliver, message).

Earnings (pending, available, lifetime), payouts history.

Policy & pricing quick edit; Instant Book toggles; Autoaccept rules.

Disputes center: upload evidence, view status.

Buyer:

Upcoming shoots; requests & invites; Reschedule/Cancel; Add extras; Leave review; Receipts and invoices.

N) Analytics Touchpoints (tiein to §1.2)

Booking funnel: Profile views → addtocart → request/IB → confirmed → completed (per role).

Cancellation & dispute rates (per policy, per package).

Revenue by package/extras/license (help providers tune offers).

Time to accept / response time (feeds search filters).

Promo impact: Track fee discounts vs. conversion and LTV.

O) Acceptance Criteria (for engineering & QA)

Three booking modes fully functional (Instant Book, RequesttoBook, Smart Invite), all roleanchored.

Escrow holds funds on accept/book; autorelease on completion with dispute window.

Overtime and postcheckout extras can be added and charged midthread with bothparty confirmation.

Cancellation policies selectable per SP (or package) and enforced with prorated and exception handling.

Dispute center collects evidence, supports partial refunds, and logs final decision.

Contracts & releases autoattached and esigned at checkout; PDFs stored with booking.

Fees applied per model (12% provider, 5% buyer) with Instant Book and verification adjustments.

Payouts: standard delay 48h; newprovider reserve/delay policy enforced.

Notifications & calendar work endtoend (email + inapp; ICS export).

Dashboards show accurate states and histories for both sides.

P) Rationale (why this will convert)

Fewer steps + Instant Book = more completed bookings.

Packages + optional extras clarify scope and upsell without complexity.

Escrow + clear policies reduce buyer fear and provider noshow risk.

Disputes with evidence keep support load manageable and outcomes predictable.

Fee incentives nudge the behavior we want (Instant Book, verification) while keeping takerate competitive.

Contracts bakedin prevent most misunderstandings that plague legacy platforms.

Addendum to §1.3 — Travel & Distance Pricing & Logistics (FINAL)

1) Product goals

Make travel predictable and fair for both sides.

Prevent accidental longdistance bookings.

Keep Instant Book clean (no surprise costs).

Support true longhaul bookings with clear rules (day rates, lodging, perdiem) without overcomplicating MVP.

2) Talent travel policy (per Service Profile)

Each SP (Model/Photographer/Videographer/Creator) sets:

A. Base location

Home city + map pin (hidden publicly; we show city/ZIPlevel to users).

B. Included radius

e.g., 15 mi included (no travel fee). Buyer search defaults to radiusfiltered results.

C. Travel pricing model (choose one)

Permile beyond included radius (e.g., $0.75/mi roundtrip, cap optional), or

Pertime travel rate (e.g., $30/hr drive time), or

Zones (simple flat fees):

Local (≤ included radius): $0

Regional (e.g., 16–75 mi): flat $X

Outofarea (e.g., 76–150 mi): flat $Y

Longhaul (>150 mi): Requestonly (no Instant Book), requires custom quote (flight/train/hotel likely).

D. Longhaul rules (toggle per SP)

Travelday rate (if a day is lost to transit).

Lodging required (Yes/No; minimum star rating optional).

Perdiem (meal allowance) or “expenses at cost with receipts.”

Flight class policy (e.g., economy basic/economy).

These appear automatically when the distance exceeds the SP’s Longhaul threshold.

E. Instant Book guardrails

Maximum travel distance/time eligible for Instant Book (e.g., ≤25 mi or ≤45 mins driving).

Anything beyond becomes RequesttoBook (forces a conversation/quote).

F. Touring calendar (optional)

Talent can publish “On tour” dates (e.g., “In Dallas Nov 12–13”).

On those dates, search treats them as local to that city (travel fees suppressed/adjusted).

3) Buyer search & guardrails

Default search radius (e.g., 25 mi) with a conspicuous “Expand radius” toggle.

Results beyond the SP’s Instant Book limit display “Travel required—Request to Book.”

“Visiting talent” toggle shows users who’ve set touring dates in the buyer’s city/date.

If a buyer selects a date/location first, we prefilter to available & traveleligible profiles only.

4) Travel fee calculation (checkout)

We estimate distance/time using a mapping service (e.g., Distance Matrix API) based on talent’s base location and the buyer’s shoot location, then apply the SP’s chosen model (Permile/Pertime/Zones).

Line items at checkout:

Package price

Travel fee (breakdown: miles/time/zones)

Extras (if any)

License tier (if any)

Platform fee(s), tax (where applicable)

For longhaul: Instant Book disabled; buyer sees “Travel quote required.” The request flow collects flight/hotel expectations and/or “expenses at cost” consent.

Dallas ↔︎ Houston example (longhaul):

If distance exceeds SP’s Longhaul threshold (e.g., 150 mi), checkout switches to RequesttoBook. The SP’s longhaul rules (travel day, lodging, perdiem) appear automatically so both sides know the terms before money is held.

5) Dayof transportation (local rides)

We considered offering buyers the option to prepay a rideshare for talent. Here’s the practical approach:

MVP recommendation:

Do not directly book rides inside our app. Instead, let buyers:

Cover travel via the Travel fee (fixed & predictable), or

Offer a “Local ride credit” addon (flat $ amount) that the talent can use as they wish.

Why not deep rideshare integration for MVP?

Uber’s consumer Ride Request widget is deprecated; today they recommend deep links to m.uber.com/app rather than thirdparty apps creating rides endtoend.

Uber for Business and Vouchers API (and Lyft Concierge API) exist, but they’re designed for enterprise programs (credits/vouchers/guest rides), which adds account setup, policy, reconciliation, and support overhead we don’t need at launch.

Phase2 option (if demand is strong):

Add an “Attach rides voucher” flow for enterprise buyers using Uber for Business Vouchers or Lyft Concierge, where the buyer funds a capped ride credit tied to the booking. We’d still keep our Travel fee logic for nonvoucher cases.

6) Preventing bad bookings

Hard stops: If distance > SP’s Max travel allowed, booking cannot proceed (UI explains “Out of travel range; request a remote option or choose visiting dates”).

Soft stops: If distance triggers longhaul, we force RequesttoBook and surface the SP’s travel rules.

Calendar conflicts: Long travel times also block adjacent slots (buffer) to avoid doublebooking.

7) Payments & escrow for travel

Travel fees are part of the escrow amount and follow the same cancellation/dispute policy as the job (unless flagged as nonrefundable expenses after tickets/hotels are purchased with buyer approval).

For expenses at cost workflows (flight/hotel receipts): provider uploads receipts → buyer approves → platform charges card and adds to escrow or settles as a postcheckout extra.

8) UI copy (concise and proactive)

Search chips: “Local (≤ 25 mi)”, “Include traveling talent”.

Result badges: “Travel required—Request to Book”, “Visiting your city on [dates]”.

Checkout: “Travel fee calculated from distance/time using talent’s policy,” (ⓘ) tooltip with formula.

Longhaul panel: “This booking requires travel arrangements (flight/hotel/perdiem). Send a request to confirm details.”

9) Acceptance criteria (travel)

SPs can configure Included radius, Travel pricing model, Longhaul threshold/rules, and Instant Book limits.

Search respects radius by default and clearly marks travelrequired results.

Checkout computes travel fee via distance/time API and shows a transparent line item.

Longhaul disables Instant Book, requires RequesttoBook, and surfaces travel rules.

“Local ride credit” addon supported; no rideshare booking in MVP.

(Phase2) Can attach Uber/Lyft vouchers for enterprise buyers.

Addendum to §1.3 — Contracts, Releases & Paperwork (Templates, Requirements, Signatures) — FINAL

Goal: Make paperwork automatic, standardized, and enforceable—so deliverables, rights, and usage are crystal clear without forcing every user to lawyer up.

A) Smart Docs Engine (builtin, templatefirst)

Autoattach at booking: Based on roles in the booking, the platform attaches a default pack of documents (below) prefilled with names, dates, location, deliverables, fees, and licensing.

Esign builtin: Simple, legally binding esign (draw/type) with audit trail (IP, timestamp, device).

Bringyourown: Providers/brands may upload custom addenda (PDF/DOCX) to sign in the same flow.

Jurisdiction & minors: City/state choice adjusts venue law; minor flag adds guardian consent + stricter photo policy.

B) Minimum Document Set (autoselected)

Service Agreement / SOW (always): scope, timeline, payment schedule, revisions, cancellation, dispute venue.

License/Usage Addendum (if media usage): media types, geos, durations, paid vs organic, exclusivity options, optional workforhire clause.

Model Release (if any model present): publicity rights grant; adult vs minor variants; explicit nopornography covenant.

Property/Studio Release (if private or providerowned space): permission to shoot, house rules, damages.

NDA (optional toggle from buyer): mutual or oneway.

Safety Addendum (if Nudity Tier > Lingerie): attire/coverage, chaperone policy, changing/privacy, closed set, onsite contact.

Defaults are editable by parties before signing; diffs logged.

C) When Are Docs Required?

Before checkin. All required docs must be esigned by both parties before “Start” can be tapped in the app.

Brief stage: Buyers see the default pack preview on the brief; providers see it when quoting.

No “paperless” bookings where releases are expected (e.g., shoots with models).

D) Enforceability Hooks

Escrow gating: Funds won’t release until required docs are signed and deliverables accepted.

Deliverables manifest references the SOW + License; disputes use these as source of truth.

Audit trail: Signed PDFs with hash, IP/device/timestamps downloadable by both parties.

E) Special Cases

TFP/Collab mode: SOW + noncommercial license by default; optional upgrade to commercial later (with price).

Fansubscription creators: Adds Posting & Attribution Addendum (see §3.5 addendum) detailing deadlines and minimum live duration; autoverify posts via OAuth/URL.

Minors: Guardian esign required; extra safety terms; no nudity tiers available.

Union/agency talent: Upload agency rider; overrides conflicting defaults where allowed.

F) Templates & Ownership

Platform maintains jurisdictionaware templates reviewed by counsel (disclaimer: not legal advice).

Users retain rights per the signed License/Usage Addendum; platform is not a party beyond payment terms and dispute venue.

G) Acceptance Criteria

Smart Docs attach automatically by role; users can edit before sign.

Esign with audit trail; PDFs stored & versioned; available in booking thread.

Checkin blocked until required docs are signed; escrow release blocked without docs + acceptance.

Minor/guardian flows, safety addendum for nudity tiers, property/studio release when applicable.

Addendum — §1.3 Booking, Payments & Disputes (Studios integration)

Goal: Integrate Studios (space listings) into booking & payments without complicating talent flows. Keep talent and studio as separate bookings that can be purchased together in one checkout as a Linked Booking Group. Preserve clear rules, escrow, deposit holds, and dispute outcomes per type.

A) Booking Objects & Linked Group

Two booking types:

Talent Booking (person-based: Model/Photographer/Videographer/Creator).

Studio Booking (space-based: hourly rental with rules).

Linked Booking Group (LBG): if a buyer checks out with both a talent and a studio, we create two bookings tied under one group ID.

Independent policies & payouts per booking; the UI shows a group summary.

Time sync: studio start/end must align to the talent schedule (respecting min hours & buffers).

B) Studio Checkout (what the buyer confirms)

Pricing line items: base $/hr × booked hours + min hours enforcement + cleaning fee (if any) + estimated taxes (if applicable) + deposit hold (authorization, not captured).

Rules & access: house rules, max capacity, noise policy, overtime policy, loadin/out, door/access code (released after confirmation), parking notes.

Smart Docs (autoattach): Property/Space Release + House Rules (sign before checkin).

Address privacy: public page shows neighborhood; exact address and access details reveal only after confirmation.

C) Instant Book vs Request to Book (studios)

Default: Instant Book ON (host may toggle “Approval required”).

Instant Book guardrails: Instant Book requires Studio Lite verification or host ID verification (policy toggle).

Conflicts: if the studio is IB but the linked talent is requestbased, the LBG holds the studio slot for X minutes while talent accepts.

D) Funds Flow: Escrow & Authorizations

Talent booking: escrow per existing §1.3 rules.

Studio booking: escrow the studio rental amount at checkout.

Damage deposit: place a card hold (configurable per listing, e.g., $200–$1,000). Not counted in GMV; expires or is partially/fully captured only upon a verified claim.

Cleaning fee: charged as part of studio subtotal (refundable only if host cancels).

Payment method mix: both bookings appear on one receipt; behind the scenes, we maintain two ledgers and two payouts.

E) Reschedules & Edits (groupaware)

Propose change (buyer or provider/host): new time/date proposed to both bookings in the LBG.

If both accept → times shift; Smart Docs autoamend; any price deltas (e.g., longer hours) are quoted & reauthorized.

If only one can move → buyer chooses to split the group (proceed with one, cancel the other per its policy) or cancel both per each policy.

Price adjustments:

Talent: change orders/addons as usual.

Studio: hours & cleaning adjustments; additional fees quoted before reauth.

F) Onsite Flow: CheckIn/Out & Overtime (studios)

Checkin/out: geofenced Start/End taps; logs timestamps and duration.

Overtime: billed per listing rule (e.g., per 30 min at 1.5×).

If overtime detected (End > booked End), host files a PostBooking Adjustment within 24h with evidence (checkout log, photos).

Buyer has 48h to accept/dispute; we may autoapprove if evidence is clear (policy toggle).

Crew size overage / rule violations: host can submit an adjustment claim with evidence within 24h (caps & allowed reasons defined in listing).

G) Cancellations, NoShows & Safety (group and pertype)

Pertype matrices apply independently (talent follows talent policy; studio follows studio policy).

Group UX: buyer sees a combined summary showing outcomes for each booking.

Host cancel (studio): buyer gets 100% refund on studio + $25–$50 goodwill credit; talent booking remains unless buyer also cancels it.

Safety exception: unsafe conduct → waive platform fees, refund appropriately, and open Safety case; access to space can be revoked remotely if applicable.

Noshow:

Studio: if buyer fails to check in within grace window and host was present/available → studio payout per matrix; deposit not captured unless damage or specific violation.

H) Damage Deposits & Claims (studios)

Hold timing: authorize at checkout or 24h prior (host preference); release 48h after checkout if no claim.

Claim flow: host opens claim within 24h with photos & description; amount requested up to hold cap.

Adjudication: Neutral Review may approve full/partial capture or deny; capture appears as a separate charge (not escrow).

Abuse guard: repeated frivolous claims throttle host visibility and may remove deposit privileges.

I) Completion & Payouts

Studio completion trigger: autocomplete on successful checkout (no deliverables).

Talent completion trigger: acceptance of deliverables or autoaccept per §1.3/Delivery Room rules.

Payout timing:

Studio: 24–48h after checkout, minus adjustments under review.

Talent: 48h after acceptance/autoaccept.

Early Payout (peruse): available to eligible hosts/providers (Rep ≥ 85) with the 0.5% acceleration fee as defined in §3.2 (peruse, not subscription).

J) Receipts, Taxes & Invoices

Unified receipt shows two sections (Talent • Studio), fees, taxes (if any), deposit hold (authorization only), and separate cancellation policies.

Taxes: talent services vs space rental may differ by locale; we surface hostprovided tax settings; lineitemized.

Documents: signed Smart Docs (Service Agreement, Property/Space Release, House Rules) downloadable from the booking thread.

K) Edge Cases & Safeguards

Doublebooking protection: instant revalidation of studio availability at payment step; if collision, buyer gets a failsafe choice (waitlist or alternative suggestions).

Early exit: no refunds for unused time unless host agrees; checkout time is source of truth for overtime only (not undertime credits).

Access failures (e.g., bad code): host must provide alternate access within 30 min; otherwise buyer may cancel for cause (full refund).

Travel fees: remain talentonly; no travel fees on studio bookings.

L) Events & Analytics

booking.create.talent|studio, booking.group.linked, booking.group.split

studio.deposit.authorized|released|captured_partial|captured_full

studio.adjustment.opened|buyer_accept|buyer_dispute|resolved

checkin.start|end (role: studio/talent), overtime.detected

cancel.requested (who, when), cancel.outcome (per booking)

payout.scheduled|sent (per booking)

M) Acceptance Criteria (mark §1.3 addendum FINAL)

Two booking types implemented; Linked Booking Group supported in checkout, thread, and receipts.

Studio checkout includes hourly pricing, min hours, cleaning fee, rules & access, Property/Space Release esign, and deposit hold.

Instant Book for studios with optional “approval required”; guardrails for verification.

Reschedule proposes synchronized changes; buyer can split or cancel with pertype policies applied.

Checkin/out geofenced for studios; overtime & overage adjustments flow live with evidence & timers.

Damage deposit lifecycle (authorize → claim window → capture/deny → release) implemented.

Completion & payouts follow pertype triggers; Early Payout (peruse) eligible for highrep accounts.

Receipts/invoices show separate lines & policies; tax handling surfaced; Smart Docs downloadable.

Edge cases handled (doublebooking, access failure, early exit, travel fees talentonly).

Analytics events instrumented.

N) Why this works

Clarity & fairness: Separate bookings keep policies, disputes, and payouts clean—no crosscontamination.

Low friction: Instant Book + deposit holds match studio norms while escrow preserves trust.
