Checkin/out with geofence & door code field; QR access optional later.

Verification (Lite)

Studio Lite (already designed in §3.4): doc OCR + geocode/Place match; manual exception only.

Required docs: property/space release template + house rules (autoattached via Smart Docs).

Payments & fees

Same 12% provider / 5% buyer baseline (see §3.1), deposit holds not counted as GMV.

Refund matrix follows space norms (stricter latecancel terms than talent; see matrix below).

D) What we defer (postPMF)

Insurance marketplace, security deposits with offline inspections, complex tiered amenities pricing, multilisting host dashboards, full multicity inventory, eventuse cases.

Mapheavy discovery bells/whistles (streetlevel 3D tours, AR walkthroughs).

Equipment rentals marketplace (separate future track).

E) Studio Refund & Policy Matrix (v1 defaults; hosts may choose stricter within bands)

Amenity overages (overtime/crew size): host may file PostBooking Adjustments within 24h with evidence; buyer has 48h to approve/dispute.

F) Marketplace Mechanics (how studios add conversion, not complexity)

Brief uplift: when buyer composes a shoot brief, Attach a Studio offers 3 nearby matches with “creative amenities” chips; increases award rate by reducing buyer friction.

Talent crosssell: photographers who own a studio can toggle Studio AddOn (hourly) inside their package; the system then exposes that studio at checkout.

Boards: saved boards can include both talent & studios; Compare view keeps them separated by type.

G) Supply Seeding Playbook (first 30–60 days)

Curate 15–30 creative studios (natural light lofts, cyclorama spaces, warehouse sets) in the founding city.

Fasttrack verification (Lite); waive Studio Lite fee for first 25.

Founding Host perks: Featured placement in Verified Studios (Lite) carousel for 60 days; 0% buyer fee on first booking to stimulate demand.

Quality bar: professional photos required; template rules; minimum availability posting (2+ days/week).

Partnerships: local studio associations, photo schools, production collectives.

H) Demand GTM Hooks

Bundle messaging: “Book the crew and the space in one place.”

Saved Searches: “Talent + Studio in [City] this weekend” templates.

Case studies: showcase shoots that used both a Verified Studio and onplatform talent; highlight time saved.

I) IA & Nav Guidance (affects §4.0/§4.1 rewrites)

Browse ▸ Verified Studios (Lite) under Browse (not topnav).

Attach a Studio step in Brief/Checkout (primary place most buyers will encounter studios).

Studio result cards use a distinct badge & amenity chips; but share card patterns with talent for consistency.

J) KPIs & KillSwitches (90day postlaunch)

Attachrate: ≥ 20% of shoot briefs add a studio candidate.

Studioinvolved GMV: ≥ 15% of GMV involves a studio by month 3.

Fill rate: ≥ 50% of hosted studio slots receive at least one inquiry/week.

Incident rate: damage disputes < 1% of studio bookings.

Killswitch: If attachrate < 8% and studio search CTR < 2% for 8 consecutive weeks, hide Studios from Browse and keep only Attach in Brief/Checkout; revisit supply fit.

K) Acceptance Criteria (mark Addendum A FINAL)

Attach a Studio step live in Brief and Checkout, prefiltered by city/date.

Verified Studios (Lite) subhub live under Browse (grid + map); creative amenity filters.

Studio booking: hourly + min hours, instant book default (host can require approval), overtime rules, cleaning fee field, rules & access surfaced prepay.

Deposits: card hold configurable per listing; damage claim flow with 24h window.

Policies: studio cancel matrix implemented; host cancel strike/IB pause wired.

Verification Lite flow for studios connected; property/space release autoattached via Smart Docs.

Crosssell: studio chips on talent profiles when owned/linked; Studio AddOn in photographer packages.

KPIs dashboards for attachrate, studio GMV share, incident rate; killswitch automation.

L) Why this works

Amplifies, doesn’t distract: Studios boost conversion of shoots without turning us into a venue marketplace.

Curated & creativeonly: We avoid the event/party longtail and focus on spaces that matter to our users.

Operationally sane: Lite verification, instant book defaults, deposits, and simple amenity filters keep v1 lean.

Option value: If traction pops, we can elevate Studios in the nav and expand supply; if not, we gracefully tuck it behind “Attach” without harming core flows.

SubSection 3.1 — Core Monetization Mechanics

Goal: Monetize in ways that increase trust and throughput, not friction. Keep pricing simple, fair, and transparent; reward the behaviors that grow the marketplace (verification, Instant Book, reliability).

A) What we charge (and why)

1) Transaction (perbooking) economics

Provider fee (commission): 12% of booking subtotal (packages + extras + license + travel).
Why: This benchmarks lower than creator marketplaces like Collabstr (15%), Swipecast (15%), and Peerspace host fees (15–20%), while remaining close to Upwork’s freelancer fee (10%)—so we’re competitive for launch without undercutting our margins.

Buyer service fee: 5% (min $3); 3% when paid via ACH (once available).
Why: Buyer fees around 5–5.5% are common on large marketplaces (e.g., Fiverr 5.5% + a smallorder fee), and Upwork charges 3–5% depending on payment method/plan. Our $3 minimum ensures we cover processing on small bookings, and the ACH discount mirrors market norms and nudges lowercost rails.

Processing costs: paid out of platform take (the buyer fee largely offsets card fees at ~2.9% + $0.30 in the U.S.; ACH is lower). Note: card processing fees from the original transaction aren’t returned on refunds (industry standard).

Refund policy on fees:

If provider cancels or safety exception → refund buyer service fee.

If buyer cancels per policy → service fee is nonrefundable (covers payment ops & support).

Provider fee adjusts automatically to the final job value after any discounts/refunds.

Why this mix: Simple, predictable, and aligned with market expectations and our earlystage unit economics. 5% buyer keeps us in line with Upwork and below/near Fiverr’s charge to buyers; 12% provider undercuts or matches comparable verticals.

2) Fee adjusters (nudge the right behavior)

Instant Book discount: Provider fee –1% on Instant Book transactions (promotes “buy now”).

Trusted Pro (backgroundchecked) discount: Provider fee –0.5% (rewards safety investment).

Highvalue tiering: On the portion above $1,000 in a single booking, provider fee drops to 10% (keeps big jobs onplatform; echoes the “volume discount” concept users recognize from legacy Upwork tiers).

Newmarket promos (timeboxed): e.g., $0 buyer fee on first booking in a launch city; or –2% provider for first 60 days postlaunch.

All discounts are stackable with a floor (e.g., provider fee floor = 9%).

3) What we don’t charge for

DMs and inquiries (within fairuse credits; see §3.2).

Tips (0% platform fee on tips, paid postcompletion)—a clear differentiator vs. platforms that take a cut of tips.

TFP/Collab Mode (no cash) — no commission; we monetize indirectly (Pro, boosts).

B) Escrow, payout timing & reserves (recap, monetization lens)

Escrow on accept/book: we hold funds until completion/milestones (see §1.3).

Payout timing: standard 48h after completion; newprovider reserve (e.g., first 1–3 payouts delayed up to 7 days or 10% rolling reserve) to reduce fraud/chargeback risk.

Early Payout (Pro preview for §3.2): selected providers with strong Rep Score can receive same/nextday payouts for an optional 0.5% payoutacceleration fee (applied to the provider fee component).

C) Worked examples (realistic, stepbystep)

We keep the math explicit so Finance & Product implement identical calculations.

Example 1 — $300 booking, default fees, no discounts

Booking subtotal: $300

Buyer service fee (5%): 0.05 × 300 = $15 → Buyer pays $315

Provider fee (12% of $300): 0.12 × 300 = $36

Provider takehome (preprocessing): $300 − $36 = $264

Processor cost (illustrative): assume 2.9% + $0.30 on $315

2.9% of 315 = $9.135; + $0.30 = $9.435 (≈ $9.44)

Platform gross on this booking (before ops):

Revenue = provider fee $36 + buyer fee $15 = $51

Less processing ≈ $9.44 → Net ≈ $41.56.

Example 2 — $600 booking, Instant Book (–1%) + Trusted Pro (–0.5%)

Buyer service fee (5%): 0.05 × 600 = $30 → Buyer pays $630

Provider fee base (12%): $72

Discounted provider fee (10.5%): 0.105 × 600 = $63

Provider takehome: $600 − $63 = $537

Platform revenue preprocessing: $63 + $30 = $93

Processing (2.9% + $0.30) on $630: $18.57

Net to platform (before ops): $74.43.

Example 3 — $85 booking, smallorder check

Buyer service fee: 5% of $85 = $4.25 (≥ $3 min, so min does not apply) → buyer pays $89.25

Provider fee (12%): $10.20 → provider takehome $74.80

Processing on $89.25 (2.9% + $0.30): ≈ $2.89

Platform net (preops): (10.20 + 4.25) − 2.89 ≈ $11.56

On very small bookings (e.g., $30), the $3 min protects margin—where many peers set $3–$3.50 smallorder addons.

D) Pricing transparency & UX rules

Oneline disclosure at checkout: “Platform fees include secure escrow, contracts, support & payment processing.”

Provider dashboard “takehome preview” per package (and optional “include estimated card fees” toggle).

Refund/discount edits autoreissue amended receipts for both sides (see §1.4 addendum).

City promos show strikethrough fees (e.g., “Buyer fee ~5%~ → 0% this month in Houston”).

ACH discount labeling: clearly show “Pay by bank (save 2% on fees)” once ACH is enabled; this mirrors buyerside fee reductions on comparable platforms.

E) Antileakage incentives (why pay through us)

Protection value: escrow, platform contracts/releases, dispute handling, verified reviews, Pro analytics.

Economics: lower provider fee for Instant Book and Trusted Pro; eligibility for paid Search Boost gated by onplatform performance.

Friction: gentle inchat warnings on offplatform payment attempts; repeat attempts throttle newconversation sends (see §1.4/§1.5).

F) Edge cases & policy notes

Dispute outcomes: platform retains the buyer fee only when buyer is at fault; if we rule for the buyer due to provider fault, we refund the buyer fee (mirrors common guest/host fee treatments).

Chargebacks: a disputehandling fee (e.g., $15) may be charged to the losing party only in clear abuse; otherwise we absorb processor dispute fees.

Taxes: where services are taxable, fees are calculated on the taxable base appropriately; receipts itemize taxes separately.

NSFW policy alignment: mainstreamfirst (artistic nudity allowed), enabling mainstream processors and avoiding adultcontent surcharges/payout friction.

Refunds & processor fees: card processing fees on the original transaction are not returned by processors; our policy and tooling reflect this.

G) Acceptance criteria (to mark 3.1 FINAL)

Fee engine supports 12% provider + 5% buyer (min $3); ACH buyer fee 3%; stackable discounts (Instant Book −1%, Trusted Pro −0.5%, 10% on portion > $1,000) with floor 9%.

Buyer fee refunded on providerfault cancellations/safety exceptions; nonrefundable on buyerinitiated cancels.

Payouts: 48h standard; newprovider reserve policy configurable by cohort; Early Payout addon ready for §3.2.

Receipts/invoices autoupdate after amendments/discounts; totals consistent with escrow.

Provider dashboard shows takehome preview; checkout shows clear fee blurb + tooltip; ACH discount is surfaced when available.

Analytics capture net platform revenue per booking, fee mix, and impact of discounts on conversion.

H) Why this works (postresearch)

Marketaligned: 12% provider sits below or near sector peers (15%+ on Collabstr/Swipecast/Peerspace; Fiverr takes 20% from sellers), while 5% buyer with $3 min mirrors buyer fees at Fiverr/Upwork.

Profitable from day one: buyer fee largely covers card processing; smallorder min prevents negative unit economics; ACH discount reduces payment costs and attracts highervalue buyers.

Growthpositive: discounts for Instant Book and Trusted Pro increase conversion and safety; highvalue tier encourages larger jobs to stay onplatform (a pattern users recognize from legacy fee ladders).

Addendum to §3.1 / §3.2 — Policy & Pricing Notes (Storage & Docs)

Storage policy copy (customerfacing): “We store review copies and paperwork for 12 months. Originals stay in your Drive/Dropbox. We’re not a longterm archive.”

No storage fees at launch (per §3.2 StartFree strategy); external hosting required for large deliverables.

Document access: Signed docs are always downloadable; we maintain copies even if external links expire.

Dispute window: Contracts define a posting/delivery dispute window (e.g., 7–14 days) during which links must remain live.

Addendum — §3.1 Core Monetization Mechanics (Studios) — FINAL

Goal: Apply our simple, trusted pricing (12% provider / 5% buyer) to Studio bookings without ambiguity. Keep deposits outside GMV, align refunds with studio policies, and preserve clean ledgers for Linked Booking Groups (talent + studio in one checkout).

A) What we charge on a Studio booking

Provider (host) fee: 12% of the studio subtotal

Subtotal = hourly rental × booked hours + cleaning fee + paid addons (e.g., furniture move)

Excludes taxes and deposit holds.

Buyer service fee: 5% of the studio subtotal (min $3)

ACH discount (when enabled): buyer fee 3% (min $3) if the buyer pays via ACH.

Refund of buyer fee follows fault: refunded on hostfault cancel; nonrefundable on buyer cancel per policy.

Processing costs: paid from platform take (same as talent).

No change to talent fees. Talent and Studio fees are computed on their respective subtotals, even when purchased together.

B) Discounts & nudges (studio)

Instant Book discount applies to Studio bookings: –1% on the provider fee for IB transactions.

Trusted Pro (background) is peopleonly; does not apply to Studio hosts.

Highvalue tier: the 10% provider fee above $1,000 threshold applies per booking (talent and studio evaluated separately).

City promos (timeboxed) may separately reduce buyer/provider fees on studio bookings; configured per city cohort.

C) What we do not charge on studios

Damage deposits (card holds) are not GMV; we do not take a platform fee on deposit captures.

Postbooking damage captures (if approved) pass through to host; the platform may still incur processor fees.

Tips (if we enable them for hosts) remain 0% platform fee.

D) Adjustments that are feeable

Overtime, crewsize overages, ruleviolation fees (when upheld) are treated as booking adjustments → included in studio subtotal and feeable at the same provider/buyer fee rates.

Change orders that extend hours or add paid items → feeable (computed at approval time).

E) Linked Booking Groups (talent + studio in one checkout)

We create two bookings (one talent, one studio) under a Linked Group ID.

Fees are computed per booking; buyer sees a unified receipt with two sections (Talent • Studio).

Refunds/reversals apply per booking based on each policy; the group summary presents the net outcome.

Processing may be a single charge or split under the hood; the ledger remains separated to keep fee math transparent.

F) Refund policy alignment (studio vs talent)

Studio cancels (hostfault): 100% refund of studio charges; buyer service fee for that booking refunded; goodwill credit per §3.9.

Buyer cancels: follow the studio matrix (e.g., >7 days = 100%, 7–48h = 50%, <48h = 0%); buyer fee nonrefundable.

Noshow (buyer at studio): host paid per matrix; buyer fee nonrefundable.

Force majeure/safety: platform may waive fees and refund appropriately (studio and/or talent) per §3.9.

G) Worked examples (clear math)

Processor assumption: ~2.9% + $0.30 per charge (illustrative). We show platform preprocessing revenue and an approx net after processing for transparency.

Example 1 — Studioonly booking

Rate: $100/hr × 4h = $400

Cleaning fee: $40 → Studio subtotal = $440

Buyer fee (5%): 0.05 × 440 = $22.00 → Buyer pays = $462.00

Provider fee (12%): 0.12 × 440 = $52.80 → Host takehome (preprocessing) = 440 − 52.80 = $387.20

Platform revenue (preprocessing) = provider fee $52.80 + buyer fee $22.00 = $74.80

Processing (est.) on $462: 2.9% × 462 = $13.398 ≈ $13.40; + $0.30 = $13.70

Approx net to platform = 74.80 − 13.70 = $61.10

Deposit hold: $300 authorization (not charged, not GMV)

Example 2 — Linked Group: Talent $600 + Studio from Ex.1 (no discounts)

Talent booking

Subtotal $600 → Buyer fee (5%) $30.00; Provider fee (12%) $72.00

Platform preproc rev $102.00; processing (est. on $630) $18.57 → net ≈ $83.43

Studio booking (from Ex.1)

Platform net ≈ $61.10

Combined (informational)

Platform preproc = $102.00 + $74.80 = $176.80

Approx processing total ≈ $18.57 + $13.70 = $32.27

Approx net ≈ $144.53

Buyer sees two buyerfee lines (talent $30, studio $22) and a single receipt with two sections.

If Instant Book applies to talent and/or studio, reduce the respective provider fee(s) by 1%; math updates accordingly. ACH payment would reduce the buyer fee(s) to 3% where used.

H) Chargebacks & deposit captures (studio specifics)

Representment for studio chargebacks includes: checkin/out logs, rules acceptance, houserules esign, before/after photos, and adjustment evidence.

Deposit capture (after approved damage claim) is a separate charge; no platform fee applied; we still prepare evidence and may incur processor dispute fees.

Repeated abusive claims by hosts or buyers trigger Rep penalties and eligibility throttles (IB off, boost suppress).

I) Citybycity knobs (monetization safety)

Configure studioonly promos (e.g., 0% buyer fee on first studio booking in founding city).

Optionally waive Studio Lite verification fee for first 25–50 hosts/city (CAC budget), not a permanent policy.

Keep provider fee floor = 9% after all discounts (applies independently to talent and studio).

J) Acceptance Criteria (mark §3.1 addendum FINAL)

Provider 12% / Buyer 5% applied to Studio subtotal (cleaning/addons included; taxes/deposits excluded).

IB –1% discount applies to Studio; Trusted Pro does not (peopleonly); >$1k tier reduces Studio fee portion to 10%.

Buyer fee refunds on hostfault cancels; nonrefundable on buyerfault per studio matrix.

Deposit holds: not GMV; no platform fee on captures; lifecycle events logged.

Overtime/overages/change orders feeable at standard rates when upheld.

Linked Group receipts show two sections and two buyerfee lines; ledgers remain separated; partial refunds handled per booking.

Analytics: revenue by type (talent vs studio), fee mix, ACH penetration, discount impact, deposit claim rates, chargeback ratios by type.

K) Why this works

Simple, predictable economics extend cleanly to studios; buyers see clear line items, hosts see reliable takehome.

Margins protected: buyer fee offsets processing; deposits don’t inflate GMV or distort fee math.

Scalable ops: perbooking ledgers + group receipts make refunds, disputes, and reporting straightforward.

Aligned incentives: IB discount encourages fast conversion; fee tiers keep highvalue bookings onplatform.

SubSection 3.2 — Pricing & Tiers (Launch: Start Free, Grow, Then Monetize in Layers)

Goal: Maximize early adoption and bookings by removing monthly paywalls and monetizing via takerate (see §3.1) and optional, usagebased addons that never compromise fairness. Introduce an optional Pro tier only after we reach liquidity and can prove it increases creator revenue.

A) Principles (launch stage)

No subscriptions at launch — free to join, free to list, free to message within generous fairuse.

Value is earned, not paywalled — verification, reliability, and reputation unlock visibility and perks.

Payasyougo, not rent — Boosts/RFPs are usagebased; no forced bundles.

Fairness & safety first — paid visibility never outranks relevance or safety gates.

Monetize later, when proven — add an optional Pro tier only after clear, databacked ROI for users.

B) What everyone gets for free at launch (simple, generous)

Multirole profiles: up to 3 service profiles per account (Model / Photographer / Videographer / Creator).

Portfolio & storage: up to 100 images + 20 videos; 15 GB total storage (pooled across roles).

Messaging: 40 newconversation credits/month (unlimited replies & all booking threads).

Booking stack: escrow, contracts/releases, licensing tiers; calendar & ICS sync; travel calculator (see §1.3).

Social metrics: connect IG/YT/TT/X; verified chips on profile & cards (see §1.2 addendum).

Fees: commission per §3.1 (12% provider; 5% buyer, $3 min, 3% ACH when enabled).

No listing fees. No paid storage. No paid DM packs at launch.

C) Earned trust perks (free, but gated by safety/reliability)

1) ID Verified

Unlock Instant Book eligibility.

+20 newconversation credits/month (total 60).

Search nudge (minor tiebreak when results are otherwise equal).

Eligible for “Verifiedonly” buyer filters.

2) Trusted Pro (Background Check passed)

–0.5% providerfee discount (stacks with Instant Book –1%; floor 9% from §3.1).

Priority in RFP request queues.

Onetime $15 Boost coupon (funded from CAC budget).

3) High Reputation (Rep ≥ 85; see §1.5)

Earned tiebreak in ranking after relevance/availability/distance/price.

Early Payout eligibility (peruse; see §E).

Invite priority in Smart Invites.

None of these can be bought. They must be earned via verification, reliability, and great reviews.

D) Usagebased monetization (optional; never paytowin)

1) Search Boost (CPC with daily caps)

Promotes cards only in queries the provider already matches.

Labeled Promoted; strict density limits (≤2 in top 20; ≤1 above the fold).

Eligibility: ID Verified, Rep ≥ 70, no recent strikes.

2) Featured Carousels (fixedterm)

City/category home modules (e.g., “Featured in Houston”).

Weekly flat price; slot caps; guaranteed rotation.

3) RFP Broadcast Credits (for buyers/teams)

Post a brief (role, city, budget) → broadcast to matching verified providers.

Sold in small packs (e.g., 5 for $29). Replies remain free.

4) Optional buyer ACH discount

Buyer fee 5% (min $3) → 3% when paying via ACH once enabled (mirrors norms, reduces costs; see §3.1).

E) Early Payout (peruse, not a plan)

Eligibility: Rep ≥ 85 and ID Verified or Trusted Pro.

Pricing: 0.5% per accelerated payout (applied to the providerfee component only), charged only when used.

Limit: Max once per booking; no stacking.

F) Storage & deliverables (no paywall at launch)

Base 15 GB for all; 30 GB when ID Verified; 50 GB when Trusted Pro or Rep ≥ 85.

Large sets can use external links (Drive/Dropbox); platform captures a manifest (name/size/checksum) for disputes.

Revisit storage billing only if >5% of active users routinely hit ceilings and costs materially increase.

G) Messaging health & antispam (no paytospam)

Monthly 40 newconversation credits; +20 for ID Verified; +20 for Trusted Pro (max 80).

Credits autoreplenish monthly; extra credit purchases disabled at launch.

“Nudge” limit: 1 priority nudge / thread / day; abuse throttled; repeated violations reduce newconversation caps.

H) Fairness & ranking guardrails (immutable)

Relevance first: query fit → availability → distance → price → Rep tiebreak → Verified/Trusted nudges.

Paid visibility caps: strict density limits; clear Promoted labels; never outrank better matches.

Safety gating: Boosts & RFP broadcasts require ID Verified, Rep ≥ 70, no recent strikes.

I) Launch promos (transactionfirst; timeboxed by city)

0% buyer fee on first booking in launch cities.

–2% provider fee for first 60 days postlaunch (stackaware; respects 9% floor).

Verification subsidies: cover part of ID cost for the first 300 signups/city; $15 coupon on passing Background.

City promos rendered as strikethrough on fee lines (e.g., “Buyer fee ~5%~ → 0%”).

J) When (and only when) to add an optional Pro plan later

Introduce a voluntary Pro tier only if all triggers are true in ≥ 2 launch cities:

Liquidity: Search→Inquiry ≥ 20%; Inquiry→Booking ≥ 35%; Repeat bookings ≥ 30%.

Willingness to pay: ≥ 20% of active providers repeatedly buy Boosts/RFP credits.

Pro uplift proof: Piloted Pro features show ≥ 20% conversion/GMV lift vs. control.

Community health: NPS ≥ 45 and Pro does not depress Free engagement.

If/when launched: keep Pro optional and valueadd (e.g., monthly Boost stipend, advanced analytics, concierge), never required for discoverability.

K) Metrics to watch (prove we chose right)

Activation: % of new providers publishing ≥ 1 package within 7 days → > 50%.

Messaging health: Median first response time ≤ 2 hours; abuse reports < 0.3 / 100 conversations.

Verification adoption: ID ≥ 60%, Trusted Pro ≥ 15% by day 60 in a city.

Unit economics: Booking net (per §3.1) positive in ≥ 95% of transactions; smallorder min protects margin.

Boost ROI: Median paid Boost yields ≥ 2.5× incremental GMV.

Repeat: 30%+ repeat bookings within 90 days in mature launch city.

L) Acceptance criteria (to mark 3.2 FINAL)

No subscriptions at launch; no paid storage; no paid DM packs.

Feature gates/perks are driven by Verification, Trusted Pro, and Reputation, not payment.

Search Boost, Featured, RFP credits implemented as usagebased with eligibility gates, labels, and density caps.

Early Payout available peruse for qualified providers.

Storage tiers increase via verification/reputation; externallink manifesting implemented.

Messaging credit system live; abuse throttles; “nudge” limits enforced.

Launch promos configurable per city/cohort (fee holidays, provider fee reductions, verification subsidies).

Dashboards: activation, verification adoption, Boost ROI, unit economics, response times, repeat bookings.

M) Why this works (launch economics & growth)

Removes adoption friction that hurt legacy platforms (no “pay to participate”).

Aligns incentives — we profit when users profit (commission), not before.

Builds trust at scale — earned perks (verification/reputation) boost safety and conversion.

Keeps options open — once liquidity and ROI are proven, we can add an optional Pro that power users want to pay for.

Notes for §3.1 consistency (already reflected)

Keep 12% provider / 5% buyer (min $3; 3% ACH); Instant Book –1%, Trusted Pro –0.5%, highvalue tier 10% above $1,000; floor 9%.

Early Payout is peruse (0.5%) and eligibilitybased — not tied to any subscription.

SubSection 3.3 — Paid Boosting & Promotions (UsageBased Only)

Goal: Unlock incremental bookings and early revenue without harming trust or liquidity. Paid visibility is optional, eligibilitygated, clearly labeled, and strictly capped. Organic relevance remains the primary ranking signal. We pilot quietly (Houston) and scale only if metrics prove netpositive.

A) Principles (grounded in research)

Fairfirst, never paytowin. Organic ranking = query match → availability → distance → price fit → Rep Score. Paid units never displace more relevant organic matches.

Eligibility before dollars. Boosts only for proven, trusted providers (ID Verified, Rep ≥ 75, ≥2 completed onplatform bookings or ≥1 verified reference, no active safety flags).

Transparency & control. Every paid unit is labeled Promoted with a “Why am I seeing this?” explainer; buyers can Hide a provider and Report.

Hard caps & guardrails. Strict density, frequency, and impressionshare caps; qualityscore weighting; misrepresentation = autopause.

Pilot, measure, earn the right to scale. Quiet Houston beta → expand only if we hit growthsafe KPIs (organic share, buyer CTR/conv, provider ROAS) and no trust regressions.

B) Inventory & Placements (v1, minimal & conservative)

Search Results Boost (primary)

Placement: results list.

Format: standard profile card + Promoted chip + dynamic ribbon (e.g., “Instant Book”, “Trusted Pro”, “Available this week”).

Density caps: ≤1 Promoted abovethefold, ≤2 Promoted in top 20 results.

Category / City Featured Carousels (home & landing)

Modules: “Featured in Houston”, “Featured Photographers”.

Slots: 10–12 cards, rotating evenly; visible only in the pilot city.

Not in v1: inbox/proposal boosting, email ads, push highlights. We do not boost RFP proposal order or message thread ranking (avoids “paytowin” backlash).

C) Products & Pricing (usagebased, no bundles)

Search Boost (CPC)

Pilot floors (illustrative): TierA city (Houston) — Models $0.90, Photographers $0.70, Videographers $0.80, Creators $0.85.

Budgeting: daily budget + max CPC; even pacing; prepaid wallet; charge on valid clicks only.

Ordering (within paid caps only): Score = 0.5×log(bid) + 0.5×QualityScore.

Featured Carousel (flat weekly)

Pricing: $49–$89 / week (Houston, by role).

Delivery: impression guarantees; rotation fairness; makegood credits if short.

No subscriptions, no longterm commitments, no forced packs.

D) Eligibility, Targeting & Relevance (what keeps it fair)

Eligibility: ID Verified, Rep ≥ 75, ≥2 completed bookings (or ≥1 verified reference), no active safety flags, policycompliant content.

Query matching (hard filter): role, location radius, availability window, price range, NSFW toggle must all match; otherwise no delivery.

Audience targeting: provider may narrow by city/radius/price band; negative keywords/genres allowed.

QualityScore (0–1): exact filter match, recent response rate/time, Rep, Instant Book, price fit to query median, historical CTR/conv. New boosters start at 0.5.

E) Rotation, Frequency & ShareofShelf Caps

Frequency caps (per buyer): max 2 paid impressions/session, 5/day, 4h cooldown per provider/buyer pair.

Provider impressionshare cap: paid impressions per provider ≤8% of all eligible paid impressions/day (prevents domination).

Organic share guardrail (platformwide): at least 85–90% of buyer result clicks must land on organic cards in the pilot (monitored KPI).

Roundrobin within caps: if eligible > slots, rotate weighted by (remaining budget × QualityScore).

F) Provider Experience (setup → proof of value)

Setup flow: pick service profile → choose Search Boost or Featured → set budget & bid → (optional) narrow targeting → confirm.

Creative policy: no custom ads; we use the profile card + system ribbon (prevents deceptive creative).

Guidance: “Suggested bid” and “expected clicks/bookings” estimates; “Improve QualityScore” checklist (ID verify, reduce response time, enable Instant Book, adjust price fit).

Reporting (realtime): impressions, clicks, CTR, avg CPC, inquiries, bookings, GMV attributed, ROAS, and incremental lift via a 10% holdout (eligible but not shown).

Autocoaching: if 7day ROAS < 1.5×, show “Consider pausing or improving QS” prompt; if <1.0× after 14 days, recommend pause.

G) Buyer Experience (clarity & control)

Labeling: Promoted chip + info tooltip (“Matches your filters; purchased limited promotion. Promoted never outranks more relevant results.”)

Controls: Hide this provider (suppresses organic & paid for 30 days), Report (routes to Safety).

Consistency: paid units respect NSFW settings and all filters; density caps enforced above.

H) Fraud, Safety & Abuse Controls

Invalid click detection: rapid repeats, zerodwell bounces, bot/device anomalies, selfclicking, rings → automark invalid & credit back CPC; repeated anomalies throttle delivery & flag for review.

Misrepresentation: price/availability mismatches or baitandswitch → autopause campaign + warning; repeat → suspension.

Safety linkage: any active safety investigation → suppress all paid delivery until cleared.

Budget protection: daily overspend guard (≤5% variance) + autocredit on pacing errors. Chargeback shield: new campaigns disabled if unresolved chargebacks.

I) Launch Posture & Comms (Houston pilot)

Access: inviteonly cohort of 100–200 eligible providers per role in Houston for first 6–8 weeks.

Messaging to community: publish an Integrity Pledge (fairfirst, clear labels, hard caps, eligibility gates).

Feedback loop: inproduct survey after 2 weeks of spend; provider & buyer focus groups at week 4; adjust caps/floors accordingly.

Reinvestment: earmark 20–30% of pilot Boost revenue to buyer acquisition in Houston (drives net liquidity).

J) KPIs & “Kill Switch” Thresholds (first 60–90 days)

Adoption & performance

≥ 12–18% of eligible providers try Boost; Featured weekly slot fill ≥60%.

Median ROAS ≥ 2.5×; median costperbooking ≤ $18 (TierA).

Buyer experience & trust

Organic click share ≥ 85–90% (guardrail).

Buyer Hide rate ≤ 3% of paid impressions; Safety reports ≤ 0.2 / 1,000 paid impressions.

No significant drop in search→inquiry or inquiry→booking vs. prepilot baselines.

Fairness & ecosystem health

Gini index of paid impression distribution stays below threshold (no provider monopolies).

Nonboosted, highRep providers maintain stable inquiry rates (±10%).

Kill switch (autopause) if any occur:

Organic click share < 80% for 7 rolling days; or

Buyer Hide rate > 5% for 7 days; or

Incremental bookings (holdout) ≤ 0 for 2 consecutive weeks; or

Spike in safety reports tied to promoted cards.

K) Pricing Governance & City Tiers

City tiers: TierA (Houston, Dallas, LA, NYC, ATL) → TierB (growing metros) → TierC (smaller metros).

CPC floors review: monthly; adjust ±$0.10–$0.20 based on fill, provider ROAS, and buyer CTR/conv.

Featured pricing review: quarterly by impressions delivered, CTR, bookings/slot.

L) What we won’t do (explicit guardrails)

No boosting of proposals/RFP response order or message thread prominence.

No “unverified” or lowRep accounts in paid slots.

No unlabeled or disguised ads.

No auction in v1 (simplicity first); we may test a hybrid bid × QS auction later if/when liquidity warrants.

M) Acceptance Criteria (mark 3.3 FINAL)

Search Boost (CPC) live with city+role floors, daily budgets, validclick billing, even pacing.

Featured Carousel live with weekly flat pricing, rotation, impression guarantees & makegoods.

Eligibility gates enforced (ID, Rep ≥ 75, booking/reference minimums, no safety flags); query match hard filter; NSFW compliance.

Caps: density (≤1 above fold; ≤2 in top 20), frequency (2/session, 5/day, 4h cooldown), provider impression share ≤ 8%/day.

QualityScore & ordering implemented; fair roundrobin pacing; organic share guardrail tracked.

Fraud & safety: invalidclick credits, overspend guard, autopause on misrep/safety.

Reporting: realtime KPIs + holdoutbased incrementality; autocoaching on low ROAS.

Admin tools: floors, slot caps, guardrails/kill switch, makegood credits, cohort gating.

Comms: Integrity Pledge published; buyer labeling & controls shipped; feedback loop live.

N) Why this works (for launch)

Protects growth: Paid units are sparse, vetted, and relevancebound; early users see that quality wins without paying.

Aligns incentives: Providers can optin to spend when it pays; we prove incremental bookings via holdouts, not just clicks.

Avoids known pitfalls: No inbox/proposal boosting (sidesteps “paytowin” backlash); strict caps prevent ad overload.

Scales responsibly: Pilot → prove → expand. If metrics or sentiment sag, kill switch lets us pull back instantly.

SubSection 3.4 — Verification & Compliance Monetization

Goal: Maximize early adoption and bookings while raising trust. Use automationfirst verification with manualexception only, verify at milestones (not at signup), and absorb essential costs during launch. Store attestations (Pass/Fail) rather than raw PII.

A) Principles (launch posture)

Frictionlight, milestonegated. No heavy checks at signup. We trigger verification only when it unlocks value or reduces risk (e.g., Instant Book, first payout, privateaddress shoots).

Automation first, humans last. Use vendor SDKs (doc scan, liveness, geocode) and OCR to autoapprove the vast majority; route only fails/edge cases to a small ops queue.

Platform absorbs essential costs (launch). Treat ID checks as customer acquisition and trust investment; revisit after liquidity.

Privacy by design. We keep outcome + timestamp + vendor; vendors hold sensitive artifacts.

Explainable & fair. Clear consent, reasons, appeals. No protectedclass logic.

Citylevel dials. Subsidy, triggers, and badge rules configurable per launch city.

B) The Verification Ladder (what, when, why)

Tier 0 — Account Basics (always free)

Email + phone (SMS) verify, device fingerprint, IP risk screen.

Badge: New — building trust. Limited DM credits (see §3.2).

Tier 1 — ID Verification (unlocks value; platformpaid at launch)

Triggers (any of): enable Instant Book; accept first paid booking; release first payout; host at a private address (nonstudio); exceed monthly newconversation cap.

Method: gov ID scan + selfie liveness + fraud checks (SDK).

Unlocks: ID Verified badge, Instant Book, +20 DM credits, minor search tiebreak (equal matches).

Refresh: every 24 months or on risk events.

Tier 2 — Background Check (“Trusted Pro”, optional; passthrough priced)

Triggers: optin for Trusted Pro badge; required for certain sensitive categories if ever added.

Method: SSN trace, national criminal/sexoffender, sanctions; countylevel where indicated by vendor logic.

Unlocks: Trusted Pro badge, provider fee –0.5% (see §3.1), RFP priority, onetime $15 Boost coupon.

Refresh: 12 months or on risk events; FCRAstyle adverse action + appeal flow.

Tier 3 — Studio Verification (optional; “Lite” first)

When: user wants a Studio Verified badge or frequently sets their own space as the shoot location.

Lite (MVP, automationheavy): address claim + one supporting doc (lease/utility/biz registration) → OCR + name/address match + geocode/Place lookup → autoapprove if match confidence high; manual review only on fails.

Full (defer to Phase 2): optional remote video walkthrough or thirdparty inspection for highvolume venues.

Unlocks: Studio Verified badge; search filter “Studio access: verified”; fastpath location selection at checkout.

Social Verification (optional, free)

OAuth to IG/YT/TT/X; nightly sync metrics → verified chips and perplatform search filters (see §1.2 addendum).

Age/NSFW Eligibility (derived)

Age derived from Tier 1; enables artisticnudity portfolios per policy (mainstreamfirst stance).

C) Flows & UX (keep it fast, clear, recoverable)

2minute ID flow target; progress meter; “Why you’re seeing this” explainer tied to the trigger (e.g., “Needed to release payouts”).

Grace periods: If a trigger occurs midconversation, allow user to finish current action and prompt verification before the next gated action.

Failure recovery: clear reason category + retake guidance; escalate to manual only after 2 failed attempts.

No hard walls at signup: users can browse, build profile/portfolio, and message within free limits before any KYC.

D) Cost & Monetization Posture (launch → scale)

Who pays (launch):

ID (Tier 1): Platformpaid (subsidized) in founding cities.

Background (Tier 2): Passthrough pricing; we may add a small coupon to encourage early adoption.

Studio Lite (Tier 3): Platformpaid doc review for first 200 studios/city; then $19 docreview fee (waived by promo when needed).

Social OAuth: free.

Budget guardrails (Ops/Finance):

Set a monthly KYC budget cap per city (e.g., $750–$1,500), autothrottle subsidies if exceeded (e.g., defer nonurgent Tier 1 until payout trigger).

Track cost per verified and cost per incremental booking uplift; keep CAC efficient.

Future levers (only postliquidity):

Optional expedited verification (24h fast lane) for a small fee.

Bundles (ID + BG) with modest margin only if conversion lift is proven and churn impact is nil.

E) Automation & Ops Model (devlight, scalable)

Vendors: one KYC SDK (ID + liveness), one BG vendor, geocode/Place API for Studio Lite.

Manualexception queue: target <10% of ID attempts; SLAs: ID < 24h (exceptions), BG ≤ 48h (county delays may vary), Studio Lite < 24h for failed automatches.

Staffing (pilot): 1 parttime reviewer per ~500–700 monthly verifications (exceptions only).

Dashboards: pass/fail rates, exception volume, completion time, dropoff at each step, cost per check, conversion lift vs. unverified.

F) Data Handling & Compliance

We store: status (Pass/Fail/Needs info), reason codes, timestamp, vendor ID; no raw ID images/biometrics.

Retention: verification attestations 24 months or until account deletion; honor legal holds.

Consent: explicit consent screens; link to privacy, biometric notices where applicable.

FCRA/EEOC: preadverse + adverse action for BG denials; individualized assessment; appeal path.

Nondiscrimination: no targeting by protected class; policy + audits.

Marketplace role: verification conveys eligibility, not employment or moral certification.

G) Studio Verification — MVP (what we do now vs later)

Do now (Lite): doc OCR + name/address match + geocode/Place check; autoapprove if high confidence; manual on fails.

Don’t do now: inperson inspections, insurance validation, complex KYB—defer to Phase 2 for highvolume venues.

Booking UX: buyers can select a Verified Studio from a list; private addresses masked until confirm; location verification optional at checkout for private addresses (“Verify general area”).

H) Incentives (make trust feel rewarding)

ID Verified: Instant Book + +20 DM credits; minor search tiebreak on equal matches.

Trusted Pro: fee –0.5%, RFP priority, $15 Boost coupon (see §3.3), badge on cards.

Studio Verified: filterable badge; “Studio” ribbon on cards; inclusion in “Studios in [City]” carousel.

SocialVerified: perplatform chips and search filters; nightly trends on profile.

I) KPIs & Guardrails (first 90 days per city)

Adoption: ID ≥ 60% of active users; Trusted Pro ≥ 15% of active providers; Studio Lite ≥ 10% of active studios.

Speed: median ID completion < 2 min (selfserve); BG ≤ 48h (85%); Studio Lite ≤ 24h (exceptions).

Conversion lift (vs. unverified): ID → +12–20% search→inquiry; Trusted Pro → +10–15% inquiry→booking.

Dropoff: verificationstep abandonment < 20%; if higher, simplify flow or move trigger later.

Cost: monthly KYC spend within ±10% of budget cap; cost/verified flat to down.

Kill switches: if search→inquiry or inquiry→booking drops >10% postgating in a cohort, relax triggers (e.g., gate at payout only) until metrics recover.

J) Pricing (simple & growthfriendly at launch)

ID Verification: $0 to user (platformpaid) in founding cities.

Background Check (Trusted Pro): passthrough (e.g., ~$25–$35 avg), with promo coupon in first 60 days.

Studio Lite: $0 for first 200 per city; then $19 (doc review).

Social OAuth: $0.

Expedite (later): optional $9 fast lane if demanded (postliquidity).

K) Acceptance Criteria (mark 3.4 FINAL)

Milestonegated triggers wired (Instant Book, first payout, private address, message caps).

Vendor integrations live (ID/liveness, BG, geocode), with manualexception queue + SLAs.

Subsidy controls: percity KYC budget caps; throttle rules; ops dashboards.

Attestationonly storage; consent & privacy notices; FCRA/appeals for BG.

Studio Lite OCR+geocode flow live; manual fallback; badge + search filter.

Incentives: badges, fee nudge (Trusted Pro), DM boost, search tiebreaks wired.

Metrics & kill switches: adoption, speed, dropoff, conversion lift, cost per verified; autorelax triggers if growth impact detected.

L) Why this works

Protects growth: No heavy checks at signup; verification happens when users see the value (payouts, Instant Book).

Controls cost & ops load: Automation handles most verifications; platform pays for the musthave checks only; tight budget caps.

Builds trust fast: Visible badges and small ranking nudges reward safe, reliable behavior and raise booking confidence.

Scales cleanly: Studio Lite now; deeper inspections only when warranted. Citylevel dials let us tune friction and spend.

Notes for PM/Eng handoff: keep triggers and budgets configurable per city; log all verification events for audit; run monthly reviews on pass/fail rates, exception causes, and dropoff to continuously trim friction without compromising safety.

§3.5 — Brand/Buyer Products (Briefs/RFPs, Shortlists, Concierge, Delivery)

Goal: Buyers (brands, agencies, studios, solo creators) go from idea → shortlist → booked → delivered fast, with clear scope, documents, storagesane delivery, and verifiable outcomes—without subscriptions. Everything stays fair (relevancefirst), safe (escrow + esign), and growthfriendly (usagebased RFP credits only).

A) Principles

Speed with clarity: Briefs produce applestoapples quotes; awarding triggers escrow, documents, and a Delivery Room automatically.

Relevance over volume: Invite the right providers; broadcast only to eligible, verified cohorts.

Trustfirst: IDVerified/Trusted Pro gating, esign before checkin, onplatform escrow & dispute flows.

Storagesane delivery: Originals remain in buyer/provider cloud (Drive/Dropbox/etc.); platform stores previews + manifests only.

Usagebased monetization: Smart Invite is free; RFP is creditsbased (no monthly plans, no paywalls).

B) Buyer Personas & JobstobeDone

Solo/SMB buyer: Needs a model/photographer for a simple shoot; wants fast quotes and clear outcomes.

Marketing team/agency: Multiseat, needs shortlists, approvals, brand docs, reporting.

Studio ops: Frequent, repeat bookings; prefers Verified Studios; cares about schedule reliability.

Creator collab buyer: Seeks socialreach deliverables (IG/TT/YT posts) with verification and postingwindow guarantees.

C) Brief Composer (Quick & Full)

Required first step (Quick Brief = ~60s; Full Brief for complex jobs):

Project basics: Role(s), city/radius, date(s)/time(s), duration.

Goal & deliverables: Presets (e.g., “10 edited photos (3kpx), 2 vertical videos (1080×1920, ≤60s)”) + Influence presets (IG Collab, Story Mentions, TT Post, YT Short) with posting window & min live.

Style refs: Moodboard upload/links; keywords.

Budget: Range or fixed; Budget sanity meter (compares to city/role median).

Location: Pick Verified Studio or “Buyer provides address” (masked until award); travel radius/fee toggle.

Eligibility & safety: IDVerified/Trustedonly toggles, NDA toggle, Nudity & Boundaries (if models involved; artisticnudity only).

Model specifics (if applicable): Look filters + nudity tier + chaperone policy + social metrics filters.

Timeline: response deadline, delivery date.

Docs preview: Shows the Smart Docs pack (SOW, License, Release, NDA if toggled) that will autoattach on award.

Privacy: Hide brand name until award (toggle).

D) Smart Invite & RFP Broadcast

Smart Invite (free):

System suggests 8–15 bestfit providers (role, availability, distance, price fit, Rep Score, social metrics).

Buyer can edit and send invites (free). Providers get a consolidated request thread with Quick Quote.

RFP Broadcast (creditsbased):

Sends the brief to a wider pool of eligible providers (IDVerified, Rep ≥ 70, no safety flags).

Pricing: credit packs (e.g., 5 for $29).

Guardrails: min budget floors by city/role/duration; 1 live broadcast/role per buyer; template checks to reduce spam/underpay.

E) Proposal & Pricing UX (Provider)

Quick Quote (≈60s): select package, price, availability, short note; optional addons (travel, extra edits, overtime).

Full Proposal: itemized deliverables (incl. social deliverables), schedule/milestones, licensing line items, portfolio links.

No proposal peeking: providers don’t see others’ bids.

F) Compare & Award (applestoapples + escrow)

Compare view: normalized grid: Price, What’s included, Rep Score, Badges (ID/Trusted/Studio), Travel, Change/Overtime, Social posting window, Notes.

Fit Score (0–100): assistive signal explaining match to brief (style, budget, distance, availability).

Award flow: select winner → escrow deposit (default 50%, configurable) → Smart Docs esign session opens → booking created.

G) Documents & ESign (Smart Docs)

Autoattach pack on award: Service Agreement/SOW, License/Usage Addendum, Model Release, Property/Studio Release (if needed), NDA (if toggled), Safety Addendum (if Nudity Tier > Lingerie).

Esign: draw/type with audit trail (IP, timestamp, device).

Gate: Checkin blocked until required docs are signed. Escrow won’t release without docs + acceptance.

H) Delivery Room (storagesane delivery with verification)

Manifest = source of truth: Autogenerated from accepted quote (counts/specs).

Storage model:

Previews on platform: webres photos & 720p video proxies; watermarks allowed for previews.

Originals external: Google Drive / Dropbox / OneDrive / Box / S3 presigned owned by provider.

Ingestion:

OAuth mode (preferred): pull file list/metadata → pin manifest (names/sizes/MIME/URLs).

Linkonly mode: paste share URLs; we crawl to create a readonly manifest.

Checksums: compute hashes for onplatform files; store length/etag for externals; providers may paste SHA256 for finals.

Autochecks on upload: count, type/codec, pixel dimensions, bitrate/duration, color profile, no watermarks on finals.

“All finals delivered” provider toggle validates against manifest.

I) Acceptance, Revisions & AutoAccept

Technical acceptance: once autochecks pass, Buyer Review window opens.

Buyer Review: default 3 days (packageconfigurable) to accept, partial accept (per milestone/group), or request inscope revisions (1 round included).

Autoaccept: if buyer inactive after 3 days and autochecks passed, system autoaccepts remaining deliverables; escrow releases per §1.3.

Change orders: outofscope requests routed to paid Change Order.

J) Influence/Promo Deliverables (verification & enforcement)

Presets: IG Collab Post + Story Mentions; TikTok Post (+Duet/Stitch optional); YouTube Short + Community Post.

Posting window & minimum live: buyer sets (e.g., post within 72h, remain live ≥7 days).

Verification:

If accounts linked via OAuth, system autoverifies URL and monitors live status.

If not linked, provider submits the public URL; system captures a snapshot & status; buyer confirms.

Noncompliance: autoopens a deliverable dispute → 24h cure window → partial refund equal to the allocated value if missed/removed.

K) Attendance, NoShows, Disputes (fast, evidencebased)

Checkin/out: both parties tap Start/End (geofenced, ±60 min).

Evidence log: timestamps, geotags, chat/call logs (durations), manifests, behindthescenes snaps.

Buyer noshow / late cancel: refunds per policy (e.g., 72–24h = 50% payout; <24h = 100% payout).

Provider noshow: buyer 100% refund + goodwill credit; provider reliability strike & Instant Book pause.

Deliverables shortfall: 48h cure window; else partial refund proportional to undelivered items.

Subjective disputes: one revision → Neutral Review (scopebased outcome: reedit or partial refund).

Safety exception: fee waivers/credits as needed; safety review autoopens.

L) Boards & Collaboration

Boards: named shortlists with status tags (“New, Invited, Proposed, Awarded”).

Teamwork: @mentions, comments, polls; readonly share link; optional NDA gate for external reviewers.

Live freshness: cards show availability chips and price updates; stale badge after 14 days.

M) Concierge

Concierge Light (free, automated): AI refines brief, suggests scope/budget, drafts invites, schedules top 3 for 15min slots; nudges for NDA and verifiedonly toggles.

Human Concierge (pilot; budgets ≥ $3k): coordinator curates talent, wrangles schedules/deliverables; free at launch in founding cities; later optional 2% success fee (postliquidity).

N) Permissions, Buyer Trust & Privacy

Roles: Owner (billing/contracts), Editor (briefs/awards), Commenter (notes/votes).

Payment Verified badge: once funding source on file.

Privacy: brand name masking until award; private addresses masked until confirm; generalarea safety share during active booking only.

O) Safety & Quality Controls

Eligibility gates: RFP to IDVerified (Trustedonly optional).

Budget floors: prevent unrealistic budgets; assist with suggested ranges.

Offplatform detection: warnings & throttles in chat.

NSFW guardrails: artisticnudity only; explicit content blocked; nudity tiers & safety addendum enforced.

Buyer reputation: Providers see Buyer Rep (ontime payment, dispute rate, repeat bookings).

P) Pricing & Credits (Launch)

Smart Invite: free.

RFP Broadcast credits: 5 for $29 (consumed per role/city broadcast).

Foundingcity promo: 5 free RFP credits for new PaymentVerified buyers + 0% buyer fee on first booking.

Credit refunds: autocredit 1 if <3 qualified responses by deadline; full pack credit if 0 responses.

Q) Integrations & Contracts

Escrow & payouts: per §1.3 (milestones supported; partial releases on partial accept).

Smart Docs: autoattached on award; esign gating before checkin; PDFs/versioning in thread.

Calendar: ICS export; conflict checks vs provider availability.

Storage: external delivery required for large assets; platform stores previews + manifests only (see §1.4).

Social OAuth: for autoverification of influence deliverables.

R) Analytics

Buyer dashboard: outreach→response, timetoaward, spend by project, cost per deliverable, provider performance.

Platform: RFP adoption, response quality, award rate, GMV per brief, credit refund rate, Instant Book vs RFP split, deliverable dispute rates, autoaccept rate.

S) KPIs & Targets (first 90 days/city)

Adoption: ≥ 35% of bookings originate via Smart Invite/RFP flows.

Speed: median brief → first qualified response ≤ 2 hours (business hours); brief → award ≤ 48 hours for Quick Briefs.

Quality: ≥ 60% of broadcasts yield ≥3 qualified responses; provider response rate ≥ 45%; buyer CSAT ≥ 4.5/5.

Trust: disputes/noshows at or below Instant Book baseline; offplatform attempts in RFP threads < 1%.

Economics: RFPsourced GMV ≥ 30% by month 6; credit refund rate < 12%.

Delivery health: autoaccept ≥ 50% of jobs; deliverable disputes < 5%; influence noncompliance < 6%.

T) Acceptance Criteria (mark §3.5 FINAL)

Brief Composer live (Quick & Full) with budget guidance, influence presets, nudity/boundaries step, and Smart Docs preview.

Smart Invite (free) & RFP Broadcast (credits) live with eligibility gates and budget floors.

Proposal UX (Quick Quote + Full) with addons, licensing, influence deliverables.

Compare & Award + escrow deposit + Smart Docs esign gating before checkin.

Delivery Room with manifests, previews/proxies, external delivery ingestion (OAuth + linkonly), autochecks, watermark detection, autoaccept timer.

Influence verification (OAuth/URL snapshot) with posting window & minimumlive enforcement.

Attendance & disputes wired (checkin/out, cure window, partial refunds, Neutral Review); travel matrix referenced.

Boards & collaboration, Concierge Light, and Human Concierge pilot live.

Buyer roles & privacy, Payment Verified badge, NSFW guardrails.

Analytics dashboards shipping KPIs above.

U) Why this works

Clear scope → fewer disputes: Smart Docs + normalized quotes + manifests make expectations explicit.

Storage costs contained: We host previews & paperwork; originals stay in Drive/Dropbox/etc. with verifiable manifests.

Faster to “yes”: Smart Invite + Quick Quotes + Fit Score reduce time to award.

Verifiable outcomes: Autochecks, posting verification, and autoaccept keep projects moving and payouts timely.

Fair & safe: Relevancefirst ranking, verified cohorts, esign gating, and escrow create trust without adding paywalls.

Addendum to §3.5 — Brand/Buyer Products

Briefs & RFPs for FanSubscription Collaborations

Brief Composer (new prompts when this role is selected)

Objective: reach, conversions, or follower uplift.

Channels & formats: IG Grid/Stories, TT Post, YT Short; include posting window and min live.

Attribution: @handles, tags, links; tracking parameters.

Nudity & boundaries: clearly confirm SFW/artisticonly.

Budget sanity: shows cityrole medians for promo packs (ranges).

Compare & Award

Grid includes promo deliverables, posting windows, min live, social metrics, subscriber band, Rep & badges.

Acceptance criteria

Brief & Compare views reflect promo deliverable specifics; escrow & Smart Docs include Posting & Attribution Addendum.

SubSection 3.6 — Seller Tools & Workflows (Models • Photographers • Videographers • Creators)

Goal: Give sellers a fast, repeatable workflow that turns profile views into booked, wellscoped jobs—and makes delivery, disputes, and payouts painless. Tools are roleaware, storagesane, and trustfirst. Monetization remains usagebased (no subscriptions at launch).

A) Principles

Publish in minutes, improve forever: ship an MVP service profile quickly; refine with datadriven suggestions.

Roleaware, single account: one login, multiple service profiles (Model / Photographer / Videographer / Creator) with clean separation in search and reviews.

Clarity prevents disputes: packages, Smart Docs, Delivery Room manifests, and timeboxed review windows make outcomes objective.

Storagesane by default: previews on platform; originals remain in seller’s cloud (Drive/Dropbox/OneDrive/Box/S3 links).

Trust earns advantages: verification & reputation unlock Instant Book, tiebreaks, Early Payout, RFP priority—never paytowin.

B) Seller Onboarding Wizard (10–12 minutes, roleaware)

Step 1 — Choose roles: Model / Photographer / Videographer / Creator (can add more later).
Step 2 — Portfolio basics: upload perrole cover image(s), 12–24 highlights; set Nudity Tier & Comfort (Models/Creators).
Step 3 — Packages (per role): pick package templates (below), add price/duration/what’s included, turnaround time, revision policy, overtime & change rates.
Step 4 — Addons: travel (matrix), extra looks/edits, rush delivery, social posts, studio rental addon, hair/makeup partner, etc.
Step 5 — Availability: weekly schedule blocks, Instant Book windows, buffers, travel time logic; connect calendar (ICS).
Step 6 — Location: base city, service radius, touring dates (for traveling models/creators).
Step 7 — Safety & preferences: chaperone welcomed/required, genderpref team (optional), boundaries.
Step 8 — Pricing strategy: enable intro discount (first 3 bookings), lastminute fill (autodiscount empty slots), minimum price guardrail.
Step 9 — Connect social: IG/YT/TT/X for verified chips & search filters (per §1.2 addendum).
Step 10 — Verification prompts: ID (to unlock Instant Book), optionally Background (Trusted Pro), Studio Lite (if applicable).
Publish → profile QA checklist + “What improves ranking” tips (response time, verified docs, price fit).

C) Package Templates & AddOns (per role)

Templates are opinionated defaults sellers can edit—keeps quotes comparable & reduces scope creep.

Photographer

Starter Session (60–90 min): X looks, X edited photos (e.g., 10), raw previews for selection, 7day delivery, 1 revision.

HalfDay / FullDay: timebased; includes lighting, basic studio backdrop; deliverables by count (e.g., 25/50 edits).

Campaign Shoot: team coordination, shot list, licensing preset (web/social/paid ads tiers).

Videographer

ShortForm: 1–3 vertical edits ≤60s; footage capture + edit; licensed music option.

Product Video: 30–60s hero + cutdowns; basic motion graphics; color & sound pass.

Event Coverage: hours + deliverable minutes, highlight & social reels.

Model

Lookbook / Ecomm: rate + number of looks; posing & outfit changes; usage preset (web/social).

Creative/Editorial: half/full day; boundaries & chaperone policy surfaced.

UGC Package: selfshot stills/videos per brief + Influence addons (posts/stories).

Creator (Influence)

IG Post + Story Pack, TikTok Post + Duet/Stitch, YouTube Short + Community Post with posting window & min live duration (autoverified per §3.5).

Addons (crossrole): extra edits/looks, rush 48h, studio addon (price per hour), HMUA partner, assistant, BTS content, extended licensing, raw file addon (limited), travel matrix tiers, overtime (per 30m).

D) Availability, Calendar & Touring

Instant Book windows: sellers choose days/times eligible for IB; buffers enforced; travel time autocalc by radius.

Blackouts & holds: dragtoblock; softhold expires after X hours if buyer doesn’t escrow.

Calendar sync: ICS oneway export; ICS imports supported (Google/Apple/Outlook).

Touring calendar: add cities with date ranges; appears as “Visiting [City]” chip in search; availability filters respect touring.

Reschedule & edits (providerside): providers can propose time/date changes, price adjustments, partial refunds—buyer must approve inthread; Smart Docs autoamend and receipts reissue (per §1.4 addendum).

E) Inbox & Lead Pipeline (built on §1.4 Messaging)

Pipeline states: New → Needs Info → Quoted → Awarded → Booked → Delivered → Completed → Archived.

Action bar: Quick Reply templates, Quick Quote, send availability poll, propose calendar slots, add Zoom link (if remote briefing).

Snooze/remind: Snooze thread for 2h/24h/3d; autoremind to follow up on unanswered invites.

Autonudge: once/day per thread (caps per §1.4) with lastsent preview.

Ratelimit & DM credits: credits meter with +20 for ID Verified; +20 for Trusted Pro (max 80 at launch, per §3.2).

Offplatform guardrails: gentle warnings & throttles if payment/handle sharing detected.

F) Pricing Intelligence & Controls

City benchmark & pricefit index: shows how package price compares to city/role median; flag “too low/too high” risk.

Lastminute fill: toggle % discount for slots <72h away to lift utilization.

Intro discount: automatic for first 3 onplatform bookings.

Coupons: provider can generate singleuse or timeboxed codes (stacking rules respect §3.1 fee floors).

Dynamic addons visibility: surface popular addons postaward (e.g., “Rush delivery – add $XX”) with singleclick change orders.

Travel matrix editor: zone/mileage tiers, permile or perzone; autoquote at checkout; postevent Travel Adjustment workflow (evidence, 48h cure).

G) Smart Docs & Policy Controls (sellerfriendly)

Template library: editable clauses for revisions (#, scope), change orders, overtime, kill fees, licensing tiers (web/social/paid/term).

Preset packs by vertical (ecomm, editorial, music video, UGC).

Chaperone & boundaries (models/creators): defaults propagate into SOW & Safety Addendum; booking brief enforces buyer acknowledgment.

License calculator: price deltas for media types/geos/terms; add to quote with one click.

H) Delivery & Proofing (seller side)

Delivery Room shortcut: autobuild manifest from package/RFP; drop in previews; attach external folder links for originals (Drive/Dropbox/etc.).

Autochecks: counts/specs/codec/pixel/bitrate; watermark detection on finals.

Client proofing: contact sheet, star/flag, comments on preview assets; lock on acceptance.

Revisions: one included round by default; subsequent rounds become paid change orders.

I) Portfolio, Tagging & Social

Perrole galleries with cover tiles; NSFW gates per policy (artistic nudity only; IDgated).

Tag collaborators: suggest tags from booking history; tagged user approves; appears on both profiles.

Social chips on profile/search cards (followers & ER by platform where connected); nightly sync; manual refresh up to 3×/day (ratelimited).

“Add to Case Study” optin postcompletion to showcase results (with buyer consent if brand named).

J) Reputation, Verification & Payouts

Reputation Score panel: live 0–100 with “Why?” breakdown—reviews/volume (40%), reliability (25%), responsiveness (10%), verifications (15%), recent performance (10%).

Guided improvements: tasks (reduce response time, enable IB, finish ID/Background) and estimated lift.

Verification ladder shortcuts (ID → IB; Background → Trusted Pro; Studio Lite).

Payouts: method setup (ACH), W9/W8 flow, 1099 at yearend; standard 48h payout after acceptance; Early Payout peruse (0.5%) for eligible sellers (Rep ≥ 85; see §3.2/§3.1).

Tax notes: itemized PDFs with fees, taxes; export CSV.

K) Seller Analytics (launch set)

Funnel: search appearances → profile views → messages → quotes sent → awards → bookings → ontime delivery → reviews.

Response time & win rate: median first response; win rate by package, daypart, city radius.

Pricefit & demand: heatmap of inquiries by price band; suggestion “raise X%” or “add lowertier package.”

Top queries & tags that found you (e.g., “lifestyle • Houston • IG 100k+”).

Availability utilization: % of IB windows filled; value of lastminute fills.

Boost performance (if used): impressions, clicks, CPC, inquiries, bookings, incremental lift (holdout).

Quality & disputes: revision rate, dispute rate, average cure time.

L) Teams & Assist (Phase 2, optional)

Studio/Team accounts: add assistants/HMUA with limited roles; shared calendar; asset permissions.

Tasking: assign prep tasks (shot list, gear) with due dates.

Payroll passthrough: track internal cost splits (no payments to assistants at launch).

M) Mobile Essentials

Checkin/out, messaging, and Quick Quote optimized for mobile.

Scantosign for releases on set (offline queue; sync later).

Upload previews (autoproxy for video) and paste external links easily.

Push nudges: new lead, upcoming booking, deliverable due, dispute timer.

N) KPIs & Targets (first 90 days / city)

Activation: ≥ 50% of new sellers publish ≥1 package within 7 days.

Responsiveness: median first response ≤ 2h; >80% of invites answered within 24h.

Conversion: view → message ≥ 12%; message → award ≥ 30%; award → completed ≥ 90%.

Utilization: Instant Book adoption ≥ 40% of active sellers; lastminute fill used by ≥ 20%.

Delivery health: autoaccept ≥ 50%; deliverable disputes < 5%; revision cycles avg ≤ 1.3.

Reputation: avg Rep Score ≥ 78 by day 60 for active cohort.

Economics: Early Payout usage 10–20% among eligible; boost ROAS (for users who try it) ≥ 2.5×.

O) Acceptance Criteria (mark 3.6 FINAL)

Onboarding wizard (roles, portfolio, packages, addons, availability, location, safety, pricing, social, verification prompts).

Package templates & Addons live per role; travel matrix editor; overtime & changeorder rules.

Availability with IB windows, buffers, calendar sync, touring calendar; providerside reschedule/price edits with buyer approval & autoamend docs.

Inbox pipeline with states, Quick Replies, Quick Quote, snooze/remind, autonudge, DMcredit meter & guardrails.

Pricing intelligence (benchmarks, pricefit, intro & lastminute discounts, coupons).

Smart Docs library with esign; SOW/License/Release/Property/Safety addenda autoattach; checkin gate.

Delivery Room with manifests, previews/proxies, externallink ingestion (OAuth + linkonly), autochecks, watermark detection, revision & autoaccept timers.

Portfolio & tagging, social chips sync, casestudy optin.

Reputation panel with breakdown & tasks; Verification ladder shortcuts; Payouts & Early Payout peruse.

Analytics dashboard (funnel, response, pricefit, queries, utilization, boost, quality).

Mobile essentials: checkin/out, messaging, Quick Quote, scantosign, preview upload, push nudges.

P) Why this works

Less friction, more bookings: sellers launch fast, quote faster, and close with clarity.

Fewer disputes: standardized packages + Smart Docs + Delivery Room manifests turn “hesaid/shesaid” into objective checks.

Costs under control: originals stay in sellers’ cloud; we store only previews + manifests; no surprise infra bills.

Trust compounds: verification and high Rep Score unlock advantages that improve conversion and marketplace quality—without paywalls.

Addendum to §3.6 — Seller Tools & Workflows

FanSubscription Creator Mode (rolespecific onboarding, packages, safety)

Onboarding (rolespecific steps)

Role select: choose FanSubscription Creator.

Portfolio guardrails: SFW/artisticonly reminder; upload gate blocks explicit.

Nudity & boundaries: set Nudity Tier, comfort notes, chaperone policy.

Promo channels: connect IG/TT/YT/X (OAuth) for autoverified posting; add fanplatform links to Links block.

Metrics: optional subscriber count range (selfreported) + “request manual verification” (screenshot under NDA → staff mark Verified).

Packages: pick templates (below), set prices/windows, min live durations.

Verification: ID (18+) to unlock Instant Book; optional Background → Trusted Pro.

Package templates (examples)

IG Promo Pack — 1 Grid Post (Collab) + 2 Story Mentions w/ swipe link; post within 72h, min live 7 days.

TikTok Promo — 1 Post (original) + optional Duet/Stitch; 72h window; min live 7 days.

YouTube Short + Community — 1 Short + 1 Community Post; 5day window; min live 14 days.

SFW Collab Shoot — halfday studio/loc with specified usage; deliverables: SFW teasers for socials and linkout. (No explicit content.)

UGC SFW Teaser Pack — selfshot assets for buyer’s channels (nonexplicit), with licensing preset.

Addons

Extra Story mentions, pinned comment, linkinbio for N days, rush posting, whitelisting rights (paid ads allowlist), coauthoring.

Delivery & verification

Influence deliverables use §3.5 verification: OAuth autoverification if linked; otherwise URL submit + snapshot.

Noncompliance: 24h cure, then partial refund for the allocated item.

Safety & reputation

IDverified 18+ required for this role; artisticonly allowed onplatform.

Comfort chips and chaperone policy displayed; buyers must acknowledge in brief.

Trusted Pro and Studio Verified badges help reassure creators during inperson shoots.

Acceptance criteria

Rolespecific onboarding screens, package templates, and addons available.

Posting windows/minlive durations enforced and verified; refunds on noncompliance.

“Links” block and explicitcontent blocker in uploader working.

§3.7 — Reviews, Reputation & Incentives

Goal: Capture highsignal, lowfriction feedback after every booking; turn reliability and respect into visible trust; reward great behavior with small but meaningful advantages—without creating paytowin or review gaming.

A) Principles

Only from verified interactions. Reviews and references originate only from completed onplatform bookings (or marked “Completed – TFP/Collab”).

Doubleblind & timeboxed. Both sides review; neither sees the other’s until both submit or the window closes.

Roleaware & fair. Reviews are per role (Model/Photographer/Videographer/Creator/FanSubscription Creator); search/rank use rolespecific scores.

Evidence over rhetoric. Objective signals (attendance, deliverable manifests, timing) carry more weight than freetext opinions.

Positive incentives, not paywalls. Rewards for reliability and verification; never for positive sentiment specifically.

B) When & how reviews happen (flow)

Trigger: When a booking moves to Completed (acceptance or autoaccept), both parties receive review prompts.

Window: 7 days to submit; if one party submits, the other has 7 days from that moment; then publish simultaneously.

Noshow / cancelled: If a side is deemed NoShow or Provider/Buyer Cancel – Late, the counterpart may leave a review; flagged with an Event label (e.g., “Noshow”).

TFP/Collab: Reviews allowed; labeled “Collab (no cash)”.

Dispute coordination: If a dispute is open, the system delays publication until resolution; reviews then publish with a Resolved badge.

C) Review structure (roleaware rubric)

Star rating (overall): 1–5 stars (halfstars allowed).
Subratings (1–5, shown on profiles; weight into Reputation Score):

For Providers (e.g., Photographers/Videographers/Creators/Models as hired talent)

Professionalism & Respect (onset conduct; comfort boundaries honored).

Communication (pre/during/post).

Reliability (ontime, prepared; aligns with checkin/checkout).

Quality vs Scope (deliverables matched the agreed brief/manifest).

Safety & Comfort (Models/Creators) (for bookings with talent; chaperone, privacy).

For Buyers/Brands (visible to providers)

Clarity of Brief (scope, references, decisions).

Communication.

Reliability & Timeliness (arrived, stayed on schedule).

Respect & Safety (professional set, boundaries honored).

Payments & Approvals (escrow, acceptance, change orders handled promptly).

Attachments (optional, storagesane):

Up to 3 preview images or short proxy clips (for context), or link to public proof URL (e.g., verified promo post).

All attachments follow the artisticonly policy; no explicit content.

Private feedback to platform (not public): single freetext box for safety/moderation signals.

D) What displays on profiles & search cards

Overall role rating (e.g., 4.8) + rating histogram + # of verified reviews.

Recent highlights (last three reviews, 2line excerpts).

Badges & signals: ID Verified, Trusted Pro, Studio Verified, SocialVerified, FanSubscription Creator (18+ gated).

Operational stats (last 90 days):

Ontime rate (arrived/start on time), Completion rate (jobs finished), Dispute rate, Response time (median).

Verified references counter: number of completed onplatform collaborations.

For buyers: a Buyer Rep panel is shown to providers (see §H).

Search cards include: Rep Score ring, average rating, count, last90day ontime %, and badges.

E) Reputation Score (0–100) — computation & decay (refined)

Purpose: A quick, explainable trust signal; used in ranking as a tiebreak (never overrides relevance/filters) and to gate certain privileges (e.g., Boost eligibility, Instant Book).

Inputs & weights (roleaware; timeweighted):

Reviews & volume — 40%

Bayesianadjusted average of overall star ratings (per role) using a Wilson score prior, with recency weighting (last 90 days ×1.5).

Reliability & policy — 25%

Ontime start %, completion rate, noshow/cancel strikes (negative weights with decay), doc compliance before checkin.

Responsiveness — 10%

Median first response time; reply rate to invites/RFP.

Verifications — 15%

ID (base), Trusted Pro (+), Studio Verified (+), SocialVerified (+ small).

Recent performance — 10%

Last 90day job NPS (“Would you book again?” Yes/No), dispute outcomes.

Decay & floors:

Strikes and poor events decay 25% per 90 days of clean activity.

New accounts show “New — building reputation” until ≥3 verified reviews (prevents low initial scores).

Gaming protection:

Volume weighting cap: one job cannot change score by >3 pts.

Reciprocal review detection: correlated 5star exchanges get downweighted.

Anomaly flags: suspicious IP/device overlaps; cluster analysis for ring behavior; autoaudit queue.

F) Incentives & achievements (behavior shaping)

Universal (roleagnostic):

Complete your first 3 jobs on time → “OnTime Streak” badge + +10 DM credits.

<1hour median response for 30 days → “Fast Responder” badge + search tiebreak +1 (only in equal matches).

Complete ID → Instant Book + +20 DM credits.

Trusted Pro → Provider fee –0.5%, RFP priority, $15 Boost coupon (per §3.3).

Studio Verified → appears in studio filter; prioritized in “Studios in [City]” carousels.

Rolespecific bonus nudges (examples):

Models/Creators: “Boundary Pro” (5 bookings with ‘Safety & Comfort’ ≥4.8) → profile highlight chip.

Photographers/Videographers: “Spec Perfect” (10 jobs with 100% manifest pass, ≤1 revision) → small search nudge in equal ties.

FanSubscription Creators: “Promo Deliveries 10/10” (all posts verified within window) → featured eligibility in “Reliable Promo” carousel.

Review completion incentives (neutral):

Completing any review within window → +5 DM credits (regardless of rating).

No incentives for positive ratings (to avoid bias).

G) Antigaming, moderation & appeals

Content policy filters: NLP and rulebased filters for hate/harassment/doxxing/explicit content; block or route to moderation.

Defamation & proof: Fact claims (e.g., “stole equipment”) must include evidence (moderator can request); otherwise convert to opinion phrasing or remove.

Extortion policy: Prohibit “change deliverables or I’ll leave 1★”; report → fast moderation; outcomes: warning → strike → suspension.

Right of reply: Public owner reply allowed once per review; edit window for typos 30 minutes postpublish.

Appeals: If review violates policy or is demonstrably false, removal or redaction; SLA ≤5 business days.

Shadowweighting: Reviews from accounts with anomaly flags contribute reduced weight without visible deletion (preserves transparency while limiting harm).

Killswitch: If toxicity rate > 0.8% of reviews in a 7day window, tighten filters and increase human sampling.

H) Buyer/Brand Reputation (visible to providers)

Buyer Rep (0–100) components:

Payments & approvals: escrow timely, acceptance within window.

Reliability: ontime arrival/start, cancellation/noshow rate.

Respect & Safety: subrating from providers; safety flags (sealed).

Dispute rate & outcomes.

Display to providers: Buyer Rep ring, recent labels (“Pays on time”, “Clear briefs”), and counts (repeat rate).

Gates: RFP Broadcast requires IDVerified; poor Buyer Rep can trigger manual review on broadcasts.

I) How Reviews & Rep affect ranking & access (guardrails)

Search ranking order: relevance → availability → distance → price fit → Rep tiebreak → minor nudges (Verified/Trusted/Studio).

Boost eligibility (per §3.3): Rep ≥75 and IDVerified; safety flags disable paid delivery.

Instant Book gating: Rep <70 or recent strike → IB disabled until 30 clean days or after remediation.

Visibility throttles: Repeated disputes/late cancels lower impression share temporarily (gradual recovery with clean activity).

J) Notifications & UX copy (snippets)

“Review ready”: “Your project with {Name} is complete—share how it went (2 minutes). Your feedback publishes after both sides submit or in 7 days.”

“Keep it respectful”: “Reviews should be factual and professional. We remove harassment, doxxing, or explicit content.”

“Appeal received”: “Thanks. Our team will review and respond within 5 business days. We may request evidence.”

“Streak earned”: “OnTime Streak unlocked: +10 DM credits and a profile badge visible in search.”

K) KPIs & targets (first 90 days / city)

Review completion rate: ≥70% (bothsided) within 7 days.

Median time to first review: ≤24h postcompletion.

Toxicity rate: ≤0.5% of reviews flagged; confirmed violations ≤0.2%.

Disputeadjusted bias: rating drift after disputes ≤0.3★ (fairness).

Correlation to outcomes: Rep Score topquartile → ≥20% higher inquiry→booking vs baseline.

Appeals SLA: ≤5 business days average resolution.

Noshow reduction: repeat noshows drop ≥30% after streak/strike logic.

L) Acceptance criteria (mark 3.7 FINAL)

Doubleblind reviews with 7day window, simultaneous publish, and disputeaware delay.

Rolespecific subratings live; attachments limited to previews/proxies; private feedback channel.

Profile displays: overall & histogram, recent highlights, badges, last90day ops stats, verified references.

Reputation Score computed per role with Bayesian/Wilson, recency weighting, decay, and antigaming caps.

Buyer Rep visible to providers with components above; broadcast gates enforced.

Incentives (streaks, fast responder, verification rewards) wired; neutral reviewcompletion credits.

Moderation & appeals tooling: filters, evidence requests, redaction/removal, public reply, SLAs.

Ranking integration and feature gates (Boost eligibility, Instant Book thresholds, impression throttles).

Analytics & alerts for completion rate, toxicity, fairness, anomaly/ring detection.

M) Why this works

Trust you can see: Reviews are verified by bookings; objective ops stats back up the story.

Fair to new users: Bayesian/Wilson and recency avoid “coldstart” penalties and onereview whiplash.

Behavior improves: Streaks and small nudges reward what matters—ontime, respectful, responsive, within scope.

Hard to game: Doubleblind, anomaly detection, and evidenceweighted scoring blunt collusion and retaliation.

Brandsafe: Clear policy lines, 18+ gating for sensitive roles, and fast moderation keep content and tone professional.

§3.8 — Growth Loops & Retention
