Goal: Turn first actions into habits and habits into repeat bookings. Build crossside loops (buyers ↔︎ sellers), selfreinforcing trust loops (verification → bookings → reviews → ranking), and content loops (feeds, boards, case studies) — without paywalls and without harming fairness.

A) Principles

Value → habit: Every loop must deliver immediate value (leads, clarity, or time saved) within a user’s first 7–14 days.

Crossside by design: Features should create interactions that pull the other side back (invites, tags, verified posts).

Trust amplifies growth: Verification, ontime behavior, and clean delivery unlock visibility—not payment.

Polite, predictable comms: Fewer, better notifications with frequency caps and onetap controls.

Roleaware, safe: One account, multiple roles; feeds and alerts respect 18+ Safe Mode and artisticonly policy.

B) Lifecycle Model & Health Metrics (how we decide what to trigger)

Stages (per side):

New (days 0–7): Profile/brief created; hasn’t sent a quote (seller) or award (buyer).

Activated (days 7–30): ≥1 meaningful action (seller: Quick Quote sent; buyer: Smart Invite/RFP sent).

Habit (30–90): ≥2 completed bookings; reply median ≤ 2h; repeat rate ≥ 25%.

Risk: 14 days of inactivity and pending leads or saved searches.

Churn: 45 days no meaningful action.

Core health metrics:

Activation rate, time to first inquiry/quote/award, repeat bookings %, time between bookings, saved search alerts → booking %, winback %.

C) Core Loops (what pulls users back)

1) Supplyside loops (sellers: Models/Photogs/Videographers/Creators)

Profile → Discovery → Lead → Quote → Booking → Review → Rank lift → More Discovery

“Improve fit” hints on profile (pricefit index, missing ID, response time) show impact estimate (“+12% more invites”).

Tagging loop: after each booking, both parties can tag each other in 1–3 portfolio items; tagged approvals add those posts to both profiles and surface to each other’s followers.

Case study loop: postcompletion, onetap “Create case study” (cover + 3 images + 150 words). Case studies populate city/role showcases and boost discovery.

Rebooking loop

Auto “Book again” button appears to the buyer 7/30/90 days after certain packages (e.g., monthly content), prefilled with last scope + adjusted dates.

2) Demandside loops (buyers/brands)

Saved Search → Alert → Smart Invite/RFP → Compare → Award → Favorite → Board revisit

Saved Searches with ANY/ALL filters (incl. social metrics, nudity tiers, Verified/Trusted) send newmatch alerts (1/day max per search).

Board updates: when a profiled provider updates availability, gains a badge, or posts a relevant case study, boards with that provider show a “Fresh” chip and optional digest.

Template briefs: last 3 briefs saved as templates; 1click Reopen brief and Rebroadcast (consumes credits per §3.5).

3) Content loops (feeds & follow)

Follow → Feed → Inquiry → Booking → Tag → Feed

Single unified feed per user with role tabs (Model/Photog/Vid/Creator/FanSub Creator). Posting is once, tagged by role(s); viewers filter by role.

Feed pulls: new case studies, availability cards (“Now booking Saturday”), touring chips (“Visiting Austin 11/20–11/22”), Verified Studio open slots, and Verified influence posts delivered (SFW preview + “Verified” tick).

Safe Mode default keeps 18+ content hidden until toggled; feed respects nudity tiers & policy.

4) Social share loop (offplatform → onplatform)

Sharecard generator: onetap export of profile/case study as socialready images (IG/TT) with QR + booking link.

Linkinbio minisite (autogenerated) shows packages, availability, contact CTA; UTM tags attribute inbound traffic.

5) Verification loop (trust → visibility → bookings)

Completing ID unlocks Instant Book + DM credits → higher inquiry→booking.

Trusted Pro (BG) grants fee nudge, RFP priority, Boost coupon → more awards → more reviews → Rep Score up → ranking tiebreaks.

D) Retention Features (per user type)

Sellers

Lead Inbox nudges: “Reply within 2h to keep Fast Responder badge.”

Utilization alerts: “You have 4 open IB slots this weekend; enable LastMinute Fill for +18% leads.”

Smart “Raise price” hints when win rate >70% and price well below city median.

Touring assist: suggest nearby cities and dates based on follower heatmap; autocreate “Visiting [City]” chip.

Buyers

Shortlist intelligence: “3 of your saved photogs now Instant Book next Friday.”

Availability windows: “Top models in your board opened 8–10pm Fri.”

Budget guardrails: recommendations to adjust range for ≥3 qualified responses.

“Book again” reminders synced to last project cadence.

E) Referrals & Credits (twosided, abuseresistant)

Provider invites provider: both get +20 DM credits after invitee publishes a package and completes 1 booking.

Buyer invites buyer: inviter gets 1 RFP credit when invitee posts a brief and awards a booking.

Crossside referrals: if a provider invites a buyer who books them, both get $15 buyer credit toward next booking (used on buyer fee only).

Guardrails: peruser monthly caps; ID required to redeem; same device/IP fraud detection; clawback if first booking is refunded for fraud.

F) Saved Searches, Alerts & Digests

Saved search alerts: new matches batched 1/day/search; “turn off for 30 days” easy toggle.

Weekly city digest (optin): featured case studies, Verified Studios with open slots, “Top rising creators” (Rep + recent growth).

Postbooking digest: 7 days after completion—review reminder, case study prompt, “book again” CTA.

G) Follows, Favorites & Boards (organization that retains)

Follow counts on profiles; Following tab shows only updates from accounts you follow.

Favorites folders/Boards: draganddrop; status tags autoupdate (Invited/Proposed/Awarded).

Share boards externally (readonly) with optional NDA gate; activity pings when providers on a board go Verified or open IB slots.

H) Notifications & Frequency Caps

Channels: inapp, email, push (optin), SMS (critical only).

Global caps: max 2 push/day, 3 email/week by default; digest merges alerts.

User controls: pertopic toggles (Saved searches, Boards, Touring, Case studies, Instant Book windows).

Quiet hours: localtime 10pm–8am (nonurgent push deferred).

Respect Safe Mode: 18+ gated content never appears in public emails; only visible inapp with toggle ON.

I) WinBack & Churn Save

Risk cohort (14 days idle): send “quick action” emails (“Publish 1 package template in 60s” / “Send 3 Smart Invites from your board”).

Churn cohort (45 days idle): offer $15 buyer credit or +20 DM credits if they complete a booking within 14 days.

Exit survey on deactivation: reasons (price, low leads, complexity, safety). Autocreate remedial tasks (e.g., “Enable ID to unlock IB”).

Pause mode: let users pause discovery (hide from search) without deleting; set autoresume.

J) Feed & Posting (roleaware, one post → many views)

One composer with role tags; viewers filter by role.

Post types: Case study, Availability card, Touring card, “Looking for…” (LFM/LFP rolegated), Verified promo delivered (SFW preview).

Ranking: follows → samecity trending → recommended (Repweighted).

Moderation: AI + human; artisticonly policy; Safe Mode hides 18+ until toggled.

K) Experiments (first 8–12 weeks)

Saved search alert frequency: immediate vs daily batch.

“Book again” reminder timing: +14 vs +30 days.

Case study autoprompt: shown at acceptance vs at review submission.

Referral reward mix: DM credits vs $ buyer credits impact on bookings.

Feed ranking weights: followheavy vs citytrending weight.

Touring chip CTR: prominent vs subtle card.

L) KPIs & Targets (90day per city)

Activation: sellers sending a first Quick Quote ≥ 55%; buyers sending a first Smart Invite/RFP ≥ 60%.

Habit: ≥ 30% of activated users complete 2+ bookings in 60 days.

Repeat: ≥ 35% of bookings are repeat buyer↔︎provider pairings by month 6.

Saved searches: alert → click ≥ 18%; click → booking ≥ 6%.

Boards: ≥ 45% of active buyers maintain ≥1 board; board revisit rate ≥ 2×/month.

Referrals: ≥ 15% of new users join via invite; fraud rate on referrals < 1%.

Winback: ≥ 12% of risk cohort reactivated; ≥ 8% of churn cohort return within 30 days.

Feed: poster → inbound inquiry uplift ≥ 10% vs nonposters; toxicity < 0.5%.

M) Acceptance Criteria (mark 3.8 FINAL)

Saved searches with ANY/ALL logic (incl. social metrics and nudity tiers), daily batched alerts, onetap unsubscribe.

Follows/Boards with status tags, external share links, and board refresh “Fresh” chips.

Unified feed with role filters, Safe Mode gating, availability/touring cards, case studies, verified promo posts.

Referral system (twosided) with caps, KYC gating, fraud checks, and credit types (DM, RFP, buyer fee credit).

Rebooking buttons with prefilled scopes; brief templates and onetap rebroadcasts.

Lead & utilization nudges, pricefit hints, touring assist.

Comms controls & caps (channels, quiet hours, Safe Mode email policy).

Winback flows for risk/churn; pause mode; exit survey & remediation tasks.

Analytics: lifecycle stage dashboards, loop performance (saved search → booking, referral ROAS, feed → inquiry).

N) Why this works

Selfreinforcing: Each completed job seeds reviews, tags, case studies, and “book again” triggers that bring both sides back.

Buyer clarity = speed: Saved searches, boards, and brief templates shrink timetoaward.

Fair & safe: Visibility comes from trust and performance; Safe Mode protects brand and compliance.

Costefficient: Credits (DM/RFP/buyer fee) and smart nudges drive retention without monthly paywalls.

§3.9 — Support, Refunds, Disputes & Knowledge Base

Goal: Resolve issues quickly and fairly, protect users in urgent situations, keep most cases selfserve, and preserve trust & margins. Make outcomes predictable (clear matrices), evidencebased (manifests, checkin/out, verified posts), and brandsafe.

A) Principles

Selfserve first, human when needed. Most changes/cancellations/refunds can be initiated inthread and settled automatically under clear rules.

Evidence > rhetoric. We rely on Delivery Room manifests, autochecks, checkin/out, and Smart Docs to decide.

Timeboxed resolution. Cure windows and decision SLAs keep money and media from lingering.

Safety has priority. P0 lifesafety routes to Safety team immediately; fees are waived where appropriate.

Transparent playbook. The same refund matrix applies to everyone; it’s visible in the KB.

B) Contact Channels & Triage

Channels (launch):

Inthread “Get help” (contextual flows for that booking).

Account Help (global: billing, verification, policy).

Email/webform fallback.

Triage & priority:

P0 — Safety/Emergency (live/just occurred): response target ≤ 5 min, 24/7 oncall.

P1 — Timecritical booking (<24h): response ≤ 30 min during coverage hours.

P2 — Active booking / delivery in progress: ≤ 4 h.

P3 — General/billing/policy: ≤ 1 business day.

Selfserve flows available from “Get help”:

Change date/time, add/remove addons, adjust travel, request refund, report noshow, report safety issue, delivery problem, chargeback info, verification help.

C) Refund & Adjustment Matrix (default policy)

Packages can raise/lower strictness within allowed bands; stricter terms must be surfaced at checkout and inside Smart Docs.

1) Cancellations & NoShows

2) Delivery Shortfalls & Quality

3) Influence/Promo Deliverables (IG/TT/YT/X)

4) Travel & Location

Safety exception: If a party flags unsafe conduct (harassment, unsafe set), we waive platform fees, refund appropriately, and open a Safety case.

D) Dispute Process (structured & fast)

Open from “Get help” → choose reason.

Collect evidence: system preattaches manifest, autochecks, checkin/out, chat. Parties add statements & files.

Cure window: provider gets 48h for technical shortfalls; buyer gets 24h to supply missing info (e.g., link URLs).

Neutral Review (if unresolved): trained specialists compare against Smart Docs & manifest; may request targeted files only (no fishing).

Decision: prorata refunds, reedit orders, or uphold delivery.

Payouts adjust automatically; receipts reissued.

Appeal (facts or policy error only): ≤ 5 business days SLA.

E) Chargebacks & Payments Ops

Prechargeback rescue: autopropose settlement to buyer if they initiate dispute with their bank; surface evidence inapp.

Representment kit (if chargeback filed): signed SOW/release, manifest, acceptance logs, checkin/out, comms timeline.

Fees: platform absorbs processor dispute fees unless clear abuse → losing party may be charged a small dispute handling fee (see §3.1).

Risk dials: newprovider reserve; rolling reserves for highrisk cohorts; Early Payout eligibility aligns with Rep ≥ 85 (see §3.2/§3.1).

Thresholds: keep chargeback ratio <0.8%; above that → cohort risk review; instant IB disable for outliers.

F) Safety & Content Policy Escalations

SIRT (Safety Incident Response Team): oncall; responds ≤ 5 min to P0; preserves evidence; may freeze funds.

Interim measures: temporary Instant Book disable, ad/boost suppression, search visibility throttle.

Enforcement: threestrike model; immediate suspension for severe policy breaches (e.g., explicit sexual content, violence, doxxing).

Law enforcement: cooperate under valid legal requests; strict privacy controls.

G) Knowledge Base (KB) & InProduct Help

KB structure (public):

Booking & Payments: escrow, milestones, payouts, fees, taxes.

Cancellations & Refunds: matrices, examples, timelines.

Deliverables: Delivery Room, manifests, previews vs originals, external storage (Drive/Dropbox), checksum tips.

Influence Deliverables: posting windows, OAuth linking, URL proof, dispute examples.

Documents: Smart Docs packs, esign, minor/guardian, safety addendum, licensing.

Verification: ID, Background (Trusted Pro), Studio Lite, Social.

Search & Roles: nudity tiers, Safe Mode, FanSubscription Creator policy.

Safety: onset guidelines, reporting, chaperone policy, what happens after a report.

City promos & credits: RFP credits, buyer credits, DM credits.

Legal & Privacy: data we store (attestations), retention, appeals.

Inproduct help:

Tooltips for fee math, cancel windows, deliverable specs.

Inline checklists (e.g., “Pass autochecks: JPEG sRGB, 3000px+”).

“Why this decision?” link on outcomes.

H) Internal Tools (Agent Console)

Unified case view (thread + booking + payments + verification).

Oneclick outcomes: prorata refund %, reedit order, fee waivers.

Evidence viewer: manifests, checkin/out map, file autocheck results, social verification logs.

Policy macros: cancellation matrix variants, safety scripts, adverseaction (BG) templates.

Account controls: IB toggle, visibility throttle, boost suppress, temporary hold.

Ledger safety: doubleentry adjustments; immutable audit log.

I) SLAs, Coverage & Staffing

Coverage: Safety 24/7; general support 16×5 at launch (expand to 24×7 by city #3).

Response targets: P0 ≤ 5 min; P1 ≤ 30 min; P2 ≤ 4 h; P3 ≤ 1 biz day.

Resolution targets: P1 ≤ 12 h; P2 ≤ 48 h; P3 ≤ 3 biz days.

Houston pilot staffing: 1 Safety lead (oncall rotation), 2–3 generalists (day/evening), parttime adjudicator for Neutral Reviews.

J) Metrics & Guardrails

CSAT: ≥ 4.6/5; FRT & TTR on target per priority.

Autoresolution rate: ≥ 50% of cases resolved selfserve.

Refund leakage: within plan; buyer fee refunds only on provider fault/safety.

Dispute reopen rate: < 8%.

Chargeback ratio: < 0.8%; representment win rate > 55%.

Safety: P0 median ≤ 3 min, repeat offenders caught; policy violations < 0.3% of bookings.

Fairness: outcomes distribution consistent across roles/cities (monitor for bias).

K) Acceptance Criteria (mark 3.9 FINAL)

Selfserve flows live: date/time change, addons, travel adj, refund request, noshow, delivery problem, safety report.

Refund engine implements matrices above, with autocure windows and prorata calculations.

Dispute center inthread: evidence collection, timers, Neutral Review workflow, decision & receipts reissue.

Chargeback kit generator; reserves & IB gating rules wired.

Safety pipeline: P0 hotline, IB/boost suppress toggles, evidence preservation.

KB published; inline tips & “Why this decision?” links live.

Agent console: macros, ledger adjustments, audit logs.

Analytics dashboards: CSAT, FRT/TTR, refund leakage, reopen, chargeback, safety SLA.

L) Why this works

Predictable & fair: Users see the same rules we apply; most outcomes are obvious from the matrix.

Fast & scalable: Selfserve, timers, and autochecks keep humans for edge cases.

Trustpreserving: Safety first, evidencedriven decisions, and fee policies aligned with fault.

Marginaware: Buyer fee refunds only on provider fault; prorata logic prevents overrefunds; chargeback playbooks contain losses.

Addendum — §3.9 Support, Refunds, Disputes & Knowledge Base (Studios) — FINAL

Scope: Minimal but required clarifications so §3.9 cleanly covers Studio bookings and Linked Booking Groups (Talent + Studio in one checkout), without changing previously approved talent policies.

A) SelfServe Flows (additions)

Add the following quick actions under Inthread ▸ Get help:

Studio ▸ Access issue (can’t enter / code not working)

Studio ▸ Damage claim (hostinitiated; requires photos & description)

Studio ▸ Postbooking adjustment (overtime / crewsize overage / rule violation)

Linked Group ▸ Propose reschedule (sync both bookings)

Linked Group ▸ Split or cancel (show sidebyside outcomes per policy)

B) Refund Matrices (references & summary)

Talent cancellations & disputes: unchanged (see main §3.9 matrix).

Studio cancellations: use the Studio matrix (default bands: >7d=100% refund; 7–48h=50%; <48h/noshow=0%).

Linked Booking Groups (LBG): outcomes are computed per booking and shown in one summary (e.g., “Talent: 50% refund • Studio: 0% refund”). Support agents use the LBG outcome view when editing/issuing refunds.

C) Evidence Sets (studiospecific)

For Studio disputes we prioritize the following system evidence (autoattached where available):

Checkin/out timestamps + geofence pass/fail.

House Rules & Property Release esign audit logs.

Access logs (door code release/time sent; if integrated).

Before/after photos (host; timestamped).

Overtime/overage indicators (End time vs booked End; crew count notes).

Calendar state at booking time (to counter “doublebooked” claims).

(For Talent deliverable disputes, continue using Delivery Room manifests/autochecks as primary evidence.)

D) Standard Outcomes (studiospecific)

Access failure (host fault): buyer full refund of studio; waive buyer fee for that booking; goodwill credit allowed.

Amenity misrepresentation: cure if feasible (e.g., provide blackout curtains), else partial refund aligned to value impact; repeat issues → host strike.

Overtime/crew overage/rule violations: process via Postbooking adjustment; approve with clear evidence; refund if host lacks evidence.

Damage claim: up to the deposit hold cap; see §H.

E) SLAs & Timers (studiospecific)

Access issue (live) → P1 (≤ 30 min response; aim to resolve on the spot).

Damage claim window: host must open ≤ 24h after checkout; buyer response window 48h.

Adjustment window (overtime/overage): host opens ≤ 24h; buyer response 48h.

Neutral Review (if contested): decision target ≤ 5 business days.

F) NoShow & Early Exit (studio)

Buyer noshow: apply Studio matrix (often 0% refund); deposit is not captured unless damage/violation claimed.

Early exit: no prorata refunds unless host agrees; overtime may still apply if late start pushes past booked end.

G) Chargebacks (studio specifics)

Representment kit must include: checkin/out logs, rules/release signatures, access log evidence, house rules, before/after photos, and any approved adjustments.
Deposit captures are separate charges; submit damage evidence with capture receipt.

H) Deposit Holds & Damage Claims (operational notes)

Authorize at checkout (or 24h prior, host setting); release automatically 48h postcheckout if no claim.

On approved claim, capture partial/full up to cap; no platform fee on captured amount (see §3.1 addendum).

Abuse guard: frequent denied claims reduce host visibility and may remove deposit privileges.

I) Knowledge Base (new/updated articles)

Add/refresh articles:

Studios 101: rules, access, deposits, cleaning fees, Instant Book vs approval.

Attach a Studio to your shoot: how the inflow picker works; what “Linked Booking Group” means.

Damage deposits & claims: timelines, evidence, how captures work.

Overtime & adjustments: what qualifies, how to dispute.

LBG refunds explained: examples showing different outcomes for Talent vs Studio in one checkout.

All KB entries should link to corresponding policy matrices and timers above.

J) Agent Console (microtooling)

LBG outcome view: sidebyside (Talent | Studio) with autocalc; one click to apply both outcomes.

Deposit actions: authorize/void/capture with reason codes; evidence viewer.

Templates: “Access failure (host remedy/credit)”, “Adjustment approved/denied”, “Damage capture approved/denied”.

Sanctions: toggle IB off for studio; reduce visibility; flag host for quality review.

K) Acceptance Criteria (mark §3.9 addendum FINAL)

New selfserve actions appear for Studio & LBG cases.

Studio matrix referenced & enforced; LBG summary surfaces perbooking outcomes.

Evidence packs autoattach for Studio disputes (checkin/out, rules, access, photos).

Deposit lifecycle supported in Support tooling (authorize/void/capture) with audit logs.

Timers & SLAs implemented (24h/48h/5day) for claims/adjustments/neutral review.

KB articles created/updated; links wired from help flows.

Agent console: LBG outcome view, deposit actions, message templates, IB/visibility sanctions.

L) Why this is “tiny” but necessary

It reuses §3.9 structure—just adds Studiospecific buttons, timers, and evidence.

It keeps group bookings easy to explain and adjudicate: two bookings, one summary.

It ensures deposits don’t become support landmines (clear windows, tools, and receipts).

Section 4 — Product Architecture & Page Map

Goal: Define a coherent, scalable UX architecture that turns our marketplace rules into screens and flows. Keep the system roleaware (people vs places), cityaware, SafeModebydefault, and storagesane. Bake in trust (verification ladder, reputation), fairness (no paytowin ranking), and booking clarity (escrow, Smart Docs, Delivery Room).
Studios launch as space listings (not roles): a subhub + AttachinFlow (brief/checkout), with separate bookings and policies, tied by Linked Booking Group when purchased with talent.

A) What Section 4 guarantees (scope & outcomes)

Every jobtobedone has a page & path. Search, profile/listing, booking, delivery, review, dispute—no “dead ends.”

One account, many offerings. A user can operate multiple Service Profiles (Model/Photographer/Videographer/Creator/FanSubscription Creator) and optional Studio listings.

Clear separation of entity types. People (roles) vs Places (studios) remain distinct in search, reviews, policies, and payouts.

Mobilefirst, desktopstrong. A tight 5icon mobile nav; desktop topbar + action shortcuts; both share the same mental model.

Performance, safety, and accessibility are global requirements, not afterthoughts.

B) Core entities (objects the UX revolves around)

Account — one login; owns assets and settings.

Service Profile (Role) — personbased offering: Model / Photographer / Videographer / Creator / FanSubscription Creator.

Studio Listing (Space) — placebased offering; can earn Verified Studio (Lite).

Search Query — role selector + filters; saved search + alert cadence.

Board — buyer’s collection of candidates (talent and studios) with statuses.

Brief / RFP — buyer’s scope; generates invites/broadcasts.

Booking — Talent or Studio booking; each has escrow, policy, timeline, documents.

Linked Booking Group (LBG) — bundle of a Talent booking + Studio booking in one checkout; independent rules, synchronized time.

Thread — messaging with attachments, quotes, docs, decisions.

Smart Docs — SOW/License/Release/Property & House Rules; esign; autoamend.

Delivery — Delivery Room manifest, previews/proxies, external links, acceptance window.

Verification — ID, Background (Trusted Pro), SocialVerified, Studio Lite; badge ladder.

Reputation — 0–100 score per role; separate space reputation for studios.

Promotion — optional paid boosts/featured (guardrailed).

Support Case — refund/dispute/safety workflow with evidence packs.

C) Crosscutting UX principles (apply everywhere)

Safe Mode default ON: gates 18+ people roles & feed; studios are never 18+ gated (content must remain SFW).

Roleaware everywhere: Search, cards, reviews, analytics all show the relevant role/space context.

AttachinFlow: When a shoot brief has a time & city, suggest compatible studios before checkout.

Evidencefirst resolution: manifests/checkin/out/autochecks > rhetoric.

Storagesane: previews on platform; originals via Drive/Dropbox/OneDrive/S3 links (captured as a manifest).

Accessibility (AA) & performance budgets: keyboardable filters, strong contrast, TTI < 2.5s on 3G Fast, route codesplitting.

Cityaware: location chips, city selector, and saved searches all obey the current city context.

D) Global flows (from first visit to review)

Discover → Home/Category/Case Studies → Search (role selector + filters) → Profile/Listing card → Message or Instant Book.

Plan → Brief (Quick/Full) → smart invites/RFP → Compare & Boards → Award.

Book → Checkout (escrow, docs) → (optional) Attach a Studio → Payment → confirmation.

Work → Thread (prep) → Checkin/out (time evidence) → Delivery Room → Acceptance.

Close → Payout → Doubleblind Reviews → Reputation updates → Growth loops (follow/favorite/feed/case study).

If needed → Refund/Dispute/Safety → outcome per matrix with evidence.

E) Surface families (we’ll enumerate pages in §4.0)

Public

Landing, Category hubs (roles + Verified Studios (Lite) subhub), Search, Profile (role), Studio Detail (space), Case Studies, Help Center, Auth.

Buyer

Brief Composer (Quick/Full), Compare/Award, Boards, Threads/Messages, Checkout, LBG Summary, Delivery (read), Smart Docs (read/sign), Buyer Dashboard (spend, teams).

Seller (roles)

Onboarding wizard (per role), Packages/Addons, Portfolio/Tagging, Availability/Calendar, Threads, Delivery (author), Smart Docs (author/sign), Seller Dashboard (analytics, payouts).

Host (studios)

Create/Edit Studio listing (wizard), Studio Dashboard (calendar, rules, bookings, deposits, claims), Verification Lite status.

Crosscutting

Notifications, Verification Center, Payments & Tax, Settings & Privacy, Support/Dispute Center.

Admin (essentials)

Support console, Safety, Promotions config, Verification review.

F) Navigation model (the contract; full spec later in §4.1)

Desktop header: Logo • Browse (roles + Verified Studios (Lite)) • Search • Boards/Packages (context) • Messages • Notifications • Create • Safe Mode toggle • City • Account.

Mobile tab bar: Home • Search • Create • Messages • Profile.

Create adapts: Buyer (Brief), Seller (Package/Post), Host (Studio Listing).

G) Ranking & fairness contract

Result order = relevance → availability → distance → price fit → Rep tiebreak → tiny nudges (Verified/Trusted/Studio).

Promotions never bypass filters; density caps (e.g., ≤2 in top 20) and “Promoted” labels are mandatory.

Eligibility gates: IDVerified, Rep ≥ threshold; safety strikes suppress IB and paid delivery.

H) Global system rules we won’t violate

Separate bookings & ledgers for Talent vs Studio (even in one checkout).

Pertype policies (refunds, deposits) applied independently; the UI shows one LBG outcome summary to the user.

No forced subscriptions at launch; monetization is takerate + optional boosts, verification addons, and peruse Early Payout.

I) Performance, privacy, and safety baselines

Perf: image lazyload, skeleton cards, background prefetch for next route, defer OAuth SDKs until needed.

Privacy: exact addresses hidden until confirmation; studio surveillance disclosures required; minors require guardian docs.

Safety: P0 hotline, checkin/out evidence, hazard toggles inject Safety Addendum, instant IB/boost suppression during investigations.

J) Analytics & observability (event families)

Nav & search: nav.click, search.open, search.apply_filters, saved_search.create/alert.open.

Discovery & boards: board.add, compare.open, invite.send, rfp.broadcast.

Bookings: booking.create.talent|studio, booking.group.linked/split, checkout.complete.

Docs & delivery: doc.esign, delivery.manifest_pinned, delivery.accepted/auto_accept.

Reputation: review.submit, rep.update, strike.add/remove.

Studios: studio.create/publish/verify_lite, studio.deposit.authorize/capture/release, studio.adjustment.open/resolve.

Promotions: boost.purchase, featured.book.

Support: dispute.open/resolve, chargeback.open/represent.

All events include role_or_listing_type, city, and user cohort tags for citybycity rollout measurement.

K) Risks & mitigations (known issues, bakedin controls)

Scope creep with Studios → Mitigation: subhub + attachinflow only; capped city inventory; clear KPIs/killswitch.

Policy confusion in LBG → Mitigation: separate booking lines, sidebyside outcomes, pertype receipts.

Growth vs brand safety → Mitigation: Safe Mode default; artisticonly policy; clear surveillance & hazard disclosures.

Infra cost (media) → Mitigation: previews only; externallink manifest; virus scan on previews; cap perthread size.

Fairness perception → Mitigation: transparent ranking rules; labeled promotions; eligibility gates.

L) Acceptance Criteria (mark Section 4 FINAL)

Entity model (Account, Service Profile, Studio Listing, Booking, LBG, Thread, Smart Docs, Delivery, Verification, Reputation, Promotion, Support Case) defined and referenced consistently.

Global flows (Discover → Plan → Book → Work → Close → Support) documented with no missing steps.

Surface families enumerated (public/buyer/seller/host/cross/admin) to drive the Page Map in §4.0.

Nav model defined (desktop/mobile) with Safe Mode and city context always accessible.

Ranking & fairness contract documented (relevance first; promotions capped & labeled).

Safety/privacy/perf baselines established (Safe Mode, address privacy, hazard toggles, perf budgets).

Analytics event families declared (to wire telemetry from day one).

Studios confirmed as space listings with subhub + AttachinFlow only at launch; LBG contract in place.

Nongoals (full venue marketplace features) explicitly excluded from launch scope.

M) Why this works

Clarity → speed: Clean entities and flows make the UI obvious and the marketplace predictable.

Scales by addition, not revision: New roles or more studio inventory slot into the same model.

Trust is structural: Verification, Safe Mode, and separate booking ledgers are baked into the architecture, not bolted on.

Launchable: We can ship citybycity with confidence and expand without rewiring the product.

§4.0 — Page Map (HighLevel)

Contract: Every user task has a screen and a clear next step. Pages are grouped by Public, Buyer, Seller (roles), Host (studios), Crosscutting, and Admin. Each entry lists route pattern, owner, key sections, and primary CTAs. Mobile uses the same routes; some interactions open as drawers/modals.

A) Routing & Guardrails (global)

Route shape: kebabcase; city context as query (?city=houston) or chip; IDs as slugs.

Auth gates: actions that create/modify bookings or messages route through /auth with return URL.

Safe Mode: default ON. Hides FanSubscription Creator role & 18+ nudity tiers; studios are unaffected (SFW media only).

City awareness: city selector persistent; saved to profile/cookie.

Error routes: /404, /403, /maintenance.

SEO: canonical URLs & city/role landing pages (see Public).

B) Public Surfaces

Home / Landing — / — Owner: Public

Hero search (role selector), Featured in {City} carousels, Case Studies, How it works, Verified Studios (Lite) teaser, Safety blurb.

CTAs: Search, Change city, Sign up, Post a brief (authgated).

Category Hubs (People) — /models, /photographers, /videographers, /creators, /fan-creators (18+ gated)

Role explainer, trending filters, featured profiles, “Top in {City}”.

CTAs: Open Search prefiltered to role; Save template.

Verified Studios (Lite) Hub — /studios?city=houston — Owner: Public

Grid + optional map; amenity filters (natural light, cyc, blackout, etc.), price/hr, min hours, capacity.

CTAs: View studio, Save search, Attach (if coming from Brief/Checkout context).

Search (Roleaware) — /search?role={role}&… — Owner: Public/Signedin

Filters drawer (common + rolespecific), results list + map, Saved search, Attach a Studio pill (if talent query has time/date).

CTAs: Save search, Open result, Attach studio (drawer).

Service Profile (public) — /{role}/{slug} — Owner: Public

Cover, bio, portfolio (per role), packages/addons, availability, reviews, badges, social chips, Has/Owns Studio chip (if linked).

CTAs: Message, Instant Book/Request to Book, Add to board, Report.

Studio Detail (public) — /studio/{slug} — Owner: Public

Gallery, price/hr, min hours, rules, amenities, calendar/slots, host card, reviews, neighborhood map.

CTAs: Instant Book / Request to Book, Add to board, Report.

Case Studies — /case-studies?city=houston&role=photographer

Cards (before/after, goals, tags), deep links to profiles/studios.

CTAs: View profile/studio, Share.

Help Center (KB) — /help

Topics: Booking/Payments, Deliverables, Influencer posts verification, Studios, Safety, Verification, Policies, Fees.

CTAs: Open article, Contact support (authgated).

Auth — /auth/sign-in, /auth/sign-up, /auth/reset

Email passcode or password; phone verify (optional); 18+ attestation for FanSubscription Creator.

CTAs: Continue, Switch method.

Legal & Policy — /terms, /privacy, /safety, /content-policy

C) Buyer Surfaces

Brief Composer

Quick Brief (modal/drawer) — /brief/new?quick=1

Role, city, date/time, budget, deliverables, Attach Studio toggle.

CTA: Send Smart Invites.

Full Brief (page) — /brief/new

Goals, references, deliverables, schedule, licensing, nudity tier (if talent), Attach Studio step, posting window/minlive (if promo).

CTAs: Broadcast RFP (credits), Save draft, Invite.

Smart Invites — /brief/{id}/invites

Candidate grid (fit score chips: availability, price fit, rep), message template.

CTAs: Invite, Edit brief.

Compare & Award — /brief/{id}/compare

Sidebyside quotes (price, scope, timelines, docs, badges).

CTAs: Award, Message, Attach studio (if not yet attached).

Boards & Shortlists — /boards • /board/{id}

Mixed Talent and Studios; status tags (Invited/Proposed/Awarded).

CTAs: Compare, Invite, Share (readonly), Export.

Checkout (Talent) — /checkout/talent/{bookingTempId}

Escrow, Smart Docs (SOW/License/Release), schedule, travel, price.

CTAs: Attach a Studio (drawer), Pay & confirm.

Attach a Studio (drawer) — invoked from Brief/Checkout

Prefiltered by city/date/time; top 3 suggestions; amenity chips.

CTA: Add to checkout (creates Linked Booking Group).

Checkout (Linked Group Summary) — /checkout/group/{groupId}

Two sections: Talent & Studio; policies per type; one payment.

CTAs: Pay & confirm, Edit, Remove studio/talent.

Threads & Messages (buyer view) — /messages • /messages/{threadId}

Pipeline chip (New/Needs Info/Quoted/Awarded/Booked/Delivered/Completed).

CTAs: Reply, Propose reschedule, Request refund, Get help.

Delivery (read) — /booking/{id}/delivery

Manifest, previews, acceptance window, links to originals.

CTAs: Accept, Request revision, Open docs.

Docs (sign/view) — /booking/{id}/docs

Esign for SOW/License/Release; Property/Space Release & House Rules for studios.

CTAs: Sign, Download.

Buyer Dashboard — /buyer

Overview: upcoming, action needed (sign/review), spend to date.

Bookings: list with filters; open detail.

Invoices/Receipts: downloads.

Saved Searches: manage alerts cadence.

Payment Methods: cards/ACH, default.

CTAs: Post brief, Reopen brief, Book again.

D) Seller Surfaces (Models/Photographers/Videographers/Creators/FanSub Creators)

Onboarding Wizard — /seller/onboarding

Role(s), portfolio, packages/addons, availability, location/touring, safety preferences, social connect, verification prompts.

CTAs: Publish, Preview.

Service Profiles & Packages — /seller/profiles • /seller/profile/{role}

Package templates, addons, license presets, rush/lastminute fill.

CTAs: Add package, Save, Enable Instant Book.

Portfolio & Tagging — /seller/portfolio

Perrole galleries; tag collaborators; NSFW gates (artisticonly).

CTAs: Upload, Tag, Approve tags.

Availability & Calendar — /seller/calendar

IB windows, buffers, ICS sync, touring dates.

CTAs: Block, Add touring, Export ICS.

Inbox & Pipeline — /messages • /messages/{threadId}

Quick Replies, Quick Quote, invite response, snooze, autonudge.

CTAs: Quote, Invite to book, Propose change order.

Checkout (sellerside view) — /booking/{id}

Readonly summary; propose edits, discounts.

CTAs: Approve change, Issue partial refund (policyaware).

Delivery Room (author) — /booking/{id}/delivery

Manifest builder, previews/proxies upload, external links, autochecks, revision rounds.

CTAs: Publish delivery, Request acceptance, Start revision.

Smart Docs (author) — /booking/{id}/docs

SOW/License/Release packs; edit fields, esign.

CTAs: Send for signature, Amend.

Seller Dashboard — /seller

Overview: funnel, response time, utilization; Reputation ring and tasks.

Payouts & Tax: methods (ACH), W9/W8, statements, 1099.

Promotions: Search Boost/Featured purchase (usagebased).

CTAs: Create package, Connect social, Buy a Boost.

Verification Center — /verification

ID (Instant Book), Background (Trusted Pro), Social, progress, appeals.

CTAs: Start, Upload, Appeal.

E) Host (Studios) Surfaces — Space listings

Create/Edit Studio (wizard) — /studio/new • /studio/{slug}/edit

Basics, photos, amenities, rules, pricing (hourly/min hours, cleaning), schedule, deposit hold setting, Verification Lite, publish.

CTAs: Publish, Preview, Verify.

Studio Dashboard — /studio/{slug}/dashboard

Calendar & slots, bookings, rules editor, deposit & claims, verification status.

CTAs: Block time, File adjustment, Open damage claim.

Bookings (host view) — /studio/{slug}/bookings

Upcoming/past; checkin/out status; overtime indicators.

CTAs: Share access, Claim overtime, Message buyer.

F) CrossCutting Surfaces

Messages — /messages • /messages/{threadId}

Shared component (buyer/seller/host views differ by actions).

CTAs: Reply, Templates, Scheduling poll, Get help.

Notifications Center — /notifications

Grouped by thread; filters (Action needed, Reviews, Docs).

CTAs: Go to item, Mute thread.

Verification Center — /verification (shared)

ID, BG (people), Social, Studio Lite (space).

CTAs: Start, Resume, Appeal.

Payments & Tax — /billing

Cards/ACH, statements, tax forms.

CTAs: Add method, Download CSV.

Settings & Privacy — /settings

Profile, role switcher, privacy, Safe Mode toggle, notifications, language, city default.

CTAs: Save, Disable account, Pause discovery.

Support / Disputes — /support • /booking/{id}/support

Selfserve flows: reschedule, refunds, studio access issue, postbooking adjustment, damage claim, LBG split/cancel, chargeback info.

CTAs: Start flow, Upload evidence, Escalate.

Saved Searches — /saved-searches

Manage alerts (daily batch), edit filters, delete.

CTAs: Toggle alerts, Edit.

Promotions (usagebased) — /promotions

Search Boost (CPC floors), Featured Carousel (weekly flat), eligibility gates.

CTAs: Create Boost, Buy Featured.

Knowledge Base — /help (also contextlinks in tooltips/modals).

G) Admin / Internal (Phase1 essentials)

Support Console — /admin/support

Case list, LBG outcome view, refund engine, deposit actions, macros.

Safety Console — /admin/safety

P0 hotline, evidence bundling (checkin/out, docs), strikes, IB/boost suppression.

Verification Review — /admin/verification

Studio Lite exceptions, background check escalations, appeals.

Promotions Config — /admin/promotions

City tiers, CPC floors, featured pricing, density caps.

City Ops — /admin/cities

Launch toggles, foundingcity promos, feature flags.

Fee & Policy Config — /admin/finance

Provider/buyer fee promos by city, ACH discounts, refund matrices.

H) Modals & Drawers (Key Composers/Actions)

Quick Brief (buyer)

Smart Invite (buyer)

Attach a Studio (buyer; drawer)

Quick Quote (seller)

Change Order (seller)

Propose Reschedule (either; LBGaware)

PostBooking Adjustment (host: overtime/overage)

Damage Claim (host)

Delivery Upload (seller; proxy/manifest)

Review Composer (doubleblind)

Report Content (policy)

Payment Add/Edit Card

OAuth Connect (IG/YT/TT/X)

Safe Mode Toggle (age confirm)

Share Board (external link + NDA gate)

I) URL Patterns (examples)

/search?role=photographer&city=houston&date=2025-11-12&radius=25mi

/photographer/sunlight-studios • /studio/white-cyc-downtown

/checkout/group/GRP_abc123 • /booking/BK_talent_123 • /booking/BK_studio_987

/brief/BR_123/compare • /board/BD_456

/seller/profile/photographer • /studio/my-loft/edit

/verification?tab=studio-lite

J) Critical Empty States & Skeletons

Search empty: show relaxfilters tips, nearby neighborhoods, role switch.

Profile with no packages: onboarding card “Create your first package.”

Studio with no slots: prompt to add schedule; hide IB until set.

Boards empty: prompt to add from search; suggest saved search.

Delivery Room empty: manifest placeholder; externallink guidance.

Support center empty: point to KB and mostused selfserve flows.

K) Acceptance Criteria (mark §4.0 FINAL)

All pages above have defined routes, owners, key sections, and primary CTAs.

Studios exist as: /studios hub, /studio/{slug} detail, Create/Edit, Dashboard, and AttachinFlow drawer.

Linked Booking Group has a dedicated checkout summary and refund outcome presentation.

Safe Mode is globally present; FanSubscription Creator routes are gated; studios remain visible (SFW only).

Delivery Room, Smart Docs, and Support flows are reachable from bookings.

Buyer, Seller, Host, and Admin surfaces cover onboarding → booking → delivery → review → dispute without dead ends.

Modals/drawers defined for all timesensitive tasks (attach, quote, reschedule, claims).

City ops & promotions admin routes exist to tune CPC floors, featured pricing, and city launch flags.

L) Why this Page Map works

Nothing missing: Every accepted feature from Sections 1–3 has a page, a route, and a CTA.

People vs Places clarity: Service Profiles vs Studios are cleanly separated yet connect via AttachinFlow.

Launchable & scalable: Focuses on Houstonfirst while keeping the IA ready for multicity expansion and future categories.

Trust & safety are visible: Docs, deposits, checkin/out, and dispute paths are firstclass—not hidden.

§4.1 — Global Information Architecture & Navigation

Contract: Make it obvious where to go for any task. Keep People vs Places distinct in IA, keep city & Safe Mode always available, and keep create actions contextual (buyer vs seller vs host). All navigation choices must support the Houstonfirst rollout and scale to multicity.

A) IA Overview (mental model & global state)

Entities:

People (Service Profiles / roles): Model • Photographer • Videographer • Creator • FanSubscription Creator

Places (Space listings): Studio (can be Verified Studio via Studio Lite)

Global state persistent in nav: City (chip), Safe Mode (toggle), Auth (account), Search entry.

Discover → Plan → Book → Work → Close → Support flows are reachable from any context within ≤2 clicks/taps.

B) Desktop Navigation (top bar + browse)

Top bar (left → right)

Logo → Home (cityaware modules)

Browse (megamenu; hover/click)

People: Models • Photographers • Videographers • Creators • FanSubscription Creators (18+)

Places: Verified Studios (Lite) (subhub; not a toplevel pillar)

By City: quick list (current city first)

Case Studies

Search (prominent) → opens Role/Listing selector + filters drawer

Context area (autoswitches by user type and current route)

Buyer context: Boards

Seller context: Packages

Host context: Studios (quick link to studio dashboard)

If multirole: a small dropdown to switch the context link (Boards | Packages | Studios)

Messages (badge)

Notifications (bell; grouped)

Create (primary CTA dropdown; contextaware)

Buyer: New Brief (Quick) • New Brief (Full)

Seller: New Package • New Post (case study/availability)

Host: New Studio Listing

Safe Mode toggle (default ON; age confirm required to OFF)

City selector (Houston default; typeahead)

Account menu

Profile switcher (tabs: Model, Photographer, Videographer, Creator, FanSub Creator, Studio host)

Buyer Dashboard • Seller Dashboard • Studio Dashboard

Verification Center • Payments & Tax • Settings • Help • Sign out

Header behavior

Sticky on scroll; Search and Create remain visible.

When viewing saved searches/boards, a context bar under the header shows chips for active filters and provides Save / Edit controls.

C) Mobile Navigation (tab bar + overflow)

Bottom tab bar (5 items)

Home (cityaware feed + modules)

Search (role selector + filters drawer)

Create (FAB; buyer/seller/host contextual)

Messages

Profile (owner view w/ role switcher tabs at the top)

Header controls (mobile)

City chip left; Safe Mode shield icon right (tap → age confirm + toggle).

Overflow (⋯) menu: Boards, Notifications, Verification, Payments, Settings, Help.

Sticky action bars

On Profile/Studio detail: sticky Book/Request bar.

On Search: sticky Filters / Save bar.

On Checkout: sticky Pay & Confirm bar.

D) Search Entry Pattern (everywhere consistent)

Clicking/tapping Search opens a compact selector with six tabs:
Model | Photographer | Videographer | Creator | FanSub Creator | Studio

Tabs = People (first five) and Places (Studio) — visually separated with a divider label.

Filters drawer (right on desktop; fullscreen on mobile) includes:

Common: city/radius, availability window, budget/price, distance, minimum Rep, Verified/Trusted toggles.

Rolespecific (People): look & comfort (models/creators), specialties & deliverables (photographers/videographers), promo posting windows (FanSub Creators), perplatform social metrics (IG/YT/TT/X).

Studio (Places): price/hr, min hours, capacity, creative amenities (natural light, cyc wall, blackout, ceiling height, loadin/parking, makeup/dressing room, grip/lighting, etc.), Instant Book, Verified Studio toggles.

Saved Search: clearly visible Save button with cadence control (daily batch); confirm sheet explains alerts & Safe Mode behavior.

AttachinFlow pill: when a People search includes date/time, show “Attach a Studio” pill above results; opens a prefiltered Studio drawer.

E) Context Switching & Role/Host Awareness

Profile switcher (Account menu on desktop; top segmented control on mobile Profile) lists all enabled roles and Studio host if the account has at least one studio listing.

Context link in the header (Boards | Packages | Studios) automatically reflects the most relevant workspace for the current route; quick dropdown to change it.

Create menu always matches the current persona: posting a brief (buyer), creating a package/post (seller), or adding a studio (host).

F) Where key actions live (global “where do I…?” map)

View & edit my offerings (People): Account ▸ Seller Dashboard ▸ Packages/Portfolio/Calendar.

Create a studio listing (Places): Create ▸ New Studio Listing → wizard; manage via Studio Dashboard.

Post a brief (buyers): Create ▸ New Brief (Quick/Full); invite or broadcast from the brief.

Attach a studio to a shoot: From Brief or Talent Checkout, tap Attach a Studio (drawer) → returns a Linked Booking Group summary.

Find inspiration: Browse ▸ Case Studies; deep link to People & Places.

Get help: Thread ▸ Get help (contextual flows) or Help Center.

G) Safe Mode & Gating (global)

Default ON for guests and new users.

People: FanSubscription Creator and profiles with nudity tiers beyond “Lingerie/Swim” are hidden when Safe Mode is ON.

Places (Studios): never gated by Safe Mode (studio media must remain SFW).

Emails/push: never include 18+ previews; 18+ content visible inapp only with Safe Mode OFF.

H) CrossLinks & Shortcuts (reduce path length)

Profile → Invite opens Smart Invite prefilled with role, city, date window.

Talent profile with linked studio shows “Owns/Has Studio” chip → deep link to the Studio detail.

Studio detail shows Host card → deep link to host’s People profile(s).

Boards cards expose Compare, Invite, Attach Studio, Book shortcuts.

Case Study tiles link to both the talent and any tagged studio.

I) Header Context Bar (chips below header)

Appears on Search, Saved Search, Boards, Brief, Compare.

Shows active filter chips, city/date/time chips, and Saved state; inline Edit and Clear actions.

On Linked Booking Group checkout, shows a twochip summary: Talent | Studio (tap to expand each).

J) Error States & Auth Walls (consistent pattern)

Authrequired actions (book, message, create) route through /auth with a return URL; copy explains benefits and Safe Mode.

404 gracefully links to Search by role with city preselected.

403 uses policy copy (e.g., 18+ gating, suspended features); provides Help link.

K) Accessibility, Localization & Performance (global baselines)

AA: keyboard navigable menus & drawers; ARIA on tabs/filters; obvious focus states; colorcontrast linting in CI.

Localization: strings via i18n; USEnglish at launch; localeaware currency/date.

Performance: routebased code splitting; image lazyload; deferral of OAuth SDKs until needed; search TTI < 2.5s on 3G Fast.

L) Telemetry (navigation & IA events)

nav.click (item, location), browse.open (section), search.open (tab=role|studio), filters.open/apply, saved_search.create/toggle,
context.switch (Boards|Packages|Studios), create.open (brief|package|studio), safe_mode.toggle, city.change,
attach_studio.open/select, lbg.checkout.open, header_context_chip.click.

M) Acceptance Criteria (mark 4.1 FINAL)

Desktop header implements Browse, Search, Context link (Boards/Packages/Studios), Messages, Notifications, Create, Safe Mode, City, Account with Profile switcher.

Mobile tab bar implements Home, Search, Create, Messages, Profile; overflow contains Boards, Notifications, Verification, Payments, Settings, Help.

Role/Listing selector in Search includes Model/Photographer/Videographer/Creator/FanSub Creator/Studio with People vs Places divider; filters drawers reflect rolespecific vs studiospecific fields.

Attach a Studio pill appears only when a People search has date/time; opens a prefiltered Studio drawer; selected studio persists to Linked Booking Group checkout.

Safe Mode default ON; hides FanSub Creator and nuditybeyondLingerie for People; does not hide Studios; email/push remain 18+safe.

Context switching works: Profile switcher (roles + host), header context link (Boards/Packages/Studios), Create menu adapts to persona.

Crosslinks: People↔︎Studio chips; Invite from profile; Board shortcuts; Case Study deep links.

Header context bar shows active chips and supports Save/Edit/Clear; LBG shows twochip summary.

Auth walls and error states follow the documented patterns; accessibility, i18n, and performance budgets enforced.

All telemetry events above are emitted for nav/search/safemode/create/context interactions.

N) Why this IA works

People vs Places clarity: Users always know whether they’re looking at a person or a space, yet can combine them fluidly via AttachinFlow.

Contextual creation: The Create menu and the context link reduce cognitive load for multirole/host users.

Safety & brand protection: Safe Mode is omnipresent and conservative by default; studios stay visible but SFW.

Scalable: Adds cities, roles, or more studio inventory without changing the mental model.

Fast paths: Crosslinks and sticky action bars trim steps from discovery to booking.

§4.2 — Global Components & Design System

Goal: Ship a coherent, performant, accessible component library that makes every flow in §4.0/§4.1 consistent and fast to build. Components are role/spaceaware, SafeModeaware, cityaware, and optimized for mobilefirst. Everything here is implementationagnostic (works whether you use React/Vue/etc.).

A) Design Foundations (tokens)

Color (semantic):

Primary (actions): --primary-600, hover -700, focus ring -300

Neutral (text/ui): --neutral-900/700/500/300/100

Accent (info): --info-600

Success: --success-600

Warning: --warning-600

Danger: --danger-600

Verification (badges): --verify-600

Promoted (labels): --promo-600 (used only for the “Promoted” chip)

Type ramp:

Display, H1–H6, Body L/M/S, Caption, Mono (numbers). Use rem with 1.6–1.8 lineheight for body.

Numerals: tabular for prices, ratings, reputation rings.

Spacing & radii:

Spacing scale: 4, 8, 12, 16, 20, 24, 32, 40

Radius scale: 4, 8, 12 (cards/buttons), 999 (pills/chips)

Elevation: Card (1), Popover (2), Drawer (3), Modal (4)

Breakpoints:

XS <480, SM <768, MD <1024, LG <1440, XL ≥1440

Motion (reducemotion friendly):

Duration: 120–200ms (hover), 200–300ms (modals/drawers)

Easing: standard cubicbezier; respect prefersreducedmotion.

Icons (consistent set):

Roles (Model/Photographer/Videographer/Creator/FanSub), Studio, Instant Book (⚡), Verified (✔︎), Trusted Pro (shield), Safe Mode (shield18), Social (IG/YT/TT/X), Amenities (sun, cyc, blackout, height, parking, makeup, grip, sound), Hazards (strobe, haze, flame, ladder).

B) Layout Patterns

Page shell: Sticky header; 12column grid at MD+; single column at SM. Side drawer for filters on desktop; fullscreen on mobile.

Sticky bars: Search (Filters/Save), Profile/Studio (Book/Request), Checkout (Pay & Confirm).

Cards first: All lists (search, boards, invites) render cards with consistent skeletons.

C) Global Components (catalog)

1) Cards

PersonCard(role) — for People (Model/Photographer/Videographer/Creator/FanSub)

Top: cover image/video thumbnail (3:2 crop), Role chip, Location chip

Meta row: Name, Reputation ring (0–100 with tooltip “Why this score?”), price band, distance

Chips: Verified (ID), Trusted Pro (if BG), Instant Book, Has/Owns Studio

Social chips: IG/YT/TT/X (followers; ER% if verified connection)

Actions: View, Message, Add to Board; Promoted label (when applicable)

StudioCard — for Places

Top: hero image (3:2), Neighborhood, Price/hr, Min hours

Chips: Verified Studio, Instant Book, amenity set (Natural light • Cyc wall • Blackout • 14’ ceilings • Parking)

Meta: Capacity, rating ★ count, host card hover

Actions: View, Add to Board; Promoted label (when applicable)

BoardCard

Works with mixed types (People + Studios); shows type icon, status chip (Invited/Quoted/Awarded/Booked).

CaseStudyCard

Before/after thumbnails, tags, city; links to featured People/Studios.

SkeletonCard (both types)

Media gray box + 2–3 text bars + placeholder chips; shimmer at 60fps.

2) Chips & Badges

Role chip (Model/Photographer/…) — colorcoded

Verified (ID) — checkmark chip

Trusted Pro — shield chip

Verified Studio — building/check chip

Instant Book — ⚡ chip

Safe Mode gated — subtle lock on nuditytier chip (only visible to owner)

Nudity tier — None/Lingerie/Artistic; SafeModeaware (never shown in emails)

Social metric chips — IG 182k • 2.8% ER, YT 210k • 45k avg views, TT 530k • 8.1% ER

Promotion chip — Promoted (always labeled; never used as rank override)

3) Filters & Search

SearchBar

Role/Listing selector tabs (People vs Studio divider), query field, city chip, date/time pill

FilterDrawer

Common: city/radius, availability window, price/budget, distance, min Rep, Verified/Trusted toggles

Peoplespecific:

Models/Creators: look & comfort (height, hair, measurements, Nudity tier, chaperone policy)

Photographers/Videographers: specialties, deliverables, turnaround

FanSub Creators: platform links, promo packs, posting window/minlive controls

Studiospecific: price/hr, min hours, capacity, size, amenities (chips), Instant Book, Verified Studio

Social Metrics panel: perplatform toggles; simple Engagement slider (Low→High) + Advanced (ER ≥ %, Avg views ≥ N); ANY/ALL platform logic; Verifiedonly toggle

Saved Search bar: Save (cadence dropdown: off/daily/weekly), name field

4) Buttons & CTAs

Primary (solid), Secondary (outline), Tertiary (text), Destructive (danger)

Loading spinners inline; disabled states with tooltip reason (e.g., “Enable ID verification to turn on Instant Book”)

5) Steppers & Summaries

CheckoutStepper

Steps: Talent → Attach Studio (optional) → Docs → Payment → Confirm

LBG Summary: two panels (Talent | Studio) with expand/collapse; shows policies per type

BriefStepper (Full Brief)

Basics → Scope → Deliverables → Schedule → Attach Studio → Invite/Broadcast

6) Modals/Drawers

Quick Brief (drawer)

Attach a Studio (drawer): prefiltered list, amenity chips, selection persists to LBG

Quick Quote (seller)

Change Order

PostBooking Adjustment (host)

Damage Claim (host)

Propose Reschedule (LBGaware)

Review Composer (doubleblind)

Safe Mode Toggle (age confirm)

Payment Method add/edit

OAuth Connect (IG/YT/TT/X)

All modals: close on ESC; focus trap; restore focus to trigger element.

7) Inputs & Pickers

Date & Time pickers (range + slot selector)

Availability Scheduler (blocks, IB windows, buffers)

Number steppers (hours, capacity, ceilings)

Currency inputs (price/hr, package price) with validation and formatting

Distance/radius slider (mi/km)

Tag inputs (amenities, specialties)

File inputs (portfolio, delivery proxies) with progress & virusscan statuses

Address (Studio): neighborhood text + lat/long hidden (exact address masked publicly)

8) Messaging & Threads

ThreadHeader: counterpart avatar + role/space tag, booking status chip

MessageBubble (left/right), AttachmentChip, Read receipt dots, Quoted message

Inline tools: templates, scheduling poll, quick quote (seller), get help (contextual)

Pipeline chips: New / Needs Info / Quoted / Awarded / Booked / Delivered / Completed

9) Delivery Room

ManifestList (rows: filename, type, duration/px, size, checksum, status)

FileCard with Preview (proxy) vs Original link badges

AutoCheckStatus (green/yellow/red) with tooltip (color space, resolution, audio channels)

RevisionRequest composer (peritem); Accept Delivery button with countdown

ExternalLinkBadge (Drive/Dropbox/OneDrive/S3) + captured manifest metadata

10) Smart Docs

DocPackList (SOW, License, Model Release, Property/Space Release, House Rules, Safety Addendum)

DocStatusChip: Pending / Signed / Amend

ESignButton with signing sheet; AmendIndicator when terms change

DocAuditTrail modal (timestamps, IPs)

11) Reputation & Reviews

RepScoreRing (0–100) + Why this score? breakdown (reviews/volume 40%, reliability 25%, responsiveness 10%, verifications 15%, recent 10%; penalties decay)

StarRating + count

ReviewTile: text + photos, Verified booking label, Community reference label (lower weight)

ResponseTimeChip (e.g., “Replies in ~1h”)

12) Promotions (usagebased; fairness)

Promoted chip (always labeled)

BoostControls: daily budget slider, max CPC, city/role scope, start/stop, dayparting

QSIndicator (0–1) with Improve QS checklist

FeaturedSlotCard booking (weekly flat) with impression guarantees

Density caps visually enforced in lists (≤2 in top 20; ≤1 above the fold)

13) Verification Center

StepCard (ID, Background, Social, Studio Lite)

ProgressBar (per step)

UploadInput with OCR status for Studio Lite; GeocodeMatch chip

SocialConnectRow (IG/YT/TT/X) with verified badges

EligibilityBlurb (what unlocks: IB, badges, DM credits)

14) Calendar & Availability

StudioCalendar (hourly grid; min hours & buffers)

SellerCalendar (day blocks, IB windows, touring dates)

RescheduleSheet (propose to all in LBG; conflict indicators)

ICSConnect (import/export)

15) Checkout & Payments

PriceBreakdown (subtotal, addons, cleaning fee, buyer fee, taxes, deposit hold)

PolicySnippet per type (talent vs studio) with “Learn more” to KB

PaymentMethodSelector (Card, ACH)

FeeTooltip (what platform fees cover)

ConfirmButton with spinner & 3DS states

16) Notifications, Toasts & Banners

Toast: success/info/warn/error; 4s default; focused on state change

Banner: city promos, safety alerts; dismissible; not stackable

Inbox Badges: counts limited; batched digests configurable

17) Tables, Lists & Admin UI

DataTable (support console): sortable columns, inline actions, filter chips

OutcomeSplitView (LBG): Talent | Studio outcomes sidebyside

DepositActions: authorize/void/capture with evidence viewer

D) Content & Microcopy Guidelines

People vs Places: always say “Studio” for spaces; never “venue” at launch.

Badges: keep labels short: “Verified”, “Trusted Pro”, “Verified Studio”, “Instant Book”, “Promoted”.

Policies: use plain language (“Cancel by 7 days for full refund”).

Safety: avoid alarmist tones; be clear (“House rules apply; cameras must be disclosed”).

Email/push: never show 18+ previews; SFW copy only.

E) Accessibility & Error Patterns

AA Contrast for all text & icons; verify with tooling in CI.

Keyboard & Screen Readers: focus trap in modals, labeled inputs, ARIA on tabs/drawers, logical heading order.

Hit targets: 44×44 px minimum.

Errors: inline + summary; link to KB where relevant; keep technical jargon out of user copy.

F) Performance & Media Guidelines

Images: lazyload, responsive srcset, WebP/AVIF where supported; max card image ~120–200KB.

Video: autogenerate lightweight proxies (muted, no autoplay on mobile); never embed heavy originals.

Icons: sprite or treeshaken; defer OAuth SDKs until user opens Social Connect.

Skeletons: render within 100ms to reduce perceived latency.

G) Telemetry (componentlevel events)

card.click (type=person|studio, promoted=true|false)

chip.click (type=verified|trusted|studio|instantbook|social)

filters.open/apply/reset, saved_search.create/toggle

attach_studio.open/select, lbg.summary.expand

doc.sign/open, delivery.accept/request_revision

boost.create/pause, featured.purchase

verification.start/complete (step), social.connect

calendar.block/ib_window, reschedule.propose/accept

checkout.pay.success/fail

H) Acceptance Criteria (mark 4.2 FINAL)

Foundations (tokens, type, spacing, breakpoints, motion) defined and consumable.

Core components delivered: PersonCard, StudioCard, BoardCard, CaseStudyCard, SkeletonCard.

Chips & badges for Verified, Trusted Pro, Verified Studio, Instant Book, Social metrics, Promoted.

Search patterns: SearchBar, FilterDrawer (people + studio), Saved Search, ANY/ALL social logic, Verifiedonly toggle.

Modals/Drawers implemented: Quick Brief, Attach a Studio, Quick Quote, Change Order, PostBooking Adjustment, Damage Claim, Reschedule, Review Composer, Safe Mode Toggle, Payment Method, OAuth Connect.

Delivery Room & Smart Docs components complete and reused in all flows.

Reputation & Reviews components wired to ranking tiebreaks and profile displays.

Verification Center components (ID, BG, Social, Studio Lite) with unlock blurbs.

Calendars, Checkout, Notifications/Toasts, Admin split views ready; deposit actions supported.

Accessibility (AA) & performance budgets enforced; telemetry events instrumented.

I) Why this works

Consistency → speed: One library powers all surfaces—less time prototyping, more time validating.

Clarity of types: People vs Places appear distinct (but complementary) across cards, filters, and checkout.

Safety & fairness are visible: Badges, verified chips, Promoted labels, and policy snippets make trust legible and ads honest.

Mobilefirst: Drawers, sticky bars, and concise cards keep flows fast on phones.

§4.3 — Auth & Onboarding Flows

Goal: Move new users from “curious” → first meaningful action fast, with minimal friction and role/space awareness. Keep Safe Mode ON by default, defer heavier checks (ID, Background, Studio Lite) until they unlock value (Instant Book, badges, DM credits), and support multirole + studio under one account.

A) Principles

Fast path first: Light signin, ask current city, and immediately route to a next action (Search, Quick Brief, Quick Package, or New Studio).

One account → many offerings: Users can create Service Profiles (roles) and Studio Listings (spaces) under a single login.

Progressive verification: Verification is optional at first, but clearly rewards users (Instant Book, DM credit boosts, badges, Early Payout eligibility).

Safe by default: Safe Mode ON; FanSubscription Creator is agegated; minors operate via guardian/agency (Phase 2).

Save & resume: All wizards autosave; deep links return to the exact step.

Measure activation: Instrument “timetofirst”: Saved Search / Quick Brief / Package publish / Studio publish.

B) Auth (signup / signin)

Entry points

Header Sign in / Create account, plus intercepts on Book, Message, Create actions.

Deep links preserve return URL.

Methods

Email passcode / magic link

Apple (native/app + web)

Google (web)

Phone SMS (optional; recommended for providers/hosts to unlock extra DM credits)

First capture (all users)

Display name (public alias allowed; legal name later for payouts)

City (typeahead; defaults from IP) & Timezone

Safe Mode = ON (explain; can toggle later)

Intent chips (choose any; sets next route):

Book talent / studios (buyer path)

List my services (seller path)

List my studio (host path)

Age & policy gates

To create a FanSubscription Creator profile or toggle Safe Mode OFF, user confirms 18+ (timestamped).

Launch policy: Accounts are 18+; minors only via guardian/agencymanaged accounts (Phase 2). Studio media must be SFW.

C) Buyer Onboarding (Bookers/Brands)

1) Welcome choices (one tap):

Start a Quick Brief (30–60s)

Search now (roleselector preset to current city)

Save a Search template (e.g., “Models in Houston this weekend”)

2) Quick Brief (drawer):

Role, city, date/time, budget, deliverables, Attach Studio toggle

Send Smart Invites (top matches) or Broadcast RFP (credits)

Creates a Buyer Dashboard tile for the brief

3) Saved Search helper:

Offer 2–3 presets by role; daily alerts ON by default (user can adjust cadence)

Buyer activation (success state):

Completed Quick Brief or saved first search or sent ≥1 Smart Invite.

D) Seller Onboarding (Service Profiles: Model / Photographer / Videographer / Creator / FanSub Creator)

Entry: “List my services” → Role picker (multiselect allowed; wizard runs per role)

Wizard (per role)

Essentials

Display name (public), city, travel radius; portfolio starter (3–6 images; +1 video for video roles)

Models/Creators: look & comfort fields (height, hair, measurements, Nudity tier), chaperone policy

Photographers/Videographers: specialties, deliverables, turnaround

FanSub Creators: platform links, promo offerings, posting windows/minlive acknowledgement

Packages & Pricing

Choose a template (e.g., “2hr portrait”, “Halfday shoot”, “UGC promo”)

Set price, addons, licensing tiers, travel fee logic (radius + permile or zone)

Instant Book toggle (locked until ID verified; show what it unlocks)

Availability

Calendar connect (ICS), IB windows & buffers; touring dates

Verification (optional now, highvalue)

ID Verify → Instant Book + +20 DM credits

Background Check → Trusted Pro badge + reliability nudge + +20 DM credits

Connect Social (IG/YT/TT/X) → verified chips & engagement metrics in search

Review & Publish

Preview → Publish (searchable) → persistent checklist

Postpublish checklist (owner ribbon)

✅ Publish first package

✅ Add 6+ portfolio items

🔓 Verify ID (unlock IB + DM credits)

🔓 Connect socials (show verified metrics)

➕ Create a case study

Seller activation:

Published ≥1 package or sent first Quick Quote.

E) Host Onboarding (Studio Listings)

Entry: “List my studio” → Create Studio Listing (wizard)

Wizard (studio)

Basics: title, neighborhood (exact address hidden), capacity, size, ceiling height

Photos: gallery (min 6), suggested shot list (front, cyc, makeup, loadin, bathrooms)

Amenities: natural light, cyc (size), blackout, makeup/dressing, grip/lighting, soundtreated, parking/loadin, A/C

Rules: noise, shoes, pets, food, surveillance disclosure, crew limits, hazards (strobe/haze/open flame/ladder)

Pricing & Schedule: $/hr, min hours, cleaning fee, Instant Book on/off, hourly slots, buffers

Deposits & Docs: optional damage deposit hold, House Rules, Property/Space Release (Smart Docs)

Verification Lite: upload lease/utility/business doc → OCR + geocode match

Review & Publish

Postpublish checklist (host)

✅ Add availability slots

🔓 Pass Studio Lite (shows Verified Studio badge; IB guardrail if required)

➕ Link to your People profile (if applicable)

➕ Create a case study featuring the space

Host activation:

Published studio or accepted first booking.

F) MultiRole & Linking Flows

Add another role: After finishing one, prompt to add others (e.g., model who also shoots).

Link a studio: From a People profile, Link Studio → select owned Studio → profile shows “Has Studio” chip; Studio detail shows Host card linking back.

Context switch: Profile switcher in Account menu (desktop) / segmented control on Profile (mobile).

G) Verification Center (progressive, valuetied)

ID Verification → unlock Instant Book (people) + +20 DM credits

Background Check (Trusted Pro) → badge + +20 DM credits (people)

Social Connect → verified metrics chips & social engagement filters

Studio Lite → Verified Studio badge; enables IB guardrail if policy requires

Early Payout eligibility (peruse fee) → for highrep accounts (Rep ≥ 85)

UX: Each step shows “What you unlock”, typical duration, and success rates.

H) Safe Mode & FanSubscription Creator Gating

Safe Mode toggle in header during onboarding (explain what’s hidden); default ON.

To create FanSubscription Creator: confirm 18+ and accept policy; public media SFW; promo deliverables respect minlive rules (see §3.5).

I) FirstRun Experiences (nudges)

Seller

“Get your first 5 leads”: Save a search for buyers, post a case study, enable IB, connect social, set touring dates.

Pricefit hints vs city median; responsetime hint.

Host

“Improve discoverability”: add amenity tags, clarify rules, pass Studio Lite, upload day/night light examples.

Buyer

“Speed up booking”: save searches, reuse briefs, attach a studio in checkout, invite shortlisted talent.

J) Edge Cases & Safeguards

Abandoned wizards autosave and email/push resume links.

Duplicate detection (People/Studios): softmatch (name/phone/city); claim/merge flow.

Name privacy: public alias allowed; legal name used only for payouts/verification.

Content policy: portfolio uploader enforces artisticonly; SafeModeaware previews.

Accessibility: wizards are keyboardable, show step counts, and preserve focus on validation errors.

Fraud gates: new accounts may have payout reserves (per §3.1).

K) Metrics (per city, first 90 days)

Auth → first action conversion ≥ 65%

Buyer activation (Quick Brief or Saved Search) ≥ 60%

Seller activation (Package publish or Quick Quote) ≥ 55%

Host activation (Studio publish) ≥ 35%

Timetofirst inquiry median: ≤ 3 days (seller), ≤ 7 days (host)

Verification adoption by day 30: ID ≥ 60% (active sellers), Studio Lite ≥ 50% (active hosts)

Step dropoff < 20% at any wizard step

L) Acceptance Criteria (mark 4.3 FINAL)

Auth supports Email/Apple/Google (+ optional SMS), return URLs, city capture, Safe Mode default ON, and intent routing (buyer/seller/host).

Buyer onboarding provides Quick Brief, Search, and Saved Search; Smart Invites/Broadcast RFP work from Quick Brief.

Seller wizard (per role) collects essentials, packages, availability; exposes IB/verification unlocks; publishes searchable profiles.

Host wizard collects amenities, rules, pricing, schedule; supports deposit holds; Studio Lite step; publishes studios.

Linking: People ↔︎ owned Studio chip; host card on studio detail.

Verification Center: ID, Background, Social, Studio Lite with explicit unlocks and progress.

Safe Mode & FanSub gating enforced during onboarding; SFW previews on public surfaces.

Save & resume and duplicate detection implemented; alias vs legal name handled.

Activation metrics instrumented and visible in city rollout dashboards.

M) Why this works

Fast to value: Buyers can send invites within a minute; sellers can publish a bookable package in one sitting; hosts can list a studio with clear expectations.

Low friction, high trust: Heavy checks are optional but clearly rewarding (IB, DM credits, badges, Early Payout).

One account, many hats: Multirole + studio is natural, with simple linking and context switching.

Measurable & tunable: Activation KPIs let us iterate quickly citybycity.

§4.4 — Role Profiles (Public & Owner Views)

Goal: Make every role profile a hightrust, bookable storefront that’s easy to scan, easy to compare, and easy to manage—while keeping People vs Places distinct, Safe Mode ON by default, and rolescoped reviews & reputation. Support multirole accounts and optional studio linking cleanly.

A) Routes & Ownership

Public view (role): /{role}/{slug}
Roles: model, photographer, videographer, creator, fan-creator (18+ gated)

Owner edit: /seller/profile/{role} (single editor per role; no public /edit route)

Linked studio: public studio detail lives at /studio/{slug}; crosslinked chips (see §4.1).

B) Profile Layout (public)

1) Header

Avatar • Display name (alias allowed) • Role badge • City/Radius • Reputation ring (0–100) with “Why this score?”

Chips: Verified (ID), Trusted Pro (BG), Instant Book (if enabled), Has/Owns Studio (links to studio), Social metric chips (IG/YT/TT/X with verified badge & ER/avg views), Responsetime chip (“Replies in ~1h”)

Primary CTAs: Message, Instant Book / Request to Book, Add to Board, Share

Sticky action bar on mobile: Book/Request

2) Tabs

Portfolio (default) • Packages • About • Reviews • Updates (feed) • Policies & FAQs

FanSubscription Creator appears only when Safe Mode OFF (tab hidden otherwise)

3) Right rail (desktop) / Inline blocks (mobile)

Availability calendar (IB windows & touring)

Quick facts (rolespecific fields)

Linked Studio module (if any)

Case Studies featuring this profile

C) RoleSpecific Content (what each tab shows)

1) Portfolio (all roles)

Curated galleries: images (grid, 3:2 default) + video tiles; SFW previews only (artisticonly policy).

Sets (optional): group by theme (e.g., Beauty, Editorial, Fitness), each with cover image.

Tagging: collaborators can tag this user; owner must approve before it appears. Owner can untag or hide tagged content.

Credits: autopull tagged collaborators; tap to open their profiles; helps network effects.

Safe Mode behavior: if any set contains imagery beyond “Lingerie/Swim” aesthetic, set is hidden unless Safe Mode OFF (but previews remain SFW).

2) Packages (bookable offerings)

Card list of packages & addons with inclusions, price, duration, location policy, licensing presets.

Studio AddOn row appears for photographers who linked a studio (hourly + min hours; adds in checkout as separate Studio booking inside LBG).

Instant Book badge per package if enabled.

Availability selector → Book/Request flows (per §1.3).

3) About (rolespecific fields)

Model / Creator quick facts: height, measurements, hair, eyes, skin tone, tattoos/piercings (Y/N), shoe/dress sizes; Comfort levels: genres (fashion, fitness, lingerie/swim, artistic nude yes/no), chaperone policy, travel radius; languages.

Photographer: specialties (portrait, editorial, product, beauty, events), deliverables (edits count), turnaround SLA, licensing tiers, team size (if any), travel policy. (Gear is optional, deprioritized.)

Videographer: specialties (talkinghead, shortform, product), deliverables (length/resolution), color/sound/post options, drone license (Y/N), music licensing policy.

FanSubscription Creator (18+ gated): supported platforms (OnlyFans, Fansly, Patreon), promo deliverables (e.g., story frames, feed posts, duet/stitch), posting windows & minlive (from §3.5), whitelisting/usage rules (brand usage, duration).

Socials: verified connections (IG/YT/TT/X) + icons; follower and ER/avg views chips; linkonly platforms marked Unverified.

Languages, travel & touring cities upcoming (optional calendar).

4) Reviews

Verified booking reviews (rolescoped) at top; Community references below (lower weight).

Sort: Most recent • Highest • Lowest.

Review breakdown with charts (quality, professionalism, reliability).

Owner responses allowed (single reply per review).

Reputation “Why” panel: contribution bars (reviews/volume 40%, reliability 25%, responsiveness 10%, verifications 15%, recent 10%; penalties decay).

5) Updates (profile posts/feed)

Short posts, WIP photos, behindthescenes (SFW).

Followers see these posts in their Home feed; Follow count visible on profile.

Pinned update supported (one per role).

Tag collaborators; approvals required as with Portfolio.

6) Policies & FAQs

Cancellation (role’s matrix summary), Reschedule, Deliverables & revisions, Travel fees, Chaperone, Boundaries & comfort, Safety tips.

Links to KB for deeper policy detail.

D) Booking & Messaging Entry Points (from profile)

Primary CTA: Instant Book (if IDverified & enabled) or Request to Book (approval flow).

Secondary CTA: Message (thread; prefilled context from the package or profile).

Add to Board: saves card to a shortlist board.

Attach a Studio: appears in checkout, not on profile; profiles with a linked studio show Has Studio chip linking to the studio page.

E) Owner View (editor) per Role

Editor shell: /seller/profile/{role} with tabs matching public: Portfolio, Packages, About, Reviews, Updates, Policies, Analytics

Portfolio (owner)

Dragreorder; set covers; set privacy; approve/decline tags; watermark toggle; alttext fields; SafeMode warnings for borderline content.

Packages & Addons

Create/edit packages (templates), addons, license presets; Instant Book toggle (gated by ID), Travel fee config (zone/mi).

About

Role fields editor; nudity tier toggle (artistic nude Y/N for models/creators); chaperone policy; languages; touring schedule.

Availability

Calendar (IB windows/buffers), ICS sync, touring cities; block dates.

Policies

Perrole micropolicies (cancellation windows, reschedule rules within platform bands), deliverables SLA, revision rounds.

Updates

Compose posts (text + image/video), tag collaborators, pin/unpin; post scheduler (optional).

Reviews

Readonly list + reply; request a Community reference link (offplatform collaborator may submit; owner approves).

Analytics (per role)

Profile views, search appearances, top queries that matched you, conversion funnel (view → message → booking), pricefit vs city median, responsetime impact, social growth (if connected), Rep score breakdown.

Verification nudges

Inline cards: “Verify ID to unlock Instant Book”, “Pass Background to earn Trusted Pro”, “Connect socials to show metrics”.

Link a Studio

If account owns a studio listing: link/unlink; Studio AddOn toggle for packages (hourly + min hours).

F) Data, Reviews & Reputation (rolescoped)

Reviews & Rep are scoped to the role being viewed; profiles show that role’s score; a mini “Also operates as …” band links to other roles with their score badges.

Community references labeled and weighted lower than Verified booking reviews.

Fraud guards: multiple reviews from same buyer throttle; unusual review bursts flagged.

G) Safety, Privacy & Compliance (profile level)

Artisticonly media enforced in uploader; SafeMode previews only in public/feeds.
