No external contact leaks: public profile hides emails/phones; outbound links limited to verified social icons and case studies.

Chaperone policy visible on Model/Creator profiles; harassment reporting from the profile.

Minor participation: Phase2 via guardian/agency only; profiles must be 18+ at launch.

Report profile modal covers misrepresentation, unsafe behavior, policy violations.

H) MultiRole UX

Public profile shows role tabs (if user operates multiple).

Start on the role that matched the entry (from search).

Tab switch shows rolespecific packages, reviews, rep, and fields; keeps Message / Book CTAs contextual to the active role.

Header chips persist (Verified, Trusted Pro) per role; socials are shared.

I) Performance & Accessibility

Lazyload media; responsive srcset; AVIF/WebP where available; alttext required.

Tab ARIA roles; keyboardable galleries; captions for videos; highcontrast compliance.

Skeletons for header & package list; TTI target <2.5s on 3G Fast.

J) Telemetry (events)

profile.view (role) • cta.click.book | cta.click.message • board.add

portfolio.tag.approve/decline • package.book.start/complete • instant_book.toggle

social.verified_chip.view • rep.why.open • studio.link.click

update.post • follow.click • review.submit/respond

analytics.view (owner) • price_fit.hint.view/action

K) Acceptance Criteria (mark 4.4 FINAL)

Public role profiles render with Header, Tabs (Portfolio, Packages, About, Reviews, Updates, Policies), rightrail modules, and sticky Book/Request on mobile.

Rolespecific fields display correctly and are editable in the owner editor; nudity tier/chaperone policies for Models/Creators present.

Packages are bookable; Instant Book shows when enabled; Studio AddOn appears for linked studios and adds to checkout as LBG.

Social metric chips render only when verified connections exist; unverified links labeled clearly.

Reviews show verifiedbooking first; community references labeled; owner can reply once; Rep “Why” panel works.

Updates feed posts publish to profile and follower feeds; Follow count displays.

Tagging & approvals for portfolio items work; collaborator links open profiles.

Safe Mode hides FanSubscription Creator role & any beyondLingerie sets unless OFF; all media remains SFW on public surfaces.

Owner editor provides Portfolio, Packages, About, Availability, Policies, Updates, Reviews, Analytics, Link a Studio, and Verification nudges.

Telemetry events fire as listed; performance & accessibility targets met.

L) Why this works

Bookable storefronts: Every role’s page converts (clear packages, availability, and CTAs).

Signalrich but simple: Badges, social chips, and a transparent Rep score reduce risk without clutter.

Multirole clarity: Each role stands on its own merit; switching is explicit; reviews/reputation never mix.

Network effects: Tagging, case studies, and follows tie profiles together, lifting discovery and retention.

§4.5 — Studio Listing (Public & Host Views)

Goal: Make studios a clean, trustworthy, creativeready space type that buyers can book in minutes or attach to a talent checkout—without turning the product into a venue marketplace. Keep policies, payouts, reviews, and reputation spacescoped and separate from people roles.

A) Routes & Ownership

Public Hub: /studios?city={city} (grid + optional map; amenity filters).

Public Detail: /studio/{slug} (space page).

Host Create/Edit: /studio/new, /studio/{slug}/edit.

Host Dashboard: /studio/{slug}/dashboard (calendar, bookings, rules, deposits/claims).

Host Bookings: /studio/{slug}/bookings (list + detail).

Linking: Accounts can link their own Studio to their People profiles (shows Has/Owns Studio chip on role profile; Host card on studio page).

B) Public Studio Detail — Layout & Content

Header (above the fold)

Title (descriptive; e.g., “Downtown Loft w/ Natural Light & White Cyc”)

Neighborhood (exact address hidden until booking) • Price/hr • Min hours • Capacity

Badges: Verified Studio (if passed Studio Lite), Instant Book (if enabled)

Rating ★ + count

Primary CTA: Instant Book / Request to Book (sticky on mobile)

Secondary: Add to Board, Share, Report

Sections (scroll)

Gallery — 10–20 images (hero + grid), optional short clips; SFW only.

Quick Facts — size (sq ft/m²), ceiling height, daylight orientation, power notes.

Amenities (chips) — Natural light • Cyc wall (size) • Blackout • Makeup/dressing • Soundtreated • Grip/lighting available • Parking / Loadin • A/C • Kitchenette • Shower.

Rules & Policies — noise, shoes, pets, food, smoking, crew size tiers, surveillance disclosure, hazard toggles (strobe/haze/open flame/ladder), overtime billing, deposit hold amount.

Availability — calendar slots (hourly; min hours; buffers).

Pricing — price/hr, min hours, cleaning fee; example totals by duration.

Host — avatar, response stats, other listings; link to People profile(s) if any.

Location — approximate map only; exact address released postbooking.

Reviews — Verified booking reviews first; filter/sort; “Why this rep?” panel.

Pair with Talent — chips to open a prefiltered People search for the same date/city.

C) Booking Widget (public page)

Select date/time & duration (min hours enforced; buffer hints).

Crew size (for overage tiers) & “Add cleaning fee” (autoapplied if host requires).

Docs preview: Property/Space Release + House Rules (Smart Docs) badges; “signed at checkout.”

Deposit hold (if configured) clearly labeled as authorization only.

Price breakdown (studio subtotal, buyer fee, taxes if applicable).

IB vs Request: If Instant Book → book now; else send request (host must accept within X hours, configurable SLA in §3.9).

If user arrived from a talent checkout: show a subtle Linked Booking Group notice (“This studio will be added to your shoot checkout”).

D) Reviews & Reputation (spacescoped)

Verified booking reviews labeled; Community references allowed with lower weight and owner approval.

Reputation score (space) shown with breakdown (volume/reviews, reliability, responsiveness, verification, recency).

Owner may reply once per review.

Filters: Most recent • Highest • Lowest; “With photos”.

E) Host Views — Create/Edit Wizard

Basics — title, neighborhood (exact address masked), capacity, size, ceiling height.

Media — gallery upload (min 6), recommended shot list (exterior, cyc, makeup/dressing, loadin path, restrooms).

Amenities — chips + detail fields (e.g., cyc dimensions).

Rules — noise, shoes, pets, food, surveillance disclosure (required), crew limits, hazard toggles (strobe/haze/open flame/ladder).

Pricing & Schedule — price/hr, min hours, cleaning fee, buffers, availability slots, Instant Book toggle.

Deposits & Docs — optional damage deposit hold (e.g., $200–$1,000), House Rules, Property/Space Release (Smart Docs autoattach).

Verification Lite — upload lease/utility/biz doc; OCR + geocode/Place match; Verified Studio badge on pass.

Review & Publish — preview, publish, checklist persists.

Postpublish checklist

✅ Add slots • 🔓 Pass Studio Lite (shows badge; IB guardrail if policy requires) • ➕ Link to People profile(s) • ➕ Add Case Study.

F) Host Dashboard & Operations

Calendar — hourly grid; block/unblock; see IB windows; ICS export (import optional later).

Bookings list — upcoming/past; status; checkin/out; overtime flags.

Booking detail — timeline, messages, docs, share access (door code), PostBooking Adjustment (overtime/crew overage/violation).

Deposits & Claims — authorize timing (checkout or 24h prior), open claim (≤24h), attach photos; track capture/void status.

Rules editor — inline edits with version history; updates require buyer reack on future bookings.

Verification status — progress, recheck, appeals.

Promotions — purchase Featured (weekly) / Boost (CPC) if eligible (usagebased, see §3.3).

Analytics — views, saves, attachinflow selections, IB conversion, cancellations, adjustment winrate, damage claim rate, revenue.

G) Scheduling & Availability Model

Slots: hourly granularity; min hours and buffers between bookings (e.g., 30–60 min).

Instant Book windows can be set (e.g., weekdays 9–5); approval required outside windows.

Blackout dates for maintenance.

Doublebooking protection at payment (live revalidation); collision → present alternatives.

H) Pricing Model & Fees (studio specifics v1)

Base: $ / hr × hours + min hours; cleaning fee (optional/required); taxes if applicable.

Deposit hold (authorization) separate from subtotal (not GMV).

Overtime: billed per listing rule (e.g., per 30 minutes at 1.5×) via PostBooking Adjustment with evidence.

Crew overage / rule violations: adjustment with evidence (photos/logs).

Platform fees: 12% host, 5% buyer (min $3; 3% ACH if enabled)—see §3.1 addendum.

Promos: cityspecific (e.g., 0% buyer fee on first studio booking in founding city).

I) Policies, Safety & Privacy

Refund matrix (studio): defaults ( >7d=100%, 7–48h=50%, <48h/noshow=0% ); host cancel = full refund + credit; see §3.9 addendum.

Smart Docs mandatory: Property/Space Release, House Rules; Safety Addendum autoinjects if hazards toggled.

Checkin/out: geofenced timestamps; governs overtime and presence evidence.

Surveillance: all cameras must be disclosed; none allowed in private areas (bathrooms, dressing/makeup); signage required; audio disclosure where required.

Address privacy: exact address visible only postbooking.

Safe Mode: does not gate Studios; studio media must be SFW (it’s fine to state “suitable for fineart nude photography”).

Minors: host can disallow; otherwise guardian docs required (Phase 2).

J) CrossSell & AttachinFlow

On studio page: “Pair with Talent” opens People search prefiltered to the studio’s city & chosen date/time.

From talent flows: Attach a Studio drawer presents top studio matches; selected studio is added to checkout as a Linked Booking Group (separate policies & payouts).

K) Performance & Accessibility

Media: responsive images (WebP/AVIF), lazyload, no autoplay video on mobile; alttext required.

Keyboardable filters & calendar; ARIA on tabs; clear focus rings; large hit areas (44×44).

TTI target: <2.5s (3G Fast) for detail page with skeletons.

L) Telemetry (events)

studio.view • studio.book.start/complete • studio.request.start/complete

calendar.slot.view • calendar.slot.select • instant_book.toggle

attach_studio.from_profile.open/select

deposit.authorize/capture/void/release • adjustment.open/resolve • claim.open/resolve

rules.view • docs.sign • checkin.start/end

promotions.boost.create • promotions.featured.purchase

analytics.view (host) • verification_lite.start/pass/fail

M) Acceptance Criteria (mark 4.5 FINAL)

Public studio detail page includes Header (price/hr, min hours, capacity, Verified Studio, Instant Book), Gallery, Quick Facts, Amenities, Rules, Availability, Pricing, Host, Location (approx), Reviews, Pair with Talent module.

Booking widget: date/time & duration, crew size, cleaning fee, deposit info, Smart Docs preview, IB/Request logic, clear price breakdown.

Create/Edit wizard implements Basics, Media, Amenities, Rules (surveillance/hazards), Pricing & Schedule, Deposits & Docs, Verification Lite, Review & Publish.

Host dashboard provides Calendar, Bookings, Messages, PostBooking Adjustments, Damage Claims, Rules editor, Verification status, Promotions, Analytics.

Scheduling supports min hours, buffers, IB windows, blackout dates; doublebooking protection at payment.

Pricing & fees follow §3.1; deposit holds are authorizations (not GMV); overtime/overage adjustments implemented with evidence windows.

Policies & safety enforced: studio refund matrix, Smart Docs esign before access, geofenced checkin/out, surveillance rules, address privacy.

AttachinFlow works both directions (from talent checkout drawer and from studio page to People search) creating a Linked Booking Group at checkout.

Accessibility/Performance budgets met; Telemetry events fire.

N) Why this works

Clear separation: Studios behave like spaces with their own rules, deposits, and reviews—no confusion with people roles.

Frictionless planning: Buyers can attach a studio during talent checkout or start from a studio and find matching talent.

Trust builtin: Verification Lite, Smart Docs, deposits, and checkin/out create predictable, evidencefirst resolution paths.

Launchready: Tight scope avoids venuemarketplace bloat while delivering the features creators actually need to shoot.

§4.6 — Search & Results (Roleaware + Studios)

Goal: Make search fast, fair, and creatorspecific. Keep People (roles) and Places (Studios) distinct but easy to combine. Surface the right filters for each role, enable perplatform social targeting, and support AttachinFlow so buyers can add a Studio to a talent checkout in one pass.

A) Entry Points & Routes

Global Search header button → /search?role={role}&city={city}

Category hubs (e.g., /photographers) deeplink to search prefiltered by role & city.

Studio hub /studios?city={city} is a specialized search for Studios (grid + optional map).

AttachinFlow (from Brief/Checkout): opens a Studio drawer preseeded with city/date/time.

Saved Search links open the same route with filters applied.

Safe Mode is ON by default and gates People results that exceed “Lingerie/Swim”; Studios are not gated (SFW media only).

B) Layout (Desktop & Mobile)

Desktop

Left: Filter drawer (collapsible).

Center: Results list (cards) with infinite scroll.

Right: Optional map toggle (pins show price or a role icon).

Top: Role/Listing selector tabs (Model • Photographer • Videographer • Creator • FanSub Creator • Studio), City chip, Date/Time pill, Save Search.

Mobile

Role tabs at top; Filters opens fullscreen; map toggles within results.

Sticky bar presents Filters, Save, and (for talent with date/time) Attach a Studio pill.

Skeletons render immediately; results stream in batches.

C) Role/Listing Selector & Gating

Tabs: People (Model • Photographer • Videographer • Creator • FanSub Creator) and Places (Studio) separated by a small label.

Safe Mode ON hides FanSubscription Creator and People results with nudity tiers beyond “Lingerie/Swim.”

Switching to Studio shows Studiospecific filters and never reveals explicit content.

D) Filters

D1) Common (People & Studios)

City & radius (mi/km)

Date/time window (+ duration for talent packages that require it)

Budget / Price (People: package price; Studio: price/hr)

Distance from city center or buyer’s set location

Availability first (toggle)

Minimum Reputation Score slider

Verification toggles: ID Verified only, Trusted Pro only (People), Verified Studio only (Studios)

D2) People — Model / Creator (nonFanSub)

Look: height, hair color, eye color, skin tone, tattoos/piercings (Y/N)

Measurements (bust/waist/hips or chest/waist/hips; numeric ranges)

Genres/Comfort: fashion, beauty, fitness, lingerie/swim, artistic nude (Y/N), chaperone friendly (Y/N)

Deliverables (for UGC creators): shortform video, stills, usage window, turnaround

Travel: willing to travel (Y/N), touring dates (city list)

D3) People — Photographer

Specialties: portrait, editorial, product, beauty, lifestyle

Deliverables: number of edited images, RAW delivery (Y/N), turnaround SLA

Licensing tiers: personal, brand organic, paid ads (checkboxes)

Instant Book (toggle)

(Intentionally exclude gear/software; users don’t care at selection time.)

D4) People — Videographer

Formats: talkinghead, product broll, event, music video, shortform

Deliverables: length/resolution, color grade, sound mix, captions

Drone license (Y/N), Instant Book toggle

D5) People — FanSubscription Creator (visible only when Safe Mode OFF)

Platforms offered (OnlyFans, Fansly, Patreon)

Promo types: feed post, story, duet/stitch, link in bio (duration), collab shoot

Posting window & minlive

Audience geography (top countries) (optional Phase2)

D6) Studio (Places)

Price/hr (min–max), Min hours, Capacity, Size

Creative amenities: Natural light (orientation), Cyc wall (+ dimensions), Blackout, ceiling height ≥ N, soundtreated, makeup/dressing, grip/lighting available, parking/loadin, A/C, kitchenette, shower

Rules: Instant Book only; Verified Studio only

Schedule: date/time slot selector; bufferfriendly windows

E) Social Metrics Panel (People roles; perplatform targeting)

Platforms: IG • YT • TT • X (launch).

Filters per platform: Followers (min–max), Engagement Rate (min %), Avg views (YT/TT), 30/90day growth (min %).

Logic: Match ANY (default) or Match ALL selected platforms.

Verification: Verifiedonly (default) uses connectedaccount metrics; toggle Include selfreported to expand results (unverified numbers are labeled).

Freshness: nightly sync; user can Refresh metrics up to 3×/day platformwide (ratelimited).

Explainers: tooltip “Followers ≠ engagement” + definitions of ER per platform.

Cards show compact chips like IG 182k • 2.8% ER / TT 520k • 110k avg views with a tiny verified tick when sourced via API.

F) Results List, Map & Cards

Cards: PersonCard(role) or StudioCard (from §4.2).

Promotions: clearlylabeled Promoted units appear within capped slots (≤ 2 in top 20, ≤ 1 above the fold); they must match filters.

Map pins: price or role icon; hover/press syncs with the card; keyboard accessible.

Inline actions: Message, Add to Board, View, Invite (from buyer brief context).

AttachinFlow (talent searches with date/time): a blue pill “Attach a Studio” appears above the list; opens the prefiltered Studio drawer (top 3 suggestions inline).

Empty states:

Show nearby neighborhoods, “widen radius,” “adjust budget,” “broaden date window,” or switch role.

Offer a Save Search with current filters.

G) Sorting & Ranking

Sort options: Best match (default) • Price • Distance • Availability first • Rating • Reputation.

Ranking (default Best match):

Exact filter fit (role/amenities/social thresholds)

Availability match (date/time fit; for studios, slot + min hours; for people, IB window or calendar)

Distance (within radius)

Price fit (within selected or inferred range)

Reputation Score (rolespecific; studiospecific for spaces)

Tiebreak nudges: Verified/Trusted/Verified Studio • Instant Book • Freshness (recent calendar update)

Fairness: Paid units never bypass filter or ranking contract; they occupy their own labeled, capped slots.

H) Saved Searches & Alerts

Save Search captures all filters (including social panel logic); users name it and pick alert cadence (daily batch by default).

Email/push previews respect Safe Mode (no 18+ imagery).

Management: /saved-searches lets users rename, change cadence, or delete.

I) Boards, Compare & Brief Integration

Add to Board from any card; boards can mix People & Studios (type badges visible).

Compare (from a board or brief): sidebyside with key fields and rep.

Invite (buyer context): from search cards directly send Smart Invites; prefills brief context.

Attach a Studio: from talent search with date/time or from brief review step.

J) Performance, Accessibility & Quality

Performance: route codesplit; image srcset + lazyload; skeletons render within 100ms; target TTI < 2.5s on 3G Fast.

Accessibility: keyboardable filters & map; ARIA tabs; clear focus states; card actions readable by screen readers.

Quality: show “metrics stale” badge if social metrics > 72h old; “calendar stale” badge if not updated for 30 days (optional nudge).

K) Telemetry

search.open (role|studio) • filters.open/apply/reset • sort.change • map.toggle

social_panel.apply (platforms, any|all, verified_only=true|false) • metrics.refresh

card.view (type=person|studio, promoted=true|false) • card.action.message/add_board/invite

attach_studio.open/select • saved_search.create/toggle

empty_state.save_search • rank.debug_sample (privacysafe sampling to validate ranking fairness)

L) Acceptance Criteria (mark 4.6 FINAL)

Role/Listing tabs implement Model/Photographer/Videographer/Creator/FanSub Creator/Studio with SafeMode gating for FanSub & beyondLingerie People.

Filter sets delivered for each role and for Studio (amenities, min hours, etc.); Common filters present across all.

Social Metrics Panel supports perplatform followers/ER/avg views/growth; ANY/ALL logic; Verifiedonly default with Include selfreported toggle; nightly sync + manual refresh (3×/day).

Results list uses PersonCard / StudioCard; Promoted units are labeled and capped (≤2/20; ≤1 above fold).

Attach a Studio pill appears when a People search includes date/time; drawer shows prefiltered studios; selection persists to checkout as Linked Booking Group.

Sorting & ranking match the contract: relevance → availability → distance → price fit → reputation → small nudges; paid never overrides filters.

Saved Search with cadence (daily batch) implemented; management page exists.

Boards/Compare/Invite shortcuts work from cards; boards accept mixed types.

Performance & accessibility budgets met; skeletons present; map optional; staledata badges visible.

Telemetry events fire as listed.

M) Why this works

Roletrue filtering: Buyers get the exact knobs that matter for each role (and studios), not gear trivia.

Social clarity: Perplatform targeting with verified chips lets brands and creators find reach + engagement, not just follower tallies.

Fast planning: AttachinFlow collapses multisite planning into one search + one checkout.

Fair & trustworthy: Relevance and availability rule; promotions are clearly labeled and capped; Safe Mode protects brand and users.

§4.7 — Checkout & Linked Booking Group

Goal: Make paying predictable, transparent, and safe for both Talent and Studio bookings—whether purchased alone or together. Treat Talent and Studio as separate bookings with independent policies & payouts, but present a single, simple checkout and one receipt when bought together via an LBG. Minimize dropoff with clear fees, policy previews, and fast payment flows (Card, ACH).

A) Entry Points & Routes

From People profile (Packages): Book / Request to Book → /checkout/talent/{tempId}

From Studio page: Instant Book / Request → /checkout/studio/{tempId}

From Brief/Compare: Award → /checkout/talent/{tempId} (prefilled)

AttachinFlow (talent checkout): adds a Studio → /checkout/group/{groupId}

Linked Group summary (always when 2 bookings present): /checkout/group/{groupId}

B) Checkout Structure (single vs group)

Singlebooking Checkout (Talent or Studio)

Details (date/time/duration, package or hourly calc)

Docs (Smart Docs pack)

Payment (card/ACH)

Confirm

Linked Booking Group (Talent + Studio)

Group header with two panels: Talent | Studio (expand/collapse)

Steps: Review → Docs → Payment → Confirm

Policies & totals displayed per booking, with a group total at bottom.

Atomicity: The LBG confirms only if both bookings succeed (payments/holds). If one fails, the user sees options to retry, edit, or remove the failing item.

C) Details Step

Talent panel

Package chosen, addons, price; travel fee calc (zone or permile beyond included radius), schedule, location (approx).

Instant Book chip if applicable; otherwise “Request to Book” label with expected response window.

Studio panel

Date/time & min hours check; hourly calc + cleaning fee (if set); deposit hold badge with amount; rules summary.

Conflicts & validation

Live revalidation of availability for both panels before continuing.

If collision or minhours violation, inline error + suggested alternatives (nearby time slots, similar studios).

Group time sync enforced: studio duration must cover talent time (+ configured buffer).

D) Smart Docs Step (esign before pay)

Autoassembled packs (prefilled from booking context):

Talent: SOW, License, Model Release (if needed), Cancellation policy summary.

Studio: Property/Space Release, House Rules, Safety Addendum (autoincluded if hazards toggled), Studio cancellation terms.

Esign required to proceed (oneclick signer sheet per doc; audit trail stored).

Amendments: if details change later (reschedule/adjustments), amended docs generate automatically and require reack.

Address privacy: Studio’s exact address unlocks after confirmation; shown in thread + ics attachments.

E) Payment Step

Methods

Card (3DS/SCA when required)

ACH (Plaidlike link) → buyer fee reduced to 3% (min $3) when enabled; may have delayed confirmation.

Apple Pay / Google Pay (Phase 2) where supported.

What’s charged

Talent: full booking subtotal into escrow (per §1.3).

Studio: full studio subtotal into escrow + deposit hold authorization (not charged) per listing configuration.

Buyer service fee per booking (5% card / 3% ACH when enabled).

Taxes (if applicable) itemized per booking.

Atomic capture for LBG

Attempt charges/holds in a safe order (e.g., Talent escrow → Studio escrow → Studio deposit hold).

If any step fails → no booking confirms; guide user to retry or remove problem item.

Promos & discounts

City promos autoapply (e.g., founding city 0% buyer fee).

Provider fee discounts (IB –1%, Trusted Pro –0.5%) affect provider payout, not buyer total; shown as “Provider earns more with Instant Book” tooltip.

Fee transparency

Inline “What do platform fees cover?” tooltip: escrow, contracts, support, processing.

F) Confirm Step

Success page shows two booking tiles (Talent • Studio) with: status, dates, “Open thread,” “Add to calendar,” “View Docs,” “Share itinerary.”

Deposit hold line (Studio): clearly states authorization amount & automatic release window (e.g., 48h postcheckout if no claim).

Trusted contact prompt (optional safety feature): share generalarea location & times during the session.

Next actions:

Buyer: “Message” / “Request reschedule” / “Add notes for shoot”

Seller/Host: “Review details” / “Send prep notes” / “Share access code” (studio)

G) Pricing & Calculations (display rules)

Per booking (panel & receipt lines):

Subtotal (Talent: package + addons + travel; Studio: hours×rate + cleaning + approved addons)

Buyer fee (5% card / 3% ACH when enabled; min $3; nonrefundable on buyer cancels per policy)

Estimated taxes (if applicable)

Deposit hold (Studio only; authorization)

Total charged now (escrow amounts)

Group total shown at bottom in LBG; collapsible breakdown.

H) Edits & Reschedules (pre/postconfirmation)

Before confirmation

Edit time, add/remove addons; LBG validates both bookings.

Changing Talent time proposes Studio shift (and viceversa); if not possible, show split option or alternatives.

After confirmation (flows in thread, per §1.3 addendum)

Propose reschedule to both bookings in LBG; new times quoted & reauthorized if totals change.

Split LBG if only one party can accommodate change (buyer chooses); refunds per respective matrices.

Change orders (Talent) & duration changes (Studio) recalc totals; amended docs issued.

I) Cancellations & Refund Preview

Inline policy previews on each panel with “Learn more” to KB.

Cancellation modal shows computed outcomes per booking (e.g., “Talent: 50% refund • Studio: 0% refund”) and a group summary.

Host/Sellerfault cancels: autorefunds buyer fee for that booking; goodwill credits as configured (§3.9).

J) Receipts & Calendar

Unified receipt with two sections (Talent • Studio), fees, taxes, and deposit authorization line (Studio).

ICS invites per booking; Linked Group itinerary (combined) downloadable.

Tax docs stored per booking (not shown at checkout).

K) Error Handling & Edge Cases

Payment declined / 3DS fail: stay on Payment step; show reason; allow method switch.

Deposit hold fail (Studio): surface amount & bank advice; offer to remove Studio or retry.

Doublebooking race: if availability disappears between Details and Pay, show conflict modal with alternatives.

Early exit policy note (Studio): no prorata refunds unless host agrees; checkout governs overtime only.

No rideshare integration at v1: travel is seller configurable; buyers may arrange transport independently.

L) Accessibility, Performance & Privacy

Accessibility: logical heading order; labeled inputs; ARIA for steppers and docs list; keyboardable signature.

Performance: TTI < 2.5s; defer SDKs (ACH/OAuth/3DS) until opened; skeletons for panels; cache price calcs clientside.

Privacy: exact studio address hidden until confirm; only general area shown prior; emails/push never contain 18+ previews.

M) Telemetry

checkout.open (type=talent|studio|group)

checkout.validate.ok/fail (reason=availability|min_hours|conflict)

docs.sign (doc type) • docs.amend.issued/accepted

payment.method.select (card|ach) • payment.attempt.success/fail (reason)

deposit.authorize.success/fail (amount)

checkout.confirm.success (single|group)

cancel.preview.open • cancel.submit (outcome per booking)

reschedule.propose/accept (group=Y/N)

promo.apply (city_promo|code)

fee.tooltip.view (engagement proxy)

N) Acceptance Criteria (mark 4.7 FINAL)

Single & group checkouts implemented with steppers, perbooking panels, and a group total for LBG.

Smart Docs packs (Talent: SOW/License/Release; Studio: Property/Space Release + House Rules + Safety Addendum) are esigned before payment; amended docs reissued on changes.

Payment supports Card and ACH (ACH reduces buyer fee to 3% when enabled); handles 3DS; logs outcomes.

Escrow collected per booking; Studio deposit hold authorized (not GMV).

Atomic LBG: both bookings must succeed or none confirm; failure guidance provided.

Policies & refunds previewed per booking; cancellation modal computes outcomes; receipts show split lines and deposit authorization.

Reschedule & change order flows are LBGaware (sync or split), with reauth when totals change.

Travel fees (Talent) calculated from role settings (zones/mi beyond included radius).

Accessibility, performance, privacy baselines met; telemetry events fire.

O) Why this works

Confidence to commit: Contracts signed before money moves; fees and policies are crystalclear.

Simple for buyers, correct for finance: One checkout & receipt—even for two bookings—while ledgers stay separate.

Fewer support tickets: Evidencefirst docs, deposit holds, and policy previews reduce disputes.

Launchready: Card + ACH, IB + Request, and AttachinFlow cover the common paths without building a full billing platform.

§4.8 — Delivery Room & Acceptance

Goal: Provide a storagesane, evidencefirst workspace for handing off creative work, managing proofs → selects → finals, verifying promo/UGC deliverables, and closing out bookings with clear acceptance timers that trigger payouts and reduce disputes.

A) Routes & Ownership

Buyer view: /booking/{id}/delivery (read/approve/request revisions).

Seller view: /booking/{id}/delivery (author/publish/revise).

Studio bookings: show readonly timeline (checkin/out, docs); no Delivery Room (studios don’t deliver files).

Linked Booking Group: each booking has its own Delivery Room; LBG summary links to each.

B) Concepts & Stages

Manifest — authoritative list of deliverables (filenames/links + checksums, size, type, version).

Proofs — lowres watermarked images / lowbitrate proxies for video; no originals on platform.

Selects — buyer picks which proofs should be finalized (if package includes selection).

Finals — fullspec outputs referenced via external links (Drive/Dropbox/OneDrive/S3) + optional onplatform proxy; license applies on acceptance.

UGC/Promo — a verified post on IG/YT/TT/X with link and API check + required minlive window.

Storagesane principle: We host previews/proxies only; originals stay at the source. We capture a manifest and verify integrity (hash), so disputes can be adjudicated without hosting 100GB+ assets.

C) Typical Workflow

Prepare & Upload Proofs (seller)

Create a Delivery batch → add Proofs (images/videos) with auto watermark/proxy.

Add External Links (optional) for previewing higher quality; platform immediately stores manifest metadata (name, ext, size, checksum, provider, URL).

Autochecks (see §F) run and annotate items.

Buyer Reviews Proofs

Grid/lightbox with zoom; peritem comments (and timecode comments for video).

Buyer Selects up to the package count (e.g., 12 edits).

If package includes no selection step (e.g., “deliver all 20”), skip to Finals.

Publish Finals (seller)

For each selected item (or the whole set), upload Final proxies and attach External Links to originals.

Mark items Final; system locks proof download (if enabled) and exposes Final download links.

Add License terms chip (pulled from package preset) and Usage window if applicable.

Acceptance Window starts

Default 7 days (configurable per package: 3/7/14 days).

Buyer can Accept all or specific items, or Request revision (counts toward package revision rounds).

Autoaccept triggers when the window expires with no action.

UGC/Promo: acceptance occurs when post verifies (API or link) and remains live for the minlive window (e.g., 72h) — see §E.

Closeout

On Acceptance/Autoaccept, talent booking moves to Completed; payout queues per §1.3/§3.1.

Leave a review prompt for both sides.

D) Roles & Deliverable Types (what’s supported v1)

Photographer / Videographer: proofs → selects (optional) → finals; peritem comments, timecoded notes; revision rounds per package.

Model (as seller): usually no file delivery; deliverables are Time/Service + signed Model Release (already in Smart Docs). Optional: selfie IDmatch (phase 2).

UGC Creator / FanSubscription Creator (promo work): Post verification deliverables:

Link to post + screenshot on publish; platform fetches post ID, timestamp, initial metrics (where APIs allow).

System tracks minlive (e.g., 72h) + post window (e.g., 7 days).

Acceptance after minlive + verification (see §E).

Studio: no deliverables; checkin/out + docs + deposit flows instead.

E) UGC/Promo Verification (Creators & FanSub Creators)

At delivery: seller submits link to the post (IG/YT/TT/X) + optional screenshot.

Verification check (hourly during window):

Confirms post exists, is public, matches handle, and the timestamp ≥ booking delivery time.

Logs engagement metrics snapshot (ER proxy) where APIs permit (or displays “unverified metrics” for linkonly).

Minlive enforcement: track continuous visibility for N hours (package default 72h; configurable per deliverable).

Acceptance rule: autoaccept on passing verification + minlive, or manual accept earlier by buyer.

Edge cases: post removed/hidden before minlive → seller can repost once without restarting the entire acceptance window; noncompliance → buyer may open refund request (policy per §3.9).

Safe Mode note: We neither fetch nor display 18+ media; SFW thumbnails only; for FanSub Creators we record confirmation and metrics sans explicit previews.

F) AutoChecks & Evidence (objective validation)

On upload or link attach:

Technical:

Images: resolution (≥ target px), color space (sRGB/Adobe RGB), aspect ratio, file type, filesize, EXIF presence.

Video: container/codec (MP4/H.264 or ProRes proxy), resolution, fps, audio channels, duration.

Integrity: virus scan; checksum recorded (SHA256) for proofs/finals (and for external manifests when possible).

Policy guards: NSFW detection warning (so sellers avoid borderline public previews); SafeMode validation on previews.

Link checks: provider type (Drive/Dropbox/OneDrive/S3), reachability, headers (size/type), and expiry status.

Evidence pack: autocollects manifest, checks, and timestamps; used in disputes.

G) Revisions & Comments

Revision rounds: default 1 round (configurable per package); seller can grant extras inthread.

Peritem comments (images); timecoded comments (video); resolve state for each comment.

Change requests must be actionable (UI enforces structured notes: crop, color, retouch notes, timecode ranges).

Timers: buyer must submit revision request within the acceptance window; seller SLA per package (e.g., 3 business days).

H) Downloads & Watermarks

Proofs: watermarked, previewonly (download toggle off by default).

Finals: download links visible immediately on publish, or after acceptance (package option).

External originals: always via provider’s storage (Drive/Dropbox/OneDrive/S3/S3 presigned); we never host originals.

Retention: onplatform proxies kept 90 days; manifests retained 12–24 months; banner clarifies “Not a backup service.”

I) Acceptance, Autoaccept & Payout Triggers

Acceptance window: default 7 days (3/7/14 options).

Manual Accept: buyer can accept itemlevel or whole batch; license certificate issues instantly.

Autoaccept: when timer ends without open revision; licenses issue automatically; payout queues.

Partial acceptance: allowed; payout apportions across accepted items if package contracted peritem pricing; otherwise paid on batch acceptance.

UGC/Promo: acceptance on verify + minlive; payout scheduled afterwards.

Early Payout (peruse): eligible sellers (Rep ≥ 85) can accelerate postacceptance.

J) Disputes & NonDelivery

Missing deliverables (seller uploaded fewer than contracted): buyer opens Refund Request; system compares contracted vs manifest; partial refunds computed.

Quality disputes (offspec): rely on Autochecks + SOW to determine deviation; may provide partial refund or revision credit.

Expired external links: seller must refresh within 48h of buyer notice; timers pause during refresh grace; repeated expiry → reputation hit.

Escalation to Neutral Review (per §3.9): evidence pack includes manifest, checks, comments, timestamps, link status, and SOW terms.

Studios: route to studio deposit/adjustment flows (no file disputes).

K) Security, Privacy & Policy

Virus scanning on all uploads; block executables; safe MIME validation.

EXIF privacy: warn on personal EXIF; provide “strip on proxy” option.

DMCA & IP: report flow; lock downloads when claim is open; notify both parties.

Safe Mode: only SFW previews visible publicly; buyer & seller see full content subject to policy; FanSub flows avoid explicit previews.

L) UI Details (components & states)

ManifestList with status chips: Proof • Final • Needs action • Error • Link expired.

AutoCheckStatus: green/yellow/red with tooltips (e.g., “Video exceeds 4GB proxy limit; original link captured”).

Comment sidebar (per item) with timecodes & resolve checkboxes.

Timer banner: shows Acceptance ends in Xd Xh; pauses if revision round is open.

License chip on each Final; View License opens certificate modal (terms, project, booking ID).

UGC tracker: “Verifying post…” → “Live ✓ (48/72h remaining)” → “Verified ✓”.

M) Notifications & Emails

Seller: “Buyer selected X proofs” • “Revision requested on N items” • “Acceptance complete”

Buyer: “Finals ready” • “Acceptance ends in 24h” • “UGC post failed verification (reason)”

Both: “Autoaccept in 3h” • “Links expired—action required”

Emails respect Safe Mode (no explicit previews).

N) Metrics

Time to first delivery, time to acceptance, % autoaccept, revision rate, firstpass acceptance rate, link failure rate, nondelivery incidents, refund rate, UGC verification pass rate, minlive compliance rate.

Feed Reputation inputs: ontime delivery, revision compliance, nondelivery, link reliability.

O) Telemetry (events)

delivery.batch.create/publish • delivery.item.add/remove • delivery.link.attach/refresh/expire

autocheck.pass/warn/fail (reason) • virus.block

proofs.view • selects.add/remove • finals.publish

accept.open/accept.all/accept.some/auto_accept

revision.request/open/resolve (counts, per item)

ugc.verify.start/pass/fail • ugc.min_live.progress

refund_request.open/resolve (outcome)

license.certificate.view/download

P) Acceptance Criteria (mark 4.8 FINAL)

Delivery Room supports Proofs → Selects (optional) → Finals with peritem comments and timecoded notes for video.

External link manifest captured (name, size, type, checksum where available, provider, URL); no original hosting; proxies/previews only.

Autochecks run on upload/link; results shown per item; virus scan enforced.

Acceptance window (3/7/14 days) with Autoaccept; partial acceptance supported; payout triggers wired.

UGC/Promo verification: link ingest, API checks when available, minlive tracking, acceptance on verify+minlive.

Revisions: at least 1 round configurable; structured change requests; timers pause during active revision.

Downloads & watermarks: proofs watermarked; finals downloadable per package rule; retention & “not a backup” banner visible.

Disputes: nondelivery/quality/linkexpiry flows with evidence packs; timers & outcomes integrate with §3.9.

Safe Mode & policy: SFW previews only; FanSub Creator flows avoid explicit media.

Telemetry & metrics instrumented as listed.

Q) Why this works

Reduces disputes: Objective manifests, autochecks, and acceptance timers create shared reality.

Scales cheaply: Proxies + external links avoid massive storage costs while preserving evidence.

Fits every role: Photographers/video get proofs→finals; creators get verified posts; studios don’t carry file baggage.

Clear payout triggers: Acceptance (or verified minlive) drives completion; LBG clarity remains intact.

§4.9 — Messaging & Threads — FINAL

Goal: Provide a fast, safe, and actioncentric inbox where buyers, talent, and studio hosts coordinate work. Threads must: (1) reduce backandforth via Quick Actions (quote, reschedule, change order, refunds), (2) keep evidence attached (docs, delivery, checkin/out), and (3) respect our fairuse DM credits, Safe Mode, and offplatform payment guardrails.

A) Principles

Do work in the thread — Quotes, schedule changes, docs, delivery, adjustments, refunds are all firstclass actions.

Context everywhere — Each thread shows role/space, booking status, and key policy snippets.

Evidence over opinion — Autoattach Smart Docs, Delivery manifests, checkin/out, and price math.

Safe by default — Hide personal contact info; scan attachments; offplatform payment attempts are discouraged and throttled.

Low friction — Replies are free; new conversation credits are the only scarce resource (per §3.2).

LBGaware — When Talent + Studio are booked together, keep threads separate but coordinated, with Group Broadcast when needed.

B) Thread Types & Routing

Inquiry thread (prebooking) — starts from profile/search/brief invite. Uses DM credit on the first outbound message only; replies are free.

Booking thread (Talent) — created on acceptance/IB; status chips: Booked → In progress → Delivered → Completed; shows escrow status.

Booking thread (Studio) — created on acceptance/IB; shows access details (masked until esign), deposit hold state, checkin/out status.

RFP thread — buyer broadcast → provider reply; converts to Inquiry/Booking on award.

LBG umbrella — not a chat; a summary bar linking to the two booking threads; supports Group Broadcast (see §I).

Routes: /messages (list) • /messages/{threadId} (detail) • /messages?group={groupId} (shows both group threads with Broadcast control)

C) Layout (Thread Detail)

Header bar

Counterpart avatar & name • Role/Studio chip • City • Booking status chip • Rep ring (0–100) mini • “View booking” • “View docs”

Rightside actions: Quick Quote / Change Order / Propose Reschedule / Issue Refund / Get help (contextual, role/space aware)

Left (or main) pane

Message list (bubbles with timestamps, read receipts, link previews, inline image/video previews with SafeMode filtering)

Pinned message (e.g., access code) shown atop until unpinned

Right (or drawer) pane

Summary card (dates, times, location neighborhood, price lines)

Docs (SOW, License, Release; Studio: Property/Space Release, House Rules)

Delivery status (if talent thread)

Checkin/out (if studio thread)

Policies mini cards (cancel/refund window)

Group chip if part of LBG (tap to switch thread or use Broadcast)

D) Composer & Message Types

Text (rich formatting minimal: bold, list, link)

Attachments: images, short clips (previewed), PDFs; virusscanned and SafeMode filtered in public previews

Snippets/Templates: canned replies by role; perrole variables (price, slots, packages)

Scheduling poll (propose 2–5 times)

Quick Quote (inline price proposal from package + addons → turns into a booking when accepted)

Location picker (neighborhood only; exact studio address never sent until docs signed)

Voice notes (Phase 2; text transcript required if enabled)

Emoji/ack (👍 etc.) to reduce noise

Credit logic:

Starting a new thread consumes 1 credit (per §3.2).

Replies, booking threads, and RFP replies do not consume credits.

If messages breach spam checks, sending slows or blocks (see §G).

E) Pipeline, Automation & Reminders

Pipeline chips (auto): New • Needs Info • Quoted • Awarded • Booked • Delivered • Completed

Autonudges (1/day max/thread) when: quote unanswered 48h, buyer hasn’t proposed times, docs unsigned, delivery unreviewed.

Snooze a thread (until date/time or after event).

Remind me later on action items (e.g., “Follow up on Tuesday”).

F) Quick Actions (contextual, policyaware)

Quick Quote (Inquiry → Booking)

Pick a package, adjust addons, travel, discounts; preview fee/takehome; send quote.

Buyer taps Accept & Pay → goes to Talent checkout (or LBG if studio already attached).

Propose Reschedule (Booking)

Propose new date/time (Talent or Studio); if LBG, system proposes synchronized change to both bookings.

If only one can move, buyer picks: Split group or Change both later.

Change Order (Talent)

Add hours, addons, license tier changes; requote and reauthorize; amended Smart Docs issued.

Issue Refund / Discount (Talent)

Partial refund or discount (policyaware); provider fee recalculates; receipts reissued.

Studio: Share Access / Update Code

Access code (masked until both docs signed) • Parking/entry notes • Backup contact.

Audit log for code reveals/updates.

Studio: PostBooking Adjustment

Overtime/crew overage/violation; attach photos/logs; opens adjustment claim (per §3.9 timers).

Delivery: Request Acceptance / Request Revision

Inline buttons appear when the stage is appropriate.

Support: Get help

Opens contextual selfserve (refund, access issue, adjustment/dispute), attaching evidence from the thread.

All actions produce system messages with links to receipts, docs, or delivery items.

G) Safety, Privacy & Abuse Controls

Autoredact obvious phone/email/payment handles prebooking; after confirmation, allow a masked relay number/email (Phase 2) or keep inapp only at v1.

Offplatform payment detection → inline reminder + link to Protection benefits; repeat attempts throttle new thread creation.

Harassment & slur filter → soft block + “Report” affordance; P0 safety escalations surface hotline.

Attachment guards → virus scan, MIME/type check, SafeMode preview compliance; large files rejected with Delivery guidance.

Block/Mute other party; Report with categories (misrepresentation, harassment, payment circumvention, explicit content).

Privacy: toggle Read receipts ON/OFF per user (default ON); Last seen off by default.

H) Inbox (List) & Search

Unified inbox with folders: All, Action needed, Booked, Archived.

Sort: Recent activity (default) • Unread first • By pipeline stage.

Filters: Role (if multirole), Studio (if host), City, Has booking, Has docs pending, Has delivery pending.

Search within inbox: counterpart name, project title, booking ID.

Archive & Pin threads; archive autoreopens on new activity.

I) LBGAware Collaboration

Group bar on talent or studio booking thread shows the partner booking card with status and a “Broadcast to both” toggle.

Broadcast sends a message to both threads with a banner “Sent to both bookings”; replies arrive in respective threads (kept separate for policy/payout reasons).

Reschedules launched from either thread attempt to update both bookings; system explains outcomes if only one can move.

Docs & delivery remain per booking; crosslinks appear in the group bar.

J) Timezones, Localization & Calendars

All timestamps show local time for each user; hover reveals UTC and other party’s local time.

Date/time proposals include both parties’ local times in the message bubble.

ICS attachments created on booking and on accepted reschedules.

K) Reliability & Performance

Optimistic send with retry; duplicate protection (idempotent keys).

Typing and read indicators; fall back gracefully on poor networks.

Attachment uploads show progress; resume on reconnect.

Message retention: durable; no hard expiry.

L) Telemetry

inbox.view • thread.open • message.send (type=text|image|pdf|quote|poll|action) • message.read

quick_quote.open/send/accepted • reschedule.propose/accept/decline • change_order.open/confirm

refund.issue • studio.access.share/update • adjustment.open/resolve

delivery.request_accept • delivery.request_revision

broadcast.send (group) • offplatform.detect • report.submit

dm_credit.consume/block • nudge.auto.sent

M) Acceptance Criteria (mark 4.9 FINAL)

Thread types implemented (Inquiry, Booking—Talent/Studio, RFP) with role/space context and status chips.

Composer supports text, attachments, templates, scheduling polls, Quick Quote; SafeMode filtering for previews.

Quick Actions live and policyaware: Quick Quote, Propose Reschedule, Change Order, Issue Refund/Discount, Studio Access, PostBooking Adjustment.

LBGaware features: group bar, Broadcast, synchronized reschedules with split option.

Read receipts, typing, pin, archive, inbox filters/search delivered; DM credit spend only on first outbound of new threads.

Safety: offplatform detection, harassment filter, virus scan, block/mute/report; personal contact hidden prebooking; access codes masked until esign.

Evidence autoattached: docs, delivery links, checkin/out, receipts; system messages for every action.

Time zone clarity in proposals and timestamps; ICS updated on reschedule.

Performance: optimistic sends, retry, upload progress; telemetry fires as listed.

N) Why this works

Fewer support touches: The thread is a control panel—quotes, reschedules, refunds, and adjustments live where the conversation happens.

Safer & cleaner: Guardrails reduce fraud and harassment without blocking legit coordination.

LBG clarity without confusion: Keep bookings separate for policy/payout, yet coordinate via Group Broadcast and synchronized changes.

Frictionlight: Replies are free; credits only gate outbound cold outreach, which protects buyers and keeps the inbox healthy.

§4.10 — Reviews & Reputation UX

Goal: Make feedback trustworthy, fair, and hard to game—so buyers can choose confidently and providers/hosts know what to improve. Keep reviews rolescoped for People and spacescoped for Studios. Use a transparent 0–100 Reputation Score that’s explainable, timeweighted, and tied to real outcomes (ontime delivery, noshow rate, safety). Respect Safe Mode, privacy, and legal boundaries.

A) Principles

Only from real jobs: Public star/text reviews come only from completed, onplatform bookings (verified by escrow + acceptance).

Doubleblind & timeboxed: Neither side sees the other’s review until both submit or the window closes.

Role/space scoped: Reviews and reputation never mix across roles; studios have their own reputation.

Evidence beats rhetoric: Where relevant, the UI shows objective signals (checkin/out, delivery timestamps, UGC minlive pass).

Safety first: Provide a private safety feedback channel separate from public reviews; enforce antiharassment and antidoxxing rules.

Explain the math: The Reputation Score always has a “Why this score?” breakdown and decay timeline.

B) Triggers & Windows

Trigger to review:

Talent bookings: on Acceptance or Autoaccept in Delivery Room.

Studios: at checkout complete (after checkout time passes and no open access issue).

Window: 14 days from trigger for both parties.

Doubleblind: Reviews publish when both are submitted or at day 14; if only one submits, both publish at day 14.

Reminders: Day 3, Day 10 nudges; Day13 last call (inapp + email).

Who can review: The buyer and the counterparty (provider or host). No thirdparty public reviews.

Canceled jobs:

Provider/hostfault cancel: no star review; system records a reliability penalty visible in the Rep breakdown.

Buyerfault cancel: same (penalty on buyer account; not public).

Noshow: no star review; a Noshow marker feeds reputation (decays).

C) Review Composer (roleaware)

Common structure

Stars (1–5)

Short tags (2–3 chips)

Optional text (min 30 chars for 1–2★; 4–5★ can be empty)

Photo evidence (SFW only; optional; studios allow space photos; talent allows BTS SFW)

Private safety feedback (structured, never public; see §H)

Rolespecific tags

Model/Creator: Professional • Punctual • Communication • Posing/Direction • Boundaries respected • Would book again

Photographer: Direction • Professional • Communication • Turnaround met • Quality of edits • Clear brief

Videographer: Professional • Audio quality • Color grade • Timely delivery • Communication

UGC/FanSub Creator: Followed brief • Post verified • Met minlive • Onbrand • Clear disclosure

Studio (space): Accurate listing • Easy access • Cleanliness • Noise control • Natural light • Amenities as described

Guardrails

Disallow personal info (emails/phones), hate speech, harassment; inline warnings with policy links.

Safe Mode ensures no explicit images can be attached.

D) Display & Surfacing

On profiles (People)

Star average + count (shows only after ≥ 3 verified reviews)

Reputation Ring (0–100) with “Why this score?” → breakdown and recent trend sparkline

Latest reviews (3–5), with Verified booking label; studio reviews never appear here

Community references in a separate section (low weight, ownerapproved)

On Studio pages

Star average + count (threshold ≥ 3)

Studio Reputation Ring (spacescoped) with breakdown (reliability includes deposit claim behavior)

Photo reviews encouraged (SFW), especially of space and amenities

In Search

Rep ring chip on cards; hover/tooltip with score reason

Filters: Min Reputation (0–100) and Min Stars (1–5)

Sort: Top Reputation, Rating, and Recent

E) Reputation Score (0–100) — computation (v1)

Weights (roleaware; spaceaware for studios)

Reviews & volume — 40% (Bayesiansmoothed star mean; more weight with more reviews; community references capped)

Reliability — 25% (ontime completion, noshow rate, cancel fault, dispute loss rate; deposit abuse for studios)

Responsiveness — 10% (median first response time; response consistency)

Verifications — 15% (ID, Trusted Pro, Socialverified, Verified Studio)

Recent performance — 10% (last 90 days weighted 2×)

Penalties & decay

Late cancellations/noshows/dispute losses apply sharp penalties that decay over 60–120 days.

Smallsample protection: Bayesian prior (city/role baseline) prevents “100 after 1 review.”

Caps: Any single factor can affect at most ±12 points per month (prevents sudden swings).

New accounts: show “New — building reputation” until 3 verified reviews or 10 completed bookings.

Transparency

“Why this score?” panel shows 5 bars and examples (“2 late cancellations in last 90 days (–6)”).

“How to improve” checklist (e.g., Enable Instant Book; verify ID; reply faster; meet delivery SLA).

F) Antigaming & Moderation

Ring detection: repeated mutual 5★ bursts across a tight user cluster (IP/device/time overlap) → flag; reduce weight; investigate.

Incentivized reviews: explicit quidproquo offers (“5★ for discount”) are prohibited; detection via text patterns + reports.

Review gating: Providers/hosts cannot prompt reviews with incentives inthread; system handles prompts neutrally.

One owner response per review; edits allowed for 15 minutes after posting, then locked (typos only).

Flagging: “Report review” (harassment, personal info, hate, explicit content, irrelevant, privacy breach).

Outofscope: We don’t remove reviews for mere opinion or star rating; removal is for policy violations only.

Anonymity options: Buyers can publish under brand/team name; personal names are hidden by default.

G) LBG (Linked Booking Group) behavior

One postbooking flow invites the buyer to review both bookings (Talent & Studio) in a single step; each publishes to its own page.

Reviews remain independent; a studio’s issues don’t lower a photographer’s rating (and vice versa).

If one booking is canceled by fault, the other may still be reviewable per its own rules.

H) Safety Feedback (private, nonpublic)

Structured form in the review flow: boundary violations, harassment, unsafe space, undisclosed cameras, access issues.

Feeds Safety Console with the booking context, checkin/out, docs, and message snippets.

Not public; may trigger a strike, IB suppression, or verification recheck; submitter receives outcome summary when resolved.

I) Prompting & Emails (biasfree)

Neutral subject lines and copy (“Share feedback about your experience”).

No starnudging language; no images that could bias; SFW only.

Onetap stars deeplink on mobile; text field optional except for 1–2★ (reason required).

Followup once if unreviewed; no further nags after day 14.

J) Metrics & Health Targets

Review completion rate ≥ 55% (either side)

Doubleblind submissions ≥ 35% (both sides submitted before day 14)

1–2★ share within expected band (watch for chilling effects)

Disputeadjusted satisfaction (4★+ after successful support outcome)

Flag rate < 2% of reviews; removal rate < 0.4% (policy violations only)

Rep score stability (stdev < 6 points over 30 days for steady accounts)

Correlation: Rep vs conversion uplift (target positive, diminishing returns past ~85)

K) Telemetry

review.request.sent/open • review.submit (stars, role|studio) • review.publish

review.flag (reason) • review.owner_response.submit

rep.why.open • rep.improve.view/action

safety_feedback.submit (category)

lbg.review.bundle.start/complete

email.review.open/click (biassafe content)

L) Acceptance Criteria (mark 4.10 FINAL)

Doubleblind reviews with a 14day window; publish when both submit or on expiry.

Rolescoped reviews & reputation for People; spacescoped for Studios; never mixed.

Composer includes stars, tags, optional text, SFW photos, and private safety feedback.

Display: profiles/pages show star average (≥3 reviews), latest reviews, Reputation Ring with transparent breakdown.

Reputation Score computed with weights (40/25/10/15/10), Bayesian smoothing, penalties with decay, caps on monthtomonth swing, and “New” state until minimum data.

Search integrates Rep ring chips, filters (Min Rep/Min Stars), and sort options.

Antigaming rules enforced: ring detection, no incentives, policybased removals only; owner reply limits.

LBG review bundle flow implemented; each review publishes to its own entity.

Safe Mode respected: no explicit media in reviews; emails/push SFW.

Telemetry & KPIs instrumented as listed.

M) Why this works

Trustworthy by design: Only verified bookings yield public reviews; the rest factor into reliability quietly.

Explainable, not mysterious: The 0–100 score with a clear “why” builds confidence and guides improvement.

Hard to game, easy to use: Doubleblind timing, smallsample smoothing, and ring detection keep ratings honest; the UI stays friendly.

Aligns with search & conversions: Strong reputation helps sort ties without letting paid boosts hijack results.

§4.11 — Support, Refunds & Disputes UX

Goal: Resolve issues quickly, predictably, and fairly with minimal human touch. Keep everything policyaware, evidencefirst, LBGaware (Talent + Studio), and feeaccurate (per §3.1). Make outcomes clear before users commit to a request, and autoassemble evidence (docs, checkin/out, delivery manifests, deposit settings) to reduce friction and fraud.

A) Principles

Do it where the work lives: All flows start in the booking thread via Inthread ▸ Get help; no context loss.

Outcome clarity upfront: Show a refund/charge preview based on policy matrix and timestamps before submission.

Evidence beats rhetoric: Autoattach Smart Docs, Delivery manifests, checkin/out, calendar logs, studio access logs, and payment lines.

Separate ledgers: Talent and Studio bookings are independent; LBG shows a single summary with perbooking outcomes.

Timers & SLAs: Access issues are P1; standard disputes follow strict windows (24h/48h/5day).

Chargebackready: Every case builds a representment pack by default.

SFW & privacy: No explicit media; exact studio address hidden except to parties; Safe Mode respected in notifications.

B) Entry Points & Routes

Thread shortcut: Inthread ▸ Get help (contextual forms)

Profile menu: Support Center /support → lists bookings + cases

Booking detail: Open a case button

Admin: Support Console /admin/support (agentonly)

C) Case Types (policyaware, minimal)

Talent bookings

Refund request – cancellation (buyerinitiated; applies §3.9 talent matrix)

Nondelivery / missing items (compare SOW vs manifest)

Offspec quality (autochecks vs SOW; may route to revision first)

Noshow / late arrival (uses checkin/out evidence)

Payment correction (duplicate charge, tax error)

Studio bookings

Access issue (live) → P1 (badge); resolves or refunds per §3.9 addendum

Damage claim (hostinitiated; deposit hold)

Postbooking adjustment (overtime, crew overage, rule violation)

Amenity misrepresentation (partial refund if material)

Payment correction

Linked Booking Group (LBG)

Group cancel/split (compute separate outcomes; show one summary)

Group reschedule (sync both bookings or split)

Mixed dispute (e.g., Talent deliverables issue + Studio OK)

D) SelfServe Triage Wizard (all flows)

Step 1 — Identify issue

Contextaware options (e.g., “Access code not working” on Studio; “Delivered fewer images than contracted” on Talent).

Step 2 — Policy preview

Show matrix snippet (e.g., “>7d=100%, 7–48h=50%, <48h=0%”), countdown timers, and estimated outcomes (refund lines per booking, buyer fee policy, deposit note).

If outcome is clearly $0, offer “Contact seller/host” instead of filing.

Step 3 — Evidence (auto + user)

Autoattached: checkin/out (Studio), SOW/License/House Rules, Delivery manifest, Autochecks, messages timeline, price lines, deposit configuration, access logs (if integrated).

User prompts: upload photos/video (SFW), describe discrepancy; link to UGC post when relevant.

Step 4 — Review & submit

Show refund/charge preview with taxes/fees; LBG outcome split if group; submit → case created.

Confirmation

Thread posts a system message summarizing the case; both parties get actions (Respond / Add evidence).

E) Evidence & Calculations (what the engine uses)

Talent: SOW (deliverables count/spec), Delivery manifest (filenames/checksums), Autochecks (resolution, codecs), acceptance timestamps, revision rounds used, messages referencing scope.

Studio: checkin/out geofence pass/fail, House Rules signatures, access logs, pre/post photos, schedule vs booked, crew count note, hazard toggles & Safety Addendum.

Financials: escrow amounts, provider fee, buyer fee, tax lines, deposit authorization, promotions/discounts.

Outcome logic: applies matrices from §3.9; refund buyer fee only on provider/hostfault or safety exceptions; deposit captures no platform fee (per §3.1 addendum).

F) Case Lifecycle & States

Open (awaiting counterparty) — autodeadline set (48h respond).

Evidence needed — requester must add missing items (48h).

Proposed resolution — party has 48h to accept/decline.

Neutral Review — agent evaluates evidence; target decision ≤ 5 business days.

Resolved — refund/charge issued; receipts & amended docs generated.

Closed — telemetry logged; affects Reputation and future eligibility (IB/boosts).

Fastlane closures

Access failure (host fault) → immediate refund of Studio; buyer fee waived; goodwill credit optional.

Talent providercancel → immediate buyer refund; buyer fee waived; reputation penalty.

G) Timers & SLAs (confirming §3.9 addendum)

Studio access (live): P1; first response ≤ 30 minutes.

Damage claim window (host): open ≤ 24h after checkout; buyer response 48h.

Adjustment window (studio): open ≤ 24h; buyer response 48h.

Nondelivery (talent): buyer opens within acceptance window or ≤ 7 days post autoaccept; seller response 48h.

Neutral Review decision: ≤ 5 business days after evidence windows.

Deposit autorelease: 48h postcheckout if no claim.

H) Case Views (User & Agent)

User case detail

Timeline (events, deadlines), Outcome calculator panel, evidence list (auto + uploaded), Proposed resolution, Accept/Decline buttons, messages subthread.

Agent console /admin/support

Case list with SLA badges; filters; macros.

LBG outcome split view (Talent | Studio) with oneclick apply of both.

Deposit actions (authorize/void/capture with amount + reason); evidence viewer.

Sanctions (toggle IB off, suppress boosts, visibility throttle); strike ladder shortcuts.

Representment kit export (PDF + evidence images/logs).

Templates: Access failure (host remedy/credit), Adjustment approved/denied, Damage approved/denied, Talent nondelivery partial.

I) Money Movement & Docs

Refunds: autoissue to original method; partials itemized; tax recalculated; buyer fee refunded per rules.

Adjustments (studio): create new charge from escrow (if available) or postcharge with receipt.

Deposit capture: separate, up to cap; no platform fee; receipt with evidence link.

Amended docs: SOW/House Rules/Release updates autoissued on material change orders.

J) Special Cases & Guards

UGC/promo noncompliance: if post removed before minlive, the seller gets one retry; else partial refund per package policy.

Expired external links: seller has 48h to refresh; timer pauses; repeated expiry → reputation penalty.

Fraud guard: repeated loss in disputes → IB off and promotion suppression; investigation flag to Safety.

Chargebacks: we do not charge a dispute fee unless clear abuse; otherwise platform absorbs processor fee.

K) Knowledge Base & Inflow Help

Inline “Learn more” links from each form screen go to KB:

Talent refunds, Studio refunds, LBG outcomes, Damage deposits, Overtime/overage, UGC verification, Delivery & acceptance, Chargebacks.

Prefilled articles show the user’s exact policy bands (personalized, not generic).

L) Notifications & Emails (SFW, privacysafe)

Case opened • Evidence needed • Resolution proposed • Deadline 24h • Decision made • Refund issued • Deposit captured/voided • Adjustment approved/denied.

Studio access (P1) uses SMS/push + email to host and buyer simultaneously.

M) Metrics & Health Targets

Selfserve resolution rate ≥ 70%

Median time to resolution ≤ 3 days (nonP1)

Access P1 solve within 60m ≥ 90%

Chargeback rate ≤ 0.35% of bookings; representment win ≥ 55%

Repeat dispute rate per account < 3% (or IB suppression)

CSAT postresolution ≥ 4.2/5

Refund accuracy audits: error < 1%

N) Telemetry (support events)

support.open (type=talent_cancel|studio_access|damage|adjustment|non_delivery|ugc_noncompliance|payment_correction|group_split)`

support.preview_outcome.view • support.evidence.auto_attach • support.evidence.user_upload

support.submit • support.proposed.accept/decline • support.escalate.neutral_review

deposit.authorize/capture/void/release • adjustment.open/approve/deny

resolution.issue_refund/deny • docs.amend.issued

p1.access.alert_sent/resolved

representment.export

sanction.apply (ib_off|boost_suppress|visibility_throttle)

O) Acceptance Criteria (mark 4.11 FINAL)

Inthread Get help launches contextual triage with policy preview, evidence autoattach, and refund/charge preview.

Case types live for Talent, Studio, and LBG; Access issue is P1 with fast lane to resolve/refund.

LBG outcome split view shows separate Talent/Studio results and a single group summary.

Damage deposits: authorize/void/capture supported; no platform fee on deposit capture.

Postbooking adjustments (overtime/overage/violation) supported with evidence and timers.

UGC/promo verification integrated; minlive failures handled with one retry then policy outcome.

Neutral Review path exists; SLA ≤ 5 business days; representment pack exports.

Receipts & amended docs reissued automatically; tax/fees recompute accurately.

Notifications (SFW) and timers implemented (24h/48h/5day); P1 studio access resolves quickly.

Agent console provides macros, sanctions, deposit tools, and LBG split outcome.

Telemetry & KPIs instrumented; dashboards track resolution rate, P1 solve time, chargebacks, and accuracy.

P) Why this works

Predictable: Users see outcomes before filing; disputes don’t feel arbitrary.

Efficient: Autoevidence and policy math drive 70%+ selfserve resolution.

Chargebackresilient: Every case quietly builds the artifacts needed to win bank disputes.

Fair & transparent: LBG keeps ledgers separate but summaries simple; buyer fees and deposits behave exactly as stated in §3.1/§3.9.

§4.12 — Payments, Payouts & Tax Center UX

Goal: Give buyers, sellers (talent), and studio hosts a clear, trustworthy money hub: easy payments, transparent fees, predictable payouts, multistate tax compliance, and clean audit trails—all LBGaware, policyaccurate, and built to scale across U.S. states.

A) Surfaces & Routes

Billing Home (roleaware): /billing
Snapshot tiles: Upcoming charges, Escrow on hold, Next payout, Tax status, Promotions wallet.

Payment Methods (buyers): /billing/payment-methods
Cards, ACH, default flag, 3DS history, ACH verification status.

Payouts (sellers/hosts): /billing/payouts
Bank accounts, payout schedule, reserves, Early Payout, ledger & statements.

Receipts & Invoices: /billing/receipts
Searchable list; LBG group receipts; adjustments, refunds, deposit holds; jurisdiction tax detail.

Promotions Wallet (usagebased): /billing/wallet
Boost/Featured spend, credit balance, invalidclick credits.

Tax Center: /billing/tax
W9 collection (electronic), TIN match status, edelivery consent, annual forms (1099), earnings summaries, exports.

Settings: /billing/settings
Billing contacts, invoice branding (brands), cost centers (buyers), currency = USD (launch).

B) Personas & What They Can Do

Buyer / Brand: add cards/ACH, pick default at checkout, download receipts & invoices, set cost centers/PO (when enabled), view chargeback status, manage RFP credit purchases.

Seller (Talent) / Host (Studio): connect bank for payouts, view payout ledger & statements, enable Early Payout (if eligible), see fee math per booking, complete W9 and download annual forms.

Dualrole accounts: both tabs visible; payouts combine earnings across roles and studios but keep perbooking lines separate for audit.

C) Money Model Recap (tooltips/FAQs)

Buyer service fee: 5% per booking (3% with ACH when enabled; min $3).

Provider fee: 12% of booking subtotal (talent: packages/addons/license/travel; studio: hourly/cleaning).
Discounts: Instant Book –1%, Trusted Pro –0.5%; highvalue tier: 10% on portion > $1,000.

Deposits (studios): authorization holds, not GMV; captured only on approved claims.

Escrow: funds held until Acceptance/Autoaccept (talent) or checkout complete (studio); then queued for payout.

Early Payout: optional, peruse 0.5% on the provider fee component only, eligibilitygated (Rep ≥ 85 + ID Verified).

Taxes: destinationbased, computed at checkout per jurisdiction; shown as a line on receipts.

All figures shown per booking and summarized per payout; LBG shows split lines.

D) Payment Methods (Buyer)

Add Card
Modal: card details; 3DS prompts when required. Set default; nickname (e.g., “Marketing Visa”).

Add ACH
Plaidstyle link or microdeposit fallback; ribbon: “ACH reduces buyer fee to 3%.”
Status: Pending verify • Verified • Expired consent.

Controls
Make default, remove, retry failed method, view 3DS auth log.

Security copy
“We never store your full card number; all data is tokenized by our PCIcompliant processor.”

E) Checkout Integration (Buyer)

Method selector surfaces saved Card/ACH; ACH badge shows reduced fee.

If method fails → inline retry, add new method, or switch to card.

Tax calculation (automated): at review step, we call the tax engine with role/service, price lines, date/time & service location, buyer info; engine returns jurisdiction breakdown (state/county/city) and total tax.

If the transaction is not taxable in that jurisdiction or we’re below nexus in that state, tax shows $0.00 with “Not applicable” tooltip.

If taxable, tax appears as a separate line with “View tax detail” (expandable).

For LBG, we compute tax per booking and present group total; deposit holds listed for Studio (authorization only).

F) Payout Setup & Status (Seller/Host)

Connect bank (US)
Instant verification preferred; fallback microdeposits.

Payout cadence
Default 48h postacceptance/checkout (business days).
Newprovider reserve: show current status (e.g., “First 3 payouts delayed up to 7 days” or “10% rolling reserve: 14 days”).
Early Payout (peruse): toggle per payout; shows fee estimate and eligibility.

Payout Ledger
Table: Date, Payout ID, Amount, Bookings count, Breakdown link.
Breakdown shows: gross, platform fees, tax (for info only), discounts, adjustments, taxes collected (buyerside), net, Early Payout fee (if used).
Status chips: Queued • Sent • Failed (retry) • On hold (reserve/chargeback).

Statements
Monthly CSV/PDF with subtotals by role vs studio (dualrole), fee totals, reserve movements.

G) Receipts & Invoices (Everyone)

List view
Filters: Date range, Role/Studio, City, LBG only, Adjustments, Refunds, Deposits.

Receipt detail (single booking)
Parties, date/time, city; lines: Subtotal, Buyer fee, Taxes (with jurisdiction breakdown link), Deposit authorization (studio), Discounts/Promos; Total charged.
Docs links (SOW, Releases, House Rules), acceptance/checkout timestamps; method (Card/ACH; last4).

Group Receipt (LBG)
Two sections: Talent | Studio; separate totals + Group summary at bottom.

Amendments
Change Orders, PostBooking Adjustments, Refunds → amended receipts with version timeline.

Download
PDF & CSV; brand buyers can upload logo for invoice headers.

H) Promotions Wallet (usagebased spend)

Balance & spend graph (daily).

Boost (CPC) and Featured (weekly) line items; invalidclick credits itemized.

Budget controls: daily caps, autopause on threshold.

Funding: Add funds (optional) or “Payasyougo” on card.
Policy: “Credits are not refundable; invalid clicks credited automatically.”

I) Tax Center (USfirst) — Expanded with automation & compliance

Profiles & Onboarding

W9 collection (electronic): guided web form for U.S. persons/entities; captures all W9 fields + perjury declaration + esignature; stores signed form; versioning on updates.

TIN match (soft): background name/TIN validation; surface “Mismatch — please correct” banner to reduce 1099 errors.

Blocking rule: payouts are blocked until a valid W9 is on file (prevents backup withholding complexity).

Edelivery consent: toggle & capture consent log for electronic delivery of yearend forms; fallback to paper mail only if required.

Marketplace Sales Tax (explainer tile)

“We’re required by state marketplace facilitator laws to collect and remit sales tax on taxable transactions in many states. Taxes are computed automatically at checkout based on service location and state/local rules.”

Link: “View where we collect tax” → knowledge base list (automaintained).

YearEnd Forms (1099)

Thresholdaware messaging: dynamic banners (“On track to receive a Form 1099NEC this year” or “Below threshold; no form expected”) driven by current IRS guidance (configurable—no hardcoded amounts).

Automated generation: system compiles annual earnings (gross), uses stored W9, and generates 1099 forms (efile to IRS + states via provider; Combined Federal/State Filing where supported).

Delivery: issue PDF in Tax Center (by Jan 31); notify via email/app; if no edelivery consent or not accessed by a cutoff, trigger paper mail via provider.

Status chips: Not required • Pending • Issued; download history retained.

Summaries & Exports

Annual summaries: gross earnings, fees, refunds, adjustments, reserves (for personal bookkeeping).

Exports: month/quarter CSV of gross, fees, refunds, adjustments, reserves.

Disclaimers

“We don’t provide tax advice; consult a tax professional.”

J) Chargebacks, Holds & Deposits

Chargebacks (buyerside): show case status & timeline; link to Support case; note temporary payout holds when applicable.

Seller/Host view: representment status; attached evidence; estimated decision window.

Deposits (studio): show authorization, expiry, capture/void/release; deposit capture generates separate receipt (no platform fee).

K) Notifications

Buyer: payment success/failure, ACH verified, refund issued, chargeback opened/closed.

Seller/Host: bank verified, payout queued/sent/failed, reserve changes, Early Payout executed, chargeback opened.

Tax: W9 needed, W9 mismatch, edelivery consent needed, yearend form available.

All notifications are SFW and privacysafe.

L) Security, Privacy & Compliance — Expanded

PCI DSS: handled by processor; we store only tokens.

KYC/KYB: processorhosted flows (name, DOB, EIN, beneficial owners for entities).

PII minimization: TINs and sensitive tax data encrypted at rest (fieldlevel), with separate key vault; strict RBAC; admin access justified and audited.

W9 esignature compliance: electronic W9 flow meets IRS requirements (capture consent, signature intent, full form fields, tamperevidence, reproducible PDF).

Edelivery compliance: capture affirmative consent; provide online access; allow optout; mail paper if consent not given or undeliverable.

Audit trail: tax engine calls (request/response summaries), tax lines per receipt, W9 versions, TIN match results (nonsensitive codes), 1099 issuance logs, edelivery view events.

Data retention: retain W9 and 1099 records per federal/state requirements; purge on schedule after statutory window.

Safe Mode: billing/tax emails never include explicit previews; receipts show only SFW descriptions.

M) Accessibility & Performance

Keyboardable forms; clear labels; ARIA for steppers/tables; highcontrast charts.

TTI targets: <2.0s for /billing; paginated tables with skeletons; exports generated asynchronously with download links.

N) Telemetry (money & tax events)

billing.open

payment_method.add/remove/default • ach.verify.start/success/fail • 3ds.challenge.start/success/fail

checkout.pay.success/fail (card|ach) • tax.calculate.request/response (jurisdictions, taxable=Y/N)

deposit.authorize/capture/void/release

payout.connect.start/success/fail • payout.queue/sent/fail/retry • reserve.apply/release • early_payout.use

receipt.view/download • receipt.tax_detail.view

wallet.boost.charge • wallet.featured.charge • invalid_click.credit.apply

tax.w9.submit • tax.w9.mismatch • tax.edelivery.consent • tax.form.generate/issued/download

chargeback.open/represent/won/lost

O) Acceptance Criteria (mark 4.12 FINAL)

Billing Home snapshot tiles for upcoming charges, escrow, next payout, wallet, tax status.

Payment Methods supports Card (3DS) & ACH, default selection, and checkout integration with ACH fee reduction to 3% (when enabled).

Checkout calls tax engine with role/service, location, and price lines; returns jurisdiction tax; receipts show tax line with jurisdiction breakdown; nontaxable or nonnexus cases show $0 with explanation.

Payouts page supports bank connect, reserve visibility, Early Payout peruse, ledger & statements with perbooking breakdowns (role vs studio).

Receipts include single and LBG group formats; support amendments; deposit authorizations shown distinctly.

Promotions Wallet shows Boost/Featured spend, credits, budgets; invalid click credits itemized.

Tax Center: electronic W9 collection with esig, TIN match, payout block until W9; edelivery consent; dynamic threshold banners; 1099 generation & delivery (PDF download; mail fallback); annual summaries & exports.
