Chargebacks & Deposits states visible to both sides; deposit captures generate separate receipts (no platform fee).

Security/Compliance: TIN encryption at rest, RBAC, audit trails (tax engine, W9 versions, 1099 issuance), IRScompliant eW9 & edelivery flows.

Accessibility/Performance targets met; Telemetry events fire as listed.

P) Why this works

Compliant by design: Destinationbased tax with jurisdiction detail + marketplace facilitator stance removes ambiguity and state risk.

Handsoff tax ops: Automated eW9, TIN match, and 1099 generation/edelivery put tax handling on autopilot with clear UX.

Transparent & trustworthy: Every receipt shows tax lines and calculations; users can download forms and summaries easily.

Scales with us: Citybycity growth doesn’t require rearchitecting money/tax flows; we add states, not complexity.

§4.13 — Verification Center UX

Goal: Make verification fast, private, and explainable—so good actors unlock trust and distribution quickly, while risky behavior is filtered early. Centralize all checks in one Verification Center, with clear benefits, transparent progress, firm privacy controls, and compliant workflows (ID, background, social metrics, studio).

A) Surfaces & Routes

Verification Center home: /verify (also topnav “Verify” badge if incomplete).

Contextual nudges: in profile editor, Checkout (Instant Book gating), Boost setup, Studio onboarding.

Admin console (Trust): /admin/verify queue with evidence, statuses, audits.

B) Verification Types & Badges (what users can earn)

ID Verified (Person) — government ID + selfie liveness; unlocks Instant Book, +20 DM credits, storage bump (to 30 GB), Verifiedonly search filter eligibility.

Trusted Pro (Backgroundchecked) — FCRAstyle consumer report; unlocks –0.5% provider fee nudge (floor rules apply), Boost eligibility, search nudge, storage bump to 50 GB.

SocialVerified — connected IG/YT/TT/X with API metrics; enables verified chips and perplatform filters in search (§1.2 addendum).

Studio Verified (Space) — proof of control (lease/utility/biz doc) + address validation + photos; shows Studio Verified badge and filter.

Phone & Email Verified — base checks (SMS/OTP, email link) always required for outbound messaging.

Optional Safety Aware (Phase 2) — short safety module + quiz; soft search nudge.

18+ only: All roles require dateofbirth confirmation; ID flow enforces 18+.

C) Benefits, Gating & Incentives (consistent with §§1.5, 3.2, 3.3)

ID Verified: Instant Book on, +20 DM credits/month, storage 30 GB, “Verifiedonly” buyer filter, mild ranking tiebreak.

Trusted Pro: fee nudge –0.5%, Boost eligibility, priority in RFP queues, storage 50 GB.

SocialVerified: metric chips on cards/profile; eligibility for “Top in Houston” showcases.

Studio Verified: appears in “Verified Studios” selector at checkout; eligibility for Featured Studio carousel.

Boost eligibility: requires ID Verified + Rep ≥ 70 + no strikes (§3.3).

Founding city subsidies: autoapplied coupon for first N completions per city (configurable; see §3.4).

D) Person — ID Verification Flow

Route: /verify/id → 4step wizard

About you — legal name, DOB, country/state; explain “Your public profile can use an alias; legal name is private.”

Document capture — front/back (DL/ID/Passport); autoOCR; MRZ when available.

Selfie liveness — short movement prompts; face match score presented as “passed/needs review.”

Review & consent — purpose, retention policy, and submit.

UX states:

Instant result: Passed → badge applied immediately.

Needs review: manual review SLA ≤ 24 h; user can continue using platform; IB remains gated until pass.

Fail: give concrete next steps (better lighting, correct doc type) and allow 2 more attempts before manual review.

Privacy: Store only required vectors/metadata; no raw images shown to other users; legal name never public unless user opts in.

E) Person — Background Check (Trusted Pro)

Route: /verify/background → compliant consent flow

Consent & disclosure: explain scope; this is not employment, but we follow FCRAstyle notices.

PII capture: SSN (masked in UI), address history (5 years), legal name variations.

Run checks: national/criminal sex offender, relevant county/state, global sanctions (where legal), identity verification.

Results taxonomy: Clear, Review, Consider with reason codes.

Adverse action (riskmanaged):

Preadverse notice with report copy & dispute instructions.

7day response window (configurable); investigation pause.

Final decision recorded; detailed internal notes; user notified.

Policy highlights:

Disqualifying offenses scoped to platform safety (e.g., violent crimes, stalking, trafficking).

Recency & rehabilitation considered (timeweighted); expunged/sealed records ignored where required.

Recheck cadence: every 12 months or upon safety trigger.

Cost: passthrough pricing with foundingcity subsidies (§3.4); status shows any coupon applied.

F) Social Verification (metrics & badges)

Route: /verify/social

Connect Instagram/YouTube/TikTok/X via OAuth; request readonly insights scopes; display exactly what we fetch.

Verified chips appear on profile/search cards (e.g., IG 182k • 2.8% ER, “Verified via API”).

Sync: nightly + manual refresh up to 3×/day (ratelimited); handles token expiry gracefully.

Unlink: allowed; metrics fall back to selfreported (hidden by default unless buyer toggles “include selfreported”).

Manual verify path for large accounts if API unavailable (proof post, domain verification, lightweight review).

FanSubscription Creators: supported as Creators; no explicit content ingested; we verify the business account identity/metrics only (Safe Mode).

G) Studio Verification (space owners/hosts)

Route: /verify/studio/{studioId}

Ownership/control proof — upload lease/utility/biz registration, names must reasonably match host profile or company.

Address validation — geocode + mail code optional; exact address stays private until booking confirmation.

Space evidence — frontage photo + interior set (SFW) + entrance signage; EXIF timestamp hints accepted.

Rules & safety — hazards toggles, House Rules review, emergency contact.

Review & badge — “Studio Verified” with verification date; reverify every 12 months or on change.

What buyers see: Studio Verified badge, neighborhood (not exact address), rules summary.

H) Security & Safety Addons

Phone/email verified (required); 2FA optional (strongly recommended for payout changes).

Trusted Contact (optional): can receive checkin/out timestamps and generalarea location on active bookings.

Emergency PIN (Phase 2): inapp PIN sends silent alert to Safety with live thread + booking IDs.

Device trust (Phase 2): flag new devices; email confirmation for highrisk actions.

I) Privacy, Data Minimization & User Controls

Data we keep (minimum): doc type, issuing country, last 4 of ID, pass/fail tokens, facematch score bucket, verification timestamps.

What we don’t keep: full ID number image beyond retention window; live selfie video frames; background raw data beyond provider access window.

Retention: ID/Studio artifacts ≤ 30–90 days postdecision (configurable); outcome + reference kept longer for audit.

Download my data: provide verification outcomes and submitted documents (where lawful) upon request.

Alias vs legal: users may display an alias; legal name stays private except on tax/legal docs.

J) Admin Console (Trust) & Risk Engine

Queue: ID/Studio/Background/Social with SLA badges; prioritize “needs review,” highvalue sellers, foundingcity cohorts.

Detail view: sidebyside evidence, vendor decisions, facematch score, doc OCR fields, address geocode, rule acceptance logs.

Actions: approve/deny/require resubmission; redact PII; add internal notes; trigger recheck; apply sanctions (IB off, Boost suppression).

Audit: immutable logs (who/when/what changed), reason codes, document hashes.

Risk signals: velocity of failed attempts, device mismatch, suspicious patterns → safety investigation flag.

K) Notifications & Status

ID: Submitted → Passed / Needs review / Action required.

Background: In progress → Clear / Review / Consider; Preadverse + Adverse notices with next steps.

Social: Connected → Verified metrics available; token expired → Reconnect.

Studio: Under review → Verified / Action required; reverify reminders at 11 months.

System nudges: “Unlock Instant Book with ID,” “Get Trusted Pro for fee nudge and Boosts,” “Verify studio to appear in Verified selector.”

L) Accessibility & Performance

All flows keyboardable; large tap targets on mobile capture; clear alt text for instructions.

Use progress steppers, skeleton loaders; show typical decision times (e.g., “Most ID checks < 2 min”) as informative copy.

Support lowbandwidth: allow photo upload from gallery if live capture fails.

M) Telemetry

verify.center.open

verify.id.start/success/fail/retry/manual_review

verify.background.consent/start/clear/review/consider/pre_adverse/adverse

verify.social.connect/refresh/unlink (platform), verify.social.metrics.view

verify.studio.start/submit/approve/reject/reverify_due

verify.nudge.view/click

risk.flag (reason=velocity|doc_mismatch|device)

privacy.export.request/complete

N) Acceptance Criteria (mark 4.13 FINAL)

Verification Center hub live at /verify, showing progress bars, benefits, and next steps by type.

ID Verification: document + selfie liveness, instant decision or 24h manual review; 18+ enforced; alias support; privacy copy present.

Background Check (Trusted Pro): consented, FCRAstyle notices, clear/review/consider outcomes, preadverse/adverse workflow with 7day window; annual recheck; fee surfaced; subsidies supported.

Social Verification: OAuth for IG/YT/TT/X, nightly sync + manual refresh (3/day), verified chips in search/profile, safemode handling for FanSub creators.

Studio Verification: ownership proof, address validation, photo evidence, rules; badge on approval; reverify cadence; partial address privacy.

Gating & incentives wired: Instant Book requires ID Verified; Boost eligibility requires Trusted Pro + Rep ≥ 70; storage bumps (30 GB / 50 GB); DM credit increases; fee nudge –0.5% for Trusted Pro.

Admin console with queue, actions, audits, sanctions, and risk flags; immutable logs.

Privacy & retention: PII minimization, encryption at rest, retention windows, downloadmydata.

Notifications and nudge campaigns implemented; Accessibility/Performance baselines met; Telemetry events firing.

O) Why this works

Low friction, high signal: Users see exactly why to verify and what they get—conversiondriving perks rather than busywork.

Safety you can feel: Clear standards, FCRAstyle fairness, and privacybydesign build trust with models/creators and buyers.

Search quality improves: Verified supply rises to the top without “paytowin”; risk is filtered before bookings.

Operates at scale: Vendorbacked checks, admin SLAs, audits, and recheck cadence keep trust programs healthy citybycity.

§4.14.1 — Access Governance & Security

Goal: Ensure admins can do their jobs safely, quickly, and accountably. Enforce leastprivilege, protect PII, require explicit justification for sensitive actions, and make every change auditable and alertable.

A) Principles

Least privilege by default — roles get only what they need.

PII is special — tax/identity data behind extra gates; mask by default.

Justintime elevation — timeboxed, reasoned elevation for highrisk actions.

Twoperson rule — critical money/safety moves require a second approver.

Full traceability — immutable audit for who/what/why/when, with diffs.

Separation of duties — no single role can initiate and approve the same highrisk change.

Environment clarity — bright “Sandbox/Prod” labeling; no crosscontamination.

B) Roles & Permission Scopes (RBAC)

Roles (no nesting; combine if needed):

Super Admin (restricted to founders/CTO): feature flags, configs, emergency kills.

Trust & Safety: verifications, sanctions, strikes, IB toggle, content quarantine.

Support: tickets/disputes, policybound refunds (within caps), message redaction.

Finance: payouts/reserves, manual adjustments (with twoperson approval), chargebacks, coupons.

Tax & Compliance: W9/TIN dashboard, 1099 runs, nexus map overrides (dualapproval).

Content: reviews/profile/feed moderation, keyword lists, SafeMode thresholds (preview only).

Ops (City/Market): promos, CPC floors, Featured slots, foundingcity perks.

Marketing: homepage modules, email templates, coupon creation (no money moves).

ReadOnly Auditor: dashboards/exports; masked PII; no changes.

Permission scopes:

PIIBasic: email, phone (masked by default; unmask requires reason).

PIISensitive: address, DOB (unmask gate).

PIITax: TIN, W9 PDFs, 1099 (Tax role only; dualapproval to unmask).

PIIBackground: consumer report artifacts (Trust only; FCRA training required).

MoneyCritical: manual payout, fee override, deposit capture >$1k (twoperson rule).

SafetyCritical: IB suppression, account hold (reason & SLA tag).

C) Login, Session & Device Controls

SSO (admin): enforce SSO (e.g., Okta/Google), 2FA required (TOTP or hardware key).

IP/Geo rules (optional): block risky geos; allow admin office IPs.

Session policy: 12hour max; 15minute idle timeout; reauth for sensitive actions.

Device trust: label devices; new device prompts email confirmation.

Environment banner: persistent “PROD”/“SANDBOX” badge with color coding.

D) JustinTime Elevation & TwoPerson Approvals

JIT elevation: click “Request elevation” → select scope (e.g., MoneyCritical), add reason + ticket link → manager/peer approves → 30–120 min token granted → autorevoke and log.

Twoperson rule: actions requiring cosign (examples):

Manual payout, fee override, deposit capture >$1k, tax nexus overrides, adverse action finalization (background), permanent account disable.

UI shows “Awaiting cosign” chip; approver sees payload diff before confirming.

E) PII Handling & Redaction

Masked by default: show •••• for sensitive fields; “Unmask (reason)” button with scope check.

Download controls: exporting tables with PII requires scope + download reason; big red banner with “Contains PII.”

Inline redaction: Support/Content can redact userposted PII from threads/reviews (stores original hashed reference; shows “Redacted (Support)” tag).

PII view ledger: who accessed what PII, when, and why; exportable for audits.

F) Impersonation vs. ViewAs

ViewAs (safe default): renders the UI with PII masked; no write actions; used for reproducing UI issues.

Impersonate (restricted): requires JIT elevation + reason; write actions allowed, but money moves disabled in impersonation; session banner “IMPERSONATING {user}”; all actions doublelogged (actor + target).

Guardrails: cannot impersonate Super Admins; timeboxed; logs include IP/device.

G) Audit & Change History

Immutable audit log capturing: actor, role, IP/device, route, entity IDs, before/after diff, reason code, linked ticket/case.

Entity Timelines: on users, bookings, payouts, disputes, promotions: chronological stack of admin/user/system events.

Searchable audits: by actor, entity, reason, time range; export to CSV/PDF; retention policies applied.

Legal hold: mark entities to suspend purge (links to §4.14.15).

H) Admin UI Patterns (Safety by Design)

Action drawers with required reason, preview of impact, and secondary confirmation for risky moves.

Risk badges (P0/P1/P2) appear on threads/safety cases; timers visible.

Kill switches (flagged in §4.14.2): big, red, twostep with summary (what services will pause, who’s impacted).

Environmentaware copy: SANDBOX disallows emails/payouts; “simulation only” labels.

I) Alerts & Anomaly Detection

Highrisk action alerts to Slack/email: manual payouts, deposit captures, fee overrides, permanent disables, tax overrides.

Anomaly monitors:

“TIN views by a single admin > N/day”

“Refunds issued > $X in 1h”

“IB suppressions > Y/day by same actor”

“Mass role changes”

Daily digest: PII views, highrisk actions, failed JIT requests; link to audits.

J) Telemetry (Admin Access Events)

admin.login.success/fail (role) • admin.session.timeout • admin.device.trust.add

admin.elevate.request/approve/deny/expire (scope, reason)

admin.twoperson.request/approve/deny (action)

admin.pii.unmask (field, reason) • admin.export.download (scope)

admin.viewas.start/end • admin.impersonate.start/end

admin.alert.sent (type) • admin.anomaly.detected (rule_id)

audit.view (filters) • audit.export

K) Acceptance Criteria (mark 4.14.1 FINAL)

SSO + mandatory 2FA for all admin roles; session/timeouts enforced; environment banner shows clearly.

RBAC roles & scopes implemented; sensitive scopes (PIITax, PIIBackground, MoneyCritical, SafetyCritical) enforced at API and UI.

JIT elevation with reason and approver; timeboxed tokens; logs captured.

Twoperson approval on manual payouts, fee overrides, deposit capture >$1k, tax nexus overrides, final adverse actions.

PII masked by default; unmask requires scope + reason; PII access ledger visible and exportable.

ViewAs (readonly, masked) vs Impersonate (restricted, no money moves) implemented with banners and dual logging.

Immutable audit with before/after diffs on entities; searchable and exportable; legal hold flag present.

Alerts & anomaly rules active; Slack/email wiring; daily digest generated.

UI safety patterns: action drawers require reasons; confirmations for risky actions; killswitch pattern in §4.14.2.

Telemetry events fire for all listed actions.

L) Why this works

Prevents accidental harm (leastprivilege, masked defaults, confirmations).

Stops malicious misuse (JIT + twoperson rule + anomaly alerts + immutable audits).

Speeds legit work (viewas to debug safely; impersonation gated for rare cases).

Regulatoryfriendly (PII access ledger, legal holds, full diffs).

§4.14.2 — Config & Feature Flags

Goal: Give Ops the nocode levers to launch, tune, and safeguard the marketplace citybycity and rolebyrole. Ship a typed Config Registry, targeted Feature Flags, safe rollouts/rollbacks, and guardrails so the team can change policy, pricing, ranking, promos, and safety without deployments.

A) Scope & Principles

Single source of truth: a versioned, typed registry consumed by all services (search, booking, billing, trust, promos).

Targeted overrides: global < US < state < city < role < cohort (most specific wins).

Safety rails: validation, min/max bounds, twoperson approvals for money/safety keys.

Observable: every read/write logged; diffs, rollbacks, and blastradius previews.

Fast & reversible: staged rollouts, scheduled publishes, oneclick revert.

Auditfirst: immutable history with actor, reason, before/after.

B) Config Registry (model & precedence)

Entity: config_set

Keys: namespaced (fees.provider_pct, refunds.talent.bands, search.weights.rep …).

Value types: boolean, int, float, money, string, enum, json (schema enforced).

Scope: global|US|state|city|role|cohort (compound scopes allowed, e.g., city=HOU,role=studio).

Versioning: semantic increment; store diffs and publish notes.

Validation: schema + business rules (e.g., fees.provider_pct >= 0.09).

Precedence: mostspecific scope overrides broader scopes; unresolved keys inherit.

Workflows

Draft → Validate → Preview → Approve (2person for sensitive) → Schedule/Publish → Monitor → Rollback.

Preview: simulate impact on last N searches/bookings; show KPI guardrails.

Rollback: pick prior version; instant invalidate caches; autonotify services.

C) Feature Flags (targeting & kill switches)

Flag types: boolean (on/off), percentage (staged rollout), variant (A/B), targeting (by scope/attribute).

Targeting: by city, state, role, cohort, rep_score, verified, trusted_pro, ab_cell.

Kill switches (hard off with graceful fallbacks):

flags.instant_book.enabled

flags.promotions.boosts.enabled / flags.promotions.featured.enabled

flags.ach.enabled (fallback to card; buyer fee reverts to 5%)

flags.studio.deposits.enabled

flags.safe_mode.enabled (enforce strict previews)

flags.lbg.enabled (Linked Booking Group off → separate flows)

D) Editable Keys by Domain (typed, with guardrails)

All keys accept overrides at any scope unless noted. “(S)” requires twoperson approval.

D1. Fees & Money

fees.provider_pct float (0.09–0.15) (S) — default 0.12

fees.buyer_pct float (0.00–0.10) (S) — default 0.05

fees.buyer_pct_ach float (0.00–0.05) (S) — default 0.03

fees.instant_book_nudge_pct float (0–0.02) — default 0.01

fees.trusted_pro_nudge_pct float (0–0.01) — default 0.005

fees.high_value.threshold_money money — default $1,000

fees.high_value.rate_pct float (0.08–0.12) — default 0.10

fees.floor_pct float — global floor 0.09 (nonoverridable)

D2. Refunds, Cancellations & Delivery

refunds.talent.bands json[] — e.g.,

[

{"min_hours_before":168,"buyer_refund_pct":1.0},

{"min_hours_before":48,"buyer_refund_pct":0.5},

{"min_hours_before":0,"buyer_refund_pct":0.0}

]

refunds.studio.bands json[] (studiospecific)

delivery.acceptance_window_days int (1–7) — default 3

delivery.revision_rounds_default int (0–3) — default 1

ugc.min_live_days_post_booking int (0–14) — default 3

booking.auto_accept_days int (1–7) — default 3

D3. Travel & Distance

travel.ib_radius_miles int (0–100) — default 25

travel.max_distance_miles int (0–300) — default 100

travel.fee_bands json[] — e.g.,

[

{"max_miles":10,"fee_money":0},

{"max_miles":25,"fee_money":25},

{"max_miles":50,"fee_money":60}

]

travel.calc_method enum (band|per_mile|flat_by_city) — default band

D4. Search, Ranking & Safe Mode

search.weights.distance float (0–2) — default 0.8

search.weights.price float (0–2) — default 0.6

search.weights.rep_tiebreak float (0–2) — default 1.0

search.facet_toggles json — per role: enable/disable measurements, price_range, perplatform social, engagement

safe_mode.enabled bool — default true

nsfw.visibility enum (off|artistic_only|on_gated) — default artistic_only

nsfw.keyword_denylist string[] — default curated set

classifier.threshold.preview float (0.50–0.95) — default 0.80

D5. Promotions (Boosts/Featured)

promos.boosts.cpc_floor.city_role json map — e.g., { "HOU:model": 0.90 } (S)

promos.boosts.qs_weight_bid float (0–1) — default 0.5

promos.boosts.qs_weight_quality float (0–1) — default 0.5

promos.boosts.density_cap_per_20 int (0–3) — default 2

promos.boosts.above_fold_cap int (0–2) — default 1

promos.boosts.freq_caps json — { "per_session":2, "per_day":5, "cooldown_hours":4 }

promos.featured.weekly_price.city_role json map (S)

promos.eligibility.rule string (DSL) — default id_verified && rep>=70 && !recent_strike

D6. Verification & Reputation

verify.ib.requires_id bool — default true

verify.boost.requires_trusted_pro bool — default true

verify.subsidy.count_city int — default 300

verify.recheck_days.background int (180–540) — default 365

rep.weights json (bounded) — e.g.,

{"reviews":0.40,"reliability":0.25,"responsiveness":0.10,"verifications":0.15,"recent":0.10}

rep.decay.half_life_days int (30–180) — default 90

rep.max_change_per_30d float (0.0–20.0) — default 10.0

D7. Support & Disputes

support.sla_hours json — { "P0":1, "P1":24, "P2":48 }

disputes.escalation_hours int — default 72

refunds.goodwill.limit_money money — default $100 (per case)

evidence.required_kinds string[] — e.g., ["chat","deliverables","timestamp"]

D8. Tax & Compliance

tax.ach_discount_enabled bool — default true

tax.nexus.states string[] — financemanaged (readonly to Ops) (S)

tax.category_map json — service → tax code (admin editable with dual approval) (S)

tax.edelivery.default_consent bool — default true

tax.engine.timeout_ms int — default 1500

D9. Messaging, Storage & Limits

dm.credits.new_conversations int — default 40

dm.credits.bonus.id_verified int — default 20

dm.credits.bonus.trusted_pro int — default 20

dm.nudge.per_thread_per_day int — default 1

storage.quota.free_gb int — default 15

storage.quota.id_verified_gb int — default 30

storage.quota.trusted_pro_gb int — default 50

D10. Studios

studio.deposit.default_pct float (0–0.50) — default 0.20

studio.deposit.cap_money money — default $250

studio.cleaning_fee.min_money money — default $25

studio.blacklist.amenities string[]

D11. City Ops & Perks

city.perks.buyer_fee_holiday_pct float (0–0.05) (S)

city.perks.provider_fee_discount_pct float (0–0.02) (S)

city.perks.verification_subsidy.count int — default 300

city.perks.window json — { "start":"2025-12-01", "end":"2026-01-15" }

E) Rollouts, Scheduling & Guardrails

Staged rollout: 1% → 10% → 50% → 100% (by city/role/cohort); automonitor KPIs (dropdown presets).

Scheduling: publish windows (start/end), local timezone awareness.

Guardrails: block publish if validations fail (e.g., provider fee < floor) or if simulated KPI deltas exceed thresholds (e.g., est. takerate −> −3%+).

Rollback: oneclick revert; auto cachebust; notify affected modules (webhooks).

Approvals: twoperson approval required for fees, promo pricing, tax category map, nexus list, NSFW visibility.

Dryrun: compute outcomes (no apply) for 24h; log deltas to admin dashboard.

F) Admin UI (Editor)

Form + JSON dual view; live validation; inline hints; example payloads.

Diff viewer (before/after) with reason code & ticket link.

Impact preview: sample searches/rankings, bookingfee math, promo inventory fill.

Scope picker: breadcrumb of inheritances; “show effective value” at any scope.

History & rollback: timeline of publishes; pin “golden” configs.

G) Service Consumption & Caching

Read path: services request effective_config(scope, key); library resolves precedence + local cache.

Caching: inmemory TTL + eventdriven invalidation (pub/sub); 99p read latency < 5ms.

Bootsafe: services start with last known snapshot; failopen defaults for noncritical keys; failclosed for safety/money keys.

Schema shared package to avoid drift; CI blocks breaking changes.

H) Observability & Alerts

Config read metrics: hit/miss, stale fetch, latency; perservice dashboards.

Drift detection: compare service snapshot vs registry head; alert on mismatch.

Anomaly rules:

“Fee change > 1% absolute in 24h across >2 cities”

“NSFW visibility toggled in Safe Mode city”

“CPC floors moved > $0.20 in 1h”

Slack/email alerts on publish/rollback for sensitive domains.

I) Telemetry (config events)

config.edit.start/validate/fail/success

config.preview.run/result (KPI deltas)

config.publish.request/approve/deny

config.publish.start/done/rollback

config.read (service, scope, key) • config.cache.invalidate

flags.toggle (name, targeting, % rollout)

J) Acceptance Criteria (mark 4.14.2 FINAL)

Typed Config Registry with scopes, precedence, validation, versioning, and immutable history.

Feature Flags with targeting, staged rollout, and kill switches wired to fallbacks.

Editable keys implemented for Fees, Refunds/Delivery, Travel, Search/Ranking/Safe Mode, Promotions, Verification/Rep, Support/Disputes, Tax, Messaging/Storage, Studios, City Perks.

Twoperson approvals enforced for sensitive keys; guardrails prevent outofbounds settings.

Preview & simulation tools display impact on recent searches/bookings; KPI thresholds gate publishes.

Scheduling & rollback operational; cache invalidation with pub/sub; service snapshots bootsafe.

Observability dashboards + alerts for config publishes, drift, and anomalies.

Telemetry events fired for edits, previews, publishes, reads, and rollbacks.

K) Example Playbooks (no code required)

Houston buyerfee holiday: set fees.buyer_pct=0.00 for city=HOU with end date → publish staged → autorevert.

Tighten Safe Mode: raise classifier.threshold.preview to 0.85 for state=TX after a spike; rollback if CTR drops >5%.

Add travel fee band: append 25–50mi at $60 for city=DAL; preview geosim; publish.

Ranking tune: bump search.weights.rep_tiebreak from 1.0→1.2 in HOU:model; A/B 50/50; evaluate conversion.

Deposit policy update: increase studio.deposit.cap_money to $400 for LA; schedule for tomorrow 09:00 local; rollback link armed.

Boost economics: lift promos.boosts.cpc_floor.city_role["HOU:model"] to $1.00; monitor ROAS; revert if invalid clicks >7%.

§4.14.3 — Trust & Safety Ops

Goal: Prevent harm, respond fast, and preserve marketplace integrity. Provide Ops with clear triage, evidencedriven decisions, proportionate sanctions, and auditable outcomes—while protecting user privacy and complying with policy and law.

A) Scope & Inputs

What flows in:

Safety reports (from chat, booking, profile, studio)

Automated risk signals (rate limits, device anomalies, classifier flags)

Verification results (ID, Background, Social, Studio)

Content flags (handoff to §4.14.4 for final content actions)

Dispute escalations with safety context (handoff from §4.14.5)

Case types (examples):

P0: Imminent harm, threats, stalking, underduress, doxxing, sexual coercion, child safety.

P1: Onprem access failures, harassment, boundary violations, unsafe location, escorting/illegal solicitation.

P2: Misrepresentation (age/identity/portfolio), spam/scams, offplatform payment steering, policy nudity violations (previews).

B) SLAs & Queues

P0 queue: 15 min first response, 60 min mitigation target (freeze, contact, takedown).

P1 queue: 30 min first response, 24 h resolution target.

P2 queue: 24 h first response, 72 h resolution target.

Queue view includes: severity chip, time since opened, linked booking/thread, user roles, location (city), verification badges, prior strikes, and live status (e.g., “IB suppressed,” “payouts frozen”).

C) Triage & Intake (Agent Playbook)

Verify severity (P0/P1/P2) from report details; upgrade severity if signals suggest escalation.

Is there an active/linked booking? Pull: SOW/House Rules, checkin/out timestamps, areashare logs, studio rules, delivery manifest.

Preserve evidence (oneclick): chat transcripts, attachments, IP/device, booking metadata, profile revisions → writeonce storage with hash (chainofcustody).

Immediate controls (if needed):

Payout freeze (partial) on involved bookings.

IB suppression on reported party (auto for P0).

DM ratelimit for suspected spam.

Profile quarantine (search hidden) pending review.

Contact counterparties via case thread (templated, safe language).

Decide: resolve, sanction, or escalate to Neutral Review Panel (multiagent decision) for ambiguous, highimpact cases.

D) Evidence: What Good Looks Like

System logs: booking creation/acceptance, checkin/out, location fuzz logs, deliverables acceptance, payment attempts (incl. offplatform keywords).

Conversations: timestamped chat, read receipts, media (with original metadata), message redactions visible in audit.

Studio artifacts: house rules, access codes, deposit photos/evidence, door logs if provided.

Verification: ID/Background outcomes, studio proofs, social connect status.

User history: cancellations/noshows, prior strikes, dispute outcomes, responsetime stats.

Agent tooling: sidebyside view, sensitive PII masked by default; “Unmask (reason)” gated by §4.14.1 scopes.

E) Sanctions & Remedies (Proportionate Ladder)

Soft controls:

Education notice (policy excerpt + safer alternative).

DM throttling (reduced newconversation credits for 7–30 days).

IB off for N days (auto for P1/P2; indefinite for P0 until cleared).

Boost suppression (removes promoted eligibility temporarily).

Strikes (expire after N days unless renewed):

Strike1 (30 days): visible internally; mild ranking dampening.

Strike2 (90 days): IB off, search demotion, promotions blocked.

Strike3 (180 days): account hold or suspension; payout freezes resolved per policy.

Hard outcomes:

Account suspension (reversible with review)

Permanent disable (twoperson approval; limited to egregious or repeated harm)

Studio delisting (Studio Verified badge revoked)

Law enforcement referral (via §4.14.15 workflow)

Autosanction triggers (configurable in §4.14.2):

≥2 P1 cases in 90 days → auto Strike2

Any P0 credible harm → Strike3 + suspension

Repeated offplatform payment attempts after warnings → IB off + DM throttle

F) Risk Rules Engine (ConfigDriven)

Signals: newaccount velocity, message spam patterns, offplatform payment phrases, device mismatch, sudden rating bursts, selfclick promos, NSFW keyword hits.

Actions: autothrottle DMs, quarantine profile, flag to T&S queue, suppress IB, block Boosts, require reverify.

Explainability: every auto action records rule_id, inputs, and confidence; surfaced in case panel; tunable via §4.14.2 (weights/thresholds).

Failures safe: false positives decay; manual override clears the flag and adds rule feedback.

G) Background & Identity (Link to §4.13)

Background “Consider/Review” → T&S evaluates role fit, recency, rehabilitation; adverse action flow (preadverse notice, 7day response).

Underage concerns: immediate suspension, ID reverify, documentation gate; report via child safety playbook if credible.

Impersonation/catfish: require live selfie/ID recheck; quarantine portfolio; strike if intent to defraud.

H) StudioSpecific Safety

Access failure (P1): verify instructions sent, code validity; if failure owed to host → refund policy path + deposit void; if guest misconduct → partial capture per rules.

Unsafe conditions: hazards misrepresented → Strike & delist until corrected; require updated photos.

Thirdparty conflicts: landlord complaints or neighbor incidents → temporary delist; require documentation.

I) Buyer & Provider Protections (Immediate Mitigations)

Trusted Contact ping (if enabled) for delayed checkout / SOS keywords.

Relocation: for studio lockout, offer curated alternates (Houston list) + goodwill credit (config limits in §4.14.2).

Emergency path: surface “Get help now” → safety card (nonlawenforcement resources) + prompt to contact 911 for imminent danger (we don’t intercept emergencies).

J) Appeals & Neutral Review

Appeal window: 14 days from sanction; one appeal per case unless new evidence.

Neutral Review Panel: 2 T&S agents + 1 crossfunction (Support/Legal); majority rule; document rationale.

Outcome: uphold, downgrade sanction, or overturn; update strike count and Reputation (§4.10).

Transparency: user receives outcome with policy citations; internal notes logged.

K) Integrations & Handoffs

Content: NSFW/preview violations routed to §4.14.4 with case linkage; content removal reasons synchronized.

Support/Disputes: safetycolored disputes use this case ID; refund calculators reflect sanctions/policy.

Finance: payout freeze flags; chargeback evidence packs pull T&S evidence.

Legal & Records: LE requests, subpoenas, child safety referrals via §4.14.15 with limited PII access.

L) Metrics & Quality

Operational KPIs

P0/P1 firstresponse SLA hit rate

Time to mitigation (P0 median ≤ 60m)

Safety incident rate per 1,000 bookings (target downward trend)

False positive rate (autosanctions)

Appeal overturn rate (target < 10%)

Repeat offender rate (strike recurrence within 180 days)

IB suppression count & duration (monitor collateral impact)

Quality controls

Weekly case sampling; peer QA rubric; calibration sessions.

Rule feedback loop: promote/demote rules based on accuracy.

M) Admin UI — Trust Console (Key Interactions)

Case detail: timeline, linked entities, evidence panel, sanctions drawer with reason codes, strike history.

Oneclick controls: IB off/on, DM throttle, Boost suppression, payout freeze toggle (with reason).

Evidence pack builder: export ZIP/PDF for chargebacks or legal (hashed manifest).

Policy helper: inline matrix preview (refund/cancellation) based on city/role at incident time.

N) Telemetry (Trust & Safety)

ts.case.open (severity, source) • ts.case.upgrade (P1→P0) • ts.case.resolve (outcome)

ts.evidence.attach (type) • ts.freeze.payout.toggle • ts.ib.toggle

ts.sanction.apply (type=strike1/2/3|suspend|disable) • ts.sanction.expire

ts.rule.fire (rule_id, confidence) • ts.rule.override

ts.appeal.open/resolve (result) • ts.export.pack (purpose)

O) Acceptance Criteria (mark 4.14.3 FINAL)

Queues & SLAs for P0/P1/P2 with severity chips and timers.

Triage workflow with evidence preservation (hashed), booking/thread linkage, and immediate controls.

Sanctions ladder implemented (education → throttles → strikes → suspension/disable) with expiries and autotriggers.

Risk rules engine active; configurable thresholds/weights via §4.14.2; explainable rule hits.

Background/ID links honored; adverse action flow for background checks.

Studio safety flows: access failure, unsafe conditions, delist/reverify.

Appeals & Neutral Review process with documented outcomes and updates to Reputation.

Integrations to Content, Support/Disputes, Finance, and Legal; payout freeze flags honored.

Trust Console UI supports oneclick controls, evidence packs, and policy helper.

Metrics & QA dashboards live; Telemetry events fire as listed.

P) Why this works

Fast where it matters (P0/P1 timers, oneclick mitigations) and fair where it’s complex (evidence, neutral review, expiring strikes).

Prevention + response: a configurable rule engine reduces incidents; strong playbooks resolve the rest.

Auditable endtoend: preserved evidence, hashed manifests, reasoned decisions, and measured quality.

§4.14.4 — Content Moderation

Goal: Keep the platform SFW by default, protect users from harmful or deceptive content, and maintain highquality discovery. Combine automated screening, human review, clear policies, and appeals—with auditable outcomes and city/role tunability via §4.14.2.

A) Scope & Content Types

Moderated surfaces

Profiles (avatar, cover, bio), Service Profiles (per role), Portfolio (images/videos), Feed posts, Reviews & responses, Studio pages (photos, amenities), RFP briefs (buyer text), Gig listings/cards (search cards, ribbons).

Not public but scanned

DM attachments (virus only; policy checks on reported threads), Deliverables manifests (names/sizes/hash only), House Rules/SOW text (for prohibited clauses).

Policy anchors (SFW)

Allowed: artistic, nonsexual imagery; fashion/fitness/glamour; implied nudity that remains SFW in previews.

Prohibited: explicit sexual content; pornographic poses; fetish content; solicitation of sexual services; child/younglooking sexualized content; hateful symbols; doxxing/PII in public fields; offplatform payment steering.

OnlyFans / Fansubscription creators: supported as “Creators”, but no explicit content is uploaded or displayed; metrics/identity only (per §4.13).

B) Pipeline Overview (Upload → Screen → Publish)

Upload → temporary pending state (placeholders with skeletons).

Automated screening (subsecond):

NSFW classifier (preview threshold from §4.14.2 classifier.threshold.preview).

Nudity mask: detects areola/genital zones; triggers autocrop/blur overlay tool.

OCR for embedded PII (emails, phone #, payment handles).

Text filters on titles/captions/hashtags (slurs, sexual solicitation, offplatform payment phrases).

Duplicate/perceptual hash check (copyright/banlist).

Virus/malware scan (for videos).

Policy decision:

Autopublish if fully SFW (green).

Borderline → autoblur/autocrop; publish with “sensitive” overlay; enqueue human review SLA ≤ 24h.

Block & queue if explicit/illegal or disallowed text (red).

Human review (moderation queue) → Approve / BlurandPublish / Remove with reason / Escalate to T&S (§4.14.3).

Publish → search cards always use SFW thumbnails; portfolio detail uses SFW or blur taptoreveal (if marked sensitive but allowed).

Firsttime uploader policy: premoderate first N=10 portfolio items (editable via §4.14.2) to set quality baseline.

C) Queues & SLAs

Priority A (P0/P1 handoff from T&S): explicit sexual/child safety/violent threats → immediate takedown, SLA 15–30 min.

Priority B (policy/borderline): nudity boundaries, hate symbols, offplatform payment steering → SLA 24 h.

Priority C (quality/metadata): miscategorization, spam, duplicate/loweffort → SLA 72 h.

Queue cards show: surface (profile/portfolio/feed), uploader role, city, verification badges, classifier confidence, prior violations, and report count.

D) Rules by Surface

Profiles & Service Profiles

Avatar/cover must be SFW; bios may not include contact handles or payment details; location granular to city (no home address).

Role tags and NSFW switches are not usercontrolled; they derive from content classification and policy.

Portfolio

Must remain SFW in preview. If artistic nudity is present, the system enforces autocrop/blur for thumbnails and grid previews.

No exposed genitals; female nipples not visible in previews; implied nudity ok with strategic coverage.

Feed posts

Same preview constraints as portfolio; no explicit calltooffplatform payments; collaboration tags require consent (accept/deny).

Reviews

Disallow slurs, harassment, doxxing, explicit language; allow experiencebased criticism.

Only verified booking participants can post (per §1.4).

Studios

Images show space/amenities only; no explicit sets; safety disclosures required for hazardous features.

RFP briefs

Disallow sexualized gig requests; disallow offplatform payment instructions; require budget ranges.

E) Automated Signals & Thresholds (configurable via §4.14.2)

NSFW classifier with three bands: allow, sensitiveallow (blur), block.

OCR PII detection: email/phone/payment handles → autoredact in public captions; warn uploader.

Keyword denylist (nsfw.keyword_denylist): sexual solicitation, hate slurs, offplatform payment verbs/handles.

Hash banlist: known abusive images (internal + partner lists).

Spam heuristics: rapid identical posts, URL stuffing, engagement bait → throttle.

F) UserFacing UX

During upload: live preview shows autocrop/blur; user can adjust crop within SFW bounds (hard stops).

After decision:

Approved: normal publish.

Sensitiveallow: blur overlay with “Tap to view” + policy tooltip.

Removed: user receives reason code, policy excerpt, and appeal link.

Tagging: tagged collaborators must accept before content shows on their profile/feed.

Education nudges: “Previews must be SFW—here’s how to crop/cover.”

G) Enforcement & Escalation

Autoactions on violation counts (rolling 30 days):

2 content removals → Content warning + education card.

3 removals → DM throttle + search demotion.

4 removals → IB off and Boost suppression; queue to T&S.

Hard violations (explicit sexual content, child/younglooking sexualized, hate symbols) → immediate takedown + Strike2/3 (T&S ladder) and potential suspension.

Appeals: within 14 days; reviewed by a separate moderator or Neutral Review if highimpact.

H) Tools for Moderators

Sidebyside original vs preview thumbnail; crop grid overlay; sensitive area heatmap.

Redact inline (captions/hashtags); system stores hash of original.

Batch actions for spam waves; bulk restore/remove with single reason.

Simulateas card: preview how a search card will render postdecision.

Policy helper: quick links to current §1.5 rules and cityspecific appendums.

I) Integrations & Handoffs

Trust & Safety (§4.14.3): escalations (P0/P1), sanctions ladder updates, strike sync.

Search (§4.14.2): demotion flags, sensitiveallow affects ranking weights (minor).

Support (§4.14.5): user communications, appeal tickets, macros.

Promotions (§3.3): promoted inventory excludes “sensitiveallow” unless explicitly allowed by config.

Verification (§4.13): repeated misrepresentation → require reverify.

J) Metrics & Quality

Operational KPIs

Autoapprove ratio (target ≥ 85% after first10 gating phase)

Timetodecision median (Priority B ≤ 8h)

Appeal rate & overturn rate (goal < 10% overturn)

Repeat violation rate (per 30/90 days)

Sensitiveallow share and CTR impact (ensure buyer trust)

Offplatform payment phrase incidence (monthovermonth ↓)

Quality

Weekly calibration sessions; golden set refresh; reviewer agreement rate.

Classifier drift monitor (precision/recall on labeled sample).

K) Telemetry (Moderation)

mod.upload.scan.start/result (nsfw_band, ocr_hits)

mod.auto.crop/applied • mod.auto.blur/applied

mod.queue.enqueue/dequeue (priority) • mod.decision (approve|blur|remove|escalate, reason)

mod.appeal.open/resolve (upheld|overturned)

mod.violation.count.update • mod.auto.sanction.trigger

mod.hash.ban.hit • mod.keyword.hit • mod.redact.caption

L) Acceptance Criteria (mark 4.14.4 FINAL)

Endtoend upload→screen→publish pipeline with placeholders and subsecond automated screening.

NSFW classifier, OCR PII, keyword denylist, hash banlist, and virus scan wired; thresholds configurable via §4.14.2.

Autocrop/blur for previews; hard stops to keep thumbnails SFW; user crop UI present.

Moderation queues with Priority A/B/C SLAs; decision actions (approve/blur/remove/escalate).

User notifications with reason codes and appeal flow; taggedcontent acceptance.

Autosanctions for repeated violations; hard violations escalate to T&S.

Integrations with Search, T&S, Support, Promotions, Verification.

Metrics dashboards and calibration workflow; Telemetry events emitted.

M) Why this works

SFW by design keeps payment partners comfortable and buyers confident, while still enabling artistic expression.

Fast automation + human judgment gives scale without losing nuance.

Clear user tools (crop/blur, appeals) reduce friction and educate creators.

Tunable policies via §4.14.2 let Ops adjust thresholds citybycity without code

§4.14.5 — Support & Disputes

Goal: Resolve issues fast, fair, and policyaccurately—with minimal engineering. Give agents nocode tools to calculate outcomes, capture evidence, coordinate with Trust/Safety and Finance, and issue amended receipts/credits with a clear audit trail.

A) Channels & Intake

Inapp Help → “Report/Resolve a Problem” from: Booking, Chat thread, Delivery screen, Studio page.

Email & Web form (for loggedout users on brand accounts).

Autocases from signals: missed checkin/out, late/no delivery, accessfailure events, chargeback opened, payment duplicate, travelfee dispute, offplatformpayment attempt (flagged).

Intake schema (prefilled from context): booking IDs (LBGaware), role(s), city, timestamps, house rules/SOW version, deliverables manifest, chat transcript link, deposit status, verification badges, prior strike history.

B) Case Types & Routing

Operational: reschedule, change order, pricing correction, travel fee dispute.

Nondelivery/Quality: late/no delivery, partial delivery, unusable media.

Attendance: buyer/provider noshow, late arrival (both sides).

Access (Studios): code/lock failure, unsafe conditions, damages/deposit claims.

Money: duplicate charge, overcharge, refund request, invoice edits, ACH retry.

Safetycolored: harassment, boundary violations, escorting solicitation (autolink to §4.14.3).

Payments network: chargeback (card issuer) → evidence pack & representment.

Routing rules

Safetycolored → T&S queue with Support shadow.

Deposit claims → Support + Finance bin.

LBG cases → “Group” handler with perleg subtabs.

C) SLAs & Priorities

Priority 0 (Safety): first response ≤ 15–30 min (T&S lead, Support copilot).

Priority 1 (Access/Noshow/Active booking): first response ≤ 1 h; resolution target ≤ 24 h.

Priority 2 (Money/Delivery/Quality): first response ≤ 8 h; resolution ≤ 72 h.

Priority 3 (General): response ≤ 24 h; resolution ≤ 5 d.

Timers display in case header; breaches flagged and escalated.

D) Agent Workspace (Case View)

Header: severity, SLA timer, booking chip(s), role(s), city, deposit state, payouts frozen?, promotions eligibility, strikes.

Timeline: booking events, chat excerpts (expand), delivery manifest (hashes, sizes), acceptance/rejection log, studio rules snapshot, location (fuzzed).

Evidence panel: upload files, link docs, annotate; chainofcustody hash.

Policy helper: pulls effective config from §4.14.2 (refund bands, acceptance window, travel fee bands, deposit defaults).

Calculators drawer (see next).

Actions: refund/partial, credit, deposit capture/void, change order, reschedule, amended receipt, sanction shortcuts (IB off/DM throttle).

E) Calculators (nocode, policyaccurate)

Refund Calculator
Inputs: role, cancel timing or lateness, price lines (packages/addons/license/travel), policy bands.
Output: buyer refund $; provider clawback $; platform fee adjustments; who pays processor fees per policy.
Oneclick Apply → posts ledger events + issues amended receipt (§4.12).

Delivery/Acceptance Calculator
Inputs: due date, posted date, items delivered vs promised, acceptance window, revision rounds left.
Output: “Eligible for partial refund X%” or “Request revision” path; sets autoreminder in the thread.

Travel Fee Calculator
Inputs: geo distance (map link), city override bands from §4.14.2.
Output: allowable travel fee or adjustment recommendation.

Deposit Claim Calculator (Studios)
Inputs: evidence, claimed damages types, cap %, expiry.
Output: capture up to $Y; requires twoperson approval when > threshold.

F) Standard Workflows (Playbooks)

1) Reschedule / Change Order

Propose new time; pricing delta autocomputed; both parties accept → SOW updates → amended receipt.

2) Buyer Noshow

Confirm arrival logs; provider/studio present?

Policy outcome: buyer forfeits %; provider paid per bands; strike optional if abuse.

3) Provider Noshow / Late

Confirm location logs; attempt contact in thread.

Outcome: refund buyer; provider forfeits; strike (T&S); remove Boost eligibility window.

4) Late / Partial Delivery

Run Delivery calculator; offer revision first if within rounds; otherwise partial refund per matrix.

5) Quality Dispute

Require 3 examples & rationale; compare to SOW.

If subjective with adequate delivery, educate + deny; if objective miss, partial refund.

6) Studio Access Failure

Validate instructions sent and code logs; if host fault → full/partial refund; deposit void.

Offer Relocation (city curated list) + goodwill credit (config caps).

7) Deposit Claims (Studio)

Require timestamped photos, house rules match; capture up to cap; disputed? move to Neutral Review.

8) Duplicate/Overcharge

Verify processor logs; refund excess; issue amended receipt.

9) Chargebacks

Freeze related payouts; assemble evidence pack (receipts, chat, acceptance logs, deliverables hashes, location fuzz logs); submit; track outcome; if lost, apply platform loss policy.

10) LBG: Talent ok / Studio failed (or vice versa)

Prorate group: refund failed leg; preserve valid leg; issue Group amended receipt.

G) Neutral Review Panel (Ambiguous / Highimpact)

Composition: 2 Support seniors + 1 crossfunction (T&S/Finance) → majority decision.

Inputs: timeline, evidence, calculators’ outputs, policy excerpt, customer narratives.

Outcomes: uphold/modify/overturn; optional goodwill credit; document rationale; update Reputation and strikes if applicable.

H) Credits & Goodwill (Guardrails)

Goodwill credits are marketingfunded, scoped to city/role, with percase and peragent monthly caps (from §4.14.2).

Autoexclusion: users with active strikes or abuse patterns.

On apply: credit line appears in receipt; expiry date; cannot be withdrawn as cash.

I) Automation & Triggers

Autoopen case: missed checkin/out, no delivery by T+X hours, accessfailure signal, duplicate charge, chargeback.

Autosuggest macros: populate opening message using case type & policy; agent reviews/edits.

Autoreminders: revision requested → followup in 48h; acceptance window about to expire.

J) Comms & Templates

Template packs (editable in §4.14.10): safetyneutral, plainEnglish, localized.

Macros per case type with dynamic fields (names, amounts, dates, policy links).

Tone checks: disallow blamey or legalese phrases; suggest neutral alternatives.

K) Integrations & Handoffs

Finance (§4.14.6): refunds/credits/deposit captures post to ledger; payout holds released on resolve.

T&S (§4.14.3): safetycolored cases mirror to T&S; sanctions reflected back.

Content (§4.14.4): if dispute reveals policybreaking content → removal & strike handoff.

Tax (§4.12): amended receipts reflect tax deltas; yearend summaries updated.

Analytics (Section 5): case and resolution data to warehouse.

L) Metrics & QA

Ops KPIs

First response & timetoresolution by queue.

Refund error rate (target < 1%).

% cases resolved selfserve (target ↑ over time).

Chargeback win rate; deposit claim success rate.

CSAT after resolution; NPS impact for buyers/providers.

Quality

Weekly case reviews; coaching notes; macro hygiene; consistency checks across agents/cities.

M) Telemetry (Support & Disputes)

sup.case.open (source, type, severity) • sup.case.assign/reassign

sup.calc.refund.run/apply • sup.calc.delivery.run • sup.calc.deposit.run/apply

sup.action.refund/credit/receipt_amend • sup.action.reschedule/change_order

sup.case.escalate.neutral_review • sup.case.escalate.ts

sup.case.resolve (outcome_code) • sup.case.sla.breach

sup.chargeback.open/represent/won/lost

sup.csat.submit

N) Acceptance Criteria (mark 4.14.5 FINAL)

Multichannel intake + autocase triggers wired; LBGaware grouping.

Case view shows full context + evidence + policy helper + calculators.

Refund/Delivery/Travel/Deposit calculators apply outcomes and issue amended receipts.

Standard workflows implemented for noshow, late/partial delivery, access failure, deposit claims, chargebacks, LBG splits.

Neutral Review Panel flow live with documented outcomes and Reputation updates.

Goodwill credits with caps and audit; abuse exclusions enforced.

Integrations with Finance, T&S, Content, Tax; ledger and payouts reflect decisions.

SLA timers, metrics dashboards, and QA process; Telemetry events emitted.

O) Why this works

Fast, fair, consistent outcomes without engineering.

One case, full picture: booking, chat, deliverables, rules—reduces backandforth.

Policyaccurate math via calculators prevents costly mistakes.

Auditable: amended receipts, evidence hashes, and documented rationales.

§4.14.6 — Finance & Payouts Ops

Goal: Run money ops safely and fast—payouts, reserves, refunds/credits, deposits, chargebacks, promos—without code changes. Keep books clean (escrow/recognition), minimize leakage and loss, and provide auditable, reversible actions with dualapproval where needed.

A) Scope & Roles

Who uses this: Finance, Support (limited), Ops/Marketing (promos), Readonly Auditors.
What it controls: payout batches & reserves, Early Payouts, refunds/credits, studio deposits, chargebacks/representment, coupons/promos, daily reconciliation, revenue recognition exports.

Guardrails: Moneycritical actions require twoperson approval per §4.14.1 (manual payout, fee override, deposit capture > $1k, tax category overrides).

B) Ledgers & Money Objects (model)

Money objects (immutable IDs)

Booking (talent or studio leg; LBGaware)

Escrow (liability)

Fees: provider fee, buyer fee, processor estimate/actual

Taxes (passthrough)

Deposits (auth hold; studio)

Payout (batch line items; per payee)

Refund/Credit (buyerside)

Adjustment (postbooking change order)

Chargeback (case + amounts, stages)

Journaling (highlevel)

At charge: Dr Cash / Cr Escrow + Taxes + Buyer fee (revenue)

At completion (accept/autoaccept): move Escrow → Payable to provider; Provider fee recognized (revenue)

At refund: reverse appropriate portions; taxes per jurisdiction rules

At payout: Dr Payable / Cr Cash; reserves retained as liability

Deposits: not GMV; separate liability “Deposits held”; capture/void moves between liabilities and cash.

All journaling exported; detail remains in data warehouse (Section 5).

C) Payouts, Reserves & Early Payout

Payout batches

Views: Queued / Sent / Failed / On hold (reserve/chargeback)

Filters: provider, date, city, role, bank status, amount ranges

Actions: Retry, Change bank (with KYC check), Split batch for compliance timing

Failures: display processor reason; allow oneclick retry after method update

Reserves

Newprovider reserve: first N payouts delayed up to 7 days (config in §4.14.2)

Rolling reserve: hold X% for Y days; adjustable by cohort/risk (twoperson approval to change)

Reserve ledger shows applied, released, scheduled releases

Early Payout (peruse)

Eligibility: Rep ≥ 85 + ID Verified (gate in §4.12)

Finance can override eligibility with reason (dualapproval)

Fee: 0.5% on provider fee component only; calculator shows amount before confirm

Telemetry and reporting on takerate impact

D) Refunds, Adjustments & Credits

Refunds

Triggered by Support calculators (§4.14.5) or Finance directly (edge cases)

Autorecompute: provider/buyer fees, taxes, processor costs per policy matrix; regenerate amended receipt (§4.12)

Partial refunds supported per line (packages, addons, license, travel)

ACH/card: refund path chosen based on original method; if method expired, create credit memo

Adjustments (Change Orders)

Price deltas (time overage, addon, travel); pushes delta charge to buyer; fee math applied to delta only

Credits (Goodwill / Ops)

Noncash platform credits with expiration; scoped by city/role; caps in §4.14.2

Not withdrawable; applied at checkout; tracked as marketing expense

E) Studio Deposits (Auth Holds & Captures)

Dashboard

Columns: Booking, Host, Amount, Auth expiry, Evidence, Status (Held/Captured/Void/Released)

Actions

Capture (with evidence attach) → separate deposit receipt (no platform fee)

Void/Release on resolution or expiry

Twoperson approval if capture > $1k or > default cap in §4.14.2

Rules

Captures must occur before auth expiry; system warns at T24h

Partial capture allowed up to cap; multiple captures if processor supports incremental

F) Chargebacks & Representment

Case flow

Ingest webhooks: Opened → Evidence due → Represented → Won/Lost

Autofreeze related payouts (partial) on open; unfreeze on resolution

Representment pack builder: receipts, amended receipts, SOW/House Rules, chat excerpts, checkin/out logs, deliverables manifest hashes, location fuzz logs, policy extracts

Submit from console; track carrier reference; reminders for due dates

Loss handling

Apply platform policy: who absorbs what; adjust fees; mark fraud indicators for T&S risk engine

KPIs

Win rate, average liability, time to representment, scheme reasons top10

G) Coupons & Promotions (Money Ops)

Create coupons (percent/flat), scope by city/role/user cohort; start/end; stack rules; usage limits; code vs autoapply

Featured/Boost billing events reflected in ledger (wallet)

Visibility: show promo burn (spend vs allocated), liability for unredeemed credits

Approvals: feeimpacting promos require dualapproval (large buyerfee holidays)

H) Reconciliation & Close

Daily recon

Processor settlements vs internal ledger by charge, refund, payout

Variance report (amount, reason, booking IDs)

Autopost adjustments (processor fees actuals) to fee expense accounts

Monthend

Escrow balance tieout; deposit liabilities; reserves ledger; revenue (provider + buyer fees) vs discounts; taxes payable

Export RevRec packs (CSV/JSON): revenue lines, liabilities movements, adjustments, chargebacks, promo expense, processing fees

Audit pack

Immutable logs of money events; sampleable booking trails with receipts and amendments

I) Runbooks & Controls

Runbooks

Payout incident (bank failure, mass retry)

Processor outage (fallback queueing; disable card/ACH flags in §4.14.2)

Chargeback surge (triage, autopack templates, Ops notice)

Deposit expiry wave (bulk void)

Promo misconfig (rollback via §4.14.2; compute refunds vs credits)

Controls

Twoperson approvals on moneycritical actions

Daily variance thresholds (alert if > $X or > Y bps)

Access logging for payouts; download/export reasons captured

J) Metrics & Alerts

Dashboards

Net takerate by city/role; processor cost %; payout failure rate; reserve coverage; refund rate; chargeback rate & win %; deposit capture volume; Early Payout usage & fee yield; promo burn vs budget

Alerts

Takerate drop > 100 bps dayoverday

Payout failure spike > 0.5%

Chargebacks opened > Z/day or win rate < target

Deposit auths expiring in next 24h > threshold

Promo burn > budget

K) Telemetry (Finance Ops)

fin.payout.batch.queue/sent/fail/retry

fin.reserve.apply/release • fin.early_payout.use/override

fin.refund.create/apply • fin.adjustment.create • fin.credit.issue

fin.deposit.authorize/capture/void/release

fin.chargeback.open/represent/won/lost

fin.promo.create/update • fin.wallet.charge (boost/featured)

fin.recon.daily.start/diff/resolved • fin.revrec.export.generate

L) Acceptance Criteria (mark 4.14.6 FINAL)

Payout batches with retry/changebank and reserve visibility; Early Payout peruse with fee math.

Reserves (newprovider & rolling) configurable via §4.14.2; applied & released with schedules.

Refunds/Adjustments recompute fees/taxes and issue amended receipts automatically.

Studio deposits: holds visible; capture/void/release with evidence and dualapproval > threshold; separate receipt.

Chargebacks: webhook ingestion, evidence pack builder, representment submission, payout freezes.

Coupons/Promos: create/manage; burn tracking; wallet line items posted.

Reconciliation & RevRec exports: daily variances, monthend packs, escrow/tax/deposit liabilities tieouts.

Runbooks & Alerts documented and wired; telemetry events emitted; dashboards live.

M) Why this works

Ops speed without risk: common money flows are oneclick with calculators and dual approvals.

Clean books by default: escrow vs revenue vs liabilities handled consistently; audits are painless.

Loss containment: reserves, evidence packs, and alerts reduce chargeback and refund leakage.

Citybycity control: economics tuned in §4.14.2; Finance executes without code.

§4.14.7 — Tax & Compliance Ops

Goal: Operate U.S. taxes and compliance without code changes: collect W9s, resolve TIN mismatches, run and deliver 1099s, manage marketplace salestax (destinationbased) with a tax engine, file remittances on time, and keep a defensible audit trail—with dual approvals on sensitive moves.

A) Scope & Roles

Who uses this: Finance (lead), Tax & Compliance, Readonly Auditor; limited Support (view-only for ticket replies).
What it covers: W9 onboarding & edelivery consent, TIN matching, 1099 generation/efile/delivery/corrections, marketplace salestax nexus tracking, tax category mapping, calculation monitoring, return filing calendar, audit pack exports.

Guardrails: Changes that affect tax exposure (nexus list, category map, backdated overrides, rate overrides) require twoperson approval per §4.14.1.

B) Dashboards & Queues

Tax Overview (/admin/tax)

Tiles: W9 coverage %, TIN mismatch open, 1099 run status, states with nexus, calc error rate, next filings due.

Trendlines: taxable vs nontaxable share by role; effective tax collected by state/city.

Queues

W9 Missing/Invalid (payoutblocking on): missing, expired name/TIN, signature not captured.

TIN Mismatch: new mismatches, under review, resolved.

1099 Exceptions: address issues, duplicate TINs, threshold edge cases, bounced emails, paper mail required.

Calc Exceptions: timeouts, “no code found,” zero tax where expected, jurisdiction mismatch.

C) W9 / TIN / EDelivery Management

W9 Control Panel

Status filters: Not started • In progress • Submitted • Valid • Needs correction.

Actions: Request W9 (nudge), Resend link, Block payouts toggle (automated default ON when missing), Mark corrected after user resubmits.

Evidence: signed PDF, submission timestamp, IP/device, consent texts.

TIN Match (soft)

Batch and ondemand checks; results classified: Match • Mismatch • Indeterminate.

Workflow: On mismatch → Notify user (selfserve fix) → if unresolved in 7 days, escalate to Support for assisted correction → remain payoutblocked.

Audit: history of match attempts, result codes; no raw SSN ever shown (PII scope gates per §4.14.1).

EDelivery Consent

Global percentage, by cohort.

Actions: Request consent template, Revoke on user request.

If no consent or unopened by deadline, queue paper mail fulfillment with address verification.

D) 1099 Runs & Corrections

Config (no code)

Thresholds: dynamic edition (managed by Finance) with notes; never hardcoded into receipts.

Form type: platformissued 1099NEC vs processorissued (if using PSE route) — select per tax season.

Run windows: preclose (draft), final generate, efile, deliver (by Jan 31 target).

Run Workflow

Preflight: snapshot gross payouts, exclude refunds/chargebacks as policy dictates; show exceptions (missing W9, TIN mismatch, missing address).

Preview: perpayee summary with deltas vs prior drafts; download sample PDFs; dual approval to proceed.

Efile: submit batch to filing provider (IRS + Combined Federal/State where applicable); capture submission IDs.

Deliver: email with secure link to PDF for consented users; queue mail for the rest; track opens and bounces.

Corrections: create CCORR entries with reason (address fix, amount update, TIN correction); refile and redeliver; maintain version chain.

Status & Controls

States: Draft • Pending approval • Filed • Delivered • Correction pending.

Bounced/undeliverable queue with address change flow (Support can help).

Export 1099 Ledger CSV: payee, TIN masked, gross, box amounts, file IDs.

E) SalesTax Nexus & Category Mapping (Marketplace Facilitator)

Nexus Map

States list with toggles: Collect & remit ON/OFF, basis (economic/physical), notes.

Economic triggers monitor: GMV and transaction count by state vs configurable thresholds; alert if approaching.

Twoperson approval to mark a state ON/OFF; prompt to schedule effective date/time.

Category Mapping (what is being taxed)

Role/service to tax code mapping (e.g., Talent service, Photography/Videography service, Studio shortterm rental, Cleaning fee, Digital license).

Editor: pick codes from tax engine catalog; perstate overrides where needed; reason required; dual approval for overrides.

Simulation: price example shows expected tax in a target city/county; compares before/after.

Exemptions (Phase 2)

Buyer tax exemption certificates: upload, verify, expire; statespecific validation; apply per booking only if valid and applicable; audit record kept.

F) Calculation Monitoring & Exceptions

Live Monitor

Success %, latency p95/p99; top states/cities by volume.

“Zero where expected” detector: service/location combos historically taxable now returning 0.

Timeouts: fallback policy (failclosed for money safety) blocks checkout or shows “Tax unavailable—please retry”; agent override path (rare) requires dual approval and postfix reconciliation.

Exception Resolution

No code found: add/adjust category mapping; rerun calc; annotate case.

Jurisdiction mismatch: verify location; correct geocode; recalc.

Engine outage: enable grace mode flag (killswitch in §4.14.2) → temporarily suspend new checkouts or switch to backup strategy; autonotify Eng/Ops.

G) Filing Calendar & Remittance

Calendar

State filing frequencies (monthly/quarterly/annual) with due dates; owner assigned; reminders at T14/T7/T2 days.

Each filing stores: period, gross taxable, tax collected, returns submitted, confirmation numbers, PDFs.

Rollups: city/county breakdowns; shortpaid/overpaid trackers.

Payments

Record ACH/epay confirmations; reconcile remitted vs collected; variance report.

Exports

Jurisdiction CSV for the period (state/county/city), taxable base, tax, count, exempt amount; importready for filing portals or CPA.

H) Knowledge Base & Policy Text (External)

KB articles linked from receipts/Tax Center: “Where we collect tax”, “Why was tax charged?”, “How 1099 works”, “How to fix a W9 mismatch”.

Templates maintained via §4.14.10 Smart Docs CMS; localized; review by Tax.

I) Metrics & Alerts

KPIs

W9 coverage ≥ target (e.g., 98% of active payees).

TIN mismatch resolution median (≤ 7 days).

1099 ontime issuance rate (target 100%).

Calc error rate < 0.5%; average calc latency < 1.5s.

Tax collected vs remitted variance (target < 0.5%).

Nexus trigger alerts resolved within 5 business days.

Alerts

New state approaches economic nexus threshold (≥80%).

Calc exceptions > threshold in any state.

1099 bounce rate > target; undelivered forms > N.

Filing due in ≤ 2 days and not marked “Submitted.”

J) Telemetry (Tax Ops)

tax.w9.request/sent/submit/valid/invalid

tax.tin.match.run/result

tax.edelivery.consent.on/off

tax.1099.prefight/preview/efile/deliver/correct

tax.nexus.state.enable/disable (actor, reason)

tax.category.map.update (before/after, scope)

tax.calc.request/response/timeout/error

tax.filing.create/submit/confirm

tax.alert.trigger (type, state)

K) Acceptance Criteria (mark 4.14.7 FINAL)

W9/TIN module with payoutblock, consent capture, mismatch workflow, and signed PDFs stored with audit.

1099 run system: preflight, preview, dualapproval, efile, edelivery/paper fallback, corrections flow with version chain.

Nexus map and economic triggers; twoperson approval to toggle; scheduled effective dates.

Category mapping editor with simulation; perstate overrides; approvals & audit.

Calc monitor with latency, errorrate, and “zero where expected” detectors; outage grace mode.

Filing calendar with reminders, submission records, confirmations, and jurisdiction exports.

KB links & templates maintained via §4.14.10; Support sees statuses for ticket replies.

Metrics & alerts dashboards; Telemetry events for all listed actions.

L) Why this works

Automates the heavy lifting (forms, calcs, filings) while keeping humans in the loop where judgment matters.

Prevents surprises with nexus monitoring, exception queues, and dual approvals on exposurechanging edits.

Auditable & defensible: signed forms, efile IDs, mapping changes, and filing confirmations are all in one place.

§4.14.8 — Promotions & Marketplace Economics

Goal: Give Ops/Marketing a nocode control tower for paid visibility that drives incremental bookings without corrupting relevance: configure CPC floors and Featured pricing citybycity, tune Quality Score (QS) weights, enforce density/frequency caps, manage eligibility/safety, run experiments, and measure true incrementality (ROAS)—all with guardrails, audits, and rollbacks.

A) Scope, Roles & Guardrails

Who uses this: Ops (city/market), Marketing, Finance (billing/credits), Trust & Safety (eligibility), Readonly Auditor.
What it controls: Search Boost (CPC), Featured Carousels (weekly flat), eligibility gates, QS weighting, density/frequency caps, citytier CPC floors, delivery guarantees & makegoods, experiments, fraud controls, wallet credits.
Guardrails: “Never paytowin”—paid units must match query/filters; caps enforced (≤2/20; ≤1 above fold); Promoted label shown; safety eligibility in effect (ID Verified + Rep ≥ 70 + no recent strikes).

B) Inventory Model (what can be sold)

Search Results Boost (CPC)

Placement: inline search cards; ribbons autogenerated (“Instant Book”, “Trusted Pro”, “Available this week”).

Capacity controls: density cap per page and frequency caps per buyer (config in §4.14.2).

Charging: per valid click (invalid click credits autoapply to wallet).

Featured Carousels (Weekly Flat)

Placement: Home + category landing (“Featured in Houston”; “Featured Photographers”).

Slots: 10–16 per carousel; rotational pacing with impression guarantees & makegood logic.

Creative rules: No custom creatives. We render the standard profile card + approved ribbon variants only (prevents deception and review load).

C) City Tiers & Pricing Governance

City tiers: A (e.g., HOU/DAL/LA/NYC/ATL), B (growth metros), C (smaller).

CPC floors per city×role (e.g., HOU:model = $0.90) and weekly Featured prices per city×role (e.g., $69/wk).

Scheduling: price changes can be scheduled (start/end) with local timezone; staged rollouts.

Review cadence: monthly CPC floor review (±$0.10–0.20) based on fill rate, CPB, ROAS; quarterly Featured pricing review (impression delivery & bookings/slot).

Dual approval: any CPC floor increase ≥ $0.20 in 24h, or Featured price change ≥ 20% requires twoperson approval (per §4.14.1).

Keys live in §4.14.2: promos.boosts.cpc_floor.city_role, promos.featured.weekly_price.city_role.

D) Eligibility, Targeting & Safety

Eligibility rule (configurable DSL): default id_verified && rep>=70 && !recent_strike.

NSFW/Safe Mode: paid units respect city NSFW visibility and Safe Mode thresholds (from §4.14.2).

Targeting knobs: city, radius, role; negative keywords (provider can exclude).

Autosuppression: any active Safety investigation or miscategorized profile → campaign paused until cleared.

E) Ranking Inside Paid Caps (fair ordering)

Within paid slots only:

Quality Score (0–1) components (weights tunable in §4.14.2):

Exact filter match fit (role/location/price/availability)

Responsiveness (firstresponse time & rate)

Rep Score

Instant Book enabled

Price fit to query median

Historical CTR (timedecayed)

Paid Order Score: score = log(bid) * α + QS * (1−α) (default α=0.5; guardrails 0.3–0.7).

Tiebreak: lower effective CPC (bid ÷ QS) wins to reward relevance.

Keys: promos.boosts.qs_weight_bid, promos.boosts.qs_weight_quality.

F) Fraud, Quality & Budget Protection

Invalid click detection: rapid repeats, zerodwell bounces, selfclick signatures, coordinated patterns; invalidated charges autocredit within 24h to wallet.

Frequency caps (buyerside): 2 impressions/session, 5/day/provider, 4h cooldown.

Budget safety: daily overspend guard (≤5%); autopause if anomaly; alert Ops.

Abuse flags: misleading pricing or availability → autopause all promos; route to T&S.

G) Admin UI — Controls & Flows

1) Floors & Pricing Editor

Table per city×role: CPC floor $, avg QS, fill %, median CPC, CPB, ROAS; edit floors inline; schedule changes; staged rollout slider.

Featured grid: weekly price ladder; slots booked vs inventory; impression guarantees; set makegood rules (auto credit or extension).

2) Eligibility & Caps

Toggle eligibility DSL (with validator), set density/frequency caps; set ribbon allowlist.

3) QS Weights & Preview

Adjust α and QS subweights (guardrails); simulate ordering on last N queries; diff view vs current.

4) Experiments

Create A/B cells: density caps A(2/20) vs B(1/20); QS α 0.5 vs 0.3; ribbon text variants.

Set success metrics (ROAS lift, CPB↓, buyer CTR↑); autostop on trust KPI breach (e.g., “Hide promoted” > 3%).

5) Credits & MakeGoods

Issue wallet credits (invalid clicks, makegood for underdelivered Featured); caps and reasons required; ledger posted to Finance.

6) Reporting

Dashboards: adoption %, spend, CPC distribution, CPB, bookings attributed, incremental GMV (holdout), ROAS percentiles, invalid click rate, buyer “Hide” rate, revenue contribution.

H) Measurement & Incrementality

Attribution: click → inquiry → booking → GMV; 7day postclick window; firsttouch within paid.

Holdout design: rolling 10% eligible supply suppressed from paid to estimate incremental bookings/GMV; configurable (5–10%).

Core KPIs: median ROAS ≥ 2.5×, CPB targets by role, invalid click rate < 7%, buyer “Hide promoted” ≤ 3%, paid revenue mix 10–15% by month 6.

Cohort views: new vs returning providers; city cohorts; role cohorts.

I) Finance & Billing Integration

Wallet ledger: CPC charges (valid clicks), Featured weekly charges, invalid click credits, makegoods.

Prepaid vs payasyougo: support both; card on file; lowbalance alerts.

Refund policy: only invalid clicks autocredit; Featured makegoods issued on short delivery (impressions) or outages.

J) Alerts & Safeguards

Spend spike > X% houroverhour in a city/role.

Invalid clicks > 10% for any provider in 24h.

Buyer “Hide promoted” rate > 3% dayoverday.

ROAS median < 2.0× for 7 days in a city → suggest floor drop or QS tuning.

Inventory saturation: density cap hits 90% for 3 days → consider raising floor or adding slots cautiously (with A/B).

K) Telemetry (Promotions)

promo.boost.floor.update • promo.featured.price.update • promo.eligibility.update

promo.qs.tune (alpha, weights) • promo.simulation.run

promo.experiment.start/stop (caps|alpha|ribbon)

promo.charge.click.valid/invalid • promo.credit.makegood

promo.metrics.roas.update • promo.alert.trigger (type)

L) Acceptance Criteria (mark 4.14.8 FINAL)

CPC floors and Featured weekly pricing editable per city×role; scheduled; dualapproval for large changes.

Eligibility rule editor with validator; safety gating enforced (ID Verified + Rep ≥ 70 + no strikes).

Density & frequency caps configurable; respected at runtime; Promoted labeling present.

QS weights tunable with simulation; ordering formula log(bid)*α + QS*(1−α) enforced within paid slots only.

Fraud controls: invalid click detection with autocredits; overspend guard; abuse autopause.

Experiments on caps, QS α, ribbons; autostop on trust KPI breach.

Reporting: spend, CPC, CPB, attributed bookings/GMV, incremental ROAS via holdout, invalid click & hide rates, revenue contribution.

Wallet & Finance linkage for charges, credits, makegoods; audit trail intact.

Alerts on spikes, quality thresholds, low ROAS, inventory saturation; Telemetry events firing.

M) Why this works

Citybycity control without code lets you stabilize early markets and price inventory rationally.

Fairness preserved: relevance first, paid only in marked slots, strict caps—so buyers trust results.

Provable value keeps spend durable (holdoutmeasured ROAS).

Operationally safe: fraud shielding, autocredits, experiments with guardrails, and quick rollbacks.

§4.14.9 — City Ops & Supply Seeding

Goal: Give Ops a nocode cockpit to launch and grow each city: set supply targets by role, seed highquality providers and studios, run foundingcity perks, balance demand vs. supply, and keep rotations/spotlights fair—without code changes.

A) Scope, Roles & Guardrails

Who uses this: City/Market Ops (lead), Marketing (copilot), Trust & Safety (eligibility), Finance (budgets), Readonly Auditor.
What it controls: city cohorts, supply targets, foundingcity perks, verification subsidies, invite/referral programs, “Top in {City}” rotations, studio seeding, demand seeding (brands/RFP), local events (“Collab Day”), and city health dashboards.

Guardrails: All perks that change fees or issue credits draw from approved budgets and obey eligibility (ID Verified, Rep ≥ 70, no strikes). Fee/price changes use §4.14.2 approvals.

B) City Dashboard (at /admin/city/{city})

Health tiles (last 28 days, rolesplit: Models / Photographers / Videographers / Creators)

Active supply (# with packages + availability) • Verified % • Instant Book %

Buyer demand (searches, inquiries, bookings) • Fill rate (% inquiries → bookings)

Repeat bookings % • Median response time • Cancellation/noshow rates

Pricing bands median vs target • Bookings heatmap by neighborhood • Studio availability

Alerts

Supply/demand imbalance (e.g., photogs < target ratio to models)

Verified % below threshold • Response time drift • High cancel/noshow pockets

Studio coverage below target • Budget burn approaching 80%

C) Targets & Ratios (editable, guardrailed)

Supply targets by role (absolute # and % verified):

Example (Houston P0): Models 300 (≥60% ID Verified), Photographers 220 (≥55%), Videographers 120 (≥50%), Creators 200 (≥55%).

Balance ratios (min/max):

Model:Photographer target 1.2–1.8 • Model:Videographer 2.0–3.0 • Creator:Photographer 0.7–1.3.

Studio coverage: ≥25 Verified Studios across ≥8 neighborhoods.

Responsetime goal: median ≤ 2h; Instant Book share ≥ 35%.

(All thresholds live as keys in §4.14.2; dashboard shows current → target with color coding.)

D) Cohort Builder & Invites

Filters (role, distance radius, verification status, Rep, perplatform social metrics, price band, availability, touring flag).
Actions

Generate invite cohort: preview list, dedupe by email/social handle; export or send.

Invite send: email/SMS templates (from §4.14.10), optional boost coupon attachment.
