Autoinvite rules: “When a provider in HOU links IG ≥ 25k & ID Verified → send ‘Founding Creator’ invite + $15 Boost.”

CSV import: offplatform prospect lists (studios, creators). Merge/match to existing accounts; privacysafe.

Tracking

Conversion funnel: sent → opened → signup → verified → first package → first booking.

E) FoundingCity Perks & Budgets

Perks (config via §4.14.2)

Buyer fee holiday (e.g., 0% buyer fee) — windowed

Provider fee nudge (e.g., −2% for 60 days) — capped by cohort

Verification subsidies: first N ID or Background passes funded

Boost starter credits: $15 on Trusted Pro pass (once)

Budgets

Tiles: allocated vs spent vs slated; alerts at 80/100%.

Makegood credits draw from promo budget; ledger posts to Finance (§4.14.6).

Eligibility

Enforce: id_verified && !recent_strike (and Trusted Pro where applicable).

Cityscoped caps per user (e.g., max $30 in credits/30 days).

F) “Top in {City}” Rotations & Merchandising

Carousels: “Top Models in Houston”, “…Photographers…”, “…Videographers…”, “…Creators…”, “Verified Studios”.

Rotation logic: weighted roundrobin among eligible profiles (Rep ≥ threshold, IB on, recent positive reviews).

Fairness caps: max X impressions/week per profile; enforce diversity (no duplicates in adjacent tiles).

Manual pin (rare): Ops can pin up to 2 slots for timeboxed campaigns (record reason; autounpin).

A/B: carousel order and labels (e.g., “Available this week” vs “Instant Book”).

G) Studio Seeding & Coverage

Neighborhood heatmap with target coverage; shows Verified Studios and peak booking windows.

Studio outreach cohort builder (amenities needed: cyclorama, natural light, dressing rooms, parking).

Deposit defaults & House Rules templates pulled from §4.14.10; autoapply on onboarding.

Studio perks: reduced Featured price for first 4 weeks; extra visibility in LBG flows.

Quality gate: minimum photo set + safety disclosures; Studio Verified required to appear in checkout selector.

H) Demand Seeding (Brands, Agencies, SMBs)

Brand prospecting: import CRM lists; tag by vertical (fashion/beauty/fitness/real estate).

RFP Broadcast rules: prebuilt briefs per vertical; budget presets; city target; send to Verified + Rep ≥ 70 supply.

Buyer incentives: firstbooking credits, ACH fee discount callouts; concierge assist flag.

Casestudy pipeline: select completed bookings → request permission → publish (adds to city landing page).

I) Local Events: “Collab Days” & Tours

Event builder: schedule Collab Day at a Verified Studio (capacity, time slots, optin roles).

RSVP & waitlist: eligibility (ID Verified), slot allocation, reminders; optional nominal fee to reduce noshows.

Touring calendar: surface “Visiting talent” weeks; suggest Smart Invites to local buyers/providers.

Afteraction: collect references; feature top outcomes in city carousels.

J) Playbooks (oneclick templates)

City Launch (8 weeks)

W8 to W6: invite wave #1; studio outreach; press list.

W5 to W3: foundingcity perks on; verification subsidies live; Boost floors set low; “Top in HOU” rotation starts.

W2: Collab Day #1; Brand RFP sprint; ACH discount banner.

W1: content blitz; early bookings showcase.

W+1 to W+4: tighten floors, raise QS weight; adjust perks based on budget & ROAS.

Supply Dip Repair

Identify missing role pocket (e.g., videographers); run targeted invites + $15 Boost coupon; pin 2 carousel slots; set IB radius +5 miles; host Collab Day #2.

Studio Gap Fix

Heatmap → neighborhoods with 0 coverage; studio outreach pack; temporary Featured discount; LBG promos.

Response Time Rehab

Message providers with slow responses; enable responsetime score nudge; suggest Quick Replies; rotate out of carousels until improved.

(Each playbook sets flags/keys in §4.14.2 and schedules comms/templates in §4.14.10.)

K) Integrations

Promotions (§4.14.8): CPC floors per city×role, Featured price ladders, eligibility.

Verification (§4.13): subsidy counts, Trusted Pro gating.

Support (§4.14.5): relocation list for studio access failures.

Finance (§4.14.6): budgets, credits, ledger posting.

Smart Docs (§4.14.10): invite templates, event emails, House Rules packs.

Search (§4.14.2): facet toggles (e.g., show “Touring talent” filter in launch window).

L) Metrics & Alerts

KPIs

Activation: % of invited providers who publish packages in 7 days (target > 50%).

Verified coverage by role (target ≥ thresholds above).

Inquiry→Booking conversion (target ≥ 35% by W+8).

Repeat booking % (target ≥ 30% by M3).

Responsetime median ≤ 2h; IB share ≥ 35%.

Studio coverage (neighborhood count) and LBG adoption.

Perk efficiency: CAC per verified, cost/booking from subsidies, Boost ROAS by cohort.

Alerts

Balancedratio violation > 2 weeks.

Verified coverage dips < threshold.

Budget burn ≥ 80% with < 60% target achieved.

Carousel impression concentration (top 10 profiles > 40% impressions).

M) Telemetry (City Ops)

city.cohort.create/send/convert

city.perk.enable/disable/budget.update

city.carousel.rotate/pin/unpin

city.studio.outreach/send/verify

city.event.create/rsvp/no_show_rate

city.ratio.alert • city.coverage.alert • city.budget.alert

N) Acceptance Criteria (mark 4.14.9 FINAL)

City Dashboard with rolesplit health, heatmaps, alerts.

Targets & ratios editable with guardrails; live comparison to actuals.

Cohort Builder & Invites with filters, CSV import, dedupe, autoinvite rules, and conversion tracking.

Foundingcity perks (buyerfee holiday, provider nudge, verification subsidies, Boost credits) with budgets and eligibility.

Rotations for “Top in {City}” with fairness caps and optional manual pinning (timeboxed).

Studio seeding tools (coverage map, outreach, Verified gating, LBG integration).

Demand seeding (brand RFP broadcast, concierge pipeline, casestudy publishing).

Local events builder (Collab Days, tours) with RSVP/waitlist and postevent followups.

Playbooks that programmatically set flags/keys and schedule comms; oneclick apply/rollback.

Metrics, alerts, telemetry implemented and visible; budgets enforced.

O) Why this works

Citybycity control aligns product knobs with ground truth (coverage, ratios, response time).

Seeding at scale: invites, perks, and events run from one place with budgets and eligibility baked in.

Fair discovery: rotations with caps prevent “winnertakeall,” improving breadth of bookings.

Tight integration with Promotions, Verification, Finance, and Support ensures moves are both effective and auditable.

§4.14.10 — Smart Docs & Templates CMS

Goal: Let Ops/Legal/Marketing manage contracts, releases, SOWs, House Rules, and comms (email/SMS) without code—using a versioned clause library, safe variables, approvals, localization, and oneclick rollout/rollback. All documents and messages should be policyaccurate, esignable, and auditable, and slot cleanly into booking, delivery, disputes, and receipts.

A) Scope, Roles & Guardrails

Who uses this:

Legal (owner of legal templates) — clauses, SOW defaults, releases, House Rules patterns.

Ops/Support — dispute macros, houserules packs, city addenda, safety notices.

Marketing — email/SMS copy, onboarding & lifecycle.

City Ops — localized notes, studio packs, event mailers.

Guardrails:

Twoperson approval required to publish legal docs or change variable sets (Legal + Ops).

Live preview + “blastradius” diff for all publishes.

Version pinning per booking (the exact doc text is frozen on create/accept).

B) Document Types & Catalog

Legal/Operational docs (rendered as PDF & HTML):

SOW (Statement of Work) — per role, roleaware fields (talent/photog/videographer/creator) + LBG aware.

Model Release / Talent Release — 18+ only; IDverified signers; alias display but legal name on signature page.

IP & License Addenda — commercial/editorial usage, term, geography, exclusivity, buyout options.

House Rules (Studio) — access, usage, equipment, noise, parking, deposit grounds.

Safety Addenda — chaperone policy, emergency contact, areashare consent, code of conduct.

Change Orders — schedule/price adjustments midthread.

Refund/Delivery Acknowledgements — standardized acceptance/refund confirmations.

Tax Consent Texts — edelivery consent language (links with §4.12/§4.14.7).

Messaging templates (transactional & lifecycle):

Checkout/escrow, acceptance, reminders, reschedule, deliverables due/accepted, revision prompts, dispute opened/closed, payout queued/sent, 1099 available, verification nudges, city launch, promotions.

C) Clause Library & Safe Variables

Clause blocks:

Atomic, reusable paragraphs with conditions (role, city, studio, NSFW state, presence of deposit, licensing tier).

Tags: #legal, #ops, #safety, #tax, #studio.

Deprecation with automigration suggestions (never changes older, pinned documents).

Variable catalog (strongly typed & validated):

Examples: {{booking.start_datetime_local}}, {{booking.city}}, {{party.buyer.display_name}}, {{party.seller.legal_name_masked}}, {{pricing.subtotal}}, {{license.scope}}, {{studio.deposit_cap}}.

Validators: required/optional, regex, min/max, enum; preview with sample data before publish.

Forbidden variables in public surfaces (email/phone/payment handles) are blocked.

D) Template Editor UI

Block editor (left: clause library, right: doc outline).

Conditions panel to include/exclude clauses by role/city/flags.

Variables inspector with type checks and autofill suggestions.

Diff viewer (before/after) + impact preview on 10 sample bookings.

Version header: author, reason code, linked Jira/issue, publish window (start/end), scopes (global/state/city/role).

Rollback button restores prior version in one click (future bookings only).

E) Versioning, Approvals & Publishing

States: Draft → Legal Review → Ops Review → Scheduled/Published → Archived.

Approvals: Legal must approve legal doc changes; Marketing approves comms; Ops approves city addenda.

Scope & scheduling: publish per city/role/cohort with local timezone; staged rollout (1%→10%→100%).

Pinning: each booking pins doc versions at create (SOW/House Rules) and accept (releases/license).

Audit: immutable log with actor, reason, diffs, affected scopes, and rollback link.

F) ESignatures & Records (Docs)

Signature methods: typedname + checkbox + timestamp, or embedded esign capture (hosted by provider).

Signer identity: ties to platform account; legal name private, shown only on signature page and receipts.

Cosigners: both sides sign; LBG: talent/studio sign their respective docs.

Records: render to PDF, hash & store, link from booking and receipts; download available to both parties.

18+ enforcement: release templates block minor language; ID Verified required to sign talent releases.

G) SOW Generator (RoleAware)

Packages & addons expanded with plainEnglish summaries; license clause assembled (scope/term/geography/exclusivity).

Travel & overtime clauses pulled from §4.14.2 policy matrices.

Deliverables: count/type, format, due date/time; acceptance window; revision rounds.

Cancellation bands summarized from policy; clear fee consequences by timing.

LBG awareness: automatically emits Talent SOW and Studio House Rules; ties to a Group Receipt (§4.12).

H) Studio Packs

House Rules templates with required fields: access, hazards, occupancy, noise, equipment, cleaning, deposit basis.

Autoinsert deposit clause when deposit is enabled; photo evidence checklist printed on receipt.

Neighborhood privacy: exact address withheld until confirmation; docs display neighborhood + arrival instructions postaccept.

I) Dispute & Support Macros

Reusable macro library for Support (approve/deny, partial refund, revision required, deposit capture notice).

Variables: amounts, dates, links to receipts, policy excerpts; tone guard flags accusatory/legalese; suggests neutral phrasing.

Appeal templates with timelines and escalation language aligned to §4.14.5/§4.14.3.

J) Email/SMS Templates (Comms CMS)

Transactional: booking request, acceptance, reminders, deliverables due/accepted, payout events, tax forms, verification status.

Lifecycle: onboarding nudge, verify your ID, Trusted Pro invite, responsetime coaching, city event invites, ROAS tips for boosts.

Localization (Phase 2): perlanguage variants; righttoleft support.

A/B variants for subject/preview lines; guardrails: transactional emails cannot be suppressed below 100%; marketing adheres to unsubscribe laws.

Ratelimit & quiet hours (cityaware).

K) Localization & City Addenda

City addenda blocks autoappend local rules (e.g., building access, noise windows) selected by City Ops; translations linked.

U.S. only at launch; keep language keys prepared for expansion.

L) Integrations & Embedding

Checkout (§4.7/§4.12): SOW and House Rules visible before pay; acceptance checkboxes required.

Messaging (§1.4): change orders & deliverables acceptance posted into the thread with signed doc links.

Receipts (§4.12): link to the exact SOW, releases, House Rules on the receipt and group receipt.

Disputes (§4.14.5): calculators reference the pinned policy text; outcome templates autopopulate.

Promotions (§3.3): ribbon text snippets come from CMS allowlist (no adhoc copy).

M) Governance & Compliance

Legal owner for legal docs; Marketing owner for comms; Ops owner for operational clauses.

Change windows for highrisk edits (e.g., not during peak booking days unless emergency).

Readonly view for auditors; export of doc versions used per booking.

PII minimization: public doc bodies never include emails/phones; signature pages allowed but masked in previews.

N) Metrics & Quality

Adoption: % bookings with SOW + release signed preshoot (target 100%).

Dispute defensibility: % disputes where pinned docs directly support outcome; chargeback win uplift postCMS update.

Comms performance: open/click for transactional (informational), lifecycle conversion to verification/IB.

Error rate: variable resolution failures (<0.1%), publish rollbacks (<1% of publishes).

Localization quality (Phase 2): language QA score; bounce rates by locale.

O) Telemetry (Docs & Comms)

cms.template.create/update/publish/rollback (type=legal|comms, scope, actor)

cms.clause.create/deprecate • cms.variable.add/remove

cms.preview.render • cms.ab.assign • cms.ab.stop

doc.sow.generate/pin • doc.release.sign (party) • doc.change_order.sign

comms.email.send/open/click/bounce • comms.sms.send/deliver/fail

cms.alert.missing_variable • cms.alert.publish_blocked (validation)

P) Acceptance Criteria (mark 4.14.10 FINAL)

Clause library with conditions; typed variable catalog with validation and previews.

Template editor with diff, impact preview, approvals, scoped publish, schedule & rollback.

SOW generator (roleaware, LBGaware) including deliverables, license, travel/overtime, cancellation summary.

Releases (18+ enforced) and IP/license addenda; esign capture; PDFs hashed and linked to bookings/receipts.

House Rules packs with deposit clauses; neighborhood privacy; studio evidence checklist.

Support macros & appeal templates with tone guard and variables.

Email/SMS CMS with A/B variants, quiet hours, unsubscribe compliance; transactional never suppressed.

Integrations to Checkout, Messaging, Receipts, Disputes, Promotions; pinned document versions by booking.

Governance: owners, change windows, audits, legal approvals enforced.

Metrics & telemetry dashboards for adoption, disputes defensibility, comms performance.

Q) Why this works

Opsspeed changes without code keep docs and comms aligned with live policy and city conditions.

Pinned, signed, and hashed records raise trust and win disputes/chargebacks.

Role and cityaware assembly means one source supports many scenarios, cleanly.

Guardrails & approvals prevent risky edits from slipping into production.

§4.14.11 — Studios Ops

Goal: Operate the studio side of the marketplace without code changes: verify studios, enforce House Rules & deposits, manage coverage by neighborhood, keep checkin smooth and safe, and tie studios cleanly into LBG (Linked Booking Group) flows with talent—while preserving SFW standards and strong audit trails.

A) Scope, Roles & Guardrails

Who uses this: Studios Ops (lead), Trust & Safety, City Ops, Support, Finance, Content Moderation, Readonly Auditor.
What it controls: studio onboarding & verification, listing standards, amenities taxonomy, House Rules packs, deposit defaults & captures, access/“lockout” handling, safety & compliance fields, visibility in search/featured, coverage heatmaps, and LBG ties.

Guardrails:

“Studio Verified” badge requires documentation + photo checks; twoperson approval to revoke badges or capture deposits > cap (§4.14.6).

No explicit sets; previews must remain SFW (enforced via §4.14.4).

Address privacy: exact address never public preconfirmation; neighborhood shown until accept.

B) Studio Onboarding & Verification

Onboarding checklist (adminconfigurable in §4.14.10):

Identity & ownership (choose 1+): lease/utility bill, business registration, or property manager letter.

Address proof: document + GPSstamped photos (entrance, main room, key amenities).

Minimum photos (≥12): wide + detail shots; safety items (first aid, exits) included.

House Rules pack applied (from CMS) with required fields (access, occupancy, noise, hazards).

Deposits setting (optional): % + cap (defaults from §4.14.2).

Safety & compliance fields: smoke detectors, fire extinguishers, ADA access, elevators/stairs, parking, neighborhood notes.

Contact method for dayof (masked relay); optional codelock provider field (logs may be uploaded).

Verification console actions:

Approve / Request changes / Reject (with reasons & examples).

Badge: Studio Verified; badge expires on reverify cadence (12–18 mo).

Reverify queue with reminder emails, autodowngrade if overdue.

C) Listing Standards & Amenity Taxonomy

Amenity taxonomy (managed in §4.14.2): cyclorama, natural light, blackout, sound treatment, dressing room, kitchenette, showers, parking, freight elevator, seamless paper, Cstands, strobes, modifiers, backdrops, props.
Blacklisted amenities/rules: hidden cameras, explicit/sexual sets, escorting/solicitation, dangerous stunts without licensed supervision, weapons, pyrotechnics (unless permitted), smoking indoors (unless ventilation + permit), offplatform payment instructions.
Photo guidelines: no explicit imagery; show space, not people in sexualized poses; watermarks permitted but unobtrusive.

Moderation: studio listings flow through §4.14.4 queues; misrepresentation → strike ladder (§4.14.3) and delist until corrected.

D) House Rules Packs & Safety Addenda (CMSdriven)

House Rules templates (cityaware): access windows, quiet hours, occupancy cap, gear usage, cleanup, alcohol/drugs, pets, minors on set, chaperone policy, privacy areas, changing area rules.

Safety Addenda (optional): ladders/rigging rules, fog/haze restrictions, electrical load limits, mandatory COI for certain rigs.

Autoinsert clauses based on amenities (e.g., cyc wall → no shoes/scuffs; haze → detectors policy).

City addenda (noise ordinances, loading zones) appended automatically.

E) Deposits & Damage Claims (with Finance integration)

Defaults (config in §4.14.2):

studio.deposit.default_pct (e.g., 20%); studio.deposit.cap_money (e.g., $250); auth expiry (e.g., 7 days).

Cleaning fee min (e.g., $25) and overtime rate rules (per 30min increments).

Operations:

Hold at checkout (separate from GMV); visible in receipts (§4.12).

Claim flow: host uploads timestamped photos + rule reference → Deposit Claim Calculator suggests capture amount (§4.14.5).

Capture/void/release managed in Finance (§4.14.6); > cap or > $1k needs dual approval; separate deposit receipt emitted.

Edge cases:

Auth expiring in 24h → alert host + Support; bulk void tool (§4.14.6 runbooks).

Disputed capture → Neutral Review (§4.14.5) with evidence pack.

F) Access Management & Lockout Handling

Access types: onsite host, code lock, concierge checkin, key pickup; captured in House Rules.

Lockout signals: repeated code failures, buyer “at door” SOS, phone relay unanswered.

Playbook: verify instructions sent → check code validity (if logs provided) → if host fault, refund path + deposit void; if buyer fault, apply policy bands.

Relocation: surface city’s backup studio list; goodwill credit within caps (§4.14.2).

G) Availability, Pricing & Visibility Controls

Admin knobs (no code):

Minimum booking duration (e.g., 2h), starttime increments (15/30/60m), max party size.

Overtime billing rule (per 15/30/60m, grace period).

Cleaning fee band and “reset time” between bookings.

Visibility tier: Verified only appears in “Studio selector” at checkout; unverified can exist but rank lower or require manual approval.

Featured eligibility (per §4.14.8) and weekly price ladder by city×role.

Search facet toggles: amenities, district/neighborhood, natural light, sound treatment, max occupancy, deposit required.

H) LBG (Linked Booking Group) TieIns

Studio + Talent legs autogrouped for cart/checkout; each has its own SOW/House Rules and receipts but a Group receipt summarizes both (§4.12).

Change orders allow moving one leg while warning if the other conflicts; conflict resolution wizard proposes nearest alternatives.

Disputes are legscoped; refund one leg without touching the other; Support calculators handle prorates (§4.14.5).

I) Studio Seeding & Coverage (with City Ops)

Coverage heatmap: neighborhoods with bookings vs demand; targets defined in §4.14.9.

Outreach tools: import local studio lists; template packs for invitations (discounted Featured, verification subsidies).

Quality gates: require Studio Verified for carousel placement; deposit defaults autoapplied.

J) Compliance & Insurance (lighttouch)

COI upload field (optional/required based on amenity—e.g., aerial rigs); expiry tracking; reminder 30 days prior.

Local regulations: note fields for special permits (fire, drone, alcohol); checklist acknowledges compliance.

Underage protections: if minors allowed by House Rules, enforce chaperone clause and IDverified guardian signature.

K) Support & Safety Integrations

Access failures autoopen Support case (P1) with House Rules and code logs attached (§4.14.5).

Unsafe conditions reports route to T&S; delist until fixes verified (§4.14.3).

Moderation: listing images/text scanned per §4.14.4; explicit sets blocked; appeals possible.

L) Metrics & Alerts

KPIs

Verification coverage (# Verified Studios, % of studio supply).

Access failure rate (per 100 bookings), deposit claim rate & win %.

Dispute rate (studio leg) and time to resolve.

Utilization: hours booked / hours available; overtime incidence.

Image quality pass rate at moderation; COI validity %.

Coverage by neighborhood vs target (green/yellow/red).

Alerts

Lockouts > threshold/day; deposit auths expiring > threshold; COI expiring in ≤30 days; neighborhood coverage gaps; repeated unsafe condition reports.

M) Telemetry (Studios Ops)

studio.verify.submit/approve/reject/reverify_due

studio.listing.photo.upload/flag/approve

studio.rules.apply/update • studio.deposit.config.update

studio.access.lockout.signal/resolve

studio.deposit.claim.open/capture/void/release

studio.visibility.tier.update • studio.featured.assign

studio.coverage.alert • studio.coi.upload/expire

N) Acceptance Criteria (mark 4.14.11 FINAL)

Onboarding & verification flow with evidence, GPSstamped photos, House Rules packs, and badge issuance/reverify cadence.

Amenity taxonomy and blacklist enforced; listing photos moderated for SFW previews.

Deposits configured per city; holds at checkout; claim flow with evidence and calculator; captures/voids in Finance.

Access & lockout playbooks with relocation option and goodwill credits within caps.

Availability/pricing knobs (min duration, increments, overtime, cleaning fee); visibility tiering and search facets.

LBG support: group checkout, legscoped disputes, group receipt, conflict wizard.

Compliance fields (COI, permits); reminder system for expiries.

City coverage heatmap & seeding hooks; Featured eligibility integration.

Metrics, alerts, telemetry dashboards live; audit trails for all actions.

O) Why this works

Trustable supply (verified, documented, SFW) that plugs directly into your booking, dispute, and finance rails.

Smooth dayof operations (clear House Rules, access, deposits) cut Support load and refunds.

City growth ready with coverage targets, seeding tools, and fair visibility.

Nocode adjustments keep you nimble as you scale studios alongside talent.

§4.14.12 — Data & Reporting (Admin UI)

Goal: Give nonengineering teams one place to see how the marketplace is performing, diagnose issues, and act—without raw SQL. Dashboards are curated, LBGaware, privacysafe, and tie back to exact definitions in a shared metric catalog. Exports and alerts are scheduled, and everything is auditable. (Section 5 will specify the data warehouse schema & event contracts.)

A) Scope, Roles & Guardrails

Who uses this: Execs, City Ops, Marketing/Promotions, Trust & Safety, Content Moderation, Support, Finance/Tax, Studios Ops, Product.
What it covers: Curated dashboards, drilldowns, cohorting/segmentation, scheduled reports, anomaly alerts, CSV/JSON exports.
Guardrails:

RBAC mirrors §4.14.1 (Admin Security).

PII masked by default; unmask requires scope + reason.

LBG vs leg metrics are clearly labeled.

All numbers show definition tooltips linking to the Metric Catalog.

B) Metric Catalog (sourceoftruth)

Catalog entries include: name, owner, business definition, SQL/logic hash, event sources, time grain, inclusions/exclusions, and version.
Examples

gmv_total (LBG sum, excludes deposits; refunds netted)

bookings_count (LBG count; includes completed & accepted scheduled)

take_rate_net ( (provider_fee + buyer_fee − processor_fees − invalid_click_credits) / GMV )

rep_score_avg (roleweighted, timedecayed average)

promos_roas_incremental (holdoutbased; §3.3)

safety_incidents_per_1k (P0+P1 cases / 1,000 LBGs)

calc_error_rate_tax (tax calc exceptions / tax calc requests)

Governance

Every dashboard tile references a catalog key with version (e.g., take_rate_net@v2).

Changes trigger deprecation windows and “what changed?” diffs.

C) Data Freshness & Reliability

Freshness badges on every page: “Updated 8 min ago” with SLA: nearrealtime (≤15 min) for ops; daily for monthend finance.

Backfill indicators when a replay job is running; “partial” banner on affected tiles.

Data Quality checks: completeness, duplicate event ratios, referential integrity (e.g., booking has a city & role), schema drift alarms.

D) Dashboard Library (curated)

D1. Marketplace Health (Companywide)

Lighthouse tiles (last 7/28/90): GMV (LBG), Bookings (LBG), Net Takerate, Active Supply by role, Verified %, IB share, Inquiry→Booking %, Repeat booking %, CSAT, NPS, Safety incidents /1k, Chargeback rate & win %, Invalid click rate.

Trends: by city & role; stacked time series with YoY/DoW controls.

Drilldowns: click GMV → city→role → provider decile → booking list.

D2. City Ops Dashboard

Targets vs actuals (from §4.14.9): supply targets, ratios, verified coverage, response time median, IB share, studio coverage heatmap.

Alerts panel: gaps, overconcentration, budget burn.

Actions: jump links to cohort builder or playbooks.

D3. Growth & Activation

Funnel: Invite → Signup → ID Verify → Publish packages → First booking → Second booking (retention).

Split by role, city, and acquisition channel.

Cohorts: weekly signup cohorts; time to first booking; weekoverweek retention.

D4. Search & Conversion

Searches, result CTR, contact rate, inquiry→booking rate by role/city.

Ranking diagnostics: distribution by distance/price/rep; effect of Safe Mode toggles.

Zeroresult queries & top filters used.

D5. Promotions Performance (§4.14.8)

Spend, CPC, CPB, clicks→inquiries→bookings, incremental ROAS (holdout) by city×role deciles.

Invalid click rate; buyer “Hide promoted” rate.

Featured impressions → clicks → bookings; makegood credits.

D6. Trust & Safety (§4.14.3)

Cases by severity (P0/P1/P2); SLA hit rate; time to mitigation; repeat offenders; autosanction accuracy (false positive rate).

IB suppression count/duration; strikes distribution; safety incident rate per 1k.

D7. Content Moderation (§4.14.4)

Upload → autoapprove %, sensitiveallow %, removal %, decision time median, appeal overturn rate.

NSFW classifier drift (precision/recall vs golden set).

Offplatform payment phrase incidence trend.

D8. Support & Disputes (§4.14.5)

Case volume by type; SLA adherence; outcome mix; refund rate; quality disputes split (subjective/objective).

Chargebacks: opened, represented, win %; liability $.

Goodwill credits issued vs caps; selfserve resolution %.

D9. Finance & Payouts (§4.14.6)

Net takerate, processor cost %, payout failure rate, reserves coverage, Early Payout usage & yield.

Deposit holds/captures, refund volume, adjustments.

Daily recon variances; monthend readiness checklist.

D10. Tax & Compliance (§4.14.7)

W9 coverage %, TIN mismatch backlog aging, 1099 run status, calc error rate & latency, nexus triggers, filing calendar.

D11. Studios Ops (§4.14.11)

Verified Studios count & %, access failure rate, deposit claim rate & win %, utilization (hours), overtime incidence, coverage by neighborhood.

D12. Product & A/B Experiments

Experiment list with lift metrics (conversion, ROAS, responsetime); guardrail breaches; sample ratio mismatch checks.

E) Filters, Segments & Cohorts

Global filters across dashboards: date range, city/state, role, device type, Safe Mode (on/off exposure), verification tier, Rep decile, acquisition channel, campaign.
Segments: new vs returning, Verified vs unverified, Trusted Pro vs not, IB on/off, social deciles (IG/TT/YT/X), price band.
Cohorts: weekly signup cohort; firstbooking cohort; citylaunch cohort; provider deciles by activity.

F) Drilldowns & Detail Views

From tile → detail (e.g., click “Chargeback loss $” → list of cases with links to evidence packs).

From promotions → providerlevel ROAS & CPB; click to open their campaign settings.

From city ratios → list of providers to invite (prefilled filters) or studios to outreach.

G) Exports & Scheduling

Oneclick CSV/JSON for tables; parquet for large extracts (warehouse path).

Scheduled reports (email/Slack) with attachments or links: daily health, weekly city ops, promos ROAS, safety SLA, finance recon, tax filings due, support SLAs.

Access control: report subscriptions require RBAC role; PII masked unless scope granted.

Run logs: success/failure; retry with backoff; recipients list.

H) Alerts & Anomaly Detection

Rules (editable via §4.14.2)

Takerate drops > 100 bps DoD in any city

Inquiry→Booking dips < 25% for > 24h in a city

Invalid click rate > 10% for any provider dayoverday

Safety P0 count ≥ 3 in 24h in a city

Tax calc error rate > 1% in any state

Payout failure rate > 0.5% daily

Moderation removal spike > 3× baseline houroverhour

Destinations: Slack channels (teamspecific) and email; each alert links to the dashboard deeplink and relevant admin tool.

I) Privacy, PII & SafeMode Display

PII masking by default; unmask requires scope + reason; downloads watermark the requester.

SFW previews only (no explicit thumbnails in dashboards).

Aggregation thresholds: hide tiles for cohorts < N to avoid reidentification.

GDPR/CCPA hooks: (futureproof) report excludes deleted/anonymized users.

J) LBG vs Leg Accounting

Toggle: “View as LBG” (grouped) vs “View legs” (talent/studio separate).

KPIs indicate which base is used (badge: LBG SUM or LEG SUM).

Exports include both views with join keys.

K) Admin UI Patterns

Tile glossary: hover → definition, owner, metric key, last changed, link to catalog.

Compare mode: select two cities or two periods; shows % change and confidence bands.

Saved views: peruser saved filter sets; share links with teammates.

Notes: add annotations (“Houston buyerfee holiday started here”).

L) Integrations & Links

Deep links to §4.14.8 (Promotions floors, QS), §4.14.9 (City playbooks), §4.14.5 (open case), §4.14.6 (finance event), §4.14.7 (nexus switch), §4.14.10 (edit template).

Warehouse: every tile shows the dataset table/view powering it; “Open in warehouse” (readonly for Analysts).

M) Metrics & Quality Ops

Data QA dashboard: event drop rates, late arrivals, schema errors, backfill status.

Reconciliation: GMV per dashboard vs finance exports; discrepancy tile with thresholds.

Ownership: each dashboard has an owner and oncall rotation for data quality.

N) Telemetry (Data UI)

data.dashboard.view (name) • data.tile.click (metric_key)

data.filter.apply • data.export.run (scope, rows) • data.schedule.create/run/fail

data.alert.fire/ack/resolve (rule_id)

data.metric.version.change (key, old→new)

data.drilldown.open (entity_type) • data.deep_link.out

O) Acceptance Criteria (mark 4.14.12 FINAL)

Metric Catalog exists; every tile references a catalog key+version with definition tooltip.

Freshness badges, backfill banners, and data quality checks present on all dashboards.

Curated dashboards for Marketplace, City Ops, Growth, Search & Conversion, Promotions, T&S, Moderation, Support, Finance, Tax, Studios, Experiments.

Filters/segments/cohorts work globally; cohort retention and funnel views implemented.

Drilldowns to entities/cases; deep links into admin tools.

Exports (CSV/JSON/parquet) and scheduled reports (email/Slack) with RBAC & masking.

Alerts and anomaly rules configurable; fire to Slack/email with dashboard links.

PII/SafeMode protections: masking, aggregation thresholds, SFW previews, watermarking.

LBG vs leg toggle implemented; labeled KPIs and exports.

Telemetry events and data QA dashboards live; owner per dashboard assigned.

P) Why this works

Puts the right numbers in front of each team with shared definitions, so decisions are aligned.

Nearrealtime ops plus monthend depth covers both daily steering and financial truth.

Privacysafe and actionlinked (deep links) means insights turn into changes quickly.

Versioned metrics keep trust high even as we refine logic.

§4.14.13 — Observability & Incident Response

Goal: Detect issues early, respond fast, and recover safely—without exposing PII or requiring code changes. Provide a unified status cockpit, clear SLOs/alerts, oneclick degradations/kill switches, tested runbooks, disciplined postmortems, and links into every admin tool that matters.

A) Scope, Roles & Guardrails

Who uses this: OnCall (Product/Platform), SRE/Ops, City Ops (read), Support Leads, Trust & Safety Leads, Finance (payout incidents), Legal (for P0 comms approvals).
What it covers: service health, dependency health, synthetic checks, error budgets, alerts & paging, incident command, comms, degradations/killswitches (from §4.14.2), runbooks, postmortems, and status page publishing.

Guardrails:

Paging thresholds & killswitches are configdriven (see §4.14.2) with twoperson approval for money/safety toggles.

PIIsafe logs only; sensitive views still respect §4.14.1 scopes.

B) SLOs, SLIs & Error Budgets

Toplevel SLOs (Prod, monthly):

Checkout success (card/ACH): ≥ 99.5% 2xx within p95 latency ≤ 2.5s.

Booking create/accept: ≥ 99.7% success, p95 ≤ 1.5s.

Search: p95 ≤ 800ms, 99.9% availability.

Payout queue: ≥ 99% of eligible payouts queued within 2h of completion; failure rate < 0.5%.

Uploads & moderation pipeline: 99% of images/videos scanned within 60s; backlog < 2k items.

Tax calc: p95 ≤ 1.5s; exception rate < 0.5%.

Promotions delivery: spend pacing error < 5% daily; invalid click falsenegative rate < 2%.

SLIs monitored: success rate, latency p50/p95/p99, saturation (queue depth, CPU/mem), dependency errors, synthetic check pass rate, error budget burn (1h/6h/24h).

C) Health Cockpit (Admin → Observability)

Status board tiles: API, Search, Checkout (Card/ACH), Escrow, Payouts, Promotions, Uploads/Moderation, Tax Engine, Background Check, Studio Deposits, Messaging, Notifications.
Each tile shows current SLI/SLO, trend sparkline, errorbudget burn, and degrade/kill buttons (where safe).
Dependency pane: external provider status ingest; shows current incidents & ETA.

Synthetic monitors:

Buyer path: search → profile → add to cart → checkout (card/ACH) → receipt.

Seller path: accept → deliverables upload → acceptance.

Studio path: calendar → checkout with deposit hold.
Runs per city (Houston focus + 3 canaries) every minute.

D) Alerting Policy & Paging

Severities

S0 (P0): Platformwide checkout failure, data loss risk, security breach → page immediately (phone/SMS/Slack) to OnCall + Incident Commander (IC).

S1 (P1): Degraded key flow in any city (e.g., Houston), payout stall, tax calc outage, promotions overspend → page OnCall.

S2: Elevated error or latency with autoretries; backlog growth; single dependency degraded → Slack alert to channel; acknowledge within 30 min.

S3: Nonurgent anomalies & dataquality drifts → daily digest.

Threshold examples (editable in §4.14.2):

Checkout success < 98.5% 10min window (S1); < 95% 5min (S0).

Tax exceptions > 2% 15min (S1).

Payout failures > 1% 30min (S1).

Promotions spend pacing > +10% houroverhour (S1).

Upload backlog > 5k or scan p95 > 120s (S2).

Escalation: IC assigns Ops Lead, Comms/Scribe, and Resolver; if no ack in 5 min, escalate to secondary.

E) Incident Lifecycle (declare → close)

Detect (monitor or report) → Declare severity & IC in the tool.

Stabilize: apply degradation/kill switches (see G), raise banners, slow traffic if needed, open support macro.

Communicate: internal incident room; post to public status page if S0/S1; cadence every 30–60 min until resolved.

Mitigate & validate: rollbacks, feature flag flips, traffic shifting, provider fallback.

Resolve: all SLIs normal; remove banners; undegrade; mark “Resolved”.

Postmortem: within 5 business days—blameless, action items with owners/deadlines.

Comms templates (from §4.14.10): internal alert, stakeholder update, public status page incident, “all clear.”

F) Degradations & Kill Switches (oneclick)

Degrade (preferred) before kill: keeps core value flowing.

Checkout: disable ACH (fallback to card; buyer fee reverts to 5%); disable multileg/LBG (separate flows) if grouping breaks.

Promotions: pause Featured, keep CPC with stricter caps; or pause all paid Boosts.

Tax: grace mode—block checkout with clear retry banner (failclosed for money safety) or delay acceptance with “tax pending” flag (adminapproved only).

Uploads: switch to queueonly (no preview generation) and lengthen moderation SLA; throttle size per file.

Payouts: enqueue only, delay send with banner; communicate ETAs to sellers.

Background checks: switch to IDonly gating temporarily; queue requests.

Studio deposits: disable new auths (fallback to cleaning fee) if PSP deposit path fails.

Kill switches (hard off; see §4.14.2): Instant Book, Promotions, LBG, ACH, Deposits, Safe Mode stricton. All require reason + twoperson approval for money/safety.

G) Runbooks (top 12)

Card processor incident → route to fallback region; if full outage: block checkout with banner; open S0; ACH off; autoretry queue.

ACH/Bank link outage → kill ACH; buyer fee back to 5%; announce; reenable when synthetic passes 30 min.

Tax engine down → enable tax grace mode; hold checkouts or delay acceptance (policy); alert Finance; reprice none.

Payouts failing → freeze sends; display “payout delayed” in UI; retry after root cause; notify sellers.

Search index degraded → fall back to cached results/top N; disable advanced filters; rebuild offline.

Uploads S3/CDN issue → switch to reduced image sizes; queue video; show “processing longer than usual.”

Moderation classifier offline → enforce SFW blur defaults; premoderate first N items; ramp back after checks.

Promotions overspend anomaly → immediate CPC cap; pause Featured; credit wallet for overdelivery; rootcause invalid clicks.

Spam/abuse wave → tighten DM caps; block offplatform keywords; autoquarantine new accounts; T&S mass actions.

Studio lockout spike → open city relocation list; goodwill credit budget; contact affected bookings.

Feature flag misconfig → oneclick rollback to last known good; diff viewer; require approver notes.

Data pipeline delay → show “partial” freshness banner; queue scheduled reports; notify dashboard users.

Each runbook includes: owner, steps, rollback, comms template, postincident checks.

H) Change Management & Safeguards

Staged rollout for risky configs (1%→10%→50%→100%); autoabort on guardrail breach (conversion, checkout, error rate).

Release freeze windows (city launches, holidays).

Preprod synthetic runs parallel to Prod.

Canaries: mirror 1–5% traffic.

Autorollback if error budget 1h burn exceeds threshold.

I) Logging, Tracing & PII Hygiene

Structured logs with request_id, booking_id, city, role; no plaintext PII (emails, phones, TINs) ever logged; use tokens only.

Distributed tracing across services; trace viewer limited to Admin roles; sampling adjustable during incidents.

Retention: app logs 14–30 days; security/finance events 1–3 years (per policy).

Access: masked views by default; unmask gated by §4.14.1 scopes + reason.

J) Backups, Recovery & Continuity

RPO/RTO targets: RPO ≤ 15 min, RTO ≤ 2 h for critical data stores.

Backups: pointintime for primary DB; object storage with lifecycle; daily job integrity checks; quarterly restore drills.

Event replay: appendonly event bus; replay tools to rebuild search indexes, counters, and derived aggregates.

External links manifest (deliverables): names/sizes/hashes enable dispute handling even if thirdparty storage hiccups.

K) Public Status Page & Comms

Components: API, Checkout, Payouts, Search, Uploads/Media, Promotions, Tax Engine, Background Checks, Studio Deposits.

Incident workflow: draft → Legal quick review for S0 “wording” → publish; cadence every 30–60 min; “resolved” with root cause summary and next steps.

Subscribe: email/RSS.

Transparency guardrails: never include PII; keep copy SFW.

L) Postmortems (Blameless)

Trigger: any S0, or S1 > 30 min, or repeat S2 within 7 days.

Structure: what/impact/timeline/where we were blind/root cause(s)/what helped/hurt/fixes/owners/dates; link to diffs & flags; attach dashboards.

Action tracking: owners & due dates; reminders; escalation if overdue.

Learning loop: update runbooks/alerts/guardrails; review in weekly ops.

M) Metrics & Alerts (Observability Program)

MTTD/MTTR (by severity), % incidents detected by monitors vs user reports (target > 80% monitors).

Error budget used per SLO; number of autorollbacks; changefailure rate; paging fatigue (alerts/week/engineer).

Runbook coverage: incidents with matching runbook; time to first mitigation.

Comms: time from declare → first status page update.

N) Telemetry (Obs & Incidents)

obs.sli.update (name, value, slo_target) • obs.error_budget.burn

incident.declare (sev, ic, reason) • incident.page/ack/escalate

incident.degrade.on/off (flag) • incident.kill.on/off (flag)

incident.status.update (public|internal) • incident.resolve

postmortem.create/publish • runbook.open/complete

obs.alert.fire/ack/resolve (rule_id) • obs.synthetic.fail/pass

O) Acceptance Criteria (mark 4.14.13 FINAL)

Status cockpit with SLIs/SLOs, error budgets, dependency health, and oneclick degradations/kill switches.

Alerting policy with severities, thresholds, paging & escalation; editable via §4.14.2.

Incident workflow (IC assignment, roles, comms cadence, banners, status page publishing).

Runbooks for top 12 scenarios; linked buttons in cockpit; tested quarterly.

Change safeguards: staged rollout, guardrails, autorollback; freeze windows.

PIIsafe logging & tracing with RBAC; retention policies applied.

Backups & restore drills meeting RPO/RTO; event replay tools.

Postmortems with action tracking; program metrics & quarterly review.

Telemetry events emitted; dashboards for MTTD/MTTR, alert volumes, error budgets.

P) Why this works

Find fast, fix fast: crisp SLOs and a cockpit that puts degradations and runbooks one click away.

Safe by design: money/safety toggles require approvals; PII never leaks; comms stay clear and SFW.

Continuous learning: postmortems feed runbooks and guardrails so incidents trend down as the platform scales.

§4.14.14 — Bulk Tools & Migrations

Goal: Give Ops/Support/Finance the power to make large, safe, reversible changes—without code. Handle duplicates, reindexing, citywide policy rollouts, mass refunds/credits, campaign adjustments, board/content moves, and backfills with dryruns, guardrails, approvals, scheduling, and audit trails. LBGaware, moneysafe, privacysafe.

A) Scope, Roles & Guardrails

Who uses this: Super Admin (rare), Ops Leads, Support Leads, Finance, City Ops, Trust & Safety (specific flows), Content Moderation (specific flows), Readonly Auditor.

What it can change (entity families):

Users & Accounts (merge, role/profile reparenting, verification status sync)

Bookings & LBGs (link/unlink legs, acceptance window extensions, deliverables due date shifts)

Money Objects (bulk refunds/credits/fee adjustments with amended receipts)

Promotions (boost/featured campaigns: pause/price floor align, budget edits)

Search/Index & Social Metrics (reindex, backfill, recalc Rep, resync social metrics)

Boards & Content (move/retag favorites, reassign tagged collaborators)

Studios (policy parameter updates: deposits, cleaning fees, min durations)

Policy Attachments (SOW/release/House Rules addenda to future/affected bookings)

Guardrails (always on):

Twoperson approval for money, safety, PIIsensitive, or irreversible actions.

Dryrun + blastradius preview with sample rows required.

Chunked execution, idempotency keys, resume on failure.

Autogenerate rollback plan (where feasible) + snapshots.

Mask PII in previews; unmask gated by §4.14.1 scopes.

B) Common Bulk Job Flow (wizard)

Select Operation → entity family + action (see sections below).

Define Target Set → filters (city, role, date range, status, verification, Rep decile, campaign status, etc.) + optional CSV list (IDs/emails).

DryRun & Preview → show count, 50row sample (before/after), impacted KPIs (e.g., total refund $), dependency checks (e.g., open disputes?).

Risk & Guardrails → flags needed (MoneyCritical, SafetyCritical), limits (max $/booking, max $ total, max rows).

Schedule & Pace → start/end window (local city TZ), batch size, interbatch delay, offpeak default.

Approvals → second approver with diff viewer.

Execute & Monitor → progress bar, perbatch logs, error bucket with retry.

Notify (optional) → attach Smart Docs/Comms templates (§4.14.10) to inform impacted users.

Rollback (if supported) → oneclick create inverse job template prefilled from snapshot.

Job record includes: actor, reason code, linked ticket, scopes, filters, dryrun snapshot hash, approvals, schedule, outcome stats, CSV of affected IDs (downloadable, masked).

C) Users & Accounts — Merge & Normalize

Use cases: duplicate signups (email + social), creator with split role accounts, brand team consolidation.

Actions:

LinkandHold (soft stage, reversible 7 days): mark profiles as aliases; both URLs redirect to a canonical; present “pending merge” banner in Admin; no data is moved yet.

Finalize Merge (irreversible): unify login identities, verifications (highest wins with audit), W9/TIN (prompt to pick primary; alternate archived), payout method (choose primary), portfolios (dedupe media via hash), reviews (union), Rep score (recompute with decay), DM threads (reassign to canonical), promotions wallets (sum balances), boards (union).

Role/Profile Reparent: move a service profile (e.g., Photographer) from user A to user B (rare; requires proof + approvals).

Guardrails:

Twoperson approval; no ongoing payout/chargeback on either account; no active safety cases.

Rollback: only from LinkandHold. After Finalize, a reversal = new merge job in opposite direction not allowed (must escalate to engineering).

Comms: notify both emails; require reauth next login.

D) Bookings & LBG — Relate, Retime, Addenda

Use cases: early legs created separately need grouping; acceptance window policy changed; stormrelated deliverables extension.

Actions:

Link to LBG: select talent/studio bookings within same buyer + window → create Group; generate Group Receipt (§4.12).

Unlink leg (rare): leg removed from LBG (keeps its receipts); requires Support case link.

Acceptance Window Extend: push acceptance due date by N days on open bookings (config max).

Deliverables Due Shift: move due dates; optional autoaddendum via Smart Docs; both parties notified.

Policy Addendum: attach a SOW/House Rules addendum to future or open bookings; requires reaccept in thread.

Guardrails: no money lines altered unless paired with Change Order; respect city policy keys (§4.14.2); log all changes & notify.

E) Money — Safe Bulk Refunds / Credits / Fee Fixes

Use cases: processor outage partial refunds, tax miscalc in one state/day, goodwill credit wave after access failures.

Actions:

Refunds (partial/full): reasoncoded; perline (packages, addons, travel, license); recompute fees/taxes; issue amended receipts (§4.12).

Credits (platform wallet): city/role scoped; expirations; ledger post (§4.14.6).

Fee Adjustment (rare): buyer or provider fee correction for window; twoperson approval; bounded by floor/cap.

Deposit Voids (studio): mass void for auths expiring due to outage.

Guardrails:

Global caps: max $ per booking, $ total, # rows; chargebackexcluded; safety cases excluded.

Dual approval; dryrun shows totals; Finance visibility during execution.

Rollback: credits reversible (issue offset); refunds not (issue countercharge only with consent → avoided).

F) Promotions — Campaign Adjustments

Use cases: raise floors citywide; pause Featured during outage; align active bids to new floors.

Actions:

Pause/Resume active Boost or Featured campaigns (filters: city×role, Rep tier, budget left).

Floor Alignment: if bid < floor, autoraise to floor (optin); notify providers.

Budget & Dates: extend end dates, add makegood credits.

Bulk credit for invalid clicks during incident (ties into §4.14.8 wallet).

Guardrails: eligibility enforced; Finance ledger posts; notify affected users (template).

G) Search/Index & Social — Reindex, Recalc, Resync

Use cases: new facet weights; rep formula tweak; social API outage recovery.

Actions:

Reindex profiles/search with new §4.14.2 weights or facet toggles; chunked by city.

Rep Recalc: recompute scores for selected cohorts (e.g., HOU photographers); publish atomically.

Social Resync: refresh IG/TT/YT/X metrics for affected accounts (ratelimited; respect API quotas); mark verified/unverified chips accordingly.

NSFW Rescan: rerun classifier on portfolio thumbnails when threshold changes; rewrite preview crops.

Guardrails: throttle; backoff on provider API limits; banner “metrics refreshing” on profiles.

H) Boards & Content — Move, Retag, Reassign

Use cases: consolidate user’s boards, fix mistagged collaborators after merge, remove content from feeds.

Actions:

Move items between boards; rename/merge boards; preserve creation dates.

Retag collaborators on content to new canonical user (after merge); send consent prompt again if needed.

Remove or reprivacy content in policy migrations (e.g., stricter preview rules) with reason + appeal link.

Guardrails: respect collaborator consent states; moderation rules (§4.14.4) rerun on moved items.

I) Studios — Policy Parameter Updates

Use cases: city raises default deposits; cleaning fee minima update; min duration changes.

Actions:

Deposit %/cap updates to listings; choose: apply to new bookings only or also to open (future) bookings via addendum + reaccept.

Cleaning fee minima mass set; min duration increased; starttime increment adjusted.

Visibility tier: demote unverified studios from carousels.

Guardrails: LBGaware; generate addenda; Finance deposit holds adjusted only on new checkouts (never silently increased on existing bookings).

J) Previews, Simulation & Impact Checks

For every job:

Count & sample (before/after columns).

Impact tiles: total refunds $, # bookings affected, # users to notify, campaigns paused, index rebuild time estimate.

Dependency warnings: “10 bookings have open disputes”, “5 users under safety investigation”, “25 payouts queued”.

KPI simulation (when applicable): expected takerate delta, ROAS effect range, search ranking drift.

K) Scheduling, Chunking & Idempotency

Chunk size defaults (e.g., 500 users; 2,000 bookings; 10,000 index docs).

Pacing: interbatch delay (e.g., 2–10s), offpeak windows (cityaware).

Idempotency: each batch writes a job_id + batch_id footprint; retries skip alreadydone rows.

Resume: pick up from last successful batch; Stop is safe; Requeue failed only.

Rate limits: external API calls (social, PSP) throttled; exponential backoff.

L) Communications (optional but recommended)

Attach email/SMS templates (§4.14.10) per job type (refund notice, policy addendum, campaign pause, merge confirm).

Quiet hours respected; city timezone aware.

“Why you’re seeing this” copy autofilled with reason code and policy link.

M) Data Integrity & Audit

Snapshot prechange: affected rows (IDs, key fields) hashed and archived.

Immutable job log: inputs, approvals, batches, outcomes, error list.

Entity timelines updated (e.g., “Bulk refund JOB123 applied 20251104”).

Downloadables: CSV of results (masked), error CSV, notification list.

N) Metrics & Alerts

KPIs

Job success %; average retry rate; rollback rate; time to completion.

Money jobs: total $ moved, variance vs preview (target < 1%).

Index jobs: doc rebuild throughput, search latency impact.

Comms: open/click/complaint rate on notices.

Safety: user reports spike postjob (guardrail metric).

Alerts

Batch error rate > threshold; preview vs actual deltas; money cap nearing; API ratelimit stalls; search p95 > SLA during reindex.

O) Telemetry (Bulk Ops)

bulk.job.create/preview/approve/schedule/start/progress/finish/fail/rollback

bulk.scope.resolve (counts) • bulk.sample.fetch

bulk.guardrail.block (reason) • bulk.approval.add

bulk.notify.send/fail • bulk.retry.batch

bulk.money.total_delta • bulk.index.docs_processed

bulk.rollback.create/finish

P) Acceptance Criteria (mark 4.14.14 FINAL)

Unified Bulk Job wizard with filters, dryrun, approvals, schedule, monitoring, rollback templates.

User merge with LinkandHold → Finalize; payout/W9/TIN/payout/portfolio/reviews/DMs/boards consolidation; redirects set; audit logged.

LBG tools: link/unlink legs, acceptance/delivery date shifts, addenda attach + reaccept flow.

Money jobs: refunds/credits/fee fixes with caps, recomputed fees/taxes, amended receipts, Finance ledger posts.

Promotions jobs: pause/resume, floor alignment, budget/date edits, invalidclick makegoods.

Index & metrics jobs: reindex, Rep recalc, social resync, NSFW rescan—throttled & resumable.

Boards/content: move/merge boards, retag collaborators, reprivacy content with appeals links.

Studio policy updates: deposit %, caps, cleaning/min duration with addenda options; no silent increases on existing bookings.

Scheduling/chunking/idempotency and PIIsafe previews; detailed job logs & snapshots.

Metrics/alerts/telemetry for success, deltas, errors, and performance impact.

Q) Why this works

Ops speed, safely: Big changes happen during offpeak with previews, caps, and approvals.

Reversible where possible: snapshots and rollback templates reduce fear and downtime.

Money and policyaware: recomputes fees/taxes, issues amended receipts, triggers addenda and reacceptance where users must opt in.

Scales with growth: chunked, resumable, idempotent jobs keep risk low as data volume rises.

§4.14.15 — Legal & Records

Goal: Handle subpoenas/LE requests, litigation holds, datasubject actions, and retention/deletion safely and defensibly—with leastprivilege access, full audit trails, reliable exports, and clear coordination with Trust/Safety, Support, and Finance. Keep engineers out of the loop for routine matters; make exceptional cases twoperson approved and PIIsafe.

A) Scope, Roles & Guardrails

Who uses this: Legal (owner), Privacy/Compliance, Trust & Safety Leads (read/assist), Support Leads (DSR assist), Finance/Tax (view for records), Readonly Auditor.

What it covers:

Intake & verification of subpoenas, warrants, and LE requests (USonly).

Case vaults and legal holds that suspend deletion/retention timers.

Data retention schedules & purge jobs for system records (chat, bookings, docs, logs).

Data Subject Requests (DSR): access/export, deletion (where allowed), and optout logging.

Clickwrap & consent logs (ToS/Privacy, Edelivery).

Discovery exports: review sets with PII redaction and hashed manifests.

Guardrails:

Twoperson approval for any data disclosure or hold release (Legal + Privacy).

PII scopes enforced (see §4.14.1): only Legal role can unmask PIITax and PIIBackground inside exports.

Chainofcustody hashing on every produced file.

Gag order awareness: suppress user notifications where order shown and recorded.

B) Intake & Triage (Subpoenas / LE Requests)

Intake form (upload + metadata): issuer, type (subpoena/warrant/court order/civil), jurisdiction, case number, served date/time, compliance deadline, scope (user(s), timeframe), gag order flag, contact info.
Verification checklist: signature and court details, jurisdiction match (US), acceptable service method.
Routing: autoopen Legal case with SLA timers (e.g., acknowledge within 2 business days; faster for warrants).
Scope precheck: search users/bookings to confirm identifiers; if insufficient, send clarification template (via Smart Docs §4.14.10).

Case view includes: timeline, documents, internal notes, holds applied, disclosure decisions, produced packages, and recipients.

C) Legal Holds (Litigation / Investigations)

Apply hold to: user(s), booking(s)/LBG(s), studio(s), or a time range across systems.

Effect: freezes deletion jobs, retention clocks, and purge eligibility for the bound entities; banners appear in Admin entity timelines.

Hold reasons: litigation, LE request, internal investigation, tax/audit.

Release hold: requires twoperson approval; reasons recorded; downstream purge job reevaluates.

SLA reminders: hold reviews every N days; stale holds flagged.

D) Retention Schedules & Purge Jobs (USfirst)

Policy profiles (editable, with Legal approval):

Operational data (bookings, receipts, payouts): 7 years.

Chat/message content: 2 years (unless tied to dispute/hold).

Moderation & T&S case records: 5 years.

Logs/telemetry (nonfinancial): 30–90 days depending on sensitivity.

Uploads (thumbnails/manifests): as long as portfolio item exists; deleted 30 days after account deletion unless under hold.

Tax records (W9/1099 summaries): 7 years; forms stored encrypted with restricted scope.

Purge engine: nightly job evaluates each record against policy & holds; performs softdelete → grace → harddelete; writes a purge ledger entry with counts and IDs (masked).
Simulation mode: preview impact before policy changes; “blastradius” diff and rollback window.

E) Data Subject Requests (DSR) — Access / Deletion / OptOut

(USonly launch; CPRAstyle patterns to futureproof.)

Access/Export (Data Copy)

Intake: authenticated user or verified requestor; scope (account, timeframe).

Output: ZIP with JSON/CSV for profile, settings, bookings/LBG, receipts, messages (thread transcripts), reviews, references, moderation decisions (nonconfidential summaries), verification statuses (pass/fail), consents.

Redactions: thirdparty PII (emails/phones) masked unless consent or legal basis; background/tax data summarized, not raw.

Hash manifest and cover letter (generated via §4.14.10).

SLA target: 45 days (configurable).

Deletion (Right to Delete)

Eligibility rules: block if active booking/dispute/chargeback/hold or retention obligations (finance/tax).

Partial deletion: remove public content (portfolio/feed), mask profile, stop discoverability; preserve billing/contract records under retention and any items under legal hold.

Tombstone logic: display “Deleted User” on historic threads/receipts.

Coolingoff window (e.g., 14 days) with cancellation option; after window, irreversible purge runs (except retained records).

SLA: 45 days to complete when eligible.

OptOut (Sale/Sharing of data / Marketing)

Track consent and optouts; update messaging lists; record timestamp, IP/device.

Do Not Sell/Share toggle (futureproof); tie to analytics adsharing flags if applied later.

Status tracker: per request: received → verifying → in progress → completed/denied (with reason). Templates for responses in §4.14.10.

F) Discovery & Production (Civil/Criminal)

Search & collect: entity filters (user, booking range, city), keyword search across chats and metadata, time bounds.
Review workspace: preview items with PII masked by default; unmask gated; tag (responsive/nonresponsive/privileged).
Redaction tools: blocklist (emails/phones/payment handles), manual area/line redaction in PDFs, autoredact minors’ identifiers.
Production packages:

Formats: PDF (with redactions), CSV/JSON for structured data, original media hashes and links (we provide manifests for thirdparty storage like Drive/Dropbox rather than duplicating large files).

Hash manifest (per file + whole set), cover letter, case metadata.

Chainofcustody: who exported, when, with which scopes; twoperson approval for release.

Notification rules: where permitted, notify users whose data is produced; suppressed if gag order recorded.

G) Policies & ClickWrap/Consent Logs

ToS/Privacy versions, with acceptance timestamps, IP/device, and surfaces (web/app).

Edelivery consent (tax forms) and marketing consents with granularity (email/SMS).

Changes: version diffs stored; user reconsent waves scheduled via §4.14.10.

Download: CSV of acceptance logs by cohort (PII masked) for audits.

H) Integrations

Trust & Safety (§4.14.3): reference cases, import preserved evidence into holds; share redacted summaries.

Support & Disputes (§4.14.5): DSR status surface to agents; macro responses.

Finance & Tax (§4.14.6/§4.14.7): retention overrides for financial/tax records; W9/1099 forms access gated to Legal.

Docs CMS (§4.14.10): generate cover letters, denial reasons, clarification requests, and disclosure receipts.

I) Metrics & SLAs

KPIs

DSR intake volume; % completed on time; average completion days.

Holds applied/active/reviewed; average hold age.

Productions count; average time from verified request → production; redaction error rate (<1%).

Purge job throughput and exceptions; records deleted vs retained (by policy).

Consent coverage: ToS/Privacy acceptance %, Edelivery consent %.

Alerts

DSR backlog > threshold or any nearing SLA breach (T7/T3/T1 days).

Holds older than review cadence.

Purge errors > threshold; production export failures.

J) Telemetry (Legal & Records)

legal.request.intake (type, jurisdiction) • legal.request.verify

legal.hold.apply/release/review

legal.dsr.open/verify/start/complete/deny (code)

legal.purge.simulate/run/fail • legal.policy.update (retention profile)

legal.discovery.search/tag/redact/export

legal.disclosure.approve/release (twoperson)

legal.consent.accept/revoke (tos|privacy|edelivery|marketing)

K) Acceptance Criteria (mark 4.14.15 FINAL)

Intake & verification flow for subpoenas/LE requests with case vault, SLA timers, and clarification templates.

Legal holds that freeze deletion and display banners; twoperson approval to release; periodic review reminders.

Retention schedules configurable; purge engine with simulation, nightly runs, and purge ledger.

DSR: access/export ZIP with redactions & hashes; deletion flow with tombstones, coolingoff, and eligibility rules; optout toggles logged.

Discovery workspace: search, masked preview, tagging, redaction, production with hashed manifest and chainofcustody; twoperson release approval.

Clickwrap & consent logs queryable and exportable.

Integrations with T&S, Support, Finance/Tax, and Smart Docs; notifications per policy/gag orders.

Metrics & alerts dashboards; Telemetry events emitted for all actions; RBAC & PII scopes enforced.

L) Why this works

Defensible: verified intake, documented holds, hashed productions, and auditable purges.

Practical: redaction and manifests avoid duplicating huge media while still producing what’s required.

Safe by default: masking, leastprivilege, and twoperson approvals keep sensitive actions controlled.

Lowcode ops: Legal drives routine compliance without engineering; only edge cases need dev help.

§4.14.16 — Sandbox & Training

Goal: Give every ops team a safe, realistic playground to learn, rehearse, and validate workflows—without touching production or real PII. Provide seeded demo data, simulators for external partners, guided role training, incident drills, and QA/UAT tooling—with hard isolation, audits, and oneclick resets.

A) Scope, Roles & Guardrails

Who uses this: Support, Trust & Safety, City Ops, Finance/Tax, Studios Ops, Content Moderation, Marketing/Ops, Product, Legal (training), Readonly Auditors.

What it covers: Environment isolation, anonymized/procedural data, seeders & scenario packs, fake gateways (payments/tax/ID/background), webhook simulators, guided curricula, incident drills & chaos tests, QA/UAT flows, resets & snapshots, reporting.

Guardrails:

No real PII ever enters Sandbox. Exports disabled; screenshots watermarked “SANDBOX.”

Separate SSO & RBAC realms (distinct login & MFA).

Feature flags & configs edited in Sandbox have no effect on Prod (crossenv writes are blocked).

Network egress from Sandbox limited to simulators and allowlisted endpoints.

B) Environments & Isolation

DEV (for builders), SANDBOX (ops training & UAT), STAGE (preprod perf tests), PROD.

Prominent environment banner + URL subdomain color coding.

Data segregation: unique databases, storage buckets, and API keys per environment; killswitches default ON in Sandbox for moneymoving actions.

Email/SMS sink: all outbound comms land in a searchable “Message Inbox” viewer (no real delivery).

C) Data Strategy (synthetic + anonymized refresh)

Synthetic baseline: cityaccurate Houston cohort plus two satellite cities; 90day booking history; realistic distributions for roles, Rep Scores, prices, availability, and social metrics.

Anonymized refresh (optional): scheduled job builds fully anonymized aggregates from Prod (counts, medians, distributions)—never raw PII. Deterministic tokenization (formatpreserving) creates realistic but nonreversible names/handles.

Media: stock & inhouse SFW sets with license to use for training; thumbnails pregenerated.

Timemachine clock: freeze or advance Sandbox time (±30 days) to simulate quarterend, 1099 runs, and filing windows.

D) Seeders & Scenario Packs (oneclick load)

Seeders (idempotent): Users, service profiles, portfolios, studios (verified/unverified), RFPs, bookings/LBGs, messages, deliverables manifests, reviews, disputes, deposits, chargebacks, promos.

Scenario packs (choose role, city, difficulty):

Support: “Late delivery & partial refund” — deliverables shortfall, acceptance window, amended receipt flow.

T&S: “Boundary violation report” — autosuppress IB, strike ladder, neutral review handoff.

Finance: “Processor outage wave” — bulk partial refunds, recon variances, payouts delay comms.

Tax: “State X nexus on” — enable state, category map tweak, calc exceptions, filing calendar dryrun.

Moderation: “NSFW spike” — classifier thresholds, blur/crop UI, appeals triage.

Studios: “Lockout at arrival” — code logs, relocation list, deposit void.

Promotions: “ROAS slumps” — floors tuning, QS weights A/B, makegood credits.

City Ops: “Coverage gap” — invites cohort, Founding perks, carousel pin, Collab Day.

Legal: “Subpoena intake” — hold creation, discovery workspace, redacted production pack.

E) Simulators & Fakes (external dependencies)

Payments Processor Sim: card success/decline matrices, 3DS challenge emulator, ACH microdeposit flow, payout states (queued/sent/fail), chargebacks lifecycle with webhook playback.

Tax Engine Sim: city/state rate tables with toggles for timeouts/errors; “zerowhereexpected” edge cases; efile stubs for 1099 runs.

ID/Background Sim: pass/fail with reason codes; throttling/bulk delays; FCRA “adverse action” stub.

Content Scan Sim: NSFW classifier bands, OCR PII hits, virus flags.

Notifications Sim: email/SMS/web push sink with opens/clicks.

Maps/Geo Sim: distance & travel fee calculator; studio geocode anomalies.

Social Metrics Sim: IG/TT/YT/X connectors return tokenized counts, growth, and ratelimit errors.

Each simulator exposes: dashboard, force state switch, and replay last N webhooks.

F) Training Modes & Curricula

Role tracks: Support, T&S, Finance/Tax, City Ops, Studios Ops, Moderation, Promotions/Ops, Legal.

Guided checklists inside the Admin UI: stepbystep tasks with autovalidation (“Issue partial refund → amended receipt generated → totals match calculator”).

Inline coach marks & hint videos (60–120s) per task.

Autograding: pass/fail with explanations; require retry when policy violated.

Certifications: “Sandbox Certified — Support L1/L2”, “T&S L1”, etc.; expire annually; printable PDF badges.

Practice datasets rotate monthly to prevent memorization.

G) Incident Drills & Chaos Kits

Drill runner: schedule P0/P1 simulations (card processor outage, tax engine down, promotions overspend).

Chaos toggles: inject latency, error spikes, partial dependency failures (e.g., 20% payout API errors).

Scoring: MTTD/MTTR, correct use of degradations & runbooks, comms timing, and adherence to guardrails (twoperson approvals).

Afteraction: autocompiled report; add action items to Observability postmortem tracker (§4.14.13).

H) QA & UAT Workflows (nocode)

Flag preview: flip §4.14.2 feature flags safely; simulate staged rollouts and guardrail aborts.

Docs CMS UAT: assemble SOW/House Rules/releases; esign with fake signers; pinned versions on fake bookings; PDF render checks.

Promotions UAT: CPC floors and QS weights simulations on a mirror of last 7 days’ synthetic queries.

Bulk Tools UAT: dryrun mass refunds, merges, and reindexes; verify impact tiles and rollback templates.

Tax UAT: 1099 dryruns with edelivery consent flows; Efile stub returns filing IDs.

Search & Ranking UAT: compare ranking diffs after rep formula/weight changes on seeded data.

I) Resets, Snapshots & Access Windows

Snapshot & restore: nightly baseline + manual snapshots preUAT; restore in <15 min.

Oneclick “clean room”: wipe personal training footprints (cases/messages) but keep seeds.

Access windows: training cohorts get timeboxed access; automatic disable after window.

J) Guardrails & Safety

Watermarks on every page; copy/paste of IDs adds “SANDBOX” suffix to prevent misuse.

Downloads limited; CSVs watermarked; large exports blocked.

Money actions are virtual; Sandbox ledger kept separate; no external funds ever move.

PII masks enforced; unmask buttons removed in Sandbox.

K) Reporting & KPIs

Training completion rate by role/cohort; firstattempt pass %; timetocertification.

Drill coverage: # of drills/quarter; average MTTD/MTTR (Sandbox); runbook adherence.

UAT throughput: # of UAT sessions, issues found before Prod, rollback rate reduction postUAT.

Simulator usage: webhooks replayed, failure modes exercised.

L) Telemetry (Sandbox & Training)

sb.seed.run (pack) • sb.snapshot.create/restore

sb.simulator.state.set (payments|tax|id|content|notify|maps|social)

sb.training.start/step_pass/step_fail/complete (role, module)

sb.drill.start/ack/degrade/resolve/postmortem

sb.uat.flag.flip • sb.uat.docs.publish_preview • sb.uat.bulk.dryrun

sb.guardrail.block (export|money|pii) • sb.access.expire

M) Acceptance Criteria (mark 4.14.16 FINAL)

Hardisolated Sandbox with environment banners, email/SMS sink, separate RBAC/SSO.

Seeders & scenario packs covering Support, T&S, Finance/Tax, Moderation, Studios, Promotions, City Ops, Legal.

Simulators for payments, tax, ID/background, content scan, notifications, maps, social; webhook replay & forcestate.

Role curricula with guided checklists, autograding, and certifications.

Incident drills & chaos kit with scoring and afteraction reports.

QA/UAT flows for feature flags, docs CMS, promotions, bulk tools, tax, and search—all without code.

Snapshots/resets; oneclick clean room; timeboxed training access.

Guardrails (no PII, no exports, no real money movement); watermarking everywhere.

Reporting & telemetry for training, drills, simulators, and UAT.

N) Why this works

Teams learn fast and safely on lifelike data.

Integrations behave realistically via simulators and webhooks—no flakiness, no vendor risk.

Quality rises—UAT & drills catch misconfigs and process gaps before they hit production.

Culture of readiness—regular drills, certifications, and audits keep everyone sharp.

§5.0 — Program Overview & Principles

Goal: Establish a clear, privacysafe, auditable data foundation that powers ops dashboards, finance/tax accuracy, trust & safety, growth analytics, and ML—while making schema evolution lowrisk and predictable.

A) Scope & Owners

Inscope: Event contracts, IDs & entity graph, ingestion pipelines, warehouse layers (Bronze/Silver/Gold), metrics catalog & semantic layer, privacy/PII/retention, dataquality, replays/backfills, lineage, ML feature store, and cost/perf governance.

Primary owners:

Data Eng (pipelines, storage, contracts),

Analytics (metrics catalog, BI/semantic layer),

Privacy/Compliance (PII/retention/access),

Finance Ops (recon & monthend accuracy),

Product/Obs (event coverage, telemetry).

B) Design Tenets

Contracts first: Every feature emits versioned events; changes are additive; breaking changes require new names.

LBGaware by design: The Linked Booking Group is a firstclass key; legs (Talent, Studio) roll up cleanly.

Bronze → Silver → Gold: Raw immutable logs → clean typed models → businessready facts/dims.

Privacy by default: PII masked at rest; sensitive tables in restricted schemas with RBAC scopes (per §4.14.1/§4.14.15).

Dual freshness: Sub15minute ops freshness; dayaccurate finance close each morning.

Single source of truth: All dashboards pull from a Metrics Catalog with versioned definitions.

Replays are normal: Idempotent loads and event replays make audits/backfills safe.

Costaware: Partition by date/city/role, columnar storage, lifecycle policies, and materialized views for heavy tiles.

C) What Section 5 Will Deliver (roadmap)

§5.1 Event contract & naming (envelope, namespaces, required fields, versions).

§5.2 Canonical IDs & entity graph (LBG/leg joins, referential rules).

§5.3 Ingest & pipelines (stream for ops, batch for finance).

§5.4 Warehouse layers & privacy zones.

§5.5 Gold schemas (facts & dims for search, bookings, finance, promos, tax, T&S, studios).

§5.6 Metrics catalog & semantic layer (ties to §4.14.12).

§5.7 Privacy, PII & retention policies (USfirst).

§5.8 Data quality & testing (schema, invariants, reconciliation).

§5.9 Backfills & replays (tooling + runbooks).

§5.10 External systems & lineage (origin → transforms → dashboards).

§5.11 ML feature store & modeling hooks (ranking, risk, Smart Invites).

§5.12 Cost, performance & governance (SLAs, quotas, deprecation).

D) Success Metrics & SLAs

Freshness: Ops Silver tables ≤ 15 min; Finance Gold closed by 06:00 local daily.

Reliability: Event loss = 0 (idempotent loads); pipeline success ≥ 99.9% daily.

Data quality: Finance recon variance < 0.5%; schema DQ failures < 0.1% runs.

Governance: 100% dashboard tiles reference a catalog key@version; PIIrestricted access logged 100%.

Performance: BI p95 query < 5s for core tiles; warehouse cost within monthly budget (tracked).

E) Change Management & Governance

PR checklist: includes event diffs & metric impact note.

Schema registry: semver + backwardcompatible evolution checks in CI.

Metric versioning: deprecation windows, with “what changed” diffs.

Access control: RBAC scopes (PIIBasic/PIISensitive/PIITax/Background); masked downloads; watermarked exports.

Retention: nightly purge engine honors legal holds (from §4.14.15).

F) Risks & Mitigations

Metric drift → enforce catalog & semantic layer; block adhoc SQL in critical dashboards.

PII exposure → separate schemas + masking + access ledger.

Cost spikes → partitioning, TTL on Bronze, and scheduled materializations.

Vendor outages → replayable ingest, DLQs, deterministic rebuilds.

G) Acceptance Criteria (mark §5.0 FINAL)

Principles and scope approved by Data Eng, Analytics, Privacy.

Subsections enumerated with owners assigned.

CI checks for event/schema changes in place (“contracts first”).

SLAs & success metrics recorded in Ops runbook and §4.14.12 dashboards.

H) Why this works

This aligns product, ops, finance, and compliance on one consistent data language. It preserves velocity (additive contracts, replays) while keeping privacy and cost under control.

§5.1 — Event Contract & Naming

Goal: Define a stable, privacysafe event contract so every feature (Sections 1–4) emits versioned, auditable events that downstream systems can trust. Contracts are additive, LBGaware, and enforce consistent types for time, money, IDs, and PII.

A) Event Envelope (required on every event)

All producers (web, mobile, services, admin) must include this envelope. Fields are snake_case, UTC timestamps in ISO8601.

{

"event_id": "c3e82a8b-2a1f-4e6a-9bf7-7c9b2b7e0d1a",

"event_name": "booking.request",

"event_version": "1.0.0",

"occurred_at": "2025-11-04T19:22:11Z",

"received_at": "2025-11-04T19:22:12Z",

"actor_user_id": "usr_6c2bd1c9",

"actor_role": "buyer", // enum: buyer|model|photographer|videographer|creator|studio_host|admin|system

"lbg_id": "lbg_01HE9Z7A5S", // nullable

"booking_leg_id": "leg_01HE9Z8R3C", // nullable

"leg_role": "talent", // enum: talent|studio|null

"city_id": "city_houston",

"state": "TX",

"country": "US",

"platform": "web", // enum: web|ios|android|admin|system

"app_version": "1.3.2", // nullable

"session_id": "sess_b5f4b2c1", // nullable

"request_id": "req_7f5c93f4", // trace/correlation

"ip_hash": "ip_7f6d3b", // irreversible hash

"user_agent_hash": "ua_1b2c3d", // irreversible hash

"privacy_tier": "pii_basic", // enum below

"payload": { /* event-specific schema */ }

}

Notes & constraints

Monetary values in minor units (cents) as integers and ISO currency in payload (e.g., "currency": "USD").

IDs are stable, opaque strings (see §5.2).

PII (email, phone, TIN, full address) must not appear in payloads; store tokens/IDs and join in protected tables only.

occurred_at is when the action happened; received_at is ingestion time; both required.

B) Naming Rules

event_name is namespace.action in snake_case, e.g., search.query_run, fin.checkout_pay_success.

Namespaces (toplevel):
acct, search, profile, msg, booking, deliver, promo, fin, tax, studio, sup, ts, cms, data, obs, bulk, legal.

Action verbs: run, click, open, send, read, request, accept, decline, cancel, change_order, upload, accept, queue, sent, fail, charge, credit, calc_request, calc_response, case_open, decision, publish, rollback, start, finish.

No breaking renames. If semantics change incompatibly, mint a new event_name.

C) Versioning Policy (semver)

event_version = "MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH".

MINOR/PATCH: add optional fields, tighten enums with backwardcompatible defaults.

MAJOR: breaking change → do not bump; create a new event_name (e.g., booking.request → booking.request_v2).

Producers must not drop required fields of an existing version.

D) Types, Enums & Limits (global)
