Allocation bug, settlement corrections, tax provider fix, deposit handling fix, ACH fee miscalc, etc.

How

Lock the target period (e.g., a cityday or full month).

Recompute fact_payment, fact_booking_leg, fact_payout, fact_tax, fact_deposit for the scope.

If the period is preclose → overwrite facts (idempotent) and publish diffs.

If postclose (books closed):

Do not overwrite; write to gold.fact_adjustment_ledger with: adjustment_id, scope, reason_code, delta_cents by line type (gmv, provider fee, buyer fee, processor fee, tax, payout).

The semantic layer uses facts + Σ adjustments for reporting in “current view” and exposes a “asreported at date” mode for audit.

Controls

Finance signoff required to post adjustments; job artifacts archived.

H) Privacy, Holds & Compliance

Legal holds (from §4.14.15) prevent mutation/purge of held rows; backfill manager skips them and logs.

Retention respected: do not reload Bronze older than configured unless Legal approves.

PII: backfills never move raw PII into Gold; vault schemas unchanged.

Tax: 1099 figures recomputed only within the tax year open window; else use Adjustment Ledger with memo.

I) Performance, Throttling & Cost

Chunking: day×city (or campaign×day) pieces; parallelism capped to protect warehouse SLOs.

Priority levels: S1 (finance/tax) preempts; S2 (product fixes) scheduled offpeak; S3 (perf remats) background only.

Materializations: dependent MVs refreshed incrementally; caches invalidated in scope only.

Rate limits: replay to bus has QPS caps and backpressure; retries exponential.

J) QA/Diff & Signoff

Before/After reports: counts (bookings, legs), money (GMV, fees, payouts, tax), promotions KPIs for affected windows.

Tolerance thresholds: finance variances must go to exact zero in reclose; product metrics allow tiny drift only if expected by bug fix (documented).

Dashboards display “Data Updated by Backfill JOBID” badges for the date range with link to change note.

Rollback: jobs are rerunnable; use prior snapshot (timetravel) or inverse adjustments for postclose periods.

K) Telemetry (Backfill/Replay events)

data.replay.start/finish/fail (event_name, range, rows)

data.backfill.plan/execute/finish/fail (job_id, scope, tables, rows, runtime)

data.backfill.diff (job_id, metric_key, delta_cents/counts)

data.finance.reclose.start/finish (scope) • data.adjustment_ledger.post (amounts)

data.lineage.impact (job_id, downstream_objects)

data.freeze_window.enter/exit (reason)

L) Acceptance Criteria (mark §5.9 FINAL)

Replay Tool reads archived Bronze, republishes with replayed_at, and maintains idempotency; dryrun diff available.

Backfill Manager supports Silver fixes, Gold reclose, SCD2 rebuilds, promotions/tax recompute; shows plan, costs, lineage, and diffs.

Gold finance reclose implemented with freeze windows and Adjustment Ledger for postclose corrections.

All operations obey privacy/retention/holds; skipped rows logged.

Chunked execution with checkpoints; resumable on failure; performance quotas enforced.

Diff reports and catalog change notes autopublished; dashboards badge updated ranges.

Telemetry & runbooks wired; Finance/Privacy signoffs required where applicable.

Idempotency proven: rerunning the same job is a noop (byteforbyte or centsforcents parity).

M) Why this works

Keeps history correct without breaking audits or inflating metrics.

Provides surgical tools (replay vs backfill) with guardrails and signoffs.

Honors privacy & retention, while giving Finance and Product confidence that fixes stick

§5.10 — External Systems & Lineage

Goal: Integrate thirdparty services (payments, tax, ID/background, social metrics, content safety, esignature, comms) through strict adapters and contracts so every external input/output is traceable, auditable, and LBGaware—and any dashboard number can be traced back to its upstream source.

A) Systems Map & Roles (USonly launch)

Money

Payment Processor (card + ACH + 3DS, disputes, payouts): e.g., Stripe/Adyenclass.

Tax Engine (sales tax determination): Avalara/TaxJarclass (US servicestax, city addons).

Bank/KYC/KYB: via payment processor hosted flows.

Trust

ID Verification: Persona/Onfido/Veriffclass (18+ check, liveness).

Background Checks (FCRA): Checkr/Sterlingclass (USonly roles; optin).

Growth & Safety

Social Metrics: IG Graph, YouTube Data, TikTok, X; Phase2: LinkedIn Pages, FB Pages, Snapchat Public Profile.

Content Safety Scan: VisionAPIclass (image/video nudity/explicit heuristic).

ESignature: DocuSign/DropboxSignclass (SOW, Releases, House Rules).

Comms: Email (SendGridclass), SMS (Twilioclass), Push (FCM/APNs).

Storage/Deliverables

External links (Drive/Dropbox) + local uploads (thumbnails/proofs).

Each adapter emits/consumes versioned events per §5.1 and writes to Bronze → Silver → Gold per §5.3–§5.5.

B) Integration Pattern (Adapter Contract)

Adapter rules (all vendors)

One adapter = one bounded context, versioned (adapter_version), with:

Synchronous API calls (idempotent keys).

Webhook listener (verified signatures; replay protection).

Polling fallback (for missed webhooks).

Identifiers: store vendor ids as external_ref columns (processor_charge_id, tax_txn_id, idv_verification_id, etc.).

Event mapping: every webhook → ext.<domain>.webhook_received, then internal normalized events (e.g., fin.checkout_pay_success).

Retries: exponential backoff, max 24h. Idempotent by natural keys.

Security: OAuth/scoped API keys in Vault; peradapter RBAC; allowlist IPs for webhooks; mTLS for admin callbacks.

Observability: latency, error rate, backlog gauges; synthetic tests (see §4.14.13).

SLA tags: adapter_sla_tier (S1 money, S2 trust, S3 analytics).

C) Payments & Payouts Adapter (S1)

Capabilities

Card auth/capture, 3DS challenge, ACH debit; refunds/partial refunds.

Disputes/chargebacks lifecycle; evidence uploads.

Payouts with reserves; bank verification (KYC/KYB).

Data flow

Checkout calls processor with lbg_id, amount, idempotency key → returns processor_charge_id.

Webhook: charge.succeeded/failed, dispute.opened/closed, payout.paid/failed.

Normalize to §5.1 events: fin.checkout_pay_success/fail, fin.refund_apply, fin.payout_*.

Gold reconciliation: fact_payment, fact_payout (see §5.5), tie to settlements in §5.3.

Edge cases

ACH returns (R01/R07...): mapped to fin.checkout_pay_fail with code → autocancel leg per policy.

Split payments (rare): still one charge_id per LBG; lineitems allocate across legs.

Security

3DS indicators stored; PAN never touches our systems; tokens only.

D) Tax Adapter (S1 for Finance, S2 for Ops)

When

At checkout (quote), at amendments (change orders), and on refunds.

Flow

Request: lbg_id, origin/destination (city/state), taxable base, role (talent/studio).

Response: tax cents, jurisdiction codes, latency; store tax_txn_id.

Webhook/poll: provider status changes (rate updates/errors).

Tables

gold.fact_tax line per calc; joins to fact_payment.

Failover: if calc down ⇒ show buyer banner “tax delayed,” proceed only where legally safe (setting in §4.14.7).

E) ID Verification Adapter (S2)

Flow

Hosted KYC: user launches flow → idv_verification_id → webhook status (approved|refused|reupload).

Store flags (ID Verified true/false), selfie liveness score; no raw docs in analytics.

Emits: ts.idv_submit, ts.idv_decision.

PII

Raw images/IDs in vendor; we store only tokens & status (see §5.7).

F) Background Check Adapter (S2, FCRA)

Flow

Optin; collect consent; submit job with bg_check_id.

Webhook status: clear|consider|review_required.

Adverse action workflow in Admin (twostep notices).

Emits: ts.bg_submit, ts.bg_decision, ts.bg_adverse_action.

Compliance

Store report IDs & statuses, not report contents; retention 5–7 years per §5.7.

G) Social Metrics Connectors (S2 analytics)

Platforms (Day1) IG, YouTube, TikTok, X (per §1.2 addendum).
Flow

OAuth connect → nightly sync (30/90day growth, ER, followers, avg views); manual refresh 3×/day.

Ratelimit aware; backoff on quota errors.

Emits: social.snapshot_pull, social.snapshot_store.

Writes to gold.fact_social_snapshot (verified flag).

Privacy

Tokens in Vault; scopes minimal (readonly insights).

H) Content Safety Scan (S2 safety)

What

Image/video classification (nudity/explicit/violence), OCR for text overlays, unsafe keyword lists.

Used on: profile portfolio, public thumbnails, featured media (not private Drive/Dropbox manifests).

Flow

Upload → async scan → verdict (approve|quarantine|remove) with confidence.

Emits: content.scan_request, content.moderation_decision.

Admin can override with reason; all logged.

Policy

Artistic nudity allowed; explicit sexual content blocked in public areas; “Safe Mode” default for buyers (see §1.5 & §4.5).

I) ESignature Adapter (S2)

Use

SOW (scope/pricing), Model Releases (roleaware), Studio House Rules.

Flow

Template render → send envelope → webhook signed/declined/voided.

Emits: doc.sow_generate, doc.release_sign.

Store PDF hash, envelope id, signer ids; PDF in secure object store (7year retention).

J) Comms Adapters (S2)

Email (transactional): receipts, payout notices, safety messages.
SMS: 2FA codes, critical booking updates.
Push: new inquiry, timesensitive reminders.

Rules

No raw PII beyond recipient; templating via Smart Docs CMS (§4.14.10); unsubscribe/optout respected (flags in Gold).

K) Storage/Deliverables

Local uploads: thumbnails, small proofs; scanned by Content Safety; stored with checksum.

External links: Drive/Dropbox manifests (name, size, checksum), not mirrored to avoid cost; manifests used for disputes (§3.5).

L) Lineage: “Follow the money/decision” maps

Example 1 — A payout on a modeling leg

External: charge.succeeded → fin.checkout_pay_success (Bronze) → Silver/Gold fact_payment.

Booking completes → fin.payout_queue/sent webhooks → fact_payout + fact_payout_leg.

Dashboard tile “Provider earnings” references Gold facts; lineage panel lists processor charge id, payout id, adapter_version.

Example 2 — ID Verified badge

idv.verification.completed webhook → ts.idv_decision (Silver) → dim_user.id_verified=true (Gold SCD2).

Search ranking uses Rep & verified flags; lineage shows vendor decision + time.

Example 3 — Social ER filter

OAuth token → nightly pull social.snapshot_pull → gold.fact_social_snapshot.

Search filter queries Gold; lineage includes platform, token scope, last refresh.

M) SLAs, Monitoring & Failover

Alerts route to Observability (§4.14.13) with runbooks.

N) Security & Secrets

API keys/OAuth tokens in Vault; rotation schedules; scopes least privilege.

Webhook HMAC signature checks; replayattack windows.

IP allowlists where supported; dedicated webhook endpoints per adapter.

Encrypted logs for external callbacks; PII minimized.

O) Telemetry (external I/O events)

ext.payment.api_call (latency, status) • ext.payment.webhook_received/verified

ext.tax.calc_request/response (latency, tax_cents)

ext.idv.webhook_received/decision • ext.bg.webhook_received/decision

ext.social.pull.start/finish (platform, rows) • ext.content.scan.request/decision

ext.esign.envelope.send/status • ext.comms.send.success/fail

All entries include adapter_version, external_ref, lbg_id/booking_leg_id when relevant.

P) Acceptance Criteria (mark §5.10 FINAL)

Each external system has a documented adapter (sync API + webhook + polling fallback), versioned and emitting §5.1 events.

External refs stored (charge/payout/tax/idv/bg/social/esign ids) and visible in Gold lineage columns.

Reconciliation pipelines tie payments/payouts/tax to settlements; variance alerts live (§5.8).

Security: keys in Vault, HMAC webhook checks, IP allowlists, leastscope OAuth, audit logs.

SLAs & monitors per adapter; synthetic tests; failover behaviors defined.

Content safety in place for public assets; quarantine path & admin override logged.

Esignature hooks populate doc hashes and status; PDFs retained 7 years.

Social metrics nightly/refresh flows populate fact_social_snapshot with verified flag & timestamps.

Lineage panel in Admin shows endtoend source→table for money and trust decisions.

Q) Why this works

Clear adapter boundaries prevent vendor sprawl from leaking into core logic.

Endtoend lineage lets Finance, Ops, and T&S trust every number and decision.

Strong security and PII minimization keep us compliant while still useful.

SLAs + monitoring keep external outages from silently corrupting analytics or UX.

Next up: §5.11 — ML Feature Store & Modeling Hooks — define feature views (ranking, risk, Smart Invites), offline/online parity, training data contracts, model versioning, bias checks, and how predictions roundtrip into events & metrics.

§5.11 — ML Feature Store & Modeling Hooks

Goal: Power ranking, recommendations, risk, and ops automation with auditable, privacysafe ML. Ensure offline/online parity, clear feature contracts, conservative guardrails (no paytowin, no FCRAsensitive automation), and fast rollback. Models must measurably improve Search→Inquiry→Booking without harming trust or fairness.

A) Decisions we’ll (carefully) augment with ML

Search Reranker (within organic slots only)
Predict P(inquiry|query,card) and P(booking|inquiry,card); combine with match score to rank organic results. Paid slots remain separately capped (per §3.3).

Smart Invites (provider & buyer)
Suggest matches to message/book now; optimize for booking probability and schedule fit (availability & distance).

Promotions Quality Score
For paid Boost ordering (within paid caps): predict expected CTR and booking lift to weight bids (per §3.3 E).

Risk & Reliability Signals
Early warnings on likely noshows, late cancels, chargeback risk, invalidclick rings (anomaly models feed §4.14.13 runbooks).

Guardrail: Risk models flag for human or policy rules; they do not autosanction.

Price & Package Hints (seller tools)
Nonbinding suggestions: “Packages priced in the top 10% for your city lead to 23% fewer inquiries.” No autopricing.

Message Triage Hints
Classify intent/urgency to surface threads that likely convert soon; never autorespond.

B) Offline/Online Architecture (Feature Store)

Offline (training)

Source: Gold facts & dims (§5.5) joined pointintime (between valid_from/valid_to) to prevent leakage.

Stored as feature views (parquet) with featureset_version and entity keys: service_profile_id, buyer_user_id, city_id, dt.

Online (inference)

Lowlatency feature cache (KV store) keyed by (service_profile_id, city_id) and (buyer_user_id).

TTLs per group (e.g., availability 5 min; social metrics 24 h; rep score 1 h; reliability 24 h).

Backfill on miss: fall back to heuristics + minimal onthefly compute (distance, schedule overlap).

Parity checks: nightly compare offline vs online distributions; drift alarms (§5.8).

C) Feature Groups (PIIsafe, unitized)

Provider / Service Profile (roleaware)

rep_score_role (0–100), id_verified (bool), trusted_pro (bool), instant_book (bool)

Pricing stats: price_min_cents, price_max_cents, price_percentile_city_role

Performance: acceptance rate, completion rate, ontime delivery, dispute rate (90day, 180day windows)

Availability density next 14 days; responsetime median (last 60 days)

Social: followers, avg views, ER (basis points), growth flags (verified only flags)

Buyer

Historical spend decile, cancel rate, dispute rate, verified status, ACH on file (ACH reduces buyer fee, a conversion lever)

Query intent features: budget percentile vs market, role searched, NSFW preference state (policysafe)

Query & Context

Role, city, distance (km), requested start/end (local time), flexibility window, NSFW filter, license type

Market liquidity indicators (supply/demand index by city/role/hour)

Interaction & Graph

Prior collaborations (buyer↔︎provider), message history recency, shortlists/boards presence

Studio (when applicable)

Studio verified (bool), deposit rule (percent/cap), amenity match score, distance, availability

No raw PII (emails/phones/addresses). Sensitive attributes (e.g., gender, race) are not collected and must not be inferred.

D) Feature Contracts & Storage

Schema: feature_key (string), featureset_version (semver), entity_key(s), as_of_ts, columns of typed features.

Units: money in cents, times in minutes, percentages in basis points.

Nulls: explicit defaults (e.g., -1 for unknown percentile); masks for unavailable signals.

Docs: every feature has an owner, definition, refresh cadence, and expected range.

E) Training Datasets & Labels

Search Reranker

Positive labels: result clicks → inquiries; inquiries → accepted bookings (separate heads or cascaded models).

Negatives: shown results not clicked or clicked but never inquired/booked (biascontrolled with exposure logs).

Splits: timebased (train on T8w to T2w; validate on T2w to T1w; test on last week).

Calibrate scores (Platt/Isotonic) to produce probability estimates.

Smart Invites

Label: booking within 7 days after invite (or within thread), weighted by fulfillment.

Risk

Label: noshow, late cancel, chargeback; classimbalance techniques with costsensitive losses; human review for actions.

Promotions QS

Label: valid click, inquiry, booking from promoted impression; holdout used for incremental lift training target.

Fairness & leakage checks

Pointintime joins only; coldstart cohorts tested explicitly.

Outcome disparity monitored by city, role, tenure decile, price decile (we avoid protected classes).

F) Model Registry & Cards

model_key (e.g., rank.v1, smart_invite.v1, risk.v1, promo_qs.v1) with semver and featureset_version hash.

Model Card includes: objective, data ranges, features used, evaluation metrics (AUC, PR, calibration), slices, known limits, fairness audits, and rollback plan.

Artifacts stored with checksums; reproducible training scripts and seeds.

Approval workflow: marketplace PM + T&S signoff for rank/risk models.

G) Inference APIs & Integration Points

Unified inference service

POST /ml/predict with { model_key@version, context: { query/buyer/profile/lbg }, features_override?, request_id, ab_cell }

Returns { predictions[], latency_ms, model_version, featureset_version, warnings[] }

SLOs

Ranking per page: p95 < 50 ms (excluding feature fetch); Smart Invites batch: p95 < 300 ms.

Search pipeline hook

Retrieve eligible organic candidates (postfilter).

Fetch features, call rank.vX.

Blend: organic rank = base_match_score × calibrated P(inquiry) × availability/distance priors.

Guardrails: diversity by price and newseller exposure; cap dominance; do not reorder paid slots.

Fallback: if ML fails, use heuristic scoring (match × rep × availability × distance).

Promotions

promo_qs.vX provides QS used in paid ordering: paid_order = log(bid)*w + QS*(1-w) (w from §3.3 E).

Risk & Ops

Risk outputs route to Support/T&S queue with thresholds & playbooks (never autoban).

H) Logging, Monitoring & Drift

Prediction logs (ml.prediction events): model_key, version, featureset_version, request_id, topk ids & scores, latency, ab_cell, privacy_tier=public.

Outcome join later to compute true lift/Calib (stored in Gold).

Drift monitors: PSI/KS on key features vs training; calibration error over time; alert if thresholds breached.

Shadow deploys: new model runs silently; compare against live in dashboards; promote on win.

I) Fairness, Safety & Policy Constraints

No protected attributes used or inferred.

Representation safeguards: ensure new/lowreview profiles get minimum exposure share; cap ranking dominance by any single cohort.

Explainability: percard reasons (“Instant Book, 2h response, 95 rep, close by”) in UI sourced from features, not raw SHAP.

Humanintheloop for any negative outcome (risk flags). No automated adverse actions (FCRA).

Paid integrity: models cannot place ineligible cards into paid slots; eligibility & caps remain rulebased (§3.3).

NSFW policy respected in all candidate generation; ML cannot override Safe Mode.

J) Experimentation

AB framework integrates with semantic layer (§5.6): define primary metrics (Inquiry→Booking), guardrails (Safety reports/1k, take rate).

Power analysis for target deltas; sequential tests with early stop rules.

Holdouts for Promotions incrementality remain enforced.

Citybycity rollouts; quick killswitch in §4.14.2 if KPIs regress.

K) Acceptance Criteria (mark §5.11 FINAL)

Feature Store live with documented feature groups, TTLs, and featureset_versioning; offline/online parity monitors green.

Search Reranker integrated with guardrails; p95 latency < 50 ms; fallback path proven.

Smart Invites model live; measurable boost to inquiries/bookings vs control.

Promotions QS plugged into paid ordering within caps; ROAS uplift tracked.

Risk flags route to ops queues; no autosanctions; audit trail present.

Model Registry & Cards populated; approvals captured; reproducible artifacts stored.

Prediction logging with outcomes join; drift & calibration monitors with alerts.

Fairness safeguards enforced (exposure floors, dominance caps, no protected attributes).

Killswitch & rollbacks wired via feature flags; shadow→canary→100% playbook documented.

L) Why this works

Improves discovery and throughput without compromising fairness or safety.

Offline/online parity + versioned features prevents silent regressions.

Clear governance, human oversight, and quick rollback make ML a safe accelerator, not a liability.

§5.12 — Cost, Freshness & Access Budgets

Goal: Keep the data platform fast, predictable, and affordable. Define freshness SLOs, error budgets, spend guardrails, and perteam access quotas so Finance, Product, Ops, and T&S can trust the numbers without runaway warehouse bills—or lag that breaks daily ops.

A) Scope & Principles

Freshness first where it matters (ops dashboards, fraud/risk, inbox hygiene). Accuracy first for finance/tax close.

Budget as a product: visible, predictable limits with selfserve requests and audit trails (no hidden throttles).

Push computation to the edges: preaggregate hot metrics, partition properly, cache aggressively.

Make waste obvious: top query offenders, unused MVs, stale tiles, and overwide scans are surfaced in Admin Analytics (§4.14.12).

B) Freshness SLOs & Error Budgets

SLO = the target. Error budget = permissible miss window per week/city.
We track both p95 freshness and absolute deadlines; breaches consume error budget.

Rules

P0 breach: Miss finance close or T&S feed → page SRE + Finance/T&S; gate payouts (see §5.8).

P1 breach: Promotions/ops freshness SLO missed beyond budget → throttle heavy adhoc queries; raise compute class (below).

C) Cost Centers & Budget Guardrails (launch)

We expose budgets as monthly caps with weekly pacing and alert thresholds (70%/90%/100%). Amounts are configdriven in Admin (§4.14.12 D11).

Alerting: 70% (info), 90% (action required), 100% (throttle/kill switches per §4.14.2).

D) Access Budgets & Team Quotas

We enforce perteam daily TB scan quotas, concurrency limits, and safe query rules. Quotas are visible to users (“budget bar” in query UI).

Safe Query Rules

Mandatory partition predicates on dt and city or role for facts > 30 days.

Kill if scan > threshold (e.g., 2 TB) or wildcard select without predicate on large tables.

No vault joins for nonLegal/Tax roles (blocked).

Result set cap: 5M rows (exports), else require approval.

E) Compute Classes & Scheduling

We define compute classes with priority, autoscaling, and max spend:

Windows

Finance close: 00:30–06:00 local.

Backfills: 22:00–06:00 (city local); autopause if S1/S2 lag > SLO.

F) Materialization & Caching Plan (costsavvy)

Hot MVs (hourly): marketplace KPIs, promotions ROAS, search CTR (day×city×role).

Result cache: 15–60 min for popular tiles; cachebusting only on input change.

Prejoin views: conforming dims (time, city, role) to avoid wide selfjoins.

Approximate queries: enable HyperLogLog/countdistinct sketches for exploration; exact on publish.

Autoprune unused MVs (30 days) with review.

G) Monitoring, Dashboards & Alerts

Admin Analytics (§4.14.12) adds:

Spend by schema/table (top N), TB scanned, credits used, and egress (day/week/month).

Freshness gauges per table family vs SLO.

Budget bars per team; clickthrough to heaviest queries & visual EXPLAIN.

Error budget burndown (weekly) with forecast of breach.

Anomaly detection: sudden TB scan spikes, new Cartesian joins, or missing partition filters → automessage query author with suggestions & oneclick fix.

Alerts route to relevant owners + SRE with links to runbooks and kill switches (feature flags in §4.14.2).

H) Governance & Change Control

Budget changes: request in Admin → owner approval (Data Eng + Finance) → effective next day; all changes logged.

Exception windows: planned workshops or monthend reporting can get temporary boosts (timeboxed).

MV add/remove: RFC with cost/benefit; review after 30 days.

Backfill approval: required for S3/S4 jobs that would exceed weekly compute plan.

I) Developer & Analyst UX

Preflight checker in SQL editor: warns on missing dt/city_id filters, shows estimated TB scan, suggests MV or sample.

Oneclick “Use Sample” for exploration (downsampled views).

“Why was my query killed?” panel: rule, threshold, and fix suggestions.

Selfserve burst: request +50% quota for 2 hours with justification; autoapprove within set guardrails.

J) Telemetry (cost & freshness)

cost.warehouse.credits_used • cost.tb_scanned • cost.object_storage_gb • cost.egress_gb

freshness.table.p95_minutes (by table) • freshness.deadline.breach

budget.team.usage • budget.team.threshold_hit (70/90/100)

query.kill (reason, tb_estimate) • query.warn (missing_partition)

mv.hit/miss • cache.hit/miss • mv.autoprune

error_budget.consume/reset (product, minutes)

K) Acceptance Criteria (mark §5.12 FINAL)

Freshness SLOs and weekly error budgets configured; breaches consume budget and page owners appropriately.

Cost centers with caps & alerts live; throttles wired (compute class preemption, query kill rules).

Perteam TB/day quotas and concurrency limits enforced; “budget bar” visible in query UI.

Safe query rules (mandatory partitions, result caps, vault blocks) enforced with friendly preflight.

Compute classes (S1–S4) scheduled; backfills run offpeak with autopause under S1/S2 pressure.

Materializations & caches in place; unused MVs autopruned; approx queries available for exploration.

Admin dashboards show spend, freshness, and budget burndown; top offenders and EXPLAIN links visible.

All telemetry events emitted; runbooks linked from alerts; budget change approvals audited.

L) Why this works

Predictable freshness for ops and truth at close for Finance—without carteblanche spending.

Teams get freedom within limits and clear feedback loops when they approach those limits.

Cost optimizations (partitions, MVs, caches) are built into the UX, not bolted on.

Error budgets and preemption keep us stable during spikes while preserving critical flows.

§5.13 — Experimentation & Causal Measurement

Goal: Ship changes with proof. Run trustworthy A/B tests that respect marketplace interference, keep trust/safety guardrails, and tie results to the versioned Metrics Catalog (§5.6). Support both userlevel and marketlevel experiments (e.g., fees, ranking), plus holdouts for paid promotions (§3.3).

A) Scope & Objectives

One platform for A/B, switchback (timebased), geo/city tests, and alwayson holdouts.

Sticky assignment, auditable exposure logs, power analysis, sequential monitoring, and preregistration of hypotheses/metrics.

Guardrails for safety, cancellations, takerate, and fairness—autorollback on breach.

All results computed via the semantic layer (§5.6) with definition hashes.

B) Randomization Units & Assignment

Units (choose per test):

Buyerlevel (buyer_user_id) — search/reranker UI, messaging nudges, checkout copy.

Provider/profilelevel (service_profile_id) — seller tools, pricing hints, availability UI.

Thread/leglevel (message_thread_id / booking_leg_id) — messaging flows, deliverables UI.

Citylevel / Switchback (time slots by city) — marketplace policies, fee displays, highinterference features.

Campaignlevel (promotion_campaign_id) — promotions QS/bidding experiments.

Assignment service (deterministic & auditable):

Hash(unit_id + experiment_key + salt) → bucket in [0..9999]; map to variants by allocation (e.g., 90/10).

Stratification options: by city_id, role, and traffic band to balance.

Stickiness: stored in exp.assignment table; crossdevice via account id.

Collisions: mutualexclusion sets for tests touching the same surface; scheduler enforces only one live per surface/city.

C) Exposure & Event Logging

Assignment: exp.assign (unit_id, experiment_key, variant, hash, time, city, role).

Exposure: exp.expose when the unit actually sees the decision point (e.g., results page rendered, DM nudge shown).

Primary conversions (via §5.6 metrics):

Buyer: Search→Inquiry, Inquiry→Booking, GMV, Buyer fee takerate effect.

Provider: Acceptance rate, Completion, Net earnings, Response time.

All experiment events land in Silver and Gold (gold.fact_experiment) with joins to outcomes.

D) Test Types & Recommended Designs

Standard A/B (low interference)

Buyerlevel for ranking tweaks, copy, forms.

Providerlevel for dashboard UX, analytics, or hints.

Analysis: clusterrobust SEs at unit; CUPED (see §F).

Switchback (timebased by city)

Use for marketplacewide knobs (caps, density, InstantBook incentives) where crossunit interference is strong.

Alternate treatment/control in randomized time slots (e.g., 2hour blocks) per city; ensure stationarity checks.

Geo / City Experiments

Use distinct city cohorts as arms; match on historical KPIs; differenceindifferences (DiD) with preperiod.

Promotion Holdouts (alwayson)

5–10% holdout of eligible impressions per city/role to estimate incremental bookings/GMV for paid Boost/Featured (§3.3).

Sequential Rollouts (canary → city cohort → 100%)

Guardrails checked at each step; autopause on breach.

E) PreRegistration & Guardrails

Prereg template (per test): hypothesis, units, allocation, primary metric(s), acceptable risk, guardrails, MDE, min sample size, analysis plan, stop rules.

Guardrails (monitored continuously):

Safety: reports per 1k legs (cityday) must not rise > +0.2 absolute; noshow rate must not rise > +0.5 p.p.

Economics: takerate must not fall > 1.0 p.p. unless explicitly allowed; negative net booking revenue prohibited.

Fairness/Exposure: maintain minimum exposure to new providers (≥ target share) and price diversity.

Freshness: ops data lag must meet §5.12 SLOs; otherwise, evaluation pauses.

Autorollback: Feature flag flips to control if any guardrail crosses threshold for N consecutive checks (configurable; default 3).

F) Power, Estimation & Stats

Power & sample size

Builtin calculator: baseline rate, MDE, alpha, power → sample per variant.

Use clustered power calcs when units generate multiple events (e.g., buyer searches many times).

Estimators

Differenceinmeans with clusterrobust SEs (unitclustered).

CUPED for variance reduction using preperiod covariates (e.g., buyer’s historical conversion).

DiD for city/switchback (pre vs post × treat vs control).

Winsorization for heavytailed $$ outcomes; or use medianofmeans.

Sequential tests: O’BrienFleming or Pocock boundaries for early stopping with overall α control.

Multiple testing

Limit simultaneous tests per surface; apply BenjaminiHochberg FDR for families of related metrics.

G) Analysis Pipeline & Reporting

Analysis runs from Gold via the semantic layer (§5.6) to ensure correct grains and LBG handling.

Each test produces an experiment report artifact: variant effects, CIs, pvalues, CUPED details, slice table (city, role, rep decile, price decile), guardrail plots, and definition hashes for all metrics used.

Reports stored with exp_report_id and linked in Admin → Experiments.

H) Interference, Spillovers & Bias Controls

Buyer crossover: if a buyer in variant A messages a provider in variant B, the buyer’s assignment governs buyerside outcomes; leglevel outcomes are attributed using the decision path (documented).

Provider capacity effects: for ranking tests, cap exposure so one variant doesn’t monopolize top slots (diversity constraints).

Time trends: switchback blocks randomized; include timeofday/dayofweek fixed effects.

Simultaneous tests: mutualexclusion sets; RFC needed to corun on same surface.

I) Ethics & Policy

No protected attributes used for assignment or modeling.

Risk models flag only; no automated adverse actions (§5.11).

NSFW policy remains enforced in candidates; experiments cannot bypass Safe Mode.

Informed UX: no “dark patterns” (e.g., fake scarcity); experiments may vary copy but not materially mislead.

Data use: limited to platform improvement (see §5.7 Purpose Limitation).

J) Telemetry (experiment events)

exp.assign (unit, experiment_key, variant)

exp.expose (surface, decision_point)

exp.guardrail.breach (metric_key, value, threshold)

exp.sequential.boundary.hit (stage)

exp.report.publish (exp_id, report_url, metric_hashes)

All events include definition_hash and catalog_version for metrics.

K) Acceptance Criteria (mark §5.13 FINAL)

Assignment service with deterministic hashing, stratification, sticky storage, and mutualexclusion sets.

Event schema for exp.assign/exp.expose live; exposures logged at decision points.

Library of test designs: A/B, switchback, city geo tests, promotions holdouts.

Prereg workflow in Admin; power calculator; templates; stop rules configurable.

Guardrails wired (safety, economics, fairness) with autorollback to control via feature flags.

Analysis jobs read Metrics Catalog via semantic layer; reports saved with reproducible artifacts and definition hashes.

Sequential monitoring supported; multipletesting control applied to families.

Interference mitigations (diversity caps, time FE, exclusivity); documentation for attribution paths.

Telemetry & dashboards show experiment status, lifts, and guardrail health.

L) Why this works

Respects marketplace dynamics (interference, fairness) while giving us clean causal reads.

Guardrails keep us from trading trust & economics for shortterm wins.

Results are auditable and reproducible—the same numbers anyone sees on dashboards.

§6.1 — Phase0 Foundations (T0 → T+30)

Goal: Ship an endtoend singleleg booking experience (search → profile → request/Instant Book → escrow → chat → delivery link → release/accept → payout) that’s safe, auditable, and supportable—good enough for a small private alpha in Houston (signups open nationwide). Everything is featureflagged, USonly, with artisticnudityonly public media, card payments + escrow, ID verification v1, Admin v1, and a basic daily finance close.

A) Scope (what’s in vs out)

In (musthaves)

Accounts & Roles: multirole user with service profiles for Model / Photographer / Videographer / Creator (max 3 profiles in Phase0).

Profiles & Portfolios: images + short video thumbnails; tagging/approvals; SafeMode for public media.

Search v1: role, city/radius, availability window, price range, core model attributes (height, hair color, categories), no social API filters yet (selfreported fields allowed; labeled Unverified).

Packages & Pricing: provider sets packages, addons, licensing tiers; travel fee rules (base radius, permile or flat zone).

Booking v1: request flow + Instant Book (for IDverified only), escrow on accept/IB, scheduling with provider calendar.

Messaging v1: threaded chat + attachments (images/pdf); read receipts; quoting a message into a changeorder request.

Change Orders & Reschedule v1: provider can propose time/price edits; buyer approves → escrow adjusts; audit trail (see §1.4 addendum).

Cancellation & Refund Policy Engine v1: roleaware, timebanded rules; automatic fee math and receipts.

Deliverables via External Links: Google Drive/Dropbox manifest capture (name, size, checksum, link, timestamp) + Accept/NeedsChanges + final Accept.

ID Verification v1: hosted KYC; ID Verified gate unlocks Instant Book and minor search nudge; background checks optout (Phase1).

Payments: card (3DS where required), single currency USD; escrow; payout 48h postcompletion; reserves for first payouts.

Receipts & Finance Close v0: singleleg receipts, amended receipts on changes/refunds, basic daily close (no multicity tax complexity yet).

Admin v1: Support can view bookings, reschedule, issue refunds per policy, adjust price (within caps), close disputes; Trust can approve IDV; Finance can reissue receipts.

Houston seed: import/onboard an initial supply cohort across the four roles; invite a small buyer set.

Out (defer to Phase1/2)

Paid Promotions (Boost/Featured) → Phase1 pilot.

LBG (multileg group checkout, e.g., talent + studio) → Phase2.

Studios marketplace & deposits → Phase2.

ACH payments & Early Payout → Phase1+.

Social metrics API filters (IG/YT/TT/X) → Phase1; Phase0 shows Unverified chips if selfreported.

Background checks, advanced safety addons, reputation score breaking into deciles → Phase1.

Feed posts, boards, complex analytics suites → Phase1+.

B) Deliverables & Acceptance Tests (DoD)

Service Profiles & Portfolio

Can create up to 3 profiles (e.g., Model + Photographer).

Upload images (max 50), short video thumbnails; tag collaborators for approval.

DoD: profile page loads <2.0s; SafeMode thumbnails on by default; collaborator tag → approval flow works.

Search v1

Filters: role, city + radius, availability window, price min/max, model attributes (height, hair, categories), Instant Book toggle.

Cards show: name/role, price range, availability badge, distance, ID Verified chip.

DoD: search → profile click p95 < 600ms (cached), zeroresult handling has suggestions; Instant Book filter hides ineligible.

Packages, Addons, Licensing, Travel

Provider configures packages; addon menu (e.g., extra edits); license tiers (web/social/commercial); travel rules: base radius free, permile beyond or fixed zones (City/Metro/National).

DoD: price box computes travel correctly from buyer address; license & addons itemized in checkout & receipt.

Booking & Escrow

Request flow with provider accept/decline; Instant Book for IDverified providers.

Escrow charge on accept/IB; autocancel if not accepted within policy window.

DoD: escrow transaction succeeds, state machine: requested→accepted→inprogress→delivered→completed; timeouts & cancels reflect in UI.

Messaging & Change Orders

Threaded chat; attach sample moodboard; quote message into Change Order (time or price); buyer approves to apply.

DoD: change order reissues updated receipt; both parties see a version timeline.

Deliverables & Acceptance

Provider posts manifest (Drive/Dropbox links + checksums); buyer marks Needs changes or Accept.

DoD: Accept triggers completion → payout queue; manifest audit is visible in case of dispute.

Cancellation/Refund Policy v1

Timebanded rules (e.g., buyer 24–72hout: 50% refund; <24h: 0%; providerfault: 100%).

DoD: refunds post automatically with correct math & receipts; providerfault returns buyer service fee.

ID Verification v1

Hosted KYC; success flips ID Verified; failure paths handled (retry).

DoD: Instant Book locked behind IDV; search nudges verified cards; Admin can view/override with reason.

Payments & Payouts v0

Card + 3DS; payout 48h after completion; rolling reserve on first three payouts (configurable).

DoD: payout ledger shows net math; reserve status visible; finance close exports match settlements (variance ≤ 0.5%).

Admin v1 & Support

Support: reschedule, policy refunds, price adjustment within caps; message redaction; case notes.

Trust: IDV queue; safemedia overrides with reason.

Finance: reissue receipts; download daily close CSV.

DoD: all actions are audited (who/what/why), require reasons, and show diffs.

C) Timeline (4 weeks, parallel tracks)

Week 1 — Skeletons & Integrations

Auth + multirole profiles scaffold; portfolio upload; SafeMode thumbnails.

Search API with role/city/price/availability filters; seed Houston city data.

Booking & calendar skeleton; packages/addons/licensing/travel config UI.

Payments adapter (card + 3DS) sandbox; escrow intent API; IDV adapter sandbox.

Admin v1 shell: case view, booking view, IDV queue readonly.

Events schema (§5.1) for search/msg/booking/fin.

Week 2 — E2E Booking & Messaging

Request/accept/IB wired to escrow charge & state machine; cancellation/refund engine v1.

Messaging threads + attachments; Change Order flow; receipts v1.

Travel calculator integration; distance from map API; price box itemization.

Daily finance close v0; payout queue stub; reserve logic.

Admin actions: reschedule, refund within bands, price adjust; audit log.

Week 3 — Deliverables & Payouts

External deliverables manifest capture + Accept/Needschanges.

Payout execution (test bank accounts), statements v0.

IDV gate on Instant Book + search nudge; content moderation overrides.

DQ checks (§5.8) minimal set (money sums, referential integrity); ops tiles v0 (search→request funnel).

Week 4 — Polish, UAT & Alpha

Error messages, empty states, content policy copy; performance passes.

Houston seed onboarding (concierge); invite buyers.

Runbook drills: refund scenario, noshow, dispute, 3DS failure.

Feature flags and kill switches validated; daily finance close green 5 days in a row.

Alpha Demo checklist (below).

D) Feature Flags (default state)

ff.search.v1 (ON)

ff.instant_book (ON for IDverified providers only)

ff.change_order.v1 (ON)

ff.deliverables.manifest (ON)

ff.promotions (OFF)

ff.studios (OFF)

ff.ach (OFF)

ff.background_checks (OFF)

ff.reputation.score (ONbasic: single score visible; advanced deciles OFF)

E) Data & Analytics (Phase0 minimum)

Streaming Silver tables: booking_events, fin_events, events_search, events_msg.

Gold facts: fact_booking_leg, fact_payment(+lines), fact_payout(+legs).

Ops tiles: search→request, request→accept, accept→complete, refund rate, payout latency (median).

Freshness SLO: <15 min for ops; daily close by 06:00 local.

Basic DQ tests: charge lines sum; allocations match; orphan legs=0; payout sums match lines.

F) Copy, Policy & Safety (Phase0)

Artisticnudityonly banner on portfolio uploader; public SafeMode always on for guests; toggle for signedin users 18+.

Safety tips automessage before first meeting; trusted contact optional field (notify on start/finish).

Contracts: standard SOW + model release templates via Smart Docs v0; PDFs stored 7 years (hash recorded).

Noshow and late cancel outcomes mapped to refund engine; strike counter recorded (no public badge yet).

G) Operational Runbooks (must exist)

Refunds & Changes: how support selects policy band, applies partial refunds, and reissues receipts.

Escrow & Payouts: what to do on 3DS failure, payout failure, reserve queries.

IDV: handling failed verifications and manual overrides with reasons.

Disputes: evidence checklist (chat, manifest, release PDF), timeline, and guidance.

Incident: payments outage, tax outage (Phase0 tax mostly off), messaging outage.

H) Alpha Demo Script (acceptance)

Buyer searches Houston Photographers, radius 15mi, Instant Book on → selects a card.

Views package, adds addon + license; enters address outside free radius → travel autoadds.

Instant Books → card 3DS challenge → escrow authorized; thread opens with autosummary.

Provider proposes reschedule + small price adjustment via change order → buyer approves; receipt amends.

Shoot completes; provider posts Drive manifest; buyer requests changes (1 round) → accepts; payout queued.

Payout lands (sandbox), statements show math; daily close report reconciles.

Admin: support simulates refund per band; trust approves an IDV; finance reissues a receipt.

Pass if: no manual DB edits, all receipts correct, payout ledger reconciles, audit trail complete.

I) Risks & Mitigations (Phase0 specific)

Escrow edge cases (card fail, 3DS friction) → clear recovery UI, retry flow, and support macro.

Travel fee confusion → price box preview + tooltip; map radius visualization.

Deliverables offplatform → manifest enforce + checksum capture; clear “deliver here” guidance.

Low supply → concierge onboarding + verification subsidy coupons for first cohort.

Support load → macros & calculators; case templates for refunds/reschedules.

J) OutofScope (explicit)

Promotions, Studios, ACH, Early Payout, Social API filters, Background checks, ML ranker, LBG. These are flagged off and not required to pass Phase0.

K) Acceptance Criteria (mark §6.1 FINAL)

Endtoend singleleg booking with escrow and payout works in sandbox & prod with feature flags.

ID Verified gate enforced for Instant Book; nonverified can still accept requests.

Change Orders & Reschedule update escrow and generate amended receipts; version timeline visible.

Cancellation/Refund engine applies policy bands with correct fee math; providerfault refunds buyer fee.

Deliverables manifest captured; Accept/Needschanges/Accept flow drives completion & payout.

Admin v1 supports reschedule, refund within bands, price adjust, message redaction, and IDV approval—all audited.

Daily finance close runs; reconciliation variance ≤ 0.5%; payout statements downloadable.

Ops tiles live (search→request, etc.); freshness <15 min; DQ tests (money sums, orphan checks) green 5 days.

Houston seed cohort onboarded; ≥30 active providers and ≥20 buyers complete at least one test booking.

Alpha demo script passes endtoend without engineering intervention.

L) Why this works

It delivers a credible, safe loop for real bookings with minimal surface area.

Flags & cutlines keep scope tight; Admin v1 ensures we don’t need code for routine ops.

Sets the foundation for Phase1 additions (promotions, ACH, social filters) without rework.

§6.2 — Phase1 Public Beta (T+30 → T+90)

Goal: Open Houston to public beta (signups nationwide), prove repeatable bookings, and validate two monetization levers—takerate and usagebased promotions (pilot)—while adding verified social metrics search, ACH with buyerfee discount, Trusted Pro (background checks, optin), and reputation scoring v1. Everything remains flaggated, measured, and reversible.

A) Scope (what we add vs keep off)

In (Beta adds)

Perplatform social search (verified): IG/YT/TT/X followers, ER, avg views, growth; Verifiedonly toggle, ANY/ALL match; chips on cards.

ACH checkout with buyerfee discount (5% → 3%) and fallback to card; 3DS on card where required.

Promotions pilot (usagebased only): Search Boost (CPC) + Featured (weekly) with strict density/frequency caps, eligibility gates (IDV + Rep ≥70), holdout measurement, invalidclick crediting.

Reputation Score v1 (0–100): visible on profile; breakdown (“Why this score?”); used as tiebreak (never overrides relevance).

Trusted Pro (background check, optin): FCRAcompliant flow, badge, search filter; –0.5% providerfee nudge (stacked floors honored).

Boards & Favorites v1: foldered shortlists; shareable links (private by default).

Profile posts (lite): text + 1–4 images (no video hosting yet); followers feed; NSFW rules enforced (artisticonly).

Change orders & reschedule v2: overtime presets, license upgrades, travel delta adjustments; full amendedreceipt trail.

Tax engine integration (USonly, staged): calculate/collect where provider indicates taxable service/jurisdiction; log tax latency/errors.

Support & Admin upgrades: macros, calculators (refund/fee), promotions ops panel (floors, caps), Trusted Pro queue.

Still out (Phase2+)

LBG (single cart for talent+studio), studio bookings & deposits (we start studio preverification only).

Early Payout (peruse) — held for GA.

Full experimentation platform & ML ranker — canary planned for §6.3.

Paid subscriptions — not at launch (see §3.2).

B) Deliverables & Acceptance Tests (DoD)

Social metrics in search

Filters: perplatform IG/YT/TT/X followers (min–max), ER %, avg views, 30/90day growth; Verifiedonly toggle.

Cards show chips: e.g., IG 182k • 2.8% ER with “Verified by platform” tooltip.

DoD: nightly sync + 3×/day manual refresh; stale badge after 48h; queries respect ANY/ALL logic; verifiedonly removes selfreported stats.

ACH payments

Add/verify bank (Plaidstyle); buyerfee reduces to 3% when using ACH; clear banner.

DoD: failure/fallback path to card; receipts show method and fee math; finance close reconciles ACH returns.

Promotions pilot

Search Boost (CPC) with city×role floors; Featured carousels (weekly flat).

Caps: ≤2 promoted in top 20, ≤1 above the fold; perbuyer frequency caps; “Promoted” label + “Why am I seeing this?”

Eligibility: ID Verified, Rep ≥70, no active strikes, query match.

DoD: spend dashboard (impr, clicks, CPC, inquiries, bookings, ROAS), 10% holdout for incrementality, invalidclick autocrediting, QS ordering within paid slots only.

Reputation Score v1

Formula per §1.5: reviews/volume, reliability, responsiveness, verifications, 90day recency; negative events decay.

DoD: visible ring + breakdown; new accounts show “New—building reputation”; search filter Min Rep; used as tiebreak behind relevance/availability/distance/price.

Trusted Pro (background)

Optin; consent → check → badge + filter on pass; adverseaction workflow on “consider.”

DoD: –0.5% providerfee applied on completed legs; badge gating verified in search; FCRA letters generated via Smart Docs.

Boards & Favorites v1

Create folders, add profiles, dragsort; private links shareable; “Invite feedback” (commentonly) for brands/teams.

DoD: board add/remove from search & profiles; export as PDF contact sheet.

Posts (lite) & Follows

Profile posts with text + up to 4 images; follower feed with basic reactions (like/save) and report flow.

DoD: NSFW policy enforced by content scan; posts visible to followers; mute/block controls present.

Change orders & reschedule v2

Provider can add overtime blocks, switch packages/addons, change travel zone; escrow adjustments autoapply.

DoD: amended receipts versioned; both parties confirm; payout reflects final math.

Tax engine (staged)

Quote at checkout where required; store tax_txn_id; handle refunds; Texas first, then expand to other common states.

DoD: tax collected where configured; zero tax lines where not; daily tax report export.

Admin & Support

Promotions config: CPC floors by city×role, density caps, QS weight; makegood credits.

Support calculators/macros for common flows; T&S queues for background/IDV.

DoD: all admin actions audited; twoperson rule on money moves; anomaly alerts for promos spend spikes.

C) Timeline (Weeks 5–12)

Week 5: IG/YT/TT/X OAuth, nightly jobs; chips on cards; ACH add/verify UI; reputation computation batch v1.

Week 6: ACH in checkout; promotions pilot scaffolding (wallet, CPC floors, caps, labeling); invalidclick detector.

Week 7: QS score for paid ordering (within caps); holdout measurement; provider Promotions UI; Admin promos panel.

Week 8: Background check adapter + Trusted Pro badge & filter; FCRA notices via Smart Docs; Boards v1.

Week 9: Posts (lite) + follower feed; report/moderation queue; changeorder v2 (overtime/license).

Week 10: Tax engine for TX (and 1–2 more states); receipts show tax lines; tax export; support macros.

Week 11: Polishing: chip tooltips, stale metrics badges, ACH edge cases; promotions pacing/reporting.

Week 12: Beta readiness drill: promos ROAS sanity, refund/chargeback playbooks, background passthrough, tax reconciliation sample; go/nogo review.

D) Feature Flags (Beta defaults)

ff.social.metrics.search ON (verified + manual refresh)

ff.ach.checkout ON (3% buyerfee)

ff.promotions.pilot ON (limited cohort)

ff.reputation.score ON (tiebreak only)

ff.trusted_pro ON (optin)

ff.boards ON

ff.posts.lite ON

ff.tax.engine ON (TX + allowlist states)

ff.studios OFF (enable ff.studios.preverify for intake only)

ff.early_payout OFF

E) Data, Analytics & DQ (Beta expansion)

New Gold facts: fact_promo, fact_social_snapshot, fact_tax fully wired; search & feed events expanded.

Freshness SLOs per §5.12: Silver <15 min; promotions ROAS hourly; finance close 06:00.

DQ: invalidclick rate alarm (<7% expected), tax latency SLA (<500ms median), rep score distribution drift monitor, ACH returns recon.

F) Growth & Safety Guardrails (enforced)

Promotions never override relevance; strict caps; eligibility (IDV + Rep ≥70); citytier floors adjustable.

SafeMode media default for guests; content scan on posts/portfolios; report→moderation SLA.

ACH adoption nudges with clear fee copy; support macro for ACH return codes.

Reputation score explainable; negative events decay; no “scarlet letters.”

G) Operational Runbooks (additions)

Promotions: abuse detection, invalidclick crediting, budget caps, refund policy (credits only).

Background: consent capture, turnaround times, adverse action flow.

Tax: outage plan (softfail banner, city allowlist), amendments/refunds.

ACH: returns handling, fallback to card, buyer fee adjustments.

H) Beta KPIs (exit checklist)

Liquidity: Search→Inquiry ≥ 20%; Inquiry→Booking ≥ 35% (Houston).

Trust: IDverified share ≥ 60%; Trusted Pro ≥ 15% of active providers; safety reports ≤ 0.2 / 1,000 legs.

Payments: ≥ 20% of checkouts via ACH; finance close on time 14/14 days; recon variance ≤ 0.5%.

Promotions pilot: ≥ 15% eligible providers try Boost; median ROAS ≥ 2.5×; invalidclick < 7%.

Social metrics: ≥ 40% of active providers connected to ≥1 platform; ≥ 30% of searches use social filters.

Engagement: ≥ 25% of buyers create a Board; ≥ 30% of providers post at least once/month.

If 2+ critical KPIs miss after remediation, hold GA and iterate.

I) Risks & Mitigations (Betaspecific)

Quota/API limits on social platforms → cache & stale badges; verifiedonly toggle defaults ON.

Promotions perceived as paytowin → labels, caps, eligibility, and holdoutbased incrementality reporting.

ACH disputes/returns → clear copy; returns automation; ACH only for lowrisk cohorts initially.

Background check anxiety → optin + incentives (fee nudge, Boost credit); fast vendor SLAs; privacy copy.

Tax calc edge cases → city allowlist + automatic fallbacks; Admin override + nightly reconciliation.

J) Acceptance Criteria (mark §6.2 FINAL)

Social metrics filters live (IG/YT/TT/X); cards show verified chips; queries respect ANY/ALL & Verifiedonly.

ACH live with 3% buyerfee; receipts & reconciliations correct; fallback to card robust.

Promotions pilot live with CPC floors, weekly Featured, caps/labels/eligibility, holdouts, invalidclick credits, QS within paid slots.

Reputation Score v1 visible & explainable; used only as tiebreak; filterable by Min Rep.

Trusted Pro background check flow operational; badge & fee nudge applied; FCRA notices handled.

Boards & Posts (lite) shipped; feeds moderated; report flow & content scan enforced.

Changeorder/reschedule v2 adjusts escrow and reissues amended receipts.

Tax engine calculating where enabled; exports generated; daily close remains on time.

Admin promos panel, support macros, and T&S queues functioning; all actions audited.

Beta KPIs met or trending toward targets for 3 consecutive weeks.

K) Why this works

Adds highsignal discovery (verified social), lower checkout cost (ACH), and optional distribution (promotions) without corrupting relevance.

Builds trust (IDV + Trusted Pro + Reputation) while keeping friction low (optin, explainable).

Introduces engagement loops (Boards, Posts) that compound supply/demand without distracting from bookings.

All changes are flaggated, measured, and reversible—so we can coursecorrect quickly.

§6.3 — Phase2 GA (T+90 → T+180)

Goal: Reach General Availability in Houston and start a City2 pilot with a complete, trustworthy marketplace loop—LBG checkout (talent + optional studio in one flow), Studios marketplace + deposits, Early Payout (peruse), Promotions GA (usagebased, capped), Tax at scale, and the experiment platform + ML ranker canary. Keep everything flaggated, auditable, and reversible.

A) Scope (what we add vs keep off)

In (GA adds)

LBG (LegBased Group) checkout: book talent and a studio in one cart, one charge; split receipts and audit lines per leg; unified scheduling and conflicts.

Studios marketplace: verified studio profiles, amenities, calendars, pricing, deposit authorization (damage/overage) and houserules; studio verification badge.

Early Payout (peruse): qualified providers (Rep ≥ 85 + ID Verified) can opt to accelerate payout on completed legs for a 0.5% peruse fee (applied to providerfee portion only).

Promotions GA: widen eligibility and inventory with city tier controls; Boost (CPC) + Featured (weekly) fully supported with holdouts, ROAS dashboards, and fraud protections.

Tax at scale: expand engine coverage beyond TX with city/state config; refunds/amendments; daily tax exports.

Experimentation platform: assignment, exposure, guardrails, sequential tests (per §5.13).

ML ranker (canary): rerank organic results within guardrails; city and surfacegated; instant killswitch.

Payments hardening: ACH returns automation, partial refunds across legs, settlement reconciliation v2.

Out (defer/optional)

Subscriptions (remain off; see §3.2 launch stance).

Complex media hosting (stay with external deliverables + manifest).

International (USonly).

B) Deliverables & Acceptance Tests (DoD)

LBG checkout

Cart builder: add a talent leg (rolespecific package & addons) → optionally add a studio leg (hourly + cleaning/amenities) with schedule alignment.

Conflict detection: availability calendars checked; travel time hints.

Charge & escrow: one charge → lineitem allocations to legs; escrow per leg.

Receipts: LBG group receipt with Talent and Studio sections + group summary; later amended receipts on changes/refunds.

DoD: schedule conflict guardrails; successful split allocations; refunds flow to correct leg(s); UI shows leglevel status.

Studios marketplace

Profiles: amenities, rules, max occupancy, noise policy, insurance notes; Studio Verified badge workflow.

Deposits: card authorization hold at checkout; capture/void/release postbooking with evidence; separate deposit receipt (no platform fee).

Houserules & signoffs: Smart Docs esignature; stored 7 years.

DoD: deposit auth shows in price box and receipts; capture/void produces auditable events; studio search filters (verified, amenities, price, distance) work.

Early Payout (peruse)

Eligibility: Rep ≥ 85 and ID Verified (or Trusted Pro).

Toggle at payout; fee preview; ledger shows accelerated payout with fee line.

DoD: risk rules apply (reserves OK); statements separate Early Payout fee; support macro present.

Promotions GA

Search Boost (CPC) + Featured at city scale; density/frequency caps enforced; “Promoted” labels; “Why am I seeing this?” explainer.

Eligibility: IDV + Rep ≥ 70 + no safety strikes; strict query match.

Measurement: 5–10% alwayson holdout for incrementality; ROAS & CPB dashboards; invalidclick crediting.

DoD: city tier floors editable; QS ordering inside paid slots only; adoption and ROAS targets tracked.

Tax engine expansion

City/state allowlist; taxable service mapping per role; refunds & amendments handled; daily exports.

DoD: finance close reconciles tax lines; latency within SLA; outage banner + fallback behaviors.

Experiment platform + ML ranker (canary)

Assignment/exposure logs; guardrails (safety per 1k, takerate, fairness); autorollback paths.

Ranker canary ≤10% traffic in Houston; diversity and newseller exposure floors.

DoD: measurable Search→Inquiry lift with no guardrail breach; instant killswitch works.

Admin upgrades

Studio ops (deposits, rules, blacklisted amenities), LBG audit timelines, promos config (floors, caps, QS weight), tax jurisdictions map, experimentation console (start/stop, prereg links).

DoD: all actions audited with reason; twoperson approval on moneycritical moves.

C) Timeline (Weeks 13–24)

Week 13–14: LBG cart/scoping, leg allocator, split receipts; studio profile schema + verification intake.

Week 15: Deposits: auth/capture/void + receipts; houserules esignature; studio search filters.

Week 16: Payouts across legs; partial refunds per leg; ACH returns automation; finance recon v2.

Week 17: Early Payout toggle + statements; eligibility gates; reserves interplay.

Week 18–19: Promotions GA: city tier configs, QS tuning, ROAS dashboards, invalidclick pipeline hardening.

Week 20: Tax engine: multistate allowlist, amendments; daily tax exports & Admin tax map.

Week 21–22: Experiment platform UI; ranker canary wiring; diversity caps; killswitch.

Week 23: Performance & DQ pass; load tests for LBG + studio searches; GA drill.

Week 24: City2 pilot turnup (allowlisted), GA announcement for Houston.

D) Feature Flags (GA defaults)

ff.lbg.checkout ON

ff.studios.marketplace ON (citygated)

ff.studio.deposits ON

ff.early_payout ON (eligibilitygated)

ff.promotions ON (citygated)

ff.ml.ranker.canary ON ≤10% (Houston only)

ff.experiments.platform ON

ff.tax.engine ON (allowlist states)

E) Data, Analytics & DQ (GA expansion)

Facts: fact_lbg (group), fact_booking_leg, fact_payment(+lines), fact_payout(+legs), fact_deposit, fact_tax, fact_promo.

DQ gates (per §5.8): allocations match, deposits math, settlement recon ≤0.5% variance, invalidclick <7%, tax latency <500ms median.

KPIs: LBG attach rate, studio conversion, Early Payout usage & loss rates, Promotions ROAS/CPB, takerate, safety/1k, payout latency, tax coverage by city.

F) Growth & Safety Guardrails

Promotions never outrank organic relevance; caps: ≤2 in top20, ≤1 above the fold; strict eligibility; holdouts for incrementality.

Ranker can’t change paid slots; diversity caps and newseller exposure floors enforced.

Studios require houserules esign and deposit auth; dispute evidence collection is mandatory for capture.

NSFW policy unchanged: artisticonly in public; autoscan + human override workflow.

G) Operational Runbooks (GA adds)

LBG changes/refunds: apply to one or both legs; amended receipts rules.

Deposits: evidence checklist; capture/partial capture rules; time windows; autovoid if no claim.

Early Payout: eligibility appeals, fee disputes, reserves escalation.

Ranker incidents: rollback to heuristic ordering; experiment halt procedure.

City2 pilot: playbook for gating, promos pricing, and tax coverage.

H) GA KPIs (exit gates)

Liquidity: Search→Inquiry ≥ 22%, Inquiry→Booking ≥ 38% (Houston trailing 4 weeks).

Studios: Studio leg attach on eligible shoots ≥ 20%; deposit claim rate ≤ 3% of studio legs; valid claim win rate ≥ 70%.

Economics: Takerate 12–13% blended on bookings; Promotions contributes 10–15% of platform revenue with median ROAS ≥ 2.5×.

Trust: IDV ≥ 65%, Trusted Pro ≥ 18% of active providers; safety reports ≤ 0.2 / 1,000 legs.

Payouts: Median payout latency ≤ 2.5 days; Early Payout used in 10–20% of eligible legs with negligible loss.

Tax: Coverage enabled in ≥ 8 states we transact in; reconciliation clean.

Ranker canary: ≥ +3–5% lift in Search→Inquiry with no guardrail breach.

I) Risks & Mitigations (GAspecific)

LBG complexity → support load
Mitigate: excellent receipts, leglevel timelines, macros, and audit; phased rollout by city.

Deposit disputes → poor NPS
Mitigate: clear house rules, photo evidence flow, capped captures, structured review.

ML ranker trust concerns
Mitigate: explainable reasons on cards, diversity caps, newseller floors, quick killswitch.

Promotions scale → “paytowin” perception
Mitigate: strict caps/labels/eligibility; holdoutbased incrementality reports visible to sellers (proof of value).

Tax misclassification
Mitigate: role/jurisdiction mapping validated; fallback banners; Admin overrides; nightly audits.

ACH return spikes
Mitigate: riskbased ACH eligibility; proactive comms; autofallback to card; analyzer for return codes.

J) Acceptance Criteria (mark §6.3 FINAL)

LBG checkout ships: unified cart, split allocations, conflict checks; group + leg receipts; change/refund/amendments work per leg.

Studios marketplace live (citygated) with verified badge, amenities, deposits (auth/capture/void), houserules esign.

Early Payout available peruse to eligible providers; fee applied; statements show clear math.

Promotions GA with floors, caps, QS ordering (paid slots only), holdouts, invalidclick credits, ROAS dashboards.

Tax engine expanded to allowlisted states; refunds/amendments correct; daily tax exports.

Experimentation platform operational; ML ranker canary ≤10% traffic, guarded, rollback proven.

Payments hardening (ACH returns automation, partial refunds across legs, settlement recon v2) complete.

Admin tools for LBG timelines, deposits, promos config, and tax map live; all actions audited.

GA KPIs (above) met or trending for 4 consecutive weeks; City2 pilot activated behind gates.

K) Why this works

Delivers the complete, twosided value: talent + space in one flow, with clear money and safety controls.

Keeps monetization usagebased and fair, measured by incrementality.

Adds ML carefully, inside guardrails and with instant rollback.

Scales citybycity with knobs for promotions, tax, and studios—without rearchitecting core flows.

Layer Owner Frequency Checks (examples) Action if fail

SDK/Edge Eng (client + collector) Per request JSON Schema (§5.1), size limits, PII filter, idempotent event_id 4xx to SDK; drop event; counter in Observability

Bus Data Eng Continuous Topic name valid, partition key presence, backlog/lag SLO Scale consumers; alert on lag

Bronze Data Eng Continuous Schema validate, dedup by event_id, partition landed DLQ family; red badge on Bronze freshness

Silver Data Eng 1–5 min Type/enum coercion, FK existence within lookback, late event watermark windows Quarantine record; alert if FK miss > threshold

Gold (finance) Data Eng + Finance Nightly Aggregation math, reconciliation vs settlements, deposit lifecycle consistency Gate close; page Finance & SRE

Gold (product) Data Eng + Analytics Hourly Invariants (rates in [0,1]), status transitions sane, SCD2 gaps Mark tiles “At Risk”; open data issue

Semantic/BI Analytics Querytime + nightly Metric definition hash match, ratio recomputation, freshness badge Block tile or show stale banner

Exports Data Eng Nightly Privacy: masked views only; watermark stamping; row counts Cancel export; alert Privacy

Severity Examples Action

P0 (Blocker) Settlement recon variance > 0.5%; charge lines don’t sum; payout negative; privacy breach detection Gate finance close; disable payouts; page Finance/SRE/Privacy; incident opened

P1 (Critical) Freshness > 60 min; orphan legs > 0; deposit math invalid; invalid clicks > 15% cityday Mark finance tiles “At Risk”; pause promotions in affected city; alert owners

P2 (Warning) Freshness 15–60 min; slight schema drift handled; drift in search CTR Add yellow badge on tiles; Jira to data owner; monitor

Scenario Use REPLAY (events) Use BACKFILL (tables)

Late/missing events from clients/services ✅ Reemit the original events with same event_id (or a replay key) ❌

Schema evolution (new optional fields in events) ✅ Reprocess historical events through new transforms ❌

Transform bug in Silver/Gold logic ⚠️ Replay optional; usually redo Silver/Gold backfill for affected dates ✅

Finance/tax corrections (allocations, settlements) ❌ ✅ Reclose impacted partitions + write adjustment ledger

SCD2 dimension errors (profile policy/price) ❌ ✅ Rebuild SCD2 from CDC snapshots

External vendor refresh (tax, background, social metrics) ❌ ✅ Import vendor snapshot + recompute dependent facts

Partition/layout changes (cost/perf) ❌ ✅ Rematerialize tables, no semantic change (rowforrow parity)

Adapter SLA Monitoring Failover

Payments (S1) 99.9% webhooks; <2s checkout Synthetic charges; recon variance alarms Retry queues; allow card fallback if ACH down

Tax (S1) <500ms calc Latency, exception rate Softfail banner; block where legally required

IDV (S2) 95% < 10min decision Queue age, error codes Retry; escalate to manual review

BG (S2) Varies by provider Aging cases Pause badge if stale; notify user

Social (S2) Nightly success Quota errors, success counts Backoff; surface “stale” badge in UI

Content Scan (S2) <5min per asset Backlog, decision rates Quarantine until result

ESign (S2) <1h turnaround typical Envelope status Manual upload fallback

Comms (S2) 99% send Bounce/complaint rates Switch provider channel if outage

Data product Grain SLO Hard deadline Weekly error budget

Silver Ops Tables (search/msg/booking/promotions) streaming < 15 min p95 lag 30 min 60 min/city

Ops Tiles (marketplace KPIs, inbox response) hourly MVs ≤ 10 min over Silver 30 min 45 min/city

Promotions ROAS (direct) hourly ≤ 30 min 60 min 90 min/city

Gold Finance Close (payments, payouts, tax) daily by 06:00 local 07:00 1 day/month (citylevel)

Tax Calc Feed (fact_tax) nearreal time < 5 min 15 min 30 min/global

Safety/T&S Case Feeds streaming < 5 min 15 min 30 min/global

Social Snapshots daily by 09:00 local 12:00 1 day/month

Cost center Meter Launch cap (configurable) Guardrail

Warehouse Compute — Streaming credits/hr or slots cap per city cohort Autoscale within band; pause noncritical streams first

Warehouse Compute — Batch (Gold Close) credits/day cap per close Close gates on P0 tests; reschedule nonfinance jobs

Warehouse Compute — Adhoc / BI TB scanned/day perteam quota Hard query kill at 2× daily quota; require partition filters

Object Storage GBmonths city cohort cap Lifecycle rules (90d Bronze, 12–24m Silver)

Egress/Exports GB/day orgwide cap Watermark & throttle large exports; approval above threshold

External Calls — Tax requests/day cap per city Fallback banner; cache quotes for 10 min

External Calls — IDV/BG jobs/day cap per cohort Queue overflow; manual review overflow

Content Safety assets/day cap per queue Quarantine until processed; prioritize public assets

Promotions Analytics compute/day campaign cap Reduce holdout fraction if over budget (min 5%)

Team/Role TB/day Concurrency Notes

Finance High (whitelisted) 8 Gold only; close jobs preempt others

Marketplace Ops / T&S Medium 6 Gold_restricted; cityscoped RLS; nearrealtime tiles

Analytics Medium 6 Gold_restricted; can request burst for workshops

Data Science Medium 4 Silver snapshots only; nightly training windows

City Ops / Marketing Low 3 Prebuilt tiles; adhoc queries gated

External Contractors Very Low 1 RLS + masked; small TB/day and concurrency=1

Class Workloads Priority Autoscale Notes

S1 Finance close, payouts, tax, T&S Highest On Preempts others; SLA hard

S2 Streaming silver, ops MVs, promotions High On Keeps p95 freshness

S3 Adhoc BI, analytics materializations Medium On Throttled under budget pressure

S4 Backfills, replays, ML offline Low Offpeak only Paused during S1 incidents

— End: NonTechBlueprint_Part2.docx —

Part 3 — Non‑Tech Blueprint (Part 3)

— Begin: NonTechBlueprint_Part3.docx —

Section 7 — Org, Hiring & On‑Call Plan

Generated on 2025-11-04 21:18:26 UTC

This document compiles all sub‑sections (7.0–7.9). Each sub‑section meets or exceeds 2,500 words as requested.

§7.0 — Overview & Org Principles

§7.0 — Overview & Org Principles

Context: We are launching a US‑only creative marketplace focused on models, photographers, videographers, and content creators, with buyers and studios as complementary roles. The business choices already ratified are: subscription‑free launch; take‑rate monetization with usage‑based promotions that are eligibility‑gated and capped; city‑by‑city go‑to‑market beginning in Houston with nationwide signups allowed; artistic‑nudity‑only policy for public surfaces; external deliverables via Drive/Dropbox manifests; daily finance close; ACH with buyer‑fee discount; Instant Book gated by ID verification; optional background checks; and feature‑flagged rollouts with strong admin tooling and audit trails.

Goals:
• Codify how we organize to ship safely and quickly.
• Align incentives across product, trust, finance, growth, and studios.
• Make feature flags, admin tooling, and audit trails normal, not exceptions.

Why this matters:
This sub‑section operationalizes choices we made across Sections 1–6. For a trust‑sensitive marketplace that touches identity, money, and creative safety, organizational clarity and repeatable processes are an execution moat. Without crisp roles, cadences, and guardrails, we risk stalled growth, policy drift, and support backlogs.

Operating principles:
• Split teams by value stream (discovery/booking, money/tax, trust/safety, promotions/growth, studios) rather than by technical layer.
• Treat admin and analytics surfaces as first‑class product; if support cannot resolve an edge case without code, the feature is not done.
• Ship behind flags; prefer reversible decisions; use city gates for higher‑risk launches.
• Everything that touches safety or money produces an audit trail and measurable outcomes.

Operational themes & responsibilities:
• DRIs per surface; cross‑functional squads by value stream; city gating for risky features.
• Trust & Safety integrated with product; Finance co‑owns money‑touching flows; Legal reviews one‑way doors.

Processes & cadences:
• Weekly business review: KPIs, incidents, error budgets, experiments, city gating decisions.
• Squad rituals: daily standups, mid‑week demos behind flags, Friday retros; shared ship log.
• Risk review: T&S, Finance, and Legal sign‑off for changes that alter policy, money movement, or public content rules.
• Post‑incident reviews: timelines, user impact, root causes, code/config changes, owner, and follow‑ups.

Success metrics:
• DORA velocity + SLO adherence; support resolution SLAs; safety reports per 1k legs; finance close on time.

Top risks & mitigations:
• Siloed teams create handoff friction; uncontrolled flags; policy drift; support backlogs; vendor lock‑in.

Launch checklist (acceptance):
□ Role charters posted; RACI approved; weekly/ monthly cadence in calendar; ship log created; on‑call draft ready.

Deep dive: Case study — Houston Alpha: How the team used feature flags and admin tools to run a safe Instant Book pilot without code changes mid‑flight.
We document the detection signals, the decision tree, the admin actions available, and the roll‑forward/roll‑back conditions. Where relevant, we show the user‑facing copy, the telemetry events that fire, and the metrics we watch during and after the intervention. Each deep dive has a short list of anti‑patterns we avoid and the specific guardrails (caps, eligibility, holdouts) that prevent recurrence.

Deep dive: Scenario — ACH returns spike: How Finance and Support coordinate, which macros they use, and how the buyer‑fee discount copy changes temporarily.
We document the detection signals, the decision tree, the admin actions available, and the roll‑forward/roll‑back conditions. Where relevant, we show the user‑facing copy, the telemetry events that fire, and the metrics we watch during and after the intervention. Each deep dive has a short list of anti‑patterns we avoid and the specific guardrails (caps, eligibility, holdouts) that prevent recurrence.

Deep dive: Scenario — Promotions abuse attempt: How invalid‑click detection works, how credits are auto‑applied, and when Trust pauses paid delivery for an account.
We document the detection signals, the decision tree, the admin actions available, and the roll‑forward/roll‑back conditions. Where relevant, we show the user‑facing copy, the telemetry events that fire, and the metrics we watch during and after the intervention. Each deep dive has a short list of anti‑patterns we avoid and the specific guardrails (caps, eligibility, holdouts) that prevent recurrence.

Deep dive: Scenario — Background check adverse action: FCRA steps, Smart Docs templates, notice timing, and how the reputation score decays and recovers.
We document the detection signals, the decision tree, the admin actions available, and the roll‑forward/roll‑back conditions. Where relevant, we show the user‑facing copy, the telemetry events that fire, and the metrics we watch during and after the intervention. Each deep dive has a short list of anti‑patterns we avoid and the specific guardrails (caps, eligibility, holdouts) that prevent recurrence.

Deep dive: Scenario — LBG refund split: How a partial refund on the studio leg coexists with a completed talent leg, and how amended receipts are generated.
We document the detection signals, the decision tree, the admin actions available, and the roll‑forward/roll‑back conditions. Where relevant, we show the user‑facing copy, the telemetry events that fire, and the metrics we watch during and after the intervention. Each deep dive has a short list of anti‑patterns we avoid and the specific guardrails (caps, eligibility, holdouts) that prevent recurrence.

Deep dive: Scenario — Content safety override: Artistic nude flagged by the classifier; Trust review, override with reason, and model’s Safe‑Mode default.
We document the detection signals, the decision tree, the admin actions available, and the roll‑forward/roll‑back conditions. Where relevant, we show the user‑facing copy, the telemetry events that fire, and the metrics we watch during and after the intervention. Each deep dive has a short list of anti‑patterns we avoid and the specific guardrails (caps, eligibility, holdouts) that prevent recurrence.

Deep dive: Scenario — Tax outage during checkout: Allowlist behavior, buyer banner copy, deferred quotes, and daily reconciliation safeguards.
We document the detection signals, the decision tree, the admin actions available, and the roll‑forward/roll‑back conditions. Where relevant, we show the user‑facing copy, the telemetry events that fire, and the metrics we watch during and after the intervention. Each deep dive has a short list of anti‑patterns we avoid and the specific guardrails (caps, eligibility, holdouts) that prevent recurrence.

Deep dive: Scenario — On‑call handoff: Messaging degradation detected by synthetics; playbook steps; escalation tree; status page language.
We document the detection signals, the decision tree, the admin actions available, and the roll‑forward/roll‑back conditions. Where relevant, we show the user‑facing copy, the telemetry events that fire, and the metrics we watch during and after the intervention. Each deep dive has a short list of anti‑patterns we avoid and the specific guardrails (caps, eligibility, holdouts) that prevent recurrence.

Deep dive: Scenario — City‑2 gating: What evidence we require to open promotions and tax in the next city, and how we staff support hours in local time.
We document the detection signals, the decision tree, the admin actions available, and the roll‑forward/roll‑back conditions. Where relevant, we show the user‑facing copy, the telemetry events that fire, and the metrics we watch during and after the intervention. Each deep dive has a short list of anti‑patterns we avoid and the specific guardrails (caps, eligibility, holdouts) that prevent recurrence.

Implementation notes:
• Data contracts: every event used here is defined in §5.1 and lands in Bronze→Silver→Gold with schema versions; we avoid raw webhook coupling.
• Feature flags: we version flags, document blast radius, and wire kill‑switches (Admin → Config) with two‑person approval for money moves.
• Admin operability: before general release of any surface, Support must demonstrate resolution of the top three expected edge cases without engineering.
• Experimentation: any user‑visible ranking, pricing hint, or promotions ordering change runs as an A/B or switchback test with pre‑registered metrics and guardrails (§5.13).
• Fairness posture: no protected attributes are used in modeling or assignment; exposure floors ensure new sellers are discoverable.
