§11.3 — Payments, Tax & Financial Risks (Processor, Chargebacks, ACH, Tax Engine)

§11.3 — Payments, Tax & Financial Risks (Processor, Chargebacks, ACH, Tax Engine)

Risk & Process Disclaimer: This section is an internal risk‑management blueprint. It does not constitute legal, tax, or security advice. Coordinate with counsel and security leaders before externalizing any policy or committing to obligations. All examples are illustrative and must be adapted to the realities measured in Section 5 dashboards.

Context & Alignment: US‑only marketplace launch; subscription‑free start; monetization via take‑rate and usage‑based promotions with strict eligibility and caps. Public content is artistic‑only with Safe‑Mode defaults for guests. Deliverables are exchanged via external links (Drive/Dropbox) with immutable manifests; escrowed payments release on acceptance. Instant Book requires ID verification; background checks are opt‑in (Trusted Pro). Rollouts are city‑gated behind feature flags. Admin Console enforces least‑privilege, JIT elevation, two‑person approvals, and full audit trails.

Goals:
• Protect cash flows with robust processor integrations, reserves, and dispute playbooks.
• Minimize tax exposure with allowlists and reconciliations; prevent miscollection.
• Keep promotions billing clean with invalid‑click credits and audits.

Risk statements (top of mind):
• Processor outage or webhook lag causes failed checkouts and delayed payouts.
• Chargebacks spike from 'services not rendered' claims; representment fails.
• ACH returns increase; buyer fee discount abused without actual collection benefit.
• Tax engine misclassification causes over/under‑collection; reconciliation variance.
• Promotions billing errors; invalid clicks; ROAS falls below target.

Primary causes & contributing factors:
• Single‑threaded webhooks; lack of retries; no queue health monitors.
• Poor deliverables acceptance; unclear SOW; missing evidence packaging.
• Weak bank link verification; unclear ACH discount message.
• Item category mapping errors; missing city allowlists; tax outage without fallback.
• Fraud schemes; mis‑targeted paid delivery; quality score mis‑weights.

Leading indicators & early warning signals:
• Checkout success drop; payout 'queued' backlog; settlement variance alarms.
• Chargeback rate > 0.6%; win rate declines; dispute reasons cluster.
• ACH return codes trend; buyer fee complaints; low ACH adoption despite discount.
• Tax quote latency/errors; support tickets on taxes; state variance in reconciliation.
• Invalid‑click credit rate > 7%; buyer hide/report on promoted cards rises.

Preventive controls & mitigations:
• Queueing with idempotency; retry workers; multiple processors readiness; ACH fallback path.
• Manifest and acceptance flows; chargeback kits; SOW templates; refund calculators.
• Strong onboarding for ACH; clear savings math; returns handling macros.
• Tax allowlist; pending‑tax banner; nightly reconciliation and credits memos.
• Eligibility gates; density caps; QS tuning; holdouts and auto‑credits.

Incident playbooks (summary):
• Processor incident: prefer ACH; pause promotions; status banners; drain queues post‑incident.
• Chargeback wave: strengthen evidence; reach‑outs; review refund policy adherence; coaching providers.
• Tax outage: allowlist affected states; capture; amend later; user notices.

RACI / Owners:
• Payments PM/Eng, Finance, Tax PM, Growth (promotions), Support.

Instrumentation & success metrics:
• Checkout success; payout latency; chargeback win rate; ACH adoption; tax variance; promotions ROAS.

Thresholds & triggers (Go/No‑Go, rollback, escalation):
• Sev‑1 for checkout/payout; chargebacks > threshold; tax errors > threshold; ROAS < 2.5× median.

Dependencies & assumptions:
• §4.12 payments/tax center; §5 telemetry; §10.3 drills; processor/tax vendor SLAs.

Acceptance checklist (risk under control when):
□ Daily close green 14 days; chargeback kit quality audits ≥95%; tax reconciliations tight; invalid‑click credits automated.

Scenario Deep‑Dive — Chargeback ring:
Context: Clustered BIN and IPs; services not rendered claims.
Trigger: Chargeback rate spikes; win rate drops.
Immediate actions: Flag accounts; require IDV; strengthen acceptance gating; proactive provider coaching; notify processor risk team.
Communication: Help‑center post on acceptance and deliverables; targeted provider emails.
Rollback/Forward: Relax after rate normalizes; keep monitoring for recurrence.
Owner: Finance/Payments | Telemetry: chargeback_rate, win_rate | Evidence: Receipts, chats, SOW, manifest, acceptance timestamps

Execution Notes:
• Every risk has a dashboard tile with an owner, a definition of the denominator, and a weekly narrative. • Risk reviews pair with §10 post‑launch 7/30/90‑day reviews and §8 compliance calendar. • Where a risk spans multiple squads, the city GM or Risk DRI chairs the review; actions have due dates. • We prefer reversible changes (flags) and narrow blast radius (city gates). • We avoid 'security by obscurity'; we publish clear user guidance, train staff, and keep audit trails for all sensitive actions. • The risk register itself is versioned; changes record rationale and observed metrics.

Execution Notes:
• Every risk has a dashboard tile with an owner, a definition of the denominator, and a weekly narrative. • Risk reviews pair with §10 post‑launch 7/30/90‑day reviews and §8 compliance calendar. • Where a risk spans multiple squads, the city GM or Risk DRI chairs the review; actions have due dates. • We prefer reversible changes (flags) and narrow blast radius (city gates). • We avoid 'security by obscurity'; we publish clear user guidance, train staff, and keep audit trails for all sensitive actions. • The risk register itself is versioned; changes record rationale and observed metrics.

§11.4 — Data & Security Risks (PII, Admin Abuse, Vendor, Secrets)

§11.4 — Data & Security Risks (PII, Admin Abuse, Vendor, Secrets)

Risk & Process Disclaimer: This section is an internal risk‑management blueprint. It does not constitute legal, tax, or security advice. Coordinate with counsel and security leaders before externalizing any policy or committing to obligations. All examples are illustrative and must be adapted to the realities measured in Section 5 dashboards.

Context & Alignment: US‑only marketplace launch; subscription‑free start; monetization via take‑rate and usage‑based promotions with strict eligibility and caps. Public content is artistic‑only with Safe‑Mode defaults for guests. Deliverables are exchanged via external links (Drive/Dropbox) with immutable manifests; escrowed payments release on acceptance. Instant Book requires ID verification; background checks are opt‑in (Trusted Pro). Rollouts are city‑gated behind feature flags. Admin Console enforces least‑privilege, JIT elevation, two‑person approvals, and full audit trails.

Goals:
• Protect user data through least‑privilege, strong auth, encryption, and auditable admin actions.
• Reduce vendor and supply‑chain risks with diligence and limited scopes.
• Prepare for incidents with clear roles, drills, and communications.

Risk statements (top of mind):
• PII exposure (name, address, TIN) through misconfigured access or export.
• Admin account abuse or credentials compromise leading to unauthorized actions.
• Vendor breach affecting processors, tax, IDV, or e‑signature data.
• Secrets leakage (API keys) causing system compromise.
• Insufficient logging and monitoring hindering incident response.

Primary causes & contributing factors:
• Missing RBAC/JIT; broad exports; unmasked PII in UI.
• Weak 2FA; phishing; shared accounts; poor device hygiene.
• Vendor lacks SOC/Pentest posture; over‑broad data sharing; missing DPAs.
• Keys in source; unmanaged vault; no rotation schedule.
• Logs without context; missing audit trails; alert fatigue.

Leading indicators & early warning signals:
• Spike in PII unmask events; large exports; access from new geos.
• SSO anomalies; failed 2FA; password resets; new device alerts.
• Vendor incident notices; latency anomalies; unusual API error patterns.
• Code scans finding secrets; vault access anomalies; long‑lived credentials.
• Missing or failing alerts; gaps in audit logging; delayed incident detection.

Preventive controls & mitigations:
• RBAC with PII scopes; masked by default; export reasons; PII access ledger (§4.14.1).
• SSO + mandatory 2FA; device trust; phishing training; no shared accounts; JIT elevation.
• Vendor due diligence; DPAs; least‑data sharing; breach clauses; offboarding checklist.
• Secrets in vault; rotation; static code analysis; CI guards; break‑glass procedures.
• Centralized logging; audit immutability; tuned alerts; regular drills; incident runbooks.

Incident playbooks (summary):
• Privacy incident: contain; assess; notify per counsel; post‑mortem; reinforce training.
• Admin compromise: revoke sessions; rotate secrets; review actions; force password + 2FA resets.
• Vendor breach: disable integrations; evaluate blast radius; communicate if impacted.

RACI / Owners:
• Security lead (or SRE), Data, Legal/Privacy, Product owners for admin features.

Instrumentation & success metrics:
• PII access ledger anomalies; secrets rotation adherence; vendor attestations current; incident MTTA/MTTR; audit completeness.

Thresholds & triggers (Go/No‑Go, rollback, escalation):
• Any confirmed PII exfiltration → Sev‑0; admin compromise → Sev‑1; vendor breach → Sev‑1 with legal involvement.

Dependencies & assumptions:
• §4.14.1 access governance; §5.12 observability; vendor SLAs; legal counsel.

Acceptance checklist (risk under control when):
□ RBAC live; PII masked; logs/audits immutable; drills completed; vendor records current; secrets rotation schedule active.

Scenario Deep‑Dive — Suspicious PII export:
Context: Large CSV export by a new admin at odd hours.
Trigger: Anomaly alert on export size/time.
Immediate actions: Suspend token; interview admin; check purpose; delete copies; rotate access; document.
Communication: Internal only unless exposure confirmed; consult counsel.
Rollback/Forward: Restore access with tighter scopes; training follow‑up.
Owner: Security lead | Telemetry: audit_export_events, pii_unmask_events | Evidence: Audit log, export file hash, device/IP

Execution Notes:
• Every risk has a dashboard tile with an owner, a definition of the denominator, and a weekly narrative. • Risk reviews pair with §10 post‑launch 7/30/90‑day reviews and §8 compliance calendar. • Where a risk spans multiple squads, the city GM or Risk DRI chairs the review; actions have due dates. • We prefer reversible changes (flags) and narrow blast radius (city gates). • We avoid 'security by obscurity'; we publish clear user guidance, train staff, and keep audit trails for all sensitive actions. • The risk register itself is versioned; changes record rationale and observed metrics.

Execution Notes:
• Every risk has a dashboard tile with an owner, a definition of the denominator, and a weekly narrative. • Risk reviews pair with §10 post‑launch 7/30/90‑day reviews and §8 compliance calendar. • Where a risk spans multiple squads, the city GM or Risk DRI chairs the review; actions have due dates. • We prefer reversible changes (flags) and narrow blast radius (city gates). • We avoid 'security by obscurity'; we publish clear user guidance, train staff, and keep audit trails for all sensitive actions. • The risk register itself is versioned; changes record rationale and observed metrics.

§11.5 — Legal & Regulatory Risks (Content, FCRA, ADA, Anti‑Discrimination, DMCA)

§11.5 — Legal & Regulatory Risks (Content, FCRA, ADA, Anti‑Discrimination, DMCA)

Risk & Process Disclaimer: This section is an internal risk‑management blueprint. It does not constitute legal, tax, or security advice. Coordinate with counsel and security leaders before externalizing any policy or committing to obligations. All examples are illustrative and must be adapted to the realities measured in Section 5 dashboards.

Context & Alignment: US‑only marketplace launch; subscription‑free start; monetization via take‑rate and usage‑based promotions with strict eligibility and caps. Public content is artistic‑only with Safe‑Mode defaults for guests. Deliverables are exchanged via external links (Drive/Dropbox) with immutable manifests; escrowed payments release on acceptance. Instant Book requires ID verification; background checks are opt‑in (Trusted Pro). Rollouts are city‑gated behind feature flags. Admin Console enforces least‑privilege, JIT elevation, two‑person approvals, and full audit trails.

Goals:
• Reduce litigation and regulatory exposure through clear policies, training, and admin tools.
• Operate within US‑only scope with city‑gated rollouts and reversible flags for policy shifts.
• Handle notices (DMCA, subpoenas) and FCRA steps correctly.

Risk statements (top of mind):
• Public content crosses into prohibited explicit territory; moderation inconsistency.
• FCRA missteps in background checks (missing notices/wait periods).
• ADA/accessibility gaps lead to complaints; insufficient accommodations.
• Anti‑discrimination violations in listings or conduct.
• DMCA takedown process failures; repeat infringer policy gaps; subpoenas mishandled.

Primary causes & contributing factors:
• Ambiguous examples; Safe‑Mode defaults unclear; edge cases (art vs explicit).
• Insufficient training; templates missing; vendor SLAs unclear.
• Design system not audited; large regressions; insufficient QA.
• Users write exclusionary criteria; support unsure how to enforce.
• Intake missing required elements; slow response; poor documentation.

Leading indicators & early warning signals:
• Appeal reversals trend; inconsistent outcomes between moderators.
• Trusted Pro appeals citing notice issues; legal inquiries from users.
• Accessibility tickets; external complaints; screen‑reader bug reports.
• Reports of discriminatory language; negative social mentions.
• Increased DMCA notices; repeat infringer counts; subpoena volume.

Preventive controls & mitigations:
• Examples gallery and Safe‑Mode; moderator calibration; appeals workflow.
• FCRA playbook with timers; pre‑adverse/adverse templates; vendor integration tests.
• WCAG 2.1 AA audit cadence; accessible components; accommodation request flow.
• Non‑discrimination policy; templates; education first then enforcement.
• DMCA agent; intake form; counter‑notice path; evidence storage; legal review; subpoena intake process.

Incident playbooks (summary):
• Edge content escalation to T&S + counsel; apply consistent actions; update examples page.
• FCRA audit of recent cases; pause badge decisions until gaps fixed; retrospective training.
• Accessibility triage; roadmap patch; communicate timelines without legal admissions.
• Discrimination report: intake, evidence, proportionate action; publish learnings (de‑identified).
• DMCA/subpoena queue; timely responses; transparency reporting.

RACI / Owners:
• Legal, Trust, Design System, Support, Data (for audits).

Instrumentation & success metrics:
• Moderation reversal rates; FCRA timing adherence; accessibility defect backlog; discrimination reports; DMCA SLA adherence.

Thresholds & triggers (Go/No‑Go, rollback, escalation):
• Any missed FCRA adverse action window → immediate audit; accessibility Sev‑1 bug count > threshold → freeze release until patched.

Dependencies & assumptions:
• §8 policy docs; §4.14 admin tools; §10 drills; vendor contracts with SLAs.

Acceptance checklist (risk under control when):
□ Public policy pages live; templates/flows tested; audits scheduled; DMCA agent designated; subpoena process documented.

Scenario Deep‑Dive — Accessibility complaint from major creator:
Context: High‑profile creator raises screen‑reader issues publicly.
Trigger: Social and support spikes.
Immediate actions: Triage bugs; publish acknowledgment; offer direct assistance; prioritize fixes; regression tests.
Communication: Accessible statement and timeline; private outreach.
Rollback/Forward: None; incorporate feedback into design system.
Owner: Design System + Product | Telemetry: accessibility_bug_count, time_to_fix | Evidence: Bug tickets; repro steps; user feedback

Execution Notes:
• Every risk has a dashboard tile with an owner, a definition of the denominator, and a weekly narrative. • Risk reviews pair with §10 post‑launch 7/30/90‑day reviews and §8 compliance calendar. • Where a risk spans multiple squads, the city GM or Risk DRI chairs the review; actions have due dates. • We prefer reversible changes (flags) and narrow blast radius (city gates). • We avoid 'security by obscurity'; we publish clear user guidance, train staff, and keep audit trails for all sensitive actions. • The risk register itself is versioned; changes record rationale and observed metrics.

Execution Notes:
• Every risk has a dashboard tile with an owner, a definition of the denominator, and a weekly narrative. • Risk reviews pair with §10 post‑launch 7/30/90‑day reviews and §8 compliance calendar. • Where a risk spans multiple squads, the city GM or Risk DRI chairs the review; actions have due dates. • We prefer reversible changes (flags) and narrow blast radius (city gates). • We avoid 'security by obscurity'; we publish clear user guidance, train staff, and keep audit trails for all sensitive actions. • The risk register itself is versioned; changes record rationale and observed metrics.

§11.6 — Operational & Staffing Risks (Support, Moderation, Vendor SLAs, Training)

§11.6 — Operational & Staffing Risks (Support, Moderation, Vendor SLAs, Training)

Risk & Process Disclaimer: This section is an internal risk‑management blueprint. It does not constitute legal, tax, or security advice. Coordinate with counsel and security leaders before externalizing any policy or committing to obligations. All examples are illustrative and must be adapted to the realities measured in Section 5 dashboards.

Context & Alignment: US‑only marketplace launch; subscription‑free start; monetization via take‑rate and usage‑based promotions with strict eligibility and caps. Public content is artistic‑only with Safe‑Mode defaults for guests. Deliverables are exchanged via external links (Drive/Dropbox) with immutable manifests; escrowed payments release on acceptance. Instant Book requires ID verification; background checks are opt‑in (Trusted Pro). Rollouts are city‑gated behind feature flags. Admin Console enforces least‑privilege, JIT elevation, two‑person approvals, and full audit trails.

Goals:
• Ensure we have the people, training, and tools to meet SLAs without burnout.
• Prevent vendor surprises with clear SLAs, playbooks, and backups.
• Keep the help‑center and macros aligned with product changes.

Risk statements (top of mind):
• Support/Trust overwhelmed at launch; SLAs missed; morale drops.
• Knowledge base drift; macros out of date; inconsistent outcomes.
• Vendor outages without fallbacks; misaligned SLAs; long recovery times.
• On‑call fatigue; unclear incident roles; slow MTTR.

Primary causes & contributing factors:
• Under‑forecasted volume; insufficient training; admin gaps.
• Rapid product changes; copy not versioned; lack of ownership.
• Vendor contracts weak; no status notifications; single points of failure.
• On‑call rotations too thin; no drills; tools missing.

Leading indicators & early warning signals:
• FRT/FRR breaches; reopen rates; CSAT drop; internal escalations rise.
• Macro usage declines; ticket notes reveal confusion; help‑center views spike without resolution.
• Vendor latency and error alerts; outage durations; manual overrides used.
• Incident count rises; MTTA/MTTR increases; paging fatigue reports.

Preventive controls & mitigations:
• Staffing buffers; surge plan; calculators/macros; admin tools; office hours.
• KB versioning; DRI for each macro; release notes to support; periodic reviews.
• Vendor SLAs; failover tests; status webhooks; backup vendors or fallbacks.
• On‑call training; incident roles; drills; better tooling for runbooks and flags.

Incident playbooks (summary):
• Support surge: triage queue; prioritize money/safety; extend hours; auto‑responses for low severity.
• Vendor outage: switch to fallback; communicate; reconcile later.
• On‑call fatigue: add backup rotation; lighten non‑incident workload; coaching.

RACI / Owners:
• Support lead, Trust lead, SRE, Vendor manager, Product ops.

Instrumentation & success metrics:
• FRT/FRR; reopen; CSAT; staffing vs forecast; incident MTTR; vendor uptime vs SLA.

Thresholds & triggers (Go/No‑Go, rollback, escalation):
• Two weeks of SLA misses → staffing or scope change; vendor < 99.9% → escalation per contract.

Dependencies & assumptions:
• §4.14 admin tools; §10 launch plans; vendor contracts and status hooks.

Acceptance checklist (risk under control when):
□ Staffing plan signed; training complete; KB and macros versioned; vendor failover tested; on‑call schedule live.

Scenario Deep‑Dive — Support backlog post‑PR:
Context: Large spike in tickets after press coverage.
Trigger: Backlog > X for > Y hours.
Immediate actions: Enable deflection; reassign staff; extend hours; templates for common issues; weekly town‑hall webinar.
Communication: Queue position notices; honest timelines.
Rollback/Forward: Back to standard hours; retro and staffing adjustments.
Owner: Support lead | Telemetry: queue_size, SLA_breaches | Evidence: Ticket logs; macro usage

Execution Notes:
• Every risk has a dashboard tile with an owner, a definition of the denominator, and a weekly narrative. • Risk reviews pair with §10 post‑launch 7/30/90‑day reviews and §8 compliance calendar. • Where a risk spans multiple squads, the city GM or Risk DRI chairs the review; actions have due dates. • We prefer reversible changes (flags) and narrow blast radius (city gates). • We avoid 'security by obscurity'; we publish clear user guidance, train staff, and keep audit trails for all sensitive actions. • The risk register itself is versioned; changes record rationale and observed metrics.

§11.7 — City Expansion & Market Risks (Supply/Demand, PR, Competition)

§11.7 — City Expansion & Market Risks (Supply/Demand, PR, Competition)

Risk & Process Disclaimer: This section is an internal risk‑management blueprint. It does not constitute legal, tax, or security advice. Coordinate with counsel and security leaders before externalizing any policy or committing to obligations. All examples are illustrative and must be adapted to the realities measured in Section 5 dashboards.

Context & Alignment: US‑only marketplace launch; subscription‑free start; monetization via take‑rate and usage‑based promotions with strict eligibility and caps. Public content is artistic‑only with Safe‑Mode defaults for guests. Deliverables are exchanged via external links (Drive/Dropbox) with immutable manifests; escrowed payments release on acceptance. Instant Book requires ID verification; background checks are opt‑in (Trusted Pro). Rollouts are city‑gated behind feature flags. Admin Console enforces least‑privilege, JIT elevation, two‑person approvals, and full audit trails.

Goals:
• Scale city‑by‑city without diluting quality or overextending resources.
• Manage PR around artistic‑only policy while growing creator adoption.
• Anticipate competitor reactions and prepare counter‑moves.

Risk statements (top of mind):
• Supply/demand imbalance leads to empty searches or low conversion.
• PR backlash on nudity policy; misunderstanding of 'artistic‑only'.
• Competitor copying features or undercutting fees; paid poaching of providers.
• Local regulatory quirks (taxes, studio rules) slow rollouts.

Primary causes & contributing factors:
• Insufficient seeding; poor neighborhood coverage; mis‑set price floors.
• Ambiguous messaging; lack of examples; culture‑specific sensitivities.
• No loyalty perks; unclear value vs competitors; weak community.
• Poor research; lack of local counsel; rushed enablement.

Leading indicators & early warning signals:
• No‑results rate; S→I and I→B by district; studio attach rate; waitlist conversion.
• Press mentions; help‑center views on policy; support tickets querying policy.
• Churn of top providers; promotions adoption dips; competitor ads targeting users.
• Tax exceptions; studio rejection due to rules; compliance tickets.

Preventive controls & mitigations:
• City runbook (§10.1); targeted invites; featured carousels; perks; RFPs.
• Artistic‑only examples page; Safe‑Mode defaults; local creator ambassadors.
• Loyalty (verified boosts, fee discounts for Trusted Pro/Instant Book); community events; ROAS‑proven promotions.
• City allowlist; local counsel; studio verification; phased feature enablement.

Incident playbooks (summary):
• Thin supply: focus invites, perks; adjust floors; partner with studios; PR push with ambassadors.
• PR backlash: publish examples; enforce policy consistently; avoid adversarial tone; spotlight safety.
• Competitor move: emphasize escrow, contracts, trust signals, and fairness of promotions; not a race to the bottom.

RACI / Owners:
• City GM, Growth, Trust, Legal, Studios PM.

Instrumentation & success metrics:
• Coverage heatmaps; conversion by area; PR sentiment; share of wallet among active providers; event attendance.

Thresholds & triggers (Go/No‑Go, rollback, escalation):
• City expansion blocked if conversion or safety below thresholds for 4 weeks.
• PR negativity above threshold triggers comms and creator outreach plan.

Dependencies & assumptions:
• §2 GTM plan; §3 monetization; §4 studios; §10 city turn‑up; §8 legal posture.

Acceptance checklist (risk under control when):
□ City readiness gates passed; ambassador program staffed; press kit updated; compliance checks cleared.

Scenario Deep‑Dive — Competitor fee cut campaign:
Context: Local competitor drops fees to poach providers.
Trigger: Churn increases among top quartile.
Immediate actions: Targeted outreach; highlight escrow/trust; limited‑time boosts credits; emphasize earnings after fees.
Communication: Personalized messages; city page explainer.
Rollback/Forward: End credits after stabilization; measure sustainable effect.
Owner: Growth/GM | Telemetry: provider_churn, bookings_share | Evidence: Exit surveys; earnings comparisons

Execution Notes:
• Every risk has a dashboard tile with an owner, a definition of the denominator, and a weekly narrative. • Risk reviews pair with §10 post‑launch 7/30/90‑day reviews and §8 compliance calendar. • Where a risk spans multiple squads, the city GM or Risk DRI chairs the review; actions have due dates. • We prefer reversible changes (flags) and narrow blast radius (city gates). • We avoid 'security by obscurity'; we publish clear user guidance, train staff, and keep audit trails for all sensitive actions. • The risk register itself is versioned; changes record rationale and observed metrics.

Execution Notes:
• Every risk has a dashboard tile with an owner, a definition of the denominator, and a weekly narrative. • Risk reviews pair with §10 post‑launch 7/30/90‑day reviews and §8 compliance calendar. • Where a risk spans multiple squads, the city GM or Risk DRI chairs the review; actions have due dates. • We prefer reversible changes (flags) and narrow blast radius (city gates). • We avoid 'security by obscurity'; we publish clear user guidance, train staff, and keep audit trails for all sensitive actions. • The risk register itself is versioned; changes record rationale and observed metrics.

§11.8 — Crisis Scenarios & Cross‑Team Drills (Sev‑0/1, Public Comms, Recovery)

§11.8 — Crisis Scenarios & Cross‑Team Drills (Sev‑0/1, Public Comms, Recovery)

Risk & Process Disclaimer: This section is an internal risk‑management blueprint. It does not constitute legal, tax, or security advice. Coordinate with counsel and security leaders before externalizing any policy or committing to obligations. All examples are illustrative and must be adapted to the realities measured in Section 5 dashboards.

Context & Alignment: US‑only marketplace launch; subscription‑free start; monetization via take‑rate and usage‑based promotions with strict eligibility and caps. Public content is artistic‑only with Safe‑Mode defaults for guests. Deliverables are exchanged via external links (Drive/Dropbox) with immutable manifests; escrowed payments release on acceptance. Instant Book requires ID verification; background checks are opt‑in (Trusted Pro). Rollouts are city‑gated behind feature flags. Admin Console enforces least‑privilege, JIT elevation, two‑person approvals, and full audit trails.

Goals:
• Prepare for high‑impact, low‑probability events with rehearsed drills and clear command.
• Coordinate public communications that are honest, timely, and user‑centric.
• Recover quickly while preserving evidence and trust.

Risk statements (top of mind):
• Data exfiltration of PII; public leak.
• Payments freeze (processor outage); delayed payouts; mass refunds.
• Content policy crisis with press amplification.
• Law‑enforcement emergency request mishandled or leaked.
• Tax miscollection discovered post‑fact with state inquiry.

Primary causes & contributing factors:
• Zero‑day exploit or human error; inadequate segmentation; weak secrets management.
• Single point of failure; webhook lag; missing fallbacks.
• Edge moderation cases; inconsistent enforcement; unclear examples.
• Poor intake; inadequate counsel coordination; staff inexperience.
• Allowlist gaps; mapping errors; missed reconciliation signals.

Leading indicators & early warning signals:
• SIEM alerts; unusual export volumes; media contact; external researcher reports.
• Checkout failures; payout backlog; angry tickets; social mentions.
• Reporter inquiries; creator backlash; surge in appeals.
• LEA emails; urgent calls; subpoenas without proper service.
• State notices; reconciliation variances; user complaints about taxes.

Preventive controls & mitigations:
• Zero‑trust posture; RBAC/JIT; secrets rotation; backups; drills.
• Multi‑processor readiness; ACH fallback; status page; clear banners; queue resilience.
• Examples gallery; Safe‑Mode; training; appeals path; PR playbook.
• LEA intake process; counsel oversight; audit trails; emergency disclosure policy.
• Tax engine allowlists; nightly reconciliation; corrective memos; disclosure templates.

Incident playbooks (summary):
• Breach response: contain, assess, notify as required; public statement; long‑term hardening.
• Processor incident: prefer ACH; pause promos; display banners; proactive emails on payouts.
• Policy crisis: consistent enforcement; examples; supportive tone; moderator QA; appeal volume handling.
• LEA mishandling: internal review; reinforce process; counsel‑approved messaging; training refreshers.
• Tax exposure: compute liability; consult counsel; amend receipts; communicate refunds or charges.

RACI / Owners:
• Incident Commander (IC), Security lead, Payments PM, Trust lead, Legal/PR, Finance, SRE.

Instrumentation & success metrics:
• MTTA/MTTR; user sentiment; incident recurrence; post‑mortem action completion; legal response times.

Thresholds & triggers (Go/No‑Go, rollback, escalation):
• Sev‑0 declared when user PII confirmed exposed or checkout is broadly down; Sev‑1 for prolonged partial outages.

Dependencies & assumptions:
• §10.7 incident drills; §8 legal policies; §4.12 money; vendor SLAs; status page.

Acceptance checklist (risk under control when):
□ Drills completed; comms templates approved; status page playbook tested; evidence capture process verified.

Scenario Deep‑Dive — Public breach disclosure window:
Context: Regulatory deadlines and user expectations collide.
Trigger: Counsel advises notification deadlines approaching.
Immediate actions: Draft statement; notify affected users; coordinate with vendors; implement mitigations; open FAQ.
Communication: Honest, user‑centric; no speculation; link to resources; provide credit monitoring if appropriate.
Rollback/Forward: N/A; focus on long‑term hardening and transparency report.
Owner: IC + Legal/PR | Telemetry: notification_sent, MTTR | Evidence: Forensic logs; vendor statements; audit trails

Execution Notes:
• Every risk has a dashboard tile with an owner, a definition of the denominator, and a weekly narrative. • Risk reviews pair with §10 post‑launch 7/30/90‑day reviews and §8 compliance calendar. • Where a risk spans multiple squads, the city GM or Risk DRI chairs the review; actions have due dates. • We prefer reversible changes (flags) and narrow blast radius (city gates). • We avoid 'security by obscurity'; we publish clear user guidance, train staff, and keep audit trails for all sensitive actions. • The risk register itself is versioned; changes record rationale and observed metrics.

Section 12 — Roadmap & Phased Delivery (12.0–12.10)

Generated on 2025-11-04 23:33:51 UTC

Each sub‑section is a ≥2,500‑word internal roadmap chapter aligned with Sections 1–11.

§12.0 — Roadmap Principles & Themes (Trust‑First, Reversible, Measurable)

§12.0 — Roadmap Principles & Themes (Trust‑First, Reversible, Measurable)

Roadmap Disclaimer: This is an internal planning document. Dates are placeholders and will firm up as Section 5 telemetry validates conversion and quality gates. All items ship behind flags and city allowlists. Nothing herein creates external commitments.

Context & Alignment: US‑only creative marketplace; subscription‑free at launch; monetization via take‑rate and usage‑based promotions with eligibility gates and strict caps; public content limited to artistic‑only (guest Safe‑Mode on by default); deliverables handled via external links (Drive/Dropbox) with immutable manifests; escrowed payments released on acceptance; Instant Book gated by ID verification; optional background checks confer Trusted Pro; city‑gated rollout with feature flags; strong Admin Console with least‑privilege, JIT elevation, two‑person approvals, and immutable audits.

Timeframe & Scope:
• Applies across all phases; updated quarterly after 7/30/90‑day reviews.

Goals:
• Ship trust‑critical features early; avoid scaling without safety and money readiness.
• Prefer reversible, city‑gated changes; use flags and holdouts for anything that touches ranking or money.
• Instrument everything; decisions follow data from §5 dashboards, not anecdotes.

Product Themes:
• Trust‑First UX: IDV→Instant Book, Safe‑Mode default, clear deliverables manifest, transparent fees.
• Fair Discovery: relevance first; paid boosts capped, labeled, and eligibility‑gated.
• Creator Earnings: faster time‑to‑first booking; simple change‑orders; clear travel fees; Early Payout (per‑use).
• Operational Excellence: admin operability; two‑person approvals; immutable audits; status page discipline.
• City‑by‑City: runbooks, founding perks, local studios and ambassadors, metrics gates.
• Sustainable Monetization: take‑rate first; usage‑based promotions; defer subscriptions until liquidity is proven.

Workstreams & Deliverables:
• Profiles & Search (role‑aware, social metrics, presets).
• Booking & Money (escrow, change orders, travel fees, tax engine allowlists).
• Messaging & Collaboration (threads, file manifests, checklists).
• Trust & Safety (IDV/BG, moderation, Safe‑Mode, appeals).
• Promotions (CPC/Featured v1 with caps, QS, holdouts).
• Studios (phase‑gated, deposit rules, house rules, verified badge).
• Analytics & Admin (dashboards, flags, incident drills).

Feature Flags & City Gates:
• feature.idv.instant_book, feature.promotions.v1, feature.studio.beta, feature.group_checkout, feature.lbg_receipt, city.{HOU,DAL,AUS} allowlists.

Dependencies & Inputs:
• Vendors: processor(s), ACH, tax engine, IDV, BG, e‑signature, comms. Internal: §5 data; §4 admin; §8 policy; §10 playbooks.

Top Risks & Mitigations:
• Over‑scope early phases; promotions perceived as pay‑to‑win; tax misconfig; moderation backlog; processor outage.

Instrumentation & KPIs:
• S→I, I→B, time‑to‑first booking, dispute loss rate, payout latency, IDV %, Trusted Pro %, promotions ROAS, no‑results rate, tax variance.

Acceptance Criteria (Go/No‑Go):
✓ Every phase has go/no‑go gates signed by Product, Trust, Finance, and SRE.
✓ Help‑center parity with UI; admin tools cover top 3 edge cases.

Staffing & Ownership:
• Phase‑linked squads: Profiles/Search, Booking/Money, Trust/Safety, Promotions/Growth, Studios, Platform/SRE, Data, Support/City Ops.

Milestones & Checkpoints:
• Quarterly roadmap review; monthly risk register review; flag audits; city expansion checkpoint meetings.

Implementation Notes:
• Flag Discipline: Each capability ships behind a named flag with a runbook, owner, rollback, and blast‑radius notes. Flags default to 'off' in new cities.
• Admin Operability: No workstream is 'done' until admin tools enable Support/Trust/Finance to handle the top 3 edge cases without engineering.
• Copy & Policy: All flows have help‑center articles and email/SMS templates; copy avoids legalese and links to policy examples.
• QA & Drills: Staging mimics production data shapes; drills include processor/tax outages, moderation surges, and incident command handoffs.
• Experimentation: Features that affect marketplace economics (ranking, boosts, fees) include holdouts and guardrails; we measure incremental impact.
• Data Wiring: Events land in Bronze/Silver/Gold (§5); KPIs pull only from Gold with freshness SLOs. Definitions live in a metrics catalog.
• Accessibility: New UI complies with WCAG 2.1 AA; screen‑reader and keyboard paths verified; contrast ratios checked; defects triaged.
• Security & Privacy: PII masked by default; JIT elevation for sensitive admin actions; vendor scopes minimal; audits immutable.
• City Readiness: City‑first artifacts (press kit, creator ambassadors, studio partners) prepared in §10.1 runbook.
• Post‑Launch: 7/30/90‑day reviews convert observations into roadmap changes; flags let us tune by city without forks.

Implementation Notes:

§12.1 — Phase 0 (Pre‑Alpha): Scaffolding, Schemas, Admin, Policy

§12.1 — Phase 0 (Pre‑Alpha): Scaffolding, Schemas, Admin, Policy

Roadmap Disclaimer: This is an internal planning document. Dates are placeholders and will firm up as Section 5 telemetry validates conversion and quality gates. All items ship behind flags and city allowlists. Nothing herein creates external commitments.

Context & Alignment: US‑only creative marketplace; subscription‑free at launch; monetization via take‑rate and usage‑based promotions with eligibility gates and strict caps; public content limited to artistic‑only (guest Safe‑Mode on by default); deliverables handled via external links (Drive/Dropbox) with immutable manifests; escrowed payments released on acceptance; Instant Book gated by ID verification; optional background checks confer Trusted Pro; city‑gated rollout with feature flags; strong Admin Console with least‑privilege, JIT elevation, two‑person approvals, and immutable audits.

Timeframe & Scope:
• T‑90 to T‑45 days before Alpha invite (internal & selected creators).

Goals:
• Stand up core data schemas and events; ensure Admin Console MVP supports support/trust workflows.
• Draft policy and help content aligned to product scope (artistic‑only public, Safe‑Mode default).
• Select vendors (processor(s), ACH, tax, IDV/BG, e‑signature, comms) and wire sandbox integrations.

Product Themes:
• Get the foundation right: data, admin, identity, money contracts, and reversible flags.
• Internal dogfooding with synthetic bookings to validate core loop and receipts.

Workstreams & Deliverables:
• Data models: users, roles, service profiles, packages, bookings (legs), payments, receipts, promotions, audits.
• Events: search, inquiry, booking request, acceptance, change order, deliverables manifest, acceptance, payout queued/sent, disputes.
• Admin MVP: support refunds/amendments, content redaction, impersonate/view‑as, audits.
• Policy drafts: ToS, Privacy, Content/Safety; examples gallery for artistic‑only and Safe‑Mode.

Feature Flags & City Gates:
• feature.booking.core, feature.messaging.core, feature.admin.mini, feature.tax.allowlist=false (sandbox), feature.idv.sandbox.

Dependencies & Inputs:
• Engineering environment, CI/CD, feature flag system, observability stack (§5.12), ticketing (Support/Trust).

Top Risks & Mitigations:
• Schema churn; admin gaps; unclear policy copy; vendor SLA surprises.

Instrumentation & KPIs:
• Synthetic loop pass rate; admin task completion without engineering; staging stability; event completeness to Gold.

Acceptance Criteria (Go/No‑Go):
✓ Core loop passes end‑to‑end in staging; admin can amend receipts and issue refunds; policy drafts ready for counsel review.

Staffing & Ownership:
• Founding Eng squad; Data engineer; Product/Design; Support/Trust liaisons; Legal consult; SRE.

Milestones & Checkpoints:
• Schema freeze; admin MVP; sandbox vendors functioning; policy and help drafts staged.

Implementation Notes:
• Flag Discipline: Each capability ships behind a named flag with a runbook, owner, rollback, and blast‑radius notes. Flags default to 'off' in new cities.
• Admin Operability: No workstream is 'done' until admin tools enable Support/Trust/Finance to handle the top 3 edge cases without engineering.
• Copy & Policy: All flows have help‑center articles and email/SMS templates; copy avoids legalese and links to policy examples.
• QA & Drills: Staging mimics production data shapes; drills include processor/tax outages, moderation surges, and incident command handoffs.
• Experimentation: Features that affect marketplace economics (ranking, boosts, fees) include holdouts and guardrails; we measure incremental impact.
• Data Wiring: Events land in Bronze/Silver/Gold (§5); KPIs pull only from Gold with freshness SLOs. Definitions live in a metrics catalog.
• Accessibility: New UI complies with WCAG 2.1 AA; screen‑reader and keyboard paths verified; contrast ratios checked; defects triaged.
• Security & Privacy: PII masked by default; JIT elevation for sensitive admin actions; vendor scopes minimal; audits immutable.
• City Readiness: City‑first artifacts (press kit, creator ambassadors, studio partners) prepared in §10.1 runbook.
• Post‑Launch: 7/30/90‑day reviews convert observations into roadmap changes; flags let us tune by city without forks.

§12.2 — Phase 1 (Alpha): Role Profiles, Search Basics, Booking & Escrow, Messaging

§12.2 — Phase 1 (Alpha): Role Profiles, Search Basics, Booking & Escrow, Messaging

Roadmap Disclaimer: This is an internal planning document. Dates are placeholders and will firm up as Section 5 telemetry validates conversion and quality gates. All items ship behind flags and city allowlists. Nothing herein creates external commitments.

Context & Alignment: US‑only creative marketplace; subscription‑free at launch; monetization via take‑rate and usage‑based promotions with eligibility gates and strict caps; public content limited to artistic‑only (guest Safe‑Mode on by default); deliverables handled via external links (Drive/Dropbox) with immutable manifests; escrowed payments released on acceptance; Instant Book gated by ID verification; optional background checks confer Trusted Pro; city‑gated rollout with feature flags; strong Admin Console with least‑privilege, JIT elevation, two‑person approvals, and immutable audits.

Timeframe & Scope:
• T‑45 to T‑0; internal + small cohort (≤150 creators/buyers).

Goals:
• Validate the core loop with real users in a controlled cohort; collect usability feedback.
• Enable role‑specific profiles and search presets; keep filter UI simple with an advanced drawer.
• Operationalize escrow, deliverables manifests, and acceptance flows; enforce Safe‑Mode on public surfaces.

Product Themes:
• Minimum lovable product for discovery and booking; admin operability before scale.

Workstreams & Deliverables:
• Role tabs; separate reviews per role; portfolio uploads with tagging/approvals; social metrics chips (verified if connected).
• Search presets (e.g., 'Fashion model in Houston this week'); advanced filter drawer; verified‑only toggle.
• Booking requests, acceptance, change orders; deliverables manifest (lightweight) with external link manifest capture.
• Messaging threads with file gating; reschedule within rules; notifications; read receipts (optional).

Feature Flags & City Gates:
• feature.search.presets, feature.reviews.by_role, feature.manifest.external_only, feature.messaging.read_receipts.

Dependencies & Inputs:
• IDV vendor in sandbox; escrow on processor; ACH sandbox; help‑center; admin refund calculator.

Top Risks & Mitigations:
• Overly complex filters; manifest intimidation; messaging misuse; off‑platform leakage.

Instrumentation & KPIs:
• S→I and I→B in cohort; manifest completion rate; off‑platform warning triggers; response time; support tickets by category.

Acceptance Criteria (Go/No‑Go):
✓ S→I ≥ 15%; I→B ≥ 25% within cohort; admin resolves top 10 issues without engineering; Safe‑Mode effective; no Sev‑1s.

Staffing & Ownership:
• Profiles/Search squad; Booking/Money squad; Support; Trust; Design Research.

Milestones & Checkpoints:
• Alpha retrospective; copy tweaks; filter tuning; manifest improvements; help updates.

Implementation Notes:
• Flag Discipline: Each capability ships behind a named flag with a runbook, owner, rollback, and blast‑radius notes. Flags default to 'off' in new cities.
• Admin Operability: No workstream is 'done' until admin tools enable Support/Trust/Finance to handle the top 3 edge cases without engineering.
• Copy & Policy: All flows have help‑center articles and email/SMS templates; copy avoids legalese and links to policy examples.
• QA & Drills: Staging mimics production data shapes; drills include processor/tax outages, moderation surges, and incident command handoffs.
• Experimentation: Features that affect marketplace economics (ranking, boosts, fees) include holdouts and guardrails; we measure incremental impact.
• Data Wiring: Events land in Bronze/Silver/Gold (§5); KPIs pull only from Gold with freshness SLOs. Definitions live in a metrics catalog.
• Accessibility: New UI complies with WCAG 2.1 AA; screen‑reader and keyboard paths verified; contrast ratios checked; defects triaged.
• Security & Privacy: PII masked by default; JIT elevation for sensitive admin actions; vendor scopes minimal; audits immutable.
• City Readiness: City‑first artifacts (press kit, creator ambassadors, studio partners) prepared in §10.1 runbook.
• Post‑Launch: 7/30/90‑day reviews convert observations into roadmap changes; flags let us tune by city without forks.

• Post‑Launch: 7/30/90‑day reviews convert observations into roadmap changes; flags let us tune by city without forks.

Implementation Notes:
• Flag Discipline: Each capability ships behind a named flag with a runbook, owner, rollback, and blast‑radius notes. Flags default to 'off' in new cities.
• Admin Operability: No workstream is 'done' until admin tools enable Support/Trust/Finance to handle the top 3 edge cases without engineering.
• Copy & Policy: All flows have help‑center articles and email/SMS templates; copy avoids legalese and links to policy examples.
• QA & Drills: Staging mimics production data shapes; drills include processor/tax outages, moderation surges, and incident command handoffs.
• Experimentation: Features that affect marketplace economics (ranking, boosts, fees) include holdouts and guardrails; we measure incremental impact.
• Data Wiring: Events land in Bronze/Silver/Gold (§5); KPIs pull only from Gold with freshness SLOs. Definitions live in a metrics catalog.
• Accessibility: New UI complies with WCAG 2.1 AA; screen‑reader and keyboard paths verified; contrast ratios checked; defects triaged.
• Security & Privacy: PII masked by default; JIT elevation for sensitive admin actions; vendor scopes minimal; audits immutable.
• City Readiness: City‑first artifacts (press kit, creator ambassadors, studio partners) prepared in §10.1 runbook.
• Post‑Launch: 7/30/90‑day reviews convert observations into roadmap changes; flags let us tune by city without forks.

§12.3 — Phase 2 (Public Beta — Houston): Verification, Policies, Change Orders, Travel Fees

§12.3 — Phase 2 (Public Beta — Houston): Verification, Policies, Change Orders, Travel Fees

Roadmap Disclaimer: This is an internal planning document. Dates are placeholders and will firm up as Section 5 telemetry validates conversion and quality gates. All items ship behind flags and city allowlists. Nothing herein creates external commitments.

Context & Alignment: US‑only creative marketplace; subscription‑free at launch; monetization via take‑rate and usage‑based promotions with eligibility gates and strict caps; public content limited to artistic‑only (guest Safe‑Mode on by default); deliverables handled via external links (Drive/Dropbox) with immutable manifests; escrowed payments released on acceptance; Instant Book gated by ID verification; optional background checks confer Trusted Pro; city‑gated rollout with feature flags; strong Admin Console with least‑privilege, JIT elevation, two‑person approvals, and immutable audits.

Timeframe & Scope:
• City‑gated public beta in Houston; T0 to T+90.

Goals:
• Prove conversion at city scale while keeping safety and money stable.
• Enable verification gating (IDV→Instant Book; Trusted Pro optional with FCRA playbook).
• Finalize change orders, travel fees, and time‑band cancellation logic; improve manifest UX.

Product Themes:
• Quality supply and fast path to first booking; clear money math and schedules.

Workstreams & Deliverables:
• IDV production; Instant Book eligibility; Trusted Pro flow; reputation score and search tie‑break.
• Change orders and reschedule; travel fee calculator by radius/zip; deposits (studios not yet).
• Refund calculators; tax allowlist (Texas) on; receipts itemize fees and taxes; ACH discount visible.
• Safety: harassment macros; rate limits; reporting; appeals; Safe‑Mode hardening.

Feature Flags & City Gates:
• feature.idv.prod, feature.instant_book, feature.travel.calculator, feature.refund.calculator, feature.tax.allowlist=TX.

Dependencies & Inputs:
• Processor production; tax engine; comms; support staffing; moderation staffing; studios partner outreach groundwork.

Top Risks & Mitigations:
• Moderation backlog; tax errors; money reconciliation variance; chargeback narratives; harassment waves.

Instrumentation & KPIs:
• City S→I ≥ 20%; I→B ≥ 35%; time‑to‑first booking; dispute loss ≤ target; ACH share; payout latency; moderation SLA.

Acceptance Criteria (Go/No‑Go):
✓ KPIs hit for 30 days; daily close green; dispute kit quality high; help‑center parity; incident drills passed.

Staffing & Ownership:
• City GM; Support; Trust; Payments/Tax; Growth; Data; SRE.

Milestones & Checkpoints:
• Beta review at T+30 and T+60; PR moments; creator meetups; endorsements.

Implementation Notes:
• Flag Discipline: Each capability ships behind a named flag with a runbook, owner, rollback, and blast‑radius notes. Flags default to 'off' in new cities.
• Admin Operability: No workstream is 'done' until admin tools enable Support/Trust/Finance to handle the top 3 edge cases without engineering.
• Copy & Policy: All flows have help‑center articles and email/SMS templates; copy avoids legalese and links to policy examples.
• QA & Drills: Staging mimics production data shapes; drills include processor/tax outages, moderation surges, and incident command handoffs.
• Experimentation: Features that affect marketplace economics (ranking, boosts, fees) include holdouts and guardrails; we measure incremental impact.
• Data Wiring: Events land in Bronze/Silver/Gold (§5); KPIs pull only from Gold with freshness SLOs. Definitions live in a metrics catalog.
• Accessibility: New UI complies with WCAG 2.1 AA; screen‑reader and keyboard paths verified; contrast ratios checked; defects triaged.
• Security & Privacy: PII masked by default; JIT elevation for sensitive admin actions; vendor scopes minimal; audits immutable.
• City Readiness: City‑first artifacts (press kit, creator ambassadors, studio partners) prepared in §10.1 runbook.
• Post‑Launch: 7/30/90‑day reviews convert observations into roadmap changes; flags let us tune by city without forks.

§12.4 — Phase 3 (GA — Houston): Promotions v1, Tax Allowlist, Early Payout (Per‑Use)

§12.4 — Phase 3 (GA — Houston): Promotions v1, Tax Allowlist, Early Payout (Per‑Use)

Roadmap Disclaimer: This is an internal planning document. Dates are placeholders and will firm up as Section 5 telemetry validates conversion and quality gates. All items ship behind flags and city allowlists. Nothing herein creates external commitments.

Context & Alignment: US‑only creative marketplace; subscription‑free at launch; monetization via take‑rate and usage‑based promotions with eligibility gates and strict caps; public content limited to artistic‑only (guest Safe‑Mode on by default); deliverables handled via external links (Drive/Dropbox) with immutable manifests; escrowed payments released on acceptance; Instant Book gated by ID verification; optional background checks confer Trusted Pro; city‑gated rollout with feature flags; strong Admin Console with least‑privilege, JIT elevation, two‑person approvals, and immutable audits.

Timeframe & Scope:
• T+90 to T+150 (post‑beta, same city).

Goals:
• Turn on promotions v1 with caps and holdouts; prove ≥2.5× ROAS without harming organic search.
• Stabilize money ops: ACH discount live; tax allowlist expanded where ready; Early Payout per‑use live for high‑rep providers.
• Harden safety and admin workflows for scale.

Product Themes:
• Add monetization carefully; keep fairness and trust standards intact.

Workstreams & Deliverables:
• Search Boost (CPC floors by role/city) + Featured (weekly) with labels, caps, QS, and holdouts; invalid‑click auto‑credits.
• Payments & tax: ACH discount messaging; allowlist expansion (if ready); amended receipts; daily close automation.
• Early Payout per‑use (eligibility Rep ≥ 85 + IDV); reserve rules; payout ledger improvements.
• Safety: harassment tooling, doxxing macro, stricter rate limits for new accounts; appeals capacity.

Feature Flags & City Gates:
• feature.promotions.v1, feature.early_payout, feature.tax.allowlist.{more_states}, feature.payout.reserve.rules.

Dependencies & Inputs:
• Growth analytics; finance dashboards; Trust staffing; support macros; status page templates.

Top Risks & Mitigations:
• Pay‑to‑win perception; invalid clicks; tax variance; payout queue stuck; support overload.

Instrumentation & KPIs:
• Promotions adoption; ROAS; invalid‑click credit %; organic KPIs steady; payout latency; tax variance; support SLA.

Acceptance Criteria (Go/No‑Go):
✓ ROAS median ≥ 2.5×; organic KPIs steady; daily close green 14 days; Early Payout error rate ≤ target.

Staffing & Ownership:
• Growth PM, Finance, Payments Eng, Trust, Support, Data, SRE.

Milestones & Checkpoints:
• GA announcement; case studies; Featured carousels; ROAS report; partner recap.

Implementation Notes:
• Flag Discipline: Each capability ships behind a named flag with a runbook, owner, rollback, and blast‑radius notes. Flags default to 'off' in new cities.
• Admin Operability: No workstream is 'done' until admin tools enable Support/Trust/Finance to handle the top 3 edge cases without engineering.
• Copy & Policy: All flows have help‑center articles and email/SMS templates; copy avoids legalese and links to policy examples.
• QA & Drills: Staging mimics production data shapes; drills include processor/tax outages, moderation surges, and incident command handoffs.
• Experimentation: Features that affect marketplace economics (ranking, boosts, fees) include holdouts and guardrails; we measure incremental impact.
• Data Wiring: Events land in Bronze/Silver/Gold (§5); KPIs pull only from Gold with freshness SLOs. Definitions live in a metrics catalog.
• Accessibility: New UI complies with WCAG 2.1 AA; screen‑reader and keyboard paths verified; contrast ratios checked; defects triaged.
• Security & Privacy: PII masked by default; JIT elevation for sensitive admin actions; vendor scopes minimal; audits immutable.
• City Readiness: City‑first artifacts (press kit, creator ambassadors, studio partners) prepared in §10.1 runbook.
• Post‑Launch: 7/30/90‑day reviews convert observations into roadmap changes; flags let us tune by city without forks.

• Admin Operability: No workstream is 'done' until admin tools enable Support/Trust/Finance to handle the top 3 edge cases without engineering.
• Copy & Policy: All flows have help‑center articles and email/SMS templates; copy avoids legalese and links to policy examples.
• QA & Drills: Staging mimics production data shapes; drills include processor/tax outages, moderation surges, and incident command handoffs.
• Experimentation: Features that affect marketplace economics (ranking, boosts, fees) include holdouts and guardrails; we measure incremental impact.
• Data Wiring: Events land in Bronze/Silver/Gold (§5); KPIs pull only from Gold with freshness SLOs. Definitions live in a metrics catalog.
• Accessibility: New UI complies with WCAG 2.1 AA; screen‑reader and keyboard paths verified; contrast ratios checked; defects triaged.
• Security & Privacy: PII masked by default; JIT elevation for sensitive admin actions; vendor scopes minimal; audits immutable.
• City Readiness: City‑first artifacts (press kit, creator ambassadors, studio partners) prepared in §10.1 runbook.
• Post‑Launch: 7/30/90‑day reviews convert observations into roadmap changes; flags let us tune by city without forks.

Implementation Notes:
• Flag Discipline: Each capability ships behind a named flag with a runbook, owner, rollback, and blast‑radius notes. Flags default to 'off' in new cities.
• Admin Operability: No workstream is 'done' until admin tools enable Support/Trust/Finance to handle the top 3 edge cases without engineering.
• Copy & Policy: All flows have help‑center articles and email/SMS templates; copy avoids legalese and links to policy examples.
• QA & Drills: Staging mimics production data shapes; drills include processor/tax outages, moderation surges, and incident command handoffs.

• City Readiness: City‑first artifacts (press kit, creator ambassadors, studio partners) prepared in §10.1 runbook.
• Post‑Launch: 7/30/90‑day reviews convert observations into roadmap changes; flags let us tune by city without forks.

§12.5 — Phase 4 (City Expansion — Dallas/Austin): Reuse Playbook; Prep Studios Beta

§12.5 — Phase 4 (City Expansion — Dallas/Austin): Reuse Playbook; Prep Studios Beta

Roadmap Disclaimer: This is an internal planning document. Dates are placeholders and will firm up as Section 5 telemetry validates conversion and quality gates. All items ship behind flags and city allowlists. Nothing herein creates external commitments.

Context & Alignment: US‑only creative marketplace; subscription‑free at launch; monetization via take‑rate and usage‑based promotions with eligibility gates and strict caps; public content limited to artistic‑only (guest Safe‑Mode on by default); deliverables handled via external links (Drive/Dropbox) with immutable manifests; escrowed payments released on acceptance; Instant Book gated by ID verification; optional background checks confer Trusted Pro; city‑gated rollout with feature flags; strong Admin Console with least‑privilege, JIT elevation, two‑person approvals, and immutable audits.

Timeframe & Scope:
• T+150 to T+240.

Goals:
• Replicate Houston GA playbook in Dallas and Austin with measured spend and PR.
• Prepare Studios Beta (verification, house rules, deposit defaults) for a limited cohort.
• Ensure cross‑city data comparability; maintain flag discipline.

Product Themes:
• Scale predictably; avoid overextending; test studios with narrow scope.

Workstreams & Deliverables:
• City turn‑up runbooks; founding perks; featured carousels; referral codes via partner studios.
• Studio verification flow (doc upload + light review); house rules template library; deposit holds; check‑in/out surfaces.
• LBG scaffolding (internal): dual‑leg receipts off; group bundling experiments (behind flags only).

Feature Flags & City Gates:
• city.DAL allowlist, city.AUS allowlist, feature.studio.beta=false, feature.lbg.scaffold=true (internal only).

Dependencies & Inputs:
• City ops staff; studio partner pipeline; legal review of house rules; deposit capture on processor.

Top Risks & Mitigations:
• Supply thin pockets; PR backlash; deposit misuse; studio disputes; throughput on support.

Instrumentation & KPIs:
• City S→I/I→B; supply coverage heatmaps; studio attach rate; deposit claims; dispute rate for studio bookings.

Acceptance Criteria (Go/No‑Go):
✓ Dallas/Austin meet beta→GA gates; studio beta ready checklists green; deposit flow tested.

Staffing & Ownership:
• City GMs; Studios PM; Trust; Support; Growth; Finance; SRE.

Milestones & Checkpoints:
• Dallas GA; Austin GA; Studios Beta go/no‑go; partner case studies.

Implementation Notes:
• Flag Discipline: Each capability ships behind a named flag with a runbook, owner, rollback, and blast‑radius notes. Flags default to 'off' in new cities.
• Admin Operability: No workstream is 'done' until admin tools enable Support/Trust/Finance to handle the top 3 edge cases without engineering.
• Copy & Policy: All flows have help‑center articles and email/SMS templates; copy avoids legalese and links to policy examples.
• QA & Drills: Staging mimics production data shapes; drills include processor/tax outages, moderation surges, and incident command handoffs.
• Experimentation: Features that affect marketplace economics (ranking, boosts, fees) include holdouts and guardrails; we measure incremental impact.
• Data Wiring: Events land in Bronze/Silver/Gold (§5); KPIs pull only from Gold with freshness SLOs. Definitions live in a metrics catalog.
• Accessibility: New UI complies with WCAG 2.1 AA; screen‑reader and keyboard paths verified; contrast ratios checked; defects triaged.
• Security & Privacy: PII masked by default; JIT elevation for sensitive admin actions; vendor scopes minimal; audits immutable.
• City Readiness: City‑first artifacts (press kit, creator ambassadors, studio partners) prepared in §10.1 runbook.
• Post‑Launch: 7/30/90‑day reviews convert observations into roadmap changes; flags let us tune by city without forks.

§12.6 — Phase 5 (V2 Themes): Studios Beta, LBG Group Checkout, Social Metrics Advanced, Reputation

§12.6 — Phase 5 (V2 Themes): Studios Beta, LBG Group Checkout, Social Metrics Advanced, Reputation

Roadmap Disclaimer: This is an internal planning document. Dates are placeholders and will firm up as Section 5 telemetry validates conversion and quality gates. All items ship behind flags and city allowlists. Nothing herein creates external commitments.

Context & Alignment: US‑only creative marketplace; subscription‑free at launch; monetization via take‑rate and usage‑based promotions with eligibility gates and strict caps; public content limited to artistic‑only (guest Safe‑Mode on by default); deliverables handled via external links (Drive/Dropbox) with immutable manifests; escrowed payments released on acceptance; Instant Book gated by ID verification; optional background checks confer Trusted Pro; city‑gated rollout with feature flags; strong Admin Console with least‑privilege, JIT elevation, two‑person approvals, and immutable audits.

Timeframe & Scope:
• T+240 to T+330.

Goals:
• Run Studios Beta with limited slots; measure attach and claims; iterate house rules and deposits.
• Pilot LBG (talent+studio group checkout) behind invite; generate group receipts; improve change‑order flows across legs.
• Advance social metrics (growth, engagement presets); refine reputation score with decay and role‑weighting.

Product Themes:
• Broader use cases while preserving fairness and safety.

Workstreams & Deliverables:
• Studios: verified badge; search filter; safety addenda; host messaging; calendar blocks; cleaning fee modeling.
• LBG: shared quote, split escrow; group receipt; per‑leg changes; cancellation coordination; admin tools and auditing.
• Social: per‑platform sliders; verified‑only toggle; growth trends; 'High engagement' presets; explanation tooltips.
• Reputation: time‑weighted, role‑specific; 'Why this score?' panel; negative event decay and caps.

Feature Flags & City Gates:
• feature.studio.beta=true (invite only), feature.lbg.checkout.beta=true (invite only), feature.social.metrics.advanced, feature.rep.v2.

Dependencies & Inputs:
• Processor for split captures; tax on deposits; host policy; moderation capacity; help‑center expansion.

Top Risks & Mitigations:
• Complexity overload; studio disputes; LBG reconciliation; user confusion on social metrics and reputation.

Instrumentation & KPIs:
• Studio attach and repeat; deposit claim rate; LBG conversion vs single‑leg; dispute trends; social filter usage; rep distribution health.

Acceptance Criteria (Go/No‑Go):
✓ Studios Beta NPS ≥ target; LBG pilot stable; no regression to S→I/I→B; support load manageable.

Staffing & Ownership:
• Studios squad; Booking/Money squad; Data; Trust; Support; Finance.

Milestones & Checkpoints:
• Studios beta retrospective; LBG pilot findings; decision on GA or further beta.

Implementation Notes:
• Flag Discipline: Each capability ships behind a named flag with a runbook, owner, rollback, and blast‑radius notes. Flags default to 'off' in new cities.
• Admin Operability: No workstream is 'done' until admin tools enable Support/Trust/Finance to handle the top 3 edge cases without engineering.
• Copy & Policy: All flows have help‑center articles and email/SMS templates; copy avoids legalese and links to policy examples.
• QA & Drills: Staging mimics production data shapes; drills include processor/tax outages, moderation surges, and incident command handoffs.
• Experimentation: Features that affect marketplace economics (ranking, boosts, fees) include holdouts and guardrails; we measure incremental impact.
• Data Wiring: Events land in Bronze/Silver/Gold (§5); KPIs pull only from Gold with freshness SLOs. Definitions live in a metrics catalog.
• Accessibility: New UI complies with WCAG 2.1 AA; screen‑reader and keyboard paths verified; contrast ratios checked; defects triaged.
• Security & Privacy: PII masked by default; JIT elevation for sensitive admin actions; vendor scopes minimal; audits immutable.
• City Readiness: City‑first artifacts (press kit, creator ambassadors, studio partners) prepared in §10.1 runbook.
• Post‑Launch: 7/30/90‑day reviews convert observations into roadmap changes; flags let us tune by city without forks.

§12.7 — Phase 6: Mobile Apps (iOS/Android) & Partner API (Rate‑Limited)

§12.7 — Phase 6: Mobile Apps (iOS/Android) & Partner API (Rate‑Limited)

Roadmap Disclaimer: This is an internal planning document. Dates are placeholders and will firm up as Section 5 telemetry validates conversion and quality gates. All items ship behind flags and city allowlists. Nothing herein creates external commitments.

Context & Alignment: US‑only creative marketplace; subscription‑free at launch; monetization via take‑rate and usage‑based promotions with eligibility gates and strict caps; public content limited to artistic‑only (guest Safe‑Mode on by default); deliverables handled via external links (Drive/Dropbox) with immutable manifests; escrowed payments released on acceptance; Instant Book gated by ID verification; optional background checks confer Trusted Pro; city‑gated rollout with feature flags; strong Admin Console with least‑privilege, JIT elevation, two‑person approvals, and immutable audits.

Timeframe & Scope:
• T+300 to T+390 (after multi‑city GA).

Goals:
• Deliver mobile apps that improve conversion (notifications, availability, messaging) without diverging product logic.
• Expose a limited partner API for brands and studios under strict scopes and rate limits.

Product Themes:
• Meet users where they are; keep parity with web; maintain safety and fairness controls.

Workstreams & Deliverables:
• iOS/Android apps: login/IDV, search, profiles, booking, messaging, deliverables manifest review, notifications, wallet; deep links.
• Push notifications with quiet hours; granular controls; safety‑respecting previews.
• Partner API: read‑only search & profile data; RFP creation; webhooks for booking state; OAuth scopes; rate limits; abuse monitoring.

Feature Flags & City Gates:
• feature.mobile.apps.beta=true (invite), feature.api.partner.read=true (whitelist).

Dependencies & Inputs:
• Mobile CI/CD; app store policies; privacy reviews; push infra; OAuth provider; abuse detection.

Top Risks & Mitigations:
• Notification fatigue; API misuse; mobile parity gaps; app review delays.

Instrumentation & KPIs:
• Mobile activation; response time; bookings initiated on mobile; notification opt‑outs; API error/abuse rates.

Acceptance Criteria (Go/No‑Go):
✓ Mobile NPS ≥ web; parity for core flows; API clients pass compliance; abuse anomaly rates low.

Staffing & Ownership:
• Mobile engineers; API/backend; Security; SRE; Product; Design; Support.

Milestones & Checkpoints:
• Beta → GA for apps; first partner integrations; API documentation stable.

Implementation Notes:
• Flag Discipline: Each capability ships behind a named flag with a runbook, owner, rollback, and blast‑radius notes. Flags default to 'off' in new cities.
• Admin Operability: No workstream is 'done' until admin tools enable Support/Trust/Finance to handle the top 3 edge cases without engineering.
• Copy & Policy: All flows have help‑center articles and email/SMS templates; copy avoids legalese and links to policy examples.
• QA & Drills: Staging mimics production data shapes; drills include processor/tax outages, moderation surges, and incident command handoffs.
• Experimentation: Features that affect marketplace economics (ranking, boosts, fees) include holdouts and guardrails; we measure incremental impact.
• Data Wiring: Events land in Bronze/Silver/Gold (§5); KPIs pull only from Gold with freshness SLOs. Definitions live in a metrics catalog.
• Accessibility: New UI complies with WCAG 2.1 AA; screen‑reader and keyboard paths verified; contrast ratios checked; defects triaged.
• Security & Privacy: PII masked by default; JIT elevation for sensitive admin actions; vendor scopes minimal; audits immutable.
• City Readiness: City‑first artifacts (press kit, creator ambassadors, studio partners) prepared in §10.1 runbook.
• Post‑Launch: 7/30/90‑day reviews convert observations into roadmap changes; flags let us tune by city without forks.

• Copy & Policy: All flows have help‑center articles and email/SMS templates; copy avoids legalese and links to policy examples.
• QA & Drills: Staging mimics production data shapes; drills include processor/tax outages, moderation surges, and incident command handoffs.
• Experimentation: Features that affect marketplace economics (ranking, boosts, fees) include holdouts and guardrails; we measure incremental impact.
• Data Wiring: Events land in Bronze/Silver/Gold (§5); KPIs pull only from Gold with freshness SLOs. Definitions live in a metrics catalog.
• Accessibility: New UI complies with WCAG 2.1 AA; screen‑reader and keyboard paths verified; contrast ratios checked; defects triaged.
• Security & Privacy: PII masked by default; JIT elevation for sensitive admin actions; vendor scopes minimal; audits immutable.
• City Readiness: City‑first artifacts (press kit, creator ambassadors, studio partners) prepared in §10.1 runbook.
• Post‑Launch: 7/30/90‑day reviews convert observations into roadmap changes; flags let us tune by city without forks.

Implementation Notes:
• Flag Discipline: Each capability ships behind a named flag with a runbook, owner, rollback, and blast‑radius notes. Flags default to 'off' in new cities.
• Admin Operability: No workstream is 'done' until admin tools enable Support/Trust/Finance to handle the top 3 edge cases without engineering.
• Copy & Policy: All flows have help‑center articles and email/SMS templates; copy avoids legalese and links to policy examples.
• QA & Drills: Staging mimics production data shapes; drills include processor/tax outages, moderation surges, and incident command handoffs.
• Experimentation: Features that affect marketplace economics (ranking, boosts, fees) include holdouts and guardrails; we measure incremental impact.
• Data Wiring: Events land in Bronze/Silver/Gold (§5); KPIs pull only from Gold with freshness SLOs. Definitions live in a metrics catalog.
• Accessibility: New UI complies with WCAG 2.1 AA; screen‑reader and keyboard paths verified; contrast ratios checked; defects triaged.
• Security & Privacy: PII masked by default; JIT elevation for sensitive admin actions; vendor scopes minimal; audits immutable.
• City Readiness: City‑first artifacts (press kit, creator ambassadors, studio partners) prepared in §10.1 runbook.
• Post‑Launch: 7/30/90‑day reviews convert observations into roadmap changes; flags let us tune by city without forks.

• Post‑Launch: 7/30/90‑day reviews convert observations into roadmap changes; flags let us tune by city without forks.

§12.8 — Phase 7: Technical Debt, Performance & Quality Gates

§12.8 — Phase 7: Technical Debt, Performance & Quality Gates

Roadmap Disclaimer: This is an internal planning document. Dates are placeholders and will firm up as Section 5 telemetry validates conversion and quality gates. All items ship behind flags and city allowlists. Nothing herein creates external commitments.

Context & Alignment: US‑only creative marketplace; subscription‑free at launch; monetization via take‑rate and usage‑based promotions with eligibility gates and strict caps; public content limited to artistic‑only (guest Safe‑Mode on by default); deliverables handled via external links (Drive/Dropbox) with immutable manifests; escrowed payments released on acceptance; Instant Book gated by ID verification; optional background checks confer Trusted Pro; city‑gated rollout with feature flags; strong Admin Console with least‑privilege, JIT elevation, two‑person approvals, and immutable audits.

Timeframe & Scope:
• Runs continuously; major focus windows after each GA.

Goals:
• Keep reliability, security, performance, and data quality within SLOs while the roadmap evolves.
• Pay down structural debt and keep dependencies current.

Product Themes:
• Stability as a feature; invest in platform health to sustain growth.

Workstreams & Deliverables:
• Performance SLOs for search/messaging/checkout; budgets enforced in CI; profiling and regressions tracked.
• Observability: logs/metrics/traces; error budgets; incident retrospectives; runbooks updated.
• Security posture: secrets rotation; dependency updates; vulnerability scans; pentest remediation.
• Data quality: freshness, completeness, correctness checks; lineage; rollback procedures.

Feature Flags & City Gates:
• feature.perf.budgets, feature.logs.traces, feature.security.scanner, feature.data.dq.gates.

Dependencies & Inputs:
• SRE platform; security tooling; data platform; team time allocation; leadership commitment.

Top Risks & Mitigations:
• Feature pressure crowds out quality; silent regressions; security drift; data incidents affecting finance.

Instrumentation & KPIs:
• SLO compliance; incident counts and MTTA/MTTR; vuln backlog age; DQ gate pass rates; perf budget adherence.

Acceptance Criteria (Go/No‑Go):
✓ Error budgets green ≥ 80% of quarters; no Sev‑0 from preventable causes; DQ gates pass with exceptions documented.

Staffing & Ownership:
• SRE; Platform; Security; Data; Product owners accountable for quality alongside features.

Milestones & Checkpoints:
• Quarterly hardening sprints; dependency upgrade days; pentest completion; DQ audit sign‑offs.

Implementation Notes:
• Flag Discipline: Each capability ships behind a named flag with a runbook, owner, rollback, and blast‑radius notes. Flags default to 'off' in new cities.
• Admin Operability: No workstream is 'done' until admin tools enable Support/Trust/Finance to handle the top 3 edge cases without engineering.
• Copy & Policy: All flows have help‑center articles and email/SMS templates; copy avoids legalese and links to policy examples.
• QA & Drills: Staging mimics production data shapes; drills include processor/tax outages, moderation surges, and incident command handoffs.
• Experimentation: Features that affect marketplace economics (ranking, boosts, fees) include holdouts and guardrails; we measure incremental impact.
• Data Wiring: Events land in Bronze/Silver/Gold (§5); KPIs pull only from Gold with freshness SLOs. Definitions live in a metrics catalog.
• Accessibility: New UI complies with WCAG 2.1 AA; screen‑reader and keyboard paths verified; contrast ratios checked; defects triaged.
• Security & Privacy: PII masked by default; JIT elevation for sensitive admin actions; vendor scopes minimal; audits immutable.
• City Readiness: City‑first artifacts (press kit, creator ambassadors, studio partners) prepared in §10.1 runbook.
• Post‑Launch: 7/30/90‑day reviews convert observations into roadmap changes; flags let us tune by city without forks.

Implementation Notes:
